Title: Battlefield 5 Review - On The Front Lines
Review: It's a fine execution of a familiar formula. There are rough spots, but Battlefield V incorporates small, effective tweaks and truly shines in the more focused objective-based modes.
Author Information: Battlefield 1942 was a major reason Michael got into PC gaming as a kid, and he's played every entry since (to varying degrees). He still considers Battlefield 2 to be his favorite multiplayer experience ever. Michael spent 35 hours with the PC version of Battlefield V for review

Title: The Quiet Man Review - Silence Is Not Golden
Review: The Quiet Man is an almost completely silent beat-em-up that combines badly staged live-action drama with a clunky, broken combat system.
Author Information: Calum Marsh endured three long, unhappy hours with The Quiet Man and politely declines the opportunity to play through it again with sound. He played on PS4.

Title: Overkill's The Walking Dead Review - DOA
Review: Overkill's The Walking Dead is a collection of poorly conceived ideas and uninspired gameplay, neither of which help its lifeless narrative and repetitive missions.
Author Information: Alessandro braved the undead over 15 hours of play, which involved numerous hours of grinding and boring loot drops to simply progress the uninspired story. He's not exactly looking forward to the next season. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Full Metal Furies Review - Puzzle-Brawler
Review: From the creators of Rogue Legacy, Full Metal Furies is a challenging co-op game that seamlessly ties together the brawler and puzzle genres while also telling a humorous story.
Author Information: Jordan Ramee played Full Metal Furies for the first time on Xbox One, where he and his friends only managed to figure out the game's hardest riddles after they penciled in pages of notes and discussed possible solutions for hours. For the purposes of this review, he replayed the game on Nintendo Switch using a code provided by Cellar Door Games.

Title: 11-11: Memories Retold Review - Modernist Warfare
Review: 11-11: Memories Retold is an exquisitely painted, touchingly told and occasionally tedious war story.
Author Information: David Wildgoose was very pleased to discover the cat Kurt befriends early in the game is actually a playable character later on. More games where you get to press X to meow, please.

Title: Spyro Reignited Trilogy Review - Fan The Flames
Review: Spyro glides into the current gen prettier than ever and as fun as ever.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through all three Spyro games in about four hours each. In case you were wondering, no, L1 + Triangle does nothing this time. A code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Tetris Effect Review - Feel The Groove
Review: Tetris Effect transforms the classic puzzle game through the power of music. It's hard to put down, and even harder to stop thinking about.
Author Information: Peter completed Tetris Effects' Journey mode on Normal difficulty and spent a bit of time with each of the optional alternate modes before writing his review. A complimentary copy of the game was provided by Enhance Inc.

Title: Pokemon Let's Go Pikachu And Let's Go Eevee Review
Review: A beautiful reimagining of one of the series' most beloved adventures.
Author Information: Pokemon Red was the first game Jake ever played, so returning to Kanto was a big deal to him. After 45 hours, he completed the Kanto Pokedex and caught two shinies. Review copies were provided by Nintendo.

Title: Sinner: Sacrifice for Redemption Review - Trials and Tribulations
Review: Sinner: Sacrifice for Redemption is a bonafide boss rush buffet with an inventive twist, though its aesthetic presentation quickly grows dull.
Author Information: Ginny Woo's love for Souls-likes borders on the masochistic. She spent 20 hours happily traipsing around in Sinner: Sacrifice for Redemption's swamp of religious horror and aggressively morose orchestral music on Switch, PS4 and PC thanks to codes provided by the publisher for review purposes.

Title: Diablo 3: Eternal Collection Switch Review - Better With Age
Review: Diablo 3 remains a clever, rewarding, and oftentimes brilliant action-RPG that has made a near seamless transition to Nintendo Switch, six years after its original release.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy has spent more than 600 hours playing Diablo 3 throughout his life (50 of which took place on Switch) and he somehow still doesn't regret it.

Title: Hitman 2 Review - You Can Stop Hitting Me Now
Review: Fantastic new level designs, minor but meaningful additions, and a few excellent bonuses help strengthen the endurance of the Hitman series.
Author Information: Edmond fondly remembers needing to use the bathroom in Hitman: Codename 47, and the Hitman reboot was one of his favorite games of 2016. He reviewed Hitman 2 on PC with some additional playtime on PS4 using codes provided by the publisher.

Title: Call Of Cthulhu Review - Squid Logic
Review: Call of Cthulhu is a mostly competent, occasionally chilling adventure ruined by unspeakable horrors.
Author Information: David Wildgoose wants to spare you the pain he endured. If you do play this game then know this: In the art gallery section, the dagger you need to thrust into the painting is the one furthest away from you at the start. You'll know it when you get there.

Title: Black Bird Review - Featherweight
Review: Black Bird‰Ûªs irreverent take on shoot-'em-up is fun while it lasts, but there‰Ûªs not enough content to sustain repeat playthroughs.
Author Information: Tom finished up Black Bird in less than 30 minutes but plugged away for more than five hours to climb ever so slowly up the leaderboards. A Switch code was provided by the developer for the purposes of this review.

Title: My Hero One's Justice Review - In Their Own Quirky Ways
Review: My Hero One's Justice captures the feeling of superpowered heroes and villains fighting against one another in destructive arena battles but doesn't do justice to My Hero Academia's story.
Author Information: After keeping up with the My Hero Academia manga, anime, and Vigilantes spin-off, as well as playing My Hero One's Justice for 10 hours, Jordan can confirm that Bakugo is best boy. He played on Xbox One X using a code provided by Bandai Namco for the purposes of this review.

Title: Gwent Review - Heart Of The Cards
Review: Gwent's revamped ruleset and eagerness to reward your time spent with it make it a compelling multiplayer endeavor in The Witcher universe.
Author Information: Alessandro stuck with the Northern Realms for most of his decks and became really skilled at chaining together Charge and Order cards. He still hasn't managed a full nine-game streak in Arena, though. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Transistor Review
Review: With a gorgeous audiovisual style, unconventional science fiction narrative, and empowering combat system, Transistor is a distinctive and memorable experience.
Author Information: Carolyn played through Transistor's story twice on the PlayStation 4, using the new game plus option to go through it a second time. She also tested out the PC version a bit. In the interests of transparency, she'd like you to know that she was an avid reader of GameSpot when Supergiant Games' creative director, Greg Kasavin, wrote for the site, and she has had friendly chats with him on a few occasions.

Title: Red Dead Redemption 2 Review - Wild Wild West
Review: PS4 and Xbox One's RDR 2 succeeds as both a prequel to the first Red Dead Redemption and a story in its own right
Author Information: Kallie spent around 55 hours playing Red Dead Redemption 2, completing the main story, a handful of side quests, and a robbery or two. She played on PS4 Pro using a code provided by Rockstar for the purposes of this review.

Title: Football Manager 2019 Review - A Winning Strategy
Review: Football Manager 2019 redesigns its tactical interface to give you the tools to create a playstyle you'll spend the next 200 hours obsessing over.
Author Information: Richard has been a wannabe football manager for over 10 years now and spent around 50 hours tinkering with every aspect of his team in Football Manager 2019. A PC copy of the game was provided by the publisher for review.

Title: Deracine Review - Elementary
Review: Deracine's gorgeous presentation masks a game that's lacking innovative ideas while misusing the few it does have.
Author Information: Alessandro explored the mysterious boarding school through two separate playthroughs, with the first journey taking around four hours to complete. He consistently tried to get past the school's black cat without any success. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Cities: Skylines - Industries Review - The Up And Up
Review: Create smokestacks and jobs in Industries, the detailed new expansion for Cities: Skylines that lets you put natural resources to good use.
Author Information: Brett has played many, many hours of Cities: Skylines for review. He dedicated about a dozen hours to industrializing Cities: Skylines using a code provided by the publisher for purposes of this review.

Title: SNK 40th Anniversary Collection Review - It Belongs In A Museum
Review: A portion of SNK's pre-Neo Geo library is given the archaeological treatment in the diverse and educational SNK 40th Anniversary Collection.
Author Information: Peter has been a fan of SNK for years, but has spent relatively little time playing games from the pre-Neo Geo era. He played each game in the collection a few times while preparing for his review, and wholeheartedly appreciates the available assist options that made up for his lack of skill. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Reigns: Game Of Thrones Review: A Westerosi Romp
Review: Reigns: Game of Thrones makes smart use of the license on which its based, offering smart writing and a wide array of scenarios to tackle.
Author Information: Chris is a big Song of Ice and Fire fan who foolishly thinks we still might get a new book someday. He spent more than six hours exploring Reigns: Game of Thrones' many possibilities and is looking forward to uncovering more of its mysteries. Devolver Digital provided an iOS code for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dark Souls Remastered Switch Review: A Very Special Revisit
Review: With Dark Souls Remastered now on Nintendo Switch, you'll be able to experience one of the decade's greatest role-playing games in an interesting new way.
Author Information: Alessandro has been following From Software's Souls series for nearly 10 years, and has played every installment. Bloodborne is his personal favorite. Playing on the Nintendo Switch, he spent well over 25 hours re-experiencing the hardships and eventual triumphs found in Dark Souls. Bandai Namco provided codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 4 Review - Zombies Blackout Multiplayer
Review: Call of Duty: Black Ops 4 is both broad and deep, but the star is its smartly executed take on battle royale, Blackout.
Author Information: Kallie started playing FPS games at a young age with her dad, who still plays Call of Duty. She lost track of how many hours of Black Ops 4 she played, but she split her time evenly between multiplayer, Zombies, and Blackout. Activision provided PS4 copies for the purposes of this review.

Title: Return Of The Obra Dinn Review: The Good Ship
Review: Return of the Obra Dinn is a startlingly original detective adventure full of murder, mutiny, and monsters.
Author Information: David Wildgoose filled his own spiral-bound pad with notes reading "Frenchman was torn apart?", "guy who was accidentally shot after being spiked and crawling away was shot by another guy" and "last seen on deck grabbed by tentacle" during the dozen or so hours it took to play through this game. He recommends you do the same.

Title: SoulCalibur 6 Review - The New Legend
Review: The sixth entry in Bandai Namco's weapons-based fighting series makes a strong return.
Author Information: Tamoor has been a Nightmare main since the first SoulCalibur. His thirst for souls is endless. A PS4 copy of the game was provided by the publisher for review.

Title: WWE 2K19 Review: A Step In The Right Direction
Review: While not much has changed between the ropes, WWE 2K19 gives you more reasons to play by featuring a plethora of new modes and content.
Author Information: Richard has been watching wrestling since the days of WWE's Attitude Era, and spent around 30 hours with WWE 2K19. He also wishes Roman Reigns a speedy recovery. A PS4 copy of the game was provided by the publisher for review.

Title: Thronebreaker: The Witcher Tales Review - Queen Of Cards
Review: Thronebreaker's compelling characters accent a strong re-imagining of Gwent and a gripping single-player story.
Author Information: Alessandro rode into battle with Meve and slayed countless cards throughout the 25-hour campaign, gathering a good percentage of optional hidden chests, beating most puzzle challenges, and making incredibly tough decisions along the way. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Lego DC Super-Villains Review: Mediocre Mischief-Makers
Review: Despite an impressive roster and some top-notch actors to voice them, Lego DC Super-Villains is a tedious game that fails to capitalize on its best qualities.
Author Information: Justin Clark finished Lego DC Super-Villains' story and spent about three hours fooling around in Free Play. He also spent four hours one day in the character creator. He regrets nothing. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Super Mario Party Review - Test Those Friendships
Review: With Super Mario Party on Switch, Nintendo's 20-year-old party franchise ditches its staple randomness for more of a strategic game.
Author Information: When Jordan first tried the original Mario Party, he had no idea the game would inspire a hobby that would eventually become a career. It took Jordan about 15 hours to gather Super Mario Party's five Gems and achieve Super Stardom. Nintendo provided codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: NBA 2K Playgrounds 2 Review - Ball Another Day
Review: There's fun to be had in 2K's arcade-style basketball game, but a lack of variety and flawed gameplay make for a missed opportunity.
Author Information: Michael was hyped to team up Patrick Ewing and Gary Payton, two of his favorite players growing up, in NBA 2K Playgrounds 2. He misses balling up at Skyline Park back home in Southeast San Diego where ball is life. He put around 10 hours into NBA 2K Playgrounds 2 for this review, and code was provided by 2K Sports. Michael also reviewed NBA 2K19, the simulation basketball experience from the same publisher.

Title: The Missing Review - Lost And Found
Review: The Missing is a dark, confronting puzzle-platformer that offers light at the end of the tunnel.
Author Information: David Wildgoose never liked camping and The Missing has only reaffirmed that belief. He now also doesn't like windmills, sawmills, those cymbal-clapping monkey toys, and islands. The game was completed in around 6 hours using a code provided by Arc System Works.

Title: Starlink: Battle for Atlas Review - Endless Space
Review: Starlink is a fun, albeit repetitive, game of space combat and exploration--but the digital version of the game is the way to go if you're on a budget.
Author Information: James O'Connor was sent the entire toy line and the Digital Deluxe edition of the game by Ubisoft for review. He tested the toys during his 20-odd hours with the game but preferred the convenience of the digital ships, pilots, and weapons after the first few hours. He's a big Star Fox fan, too.

Title: Chasm Review: The Battle Below
Review: Chasm's sharp combat mechanics and rich visual design make it easier to bear the inconsistent difficulty curve.
Author Information: Tom took more than 12 hours to finish Chasm (not including reloading saves after deaths) using a Steam code provided by the developer. He saw 99.9% of the map and cannot believe he couldn't find the last secret.

Title: Luigi's Mansion Review - Old Haunts
Review: The GameCube classic comes to the 3DS with minimal changes, and it's held up pretty well.
Author Information: James O'Connor first played through Luigi's Mansion in 2003 and is happy to return to it half a lifetime later. He spent about five and a half hours finishing the game (with every portrait ghost and Boo caught) on a New Nintendo 3DS XL, then spent some further time in the Hidden Mansion mode. A copy of the game was supplied by Nintendo.

Title: Assassin's Creed Odyssey Review - Glory Of Sparta
Review: With Assassin's Creed Odyssey on PC, PS4, and Xbox One, Ubisoft continues the series' expansion into a bigger open world, offering an impressive follow-up to Origins.
Author Information: Alessandro is a longtime fan of the Assassin's Creed series and was looking forward to diving into Odyssey's large-scale adventure. Playing on both the PS4 and PS4 Pro, he spent well over 60 hours exploring the game's massive world. Ubisoft provided codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Armello Review - Nintendo Switch Update
Review: Board gaming come to life, with none of the missing pieces.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins had no idea she wanted a mash-up of beloved childhood murder planning kit 13 Dead End Drive and Brian Jacques' Redwall books, but that's an itch that Armello definitely scratches. Even better, she doesn't have to play it alone on the living room carpet.

Title: Pathfinder: Kingmaker Review - The Classics
Review: Pathfinder: Kingmaker is a classical RPG brought to PC with some exceptional moments, though it's dragged down by a brutal difficulty curve.
Author Information: Lifelong western RPG fan Dan Starkey got his start on roleplaying in his early teens, starting with Pathfinder before making the transition to d20-based video games like Baldur‰Ûªs Gate and Knights of the Old Republic. He was provided code on release day for the purposes of review.

Title: Child of Light Review
Review: Child of Light is a singular adventure that embraces sadness in a beautiful, affecting way.
Author Information: Tom was touched by the somber tone of Child of Light and wishes more games would explore this untapped feeling. He spent more than 15 hours within this world, and is eager to revisit it.

Title: World of Warcraft: Battle For Azeroth - Come One Come All
Review: Faction politics are the backbone of Battle for Azeroth, but the real victories are the friends that you make along the way.
Author Information: Ginny Woo spends way too much time in online universes and not enough time sleeping. For the purposes of this review, Ginny reached max level on both factions and took the scenic route through all the leveling zones in Battle for Azeroth. In terms of post-launch content, she‰Ûªs cut her teeth on the first two wings of Uldir and assaulted Arathi Highlands as part of the Horde‰Ûªs latest military effort.

Title: My Memory of Us Review - War Has Changed
Review: A puzzle-platformer as World War II allegory that can't settle on an appropriate tone or interesting puzzles.
Author Information: Schindler's List was the first movie that made James cry. He spent just over five hours playing through My Memory of Us. A code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: FIFA 19 Nintendo Switch Review - Offside
Review: Nintendo Switch gets an updated version of FIFA 19, but it's lacking much of what makes EA's footballing giant special.
Author Information: Oscar spends more time trading FUT players than he cares to admit. EA provided complimentary copies of FIFA 19 on Switch for the purposes of this review.

Title: Mega Man 11 Review - An Uneven Retro Romp
Review: Mega Man 11 is a solid return for the Blue Bomber, but it's held back somewhat by overly long and frustrating stage design.
Author Information: Heidi has been playing Mega Man games since the original. She has a soft spot for X4, but 3 is her favorite of the classic series. She also ran a Mega Man music Geocities page as a teenager. Heidi completed Mega Man 11 on both Casual and Normal difficulties for this review using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: The Bard's Tale IV: Barrows Deep Review - Lament
Review: You'll need a lot of patience to make it through InXile Entertainment's nostalgic RPG, The Bard's Tale IV: Barrows Deep.
Author Information: Brett spent over 60 hours trudging through the old-time conundrums and combat of The Bard's Tale IV: Barrows Deep. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Destiny 2: Forsaken Review - A Grindhouse
Review: Destiny 2's Forsaken expansion is dense and rewarding, though it does require a bit of patience.
Author Information: Kallie lost track of how many hours of Forsaken she played over the last three and a half weeks, but she did get Ace of Spades before they nerfed the quest requirements. She did it for Cayde. She played on PS4 using code provided by the publisher.

Title: Fist Of The North Star: Lost Paradise Review - Be The Tough Boy
Review: Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise offers a solid display of drama and action that captures exactly what makes the series so great.
Author Information: Matt became a huge fan of Fist of the North Star in the lead-up to Lost Paradise's release. He teared up a few times while playing and proclaimed in shock, "To think that I, Matt, still had tears left!" He played about 30 hours of the game using a review code provided by Sega.

Title: Final Fantasy XV: Pocket Edition HD Review - Nintendo Switch
Review: Square delivers most of Final Fantasy XV in a smaller, but no less epic, package.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 40 hours with Pocket Edition on Switch. He will not rest until there‰Ûªs a Persona: Dancing All Night-type game with Noctis and crew performing BTS songs. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: FIFA 19 Review - Golazo
Review: FIFA 19 is back for a new season, but how do its brand new Kick Off modes, third chapter of The Journey, and new FUT features fare?
Author Information: For his sins, Oscar spends most of his time attempting to get his beloved Bristol City into the Champions League. Europe in five years, here we go! Complimentary codes were provided by EA for the purposes of this review.

Title: Cities: Skylines Review - In The Zone
Review: Smart attention to details like zoning and policy decisions make Cities: Skylines the most authentic city-builder you can play.
Author Information: Even though real-life mayor Brett Todd plays games to get away from real-world politics, he still enjoyed spending some 20 hours in the virtual world of Cities: Skylines.

Title: Forza Horizon 4 Review - Shifting Gears Shifting Seasons
Review: Playground Games continues to master the art of driving games that are both accessible and complex, and Horizon 4's numerous meaningful changes keep the series lively and looking fantastic.
Author Information: In the past two years, Edmond has road-tripped across both Great Britain and Australia, and drifted cars on a frozen lake. Horizon is cheaper, though. He spent roughly 37 hours playing on PC with additional testing on Xbox One X, listening to nothing but Timeless FM, using a code provided by Microsoft.

Title: The Gardens Between Review - Dance Among The Stars
Review: With a bittersweet story and a gorgeous, dreamlike world, The Gardens Between is time-bending puzzle game that you won't soon forget.
Author Information: Peter played through The Gardens Between in a few hours on Nintendo Switch using complimentary code provided by The Voxel Agents.

Title: Wasteland 2: Director's Cut Nintendo Switch Review
Review: Wasteland 2 gets the Switch port treatment, bringing a deep, involved RPG to Nintendo's hybrid console.
Author Information: Long-time Western RPG fan Dan Starkey got his start on roleplaying in his early teens, starting with Pathfinder and moving into other systems before shuffling over to their video counterparts like KOTOR. He was provided code ahead of release for the purposes of review.

Title: Zone Of The Enders: The 2nd Runner - MARS Review
Review: Zone of the Enders comes to the current gen in better shape than ever, but still an artifact of its time.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through ZOE: 2nd Runner in about seven hours. He still has no idea what the hell the title means. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Frozen Synapse 2 Review - Cool-Headed
Review: Frozen Synapse 2 is a stylish, tense, and tactical game of chess. With guns.
Author Information: James Swinbanks spent 21 hours trawling the cyber streets and outwitting foes with his Bureau-8 squad, using code provided by the publisher for review purposes.

Title: Nintendo Labo Vehicle Kit Review: The Most Fun Labo Yet
Review: Labo's newest kit features much more gameplay than its predecessor, but it's still best enjoyed with a junior partner in tow.
Author Information: Randolph and his nine-year-old son tag teamed building the various Joy-Cons, with Bastian doing most of the folding and Randy taking over any time rubber bands or fiddly stickers were involved. Bastian, however, did most of the work in Adventure Mode. GameSpot was provided the Labo Vehicle Kit courtesy of Nintendo.

Title: NHL 19 Review - A Barnburner
Review: NHL 19 controls exceptionally well and looks fantastic, and the new outdoor hockey mode nails the essence of hockey culture.
Author Information: Eddie spent around 20 hours playing NHL 19 using a code provided by Electronic Arts.

Title: Undertale Review - Nintendo Switch Update
Review: Undertale exceeds expectations, when it isn't busy subverting them.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks grew up on single-player RPGs, with Suikoden 2 topping his list of favorites. For this review, he played through Undertale twice.

Title: Star Control: Origins Review - Space Oddity
Review: Star Control: Origins is a jolly space adventure that falters when it takes on too much action.
Author Information: David Wildgoose started writing about games professionally the year after Star Control 2 was released. If you laid end-to-end every word he's written about games in those 25 years it would probably stretch to the moon and back, as long as you printed them in a very large font. He spent around 30 hours with Star Control: Origins with a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Life Is Strange 2: Episode 1 Review - What Doesn't Kill Us
Review: Life Is Strange 2 kicks off with a diverse cast of strongly-defined characters, a narrative shaped by real-world sociopolitical issues, and the love between two brothers at the root of ...
Author Information: Jess has played every Life Is Strange installment and spent eight hours with Life Is Strange 2: Episode 1 on PC over the course of two playthroughs: one where she played as a lawful, friendly Sean and another as the world's worst brother. The latter made her feel really bad.

Title: Broken Sword 5: The Serpent's Curse Review
Review: Broken Sword 5: The Serpent's Curse returns the series to its former glory with excellent storytelling and characters.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has clicked his way through many adventures starring cartoon dogs, rabbits, and a talking skeleton. For the purpose of this review, Cameron played the game from start to finish.

Title: Lamplight City Review - Cold Case
Review: Lamplight City is a detective adventure with a lot of good ideas, but it executes them with too light a touch.
Author Information: James O'Connor spent just under 12 hours finishing Lamplight City, and then went back in to explore different options and pathways. He's a long-time fan of point-and-click adventure games. Review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Dragon Quest XI: Echoes Of An Elusive Age Review - Back To The Good-Old Days
Review: Steeped in tradition and not afraid to show it, Dragon Quest XI reflects the best qualities of the series' past.
Author Information: Heidi has been playing RPGS since her childhood. She put 85 hours into finishing Dragon Quest XI and doesn‰Ûªt regret a moment of the time spent with her merry adventuring band. Also, her favorite game in the series is Dragon Quest V. Complimentary review code was provided by Square Enix.

Title: Valkyria Chronicles 4 Review - Soar High
Review: With a strong return to its unique strategy roots, Valkyria Chronicles 4 is the franchise's golden ticket to Valhalla.
Author Information: Ginny's introduction to the Valkyria Chronicles series was the franchise's first installment on the PS3. After an unfortunate skirmish with Valkyria Revolution, she was presently surprised to find Valkyria Chronicles 4 in fighting form and engaged in about 40 hours of friendly fire on Nintendo Switch, using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Telltale's The Walking Dead: The Final Season Episode 2 Review
Review: What might be the final episode of Telltale's The Walking Dead is beautiful, brutal, and bittersweet.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through Suffer the Children twice. We'll always have Fabletown. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Transference Review - In Another World
Review: Transference's distressing subject matter and eerie atmosphere make for a strong horror experience, even if some of its potential is squandered by a non-committal narrative.
Author Information: Alessandro felt uncomfortable in Transference the entirety of its three-hour runtime. He explored more of the haunting apartment after the credits rolled to uncover additional video logs and test out VR functionality. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate Review - A Formidable Beast
Review: Monster Hunter Generations Ultimate is the epitome of a good game that can be hard to recommend.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been a fan of action-adventure games of all sorts for two decades. He was a latecomer to the Monster Hunter series, starting with the fourth entry. He ran more than his share of quests with friends on Monster Hunter Generations, however, and was a big fan of the streamlined Monster Hunter World. He was provided code by the publisher for the purposes of review and spent three dozen hours revisiting old friends and foes.

Title: NBA 2K19 Review - Another Year Another Baller
Review: This year's iteration of NBA 2K packs plenty of game modes and deep mechanics that occasionally falter. And unfortunately again, VC rules everything around it.
Author Information: Michael's been breaking ankles on screen since NBA Live 95 back when he loved watching Gary Payton and the Sonics. He misses balling up at Skyline Park in his hometown of Southeast San Diego even though he always got crossed up. He's played past NBA 2K games to get hyped for each season, and spent 40 hours with NBA 2K19 to dig into MyCareer, MyTeam, MyGM, and Play Now matches. The game was provided by 2K Sports for review.

Title: The Golf Club 2019 Review
Review: With a new PGA Tour license, difficult but fair controls, and a pleasing presentation, The Golf Club 2019 is a straight shot down the fairway.
Author Information: Eddie Makuch spent around 20 hours playing The Golf Club 2019. He played on PC using a code provided by 2K.

Title: Little Dragons Cafe Review - Dragging On
Review: Little Dragons Cafe's charming world and cafe management are enjoyable, but it's held back by significant pacing issues.
Author Information: Kallie played a lot of Harvest Moon: A Wonderful Life on GameCube, and Little Dragons Cafe reminds her of those times--for better and worse. She played 40 hours using a review code provided by the publisher.

Title: Hollow Knight Review - An Exceptional Adventure
Review: Hollow Knight's sprawling world, precise combat, and wealth of content make its trip through Hollownest engrossing and rewarding.
Author Information: Alessandro spent over 30 hours exploring every nook and cranny of Hollownest, achieving just under 70% completion on his first run. He spent a few more hours tackling the game's free DLC and falling countless times to the brutal challenges of Godmaster.

Title: The Messenger Review: Shuriken Sharp
Review: Inspired by the 8-bit and 16-bit action-platformers of yesteryear, The Messenger is an ambitious and well-balanced side-scroller that's as difficult as it is funny.
Author Information: Alexander spent over 20 hours perfecting his vast array of ninja skills in his successful delivery of the all-important scroll. Additional testing of the Switch version was handled by GameSpot staff. Complimentary review code for The Messenger was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Dragon Ball FighterZ Review: The Fast And The Furious
Review: Dragon Ball FighterZ is a great fighting game and an exciting revitalization of Dragon Ball Z's glory days.
Author Information: Peter has considered himself a fan of both Dragon Ball and fighting games for the last 25 years. He completed all three story arcs and tested the other modes in the retail version of FighterZ, in addition to participating in the open beta, prior to writing his review. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Bandai Namco.

Title: Into The Breach Review: A Mechanized Masterpiece
Review: Subset Games' FTL follow-up is a pristine and pragmatic tactical gem with dynamic conflicts that will inspire you to jump Into the Breach again, and again, and again.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has spent over 100 hours with FTL across different platforms, and 40 hours with Into The Breach so far, with a copy provided by the developer. He's still hanging out for that spiritual successor to Front Mission 3, though.

Title: Divinity: Original Sin 2 Review - Definitive Edition Update
Review: Divinity: Original Sin II Definitive Edition manages to make an already fantastic RPG even better.
Author Information: Brett spent more than 70 hours questing his way to godhood in the original Divinity: Original Sin 2 on PC, and then did it all over again with the Definitive Edition on PS4 (and had no regrets!). GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Larian Studios.

Title: Marvel's Spider-Man PS4 Review: Amazing Fantasy
Review: A spectacular cinematic presentation and sensational core mechanics help Insomniac's take on a Spider-Man game shine, in spite of some unimaginative open-world activities.
Author Information: Edmond isn't ashamed to tell you that his favorite superhero game is Marvel Puzzle Quest. He hit 100% completion on Marvel's Spider-Man before writing this review, using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Yakuza Kiwami 2 Review: Double Dragon
Review: Old and new components of the Yakuza franchise combine to create one of the series' strongest entries.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has been a devoted Yakuza series fan since 2006, and Yakuza 2 has always been his favorite. He spent over 25 hours with Yakuza Kiwami 2, finishing the campaign and half of the optional content using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: PES 2019 Review
Review: Pro Evolution Soccer 2019 continues the series' excellent run of form, introducing smart improvements that enhance the on-pitch action.
Author Information: Richard has been playing PES since the good old days when it still had the International Superstar Soccer moniker. So far he's spent around 30 hours on PES 2019, with many more to come. Complimentary review code was provided by Konami.

Title: Planet Alpha Review: A Beautiful Planet
Review: Planet Alpha's glorious vistas are worth seeing, even though its mechanics aren't particularly unique.
Author Information: James O'Connor enjoyed how bright and beautiful Planet Alpha was during his eight-hour journey through the game. He's also wondering if it's time to replay Limbo, though. He played on PlayStation 4 using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Freedom Planet Review -- Speedy Ambitions
Review: Freedom Planet's fast-paced thrills and challenging boss fights make for a joyous retro outing, but don't expect the same highs from its mediocre story.
Author Information: Matt is a big fan of Sonic and is always down to play a game inspired by Sega's iconic blue hedgehog. He played about six hours of Freedom Planet using a review code provided by the publisher.

Title: Shadow Of The Tomb Raider Review - Guerilla Girl
Review: Raiding ancient tombs and exploring dense environments is still outstanding in Lara's latest, but the mechanics of the reboot series are getting as rough and unpredictable as the terrain.
Author Information: Tomb Raider was the reason Edmond begged for a new Pentium PC in 1996, and he's played most of Lara's adventures since then. He finished Shadow of the Tomb Raider's campaign with 89% total game completion, flipping between normal and hard difficulties, using a code provided by Square Enix.

Title: 428: Shibuya Scramble Review - When Fates Collide
Review: The unique presentation and excellent storytelling of 428: Shibuya Scramble make it a great visual novel experience.
Author Information: Heidi has enjoyed many visual novels and was eager to see why so many folks overseas were so excited about 428. She finished all the scenarios and got to the default ending, but she‰Ûªs now going back and replaying things to see if she can unlock another outcome. Review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Strange Brigade Review - Co-op With Style
Review: Strange Brigade is a delightful cooperative shooter with some technical issues and an idea that isn't given enough room to breathe.
Author Information: Dan Starkey has craved co-op adventures since he ran through the original Perfect Dark with some friends back in grade school. Since then he's loved working with pals and buds to clear some of gaming's most enriching challenges. He spent 14 hours over the course of a week dipping into the '30s-inspired world of Strange Brigade. A copy of the game was provided by the publisher for the review.

Title: NBA Live 19 Review - Dribbling Forward
Review: EA's NBA Live franchise returns with its best effort in a while capturing the spirit and atmosphere of basketball culture, but it's not without its problems.
Author Information: Eddie played around 20 hours of NBA Live 19, including a Franchise season with the Celtics. He played on Xbox One X using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Two Point Hospital Review - Laughter Is The Best Medicine
Review: Two Point Hospital offers more than just nostalgia for classic management sims.
Author Information: In the 20 hours he spent with Two Point Hospital, James Swinbanks cured 1284 patients, and he‰Ûªs not even a real doctor! He played using code provided by the publisher for review purposes.

Title: Death's Gambit Review - A Maddening Mission
Review: This 2D action-platformer is a gorgeous but frustrating test of patience.
Author Information: James Swinbanks took 15 hours to wipe the world of its immortal inhabitants and appease Death. He used PC code provided by the publisher for review purposes.

Title: Donut County Review: Pit Falls
Review: Donut County is high on charm but short on substance

Title: Mega Man X Legacy Collection 1 + 2 Review: Mega Museum
Review: An homage to the full breadth of Mega Man X's history shows that some parts of its legacy have aged much better than others.
Author Information: Steve tested both collections on Switch and PlayStation 4. Capcom provided GameSpot with complimentary download codes of the game

Title: The Walking Dead - The Final Season Episode 1: Done Running Review
Review: Telltale begins the final verse of Clementine's ballad on a high note.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through Done Running twice, taking about two hours for each playthrough. He once had an afro just like A.J.'s. He doesn't like talking about that time of his life much. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: H1Z1 Battle Royale PS4 Review: All Kills No Frills
Review: The PS4 version of H1Z1 Battle Royale provides a simple, streamlined experience with the thrills of the genre's high-stakes combat. Nothing more, nothing less.
Author Information: Michael took on the role of critiquing battle royale games, having reviewed PUBG, Fortnite, H1Z1 on PC, and now the PS4 version of H1Z1. He put about 20 hours into H1Z1 on PS4, roughly split between the open beta and official release. A lot of time was put into the early access PC version back in the day, and for some reason he feels very cool for being on the battle royale hype train before everyone else.

Title: Earthfall Review: An Inferior Invasion
Review: Earthfall is too derivative to stand out and too disappointing to inspire repeat trips through its 10 mediocre missions.
Author Information: James Swinbanks tried to save the world from aliens for 12 hours before getting bored and letting them take it. He played the Xbox One version of Earthfall using code provided by the publisher.

Title: F1 2018 Review - Victory Lap
Review: F1 2018 nails a new lap record with its most complete package to date.
Author Information: After spending 30 hours with F1 2018 and winning the World Championship with Red Bull Racing, James Swinbanks retired to Monaco to spend his remaining days on a yacht the size of a house. He reviewed the PS4 version of F1 2018 using code provided by the publisher.

Title: Semblance Review
Review: A level-morphing puzzle game with enough charm and ingenuity to overcome its control issues and short length.
Author Information: James O'Connor was won over by Semblance in the end and found that the game more-or-less did what it promised, if not a lot more. He enjoys puzzle platformers as a general rule. Review code was provided by the publisher on both Switch and PC.

Title: Monster Hunter World Review - Deadliest Catch
Review: Monster Hunter World successfully proves that it's both about size and how you use it.
Author Information: Ginny Woo got her first taste of being the hunter and the hunted upon Monster Hunter 3 Ultimate's release. The franchise combines her love of dinosaurs with her passion for heavy weaponry, and she's been ready to sink her teeth into Monster Hunter World since it was announced at E3 2017. For the purposes of this review, Ginny played around 60 hours solo and with others on the PS4 and around 20 hours on the PC using copies provided by Capcom.

Title: WarioWare Gold Review - Worth Its Weight
Review: The "ultimate" WarioWare game mixes together all three different handheld play styles we've seen before.
Author Information: James O'Connor played the original WarioWare religiously, mastering every microgame to unlock Pyoro 2. He spent 12 hours with Gold, building up his high scores and playing every single microgame. A review copy was provided by Nintendo.

Title: No Man's Sky Next Review: You Are Not Alone
Review: With Next, No Man's Sky blossoms into the game that was promised.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 30 hours with the Xbox One X port of the game, along with an additional six continuing his original save on PS4. Combined, he's spent over 100 hours with No Man's Sky. He's looking forward to 100 more. A copy of the full game for Xbox One was provided by the publisher.

Title: Unavowed Review: Dressed To Possess
Review: With an exceptional mystery, genuine characters and brilliant writing, Unavowed is a phenomenal adventure.
Author Information: David Rayfield is pretty sure that either he's possessed by a demon or everyone else is. Hopefully, he'll figure it out before it's too late. He reviewed Unavowed on PC, with the first playthrough taking about 12 hours.

Title: Dead Cells Review: Rise From Your Grave
Review: Dead Cells is an incredibly satisfying mishmash of genres that's more than the sum of its parts.
Author Information: Dan Starkey is a fan of all things Soulsian. Though he‰Ûªs a recent-ish inductee to the Souls-like fandom, he‰Ûªs taken the meditative combat and beautifully laid out worlds as some of his all-time favorites. He pushed through only one complete run of Dead Cells among 140 some-odd attempts over about 25 hours. He loved it.

Title: We Happy Few Review
Review: We Happy Few's borderline broken systems and unremarkable quest design make it an unentertaining slog through an intriguing world.
Author Information: Alessandro behaved as well as he could within Wellington Wells, but he found it easier to break We Happy Few's rules rather than conform to them. He completed all three character stories in just under 30 hours. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Phantom Doctrine Review: Tactical Espionage Action
Review: Phantom Doctrine blends several complex mechanics and a well-realized Cold War setting into one brilliantly engaging experience.
Author Information: Alexander Pan spent over 40 hours spying, connecting photos on a corkboard using pieces of string, and flip-flopping between the CIA and KGB without being caught. The PC version of Phantom Doctrine was tested, using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: The Banner Saga 3 Review
Review: Smart adjustments to mechanics make the act of playing the Banner Saga series finale feel as suspenseful as the story it tells.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has played through every entry of The Banner Saga at least twice on PC, but just can't get used to the gamepad controls on consoles. Gunnulf is his Banner Saga BFF.

Title: Guacamelee 2 Review - Ready For A Challenge
Review: Guacamelee 2 doubles down on what worked in the original and presents the most formidable challenges yet.
Author Information: Justin Clark's playthrough of Guacamelee 2 topped out at 15 hours. He has not stopped making Spanish-based puns to his friends and family all week. Yes, this is a cry for help. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Madden NFL 19 Review
Review: Madden NFL 19 nails the controls, Franchise gets more attention, and Longshot returns with a memorable story.
Author Information: Eddie Makuch spent 20 hours playing Madden NFL 19, including around five hours in Longshot: Homecoming. He played on Xbox One X using a code provided by Electronic Arts.

Title: Sonic Mania Plus Review - Encore! Encore!
Review: Sonic Mania remains the best Sonic game ever made, and with its latest update, it's even better than before.
Author Information: Matt was a huge fan of Sonic the Hedgehog growing up, spending countless hours playing the originals with his older brothers and drawing its characters in spiral notebooks. His favorite game in the series used to be Sonic 3 & Knuckles. Random fact: the Sonic R soundtrack holds a special place in his heart. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: Overcooked 2 Review - A Great Second Course
Review: Overcooked 2 brings new levels and small-but-smart additions to the already great couch co-op formula.
Author Information: Kallie played around 10 hours of Overcooked 2, splitting time between single-player, two-player co-op, and four-player co-op. She was able to get online and try some co-op there as well. A code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: The King's Bird Review: A Rocky Flight
Review: The lovely aesthetics and graceful movement in A King‰Ûªs Bird are undercut by a too steep difficulty and imprecise controls.
Author Information: Tom took a half dozen hours to reach the end of A King‰Ûªs Bird using a Steam code provided by the developer. He‰Ûªs as shocked as anyone that such a pretty platformer could be so unwelcoming.

Title: Onrush Review: Push It To The Limit
Review: Onrush's unique blend of influences results in an innovative and refreshing racing game that replaces the finish line with objectives and teamwork.
Author Information: Richard spent over 10 hours colliding with other vehicles across Onrush's single and multiplayer modes. A complimentary copy of the game was provided for review.

Title: Flipping Death Review: Scythe Life
Review: Flipping Death is a quirky and lovingly crafted adventure that doesn‰Ûªt overstay its welcome.
Author Information: Seamus spent six hours exploring the town of Flatwood Peaks and messing with every mortal resident he could using a Steam code provided by the developer. Already missing the lovable characters of Flipping Death, he thinks he‰Ûªll need to go back and collect each Ghost Card before he can move on to the next adventure game.

Title: West Of Loathing Review: Wild Wild West
Review: Humor courses through West of Loathing's veins, making every minute of this RPG/adventure hybrid a delight.
Author Information: Edmond Tran played through West of Loathing as a Cow Puncher on PC and a Bean Slinger on Nintendo Switch. He always rides a pale horse.

Title: Mothergunship Review: Bullet-Hell Extravaganza
Review: Mothergunship on PC, PS4, and Xbox One is a surprisingly tense and fast-paced shooter that blends the best of classic FPS gameplay with a hardcore roguelike.
Author Information: Alessandro has fond memories of classic FPS games like Doom and Quake, and he enjoyed powering through Mothergunship's difficult but satisfying missions. He spent six to seven hours clearing the main story, the game's numerous enemies falling victim to his skill in wielding six guns at once. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Moonlighter Review: Open For Business
Review: Moonlighter is a delightful adventure into the depths of ancient dungeons and the trials of running an equipment shop.
Author Information: Dan Starkey cut his teeth on 16-bit adventure titles as so many did, with Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past. Enjoying Moonlighter as a loving send up of the genre, he eagerly dipped 12 hours into the maintenance of his shop and countless trips to the depths on PC, and further testing of the PS4 version was handled by GameSpot staff. Complimentary codes were provided for this review.

Title: Jurassic World Evolution Review: Life Finds A Way
Review: An enjoyable management sim 65 million years in the making.
Author Information: After spending over 25 hours with Jurassic World Evolution, James Swinbanks was last spotted tending to the Raptor cage. He was never seen or heard from again. He played both Xbox One and PC versions using code provided by the publisher.

Title: Lumines Remastered: Groove Is In The Heart
Review: Lumines makes the jump to current-gen platforms looking and sounding better than ever.
Author Information: Justin Clark unlocked 20 of Lumines Remastered's skins, completed 25 of its missions, and made countless confused grunting noises while playing Puzzle Mode. A complimentary code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Unravel 2 Review: Partners In Twine
Review: Unravel's delightful sequel makes for a fun and breezy co-op adventure.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 5 hours completing Unravel Two and half of its optional challenges. Review code was provided by EA.

Title: Sushi Striker: The Way Of Sushido Review - Cartoon Cuisine Combat
Review: Sushi Striker's ridiculous story and fast-paced match-three puzzle gameplay make it one of Switch's most pleasant surprises.
Author Information: Kevin played through Sushi Striker's main story campaign and ate thousands of plates of sushi (in the game). Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary code for the purpose of this review.

Title: Crash Bandicoot N Sane Trilogy Review: Marsupial Makeover
Review: Crash Bandicoot N. Sane Trilogy gives three classic games a fresh coat of paint, but there's no mistaking that they're old at heart.
Author Information: Peter stayed current with new Crash games during the PlayStation's life span

Title: Mario Tennis Aces Review: Aim High
Review: Aces is the most complex and Mario Tennis game yet, but its online modes are missing some key features.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Adventure Mode after four days of fire, fury, and perseverance. He dreams of a perfect world where all threats can be neutralized through the power of tennis. A review code was provided by Nintendo.

Title: The Awesome Adventures Of Captain Spirit - Mind Over Matter
Review: A complete, free prelude to Life is Strange 2 that has us ready for more.
Author Information: James O'Connor loves episodic adventure games, and thinks developer Dontnod has a real shot of usurping Telltale's dominance in the genre. He finished The Awesome Adventures of Captain Spirit on Xbox One three times with a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Nier: Automata Review
Review: The sequel to Yoko Taro's cult hit is a beautifully frenetic hack-and-slasher with an engrossing and layered story.
Author Information: Miguel needed 50 hours to reach all of Nier: Automata's five main endings as well as a couple of minor ones. He also checked off 50% of the side missions in the process. Additional testing was handled by other GameSpot staff. Square Enix supplied complimentary codes for all platforms.

Title: The Crew 2 Review - On The Road Again
Review: Ubisoft's Transamerican driving game trades in arcade-style fun, variety, and player convenience, though its exploration and multiplayer options leave you wanting.
Author Information: Edmond Tran prefers to virtually drive cars from the 1970s and kinda wishes Ubisoft would make another Driver game. The Crew 2 was played on PS4 Pro using a code provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Wreckfest Review: Crashing The Party
Review: Destruction Derby meets Flatout in this excellent new racing game.
Author Information: James Swinbanks rolled his car 37 times and played 15 hours of Wreckfest for the purposes of this review, using a copy purchased during early access.

Title: Octopath Traveler Review: Divide And Conquer
Review: Octopath Traveler finds comfort in tradition but doesn't shy away from breaking the mold.
Author Information: Peter watched the credits roll after completing his protagonist's campaign and then jumped back in to finish three more before writing his review, after 65 hours--he has reached the final chapters of the four remaining stories. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker Nintendo Switch Review: Time For Adventure
Review: Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker's clever puzzles and creative take on platforming remain great on Nintendo Switch.
Author Information: Dan Starkey, like just about everyone, loves a satisfying platformer. He spent a total of nine hours tracking treasure on this adventure: seven for the single player mode with added stages and chapters and another two spent in co-op.

Title: Fighting EX Layer Review: One-On-One Fun
Review: Fighting EX Layer is a no-frills package, but the combat is top-notch.
Author Information: The mid-to-late '90s were a golden era for fighting games, and Heidi's been playing them since their heyday. She put roughly 15 hours with Fighting EX Layer, playing lots of matches with locally and online to come to grips with the game's nuances‰Û_though she still feels like there's plenty left to learn.

Title: Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus Nintendo Switch Review
Review: Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus is still the same great game on Nintendo Switch, but only if you play it in docked mode.
Author Information: Kallie first reviewed Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus last year. She played seven hours of The New Colossus on Nintendo Switch

Title: Yoku‰Ûªs Island Express Review: A Breath of Fresh Air
Review: The unique blend of Metroid and pinball makes Yoku‰Ûªs Island Express as entertaining as it is charming.
Author Information: While he normally loves RPGs and single-player games, Alexander had a blast pushing a colourful ball of dung, playing make-shift pinball, and delivering mail as a proud employee of Yoku‰Ûªs Island Express. Over 10 hours was spent playing on the PC, all of which involved flinging poor Yoku around the stunningly beautiful Mokumana Island.

Title: Quarantine Circular Review: Who Are We Really?
Review: Quarantine Circular asks fascinating questions about humanity in a well-written narrative adventure, but it struggles to stick the landing.
Author Information: Alessandro sought to save humanity at any cost in Quarantine Circular and met some unforgettable people along the way during his two-hour playthrough. He also returned to see how some other decisions might have worked out to satisfy his curiosity. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Street Fighter 30th Anniversary Collection Review - Keep The Past Alive
Review: The new Street Fighter collection ensures the series' most influential chapters are here to stay.
Author Information: Peter tested every game in the collection but spent most of his time playing two of his favorite fighting games of all time, Street Fighter Alpha 3 and Street Fighter III: 3rd Strike. Capcom provided GameSpot with complimentary copies of the game on all platforms.

Title: 20XX Review - Robot Generation
Review: 20XX's great gameplay is let down by inconsistent procedural level designs and underwhelming boss battles.
Author Information: Alessandro jumped, shot, and dashed his way through randomly devious levels for over eight hours, mixing things up with both Nina and Ace throughout. He learned to really despise corridors filled with deadly icicles. Code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Rainbow Skies Review: Rainbow in the Dark
Review: A stuffy follow-up to Rainbow Moon that doesn't improve on its predecessor.
Author Information: James O'Connor was quite fond of Rainbow Moon, so he's disappointed that he didn't enjoy Rainbow Skies more. Review code was provided by the publisher, and the game was played across PS4 and PS Vita, often well into the morning.

Title: BlazBlue: Cross Tag Battle Review - The Tag Team Dream
Review: The wonderful worlds of BlazBlue, Persona 4, Under Night, and RWBY collide for an accessible yet challenging fighting showcase.
Author Information: Michael threw hands in BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger and Chrono Phantasma, but pursued his true self in Persona 4 Arena and Arena Ultimax. Persona means the world to him, so seeing his best friends from Inaba brings him more joy than you can imagine. Cross-Tag Battle's story mode was completed to 100% across all episodes, and countless matches were fought locally and online with the PS4 and Switch versions. Arc System Works provided complimentary copies of the game for review.

Title: The Forest Review: Are You Afraid Of The Dark?
Review: The Forest's survival mechanics are captivating, but its unforgettable horrors steal the show.
Author Information: Alessandro spent over 24 hours crafting his settlement on The Forest's cannibal-infested island. He spent many of those hours building traps to defend his home, and more than he'd like to admit cowering in the shadows. "Armsy" the cave monster still scares him that much.

Title: Dillon's Dead-Heat Breakers Review: Running On Fumes
Review: Dillon's Dead-Heat Breakers has some fantastic moments, but it more often succumbs to mundanity.
Author Information: Dan Starkey still remembers the Golden Age of tower defense games. Whether it was desktop tower defense, the neat tron-inspired laser fields, or the more modern, big-budget iterations like Defense Grid, Starkey loved them all. He spent about 22 hours playing through all the side quests and the 15 main missions in Dead-heat Breakers. He was provided a copy of the game by the Nintendo for the purposes of this review.

Title: Framed Collection Review - Worth A Thousand Words
Review: Unique smartphone games Framed and Framed 2 are now together in one place and offer some fun, clever puzzles.
Author Information: James O'Connor had previously played both games on smartphone, but was happy to play them through again on Switch--and test the PC version--to see how they held up. GameSpot was provided with review code for both versions.

Title: Hyrule Warriors: Definitive Edition Review - The Great Zelda Spin-Off Is Back
Review: Hyrule Warriors: Definitive Edition  on Switch brings all the DLC from other platforms together for what is, in essence, a remaster of one of the best Zelda spin-offs.
Author Information: Dan Starkey put about 16 hours into this raucous affair. Spending about two hours in multiplayer, and the rest pressing through the single player maps. He received a copy the game from the publisher prior to release.

Title: Agony Review: A Captivating Disappointment
Review: Despite some glorious and gruesome horror imagery, Agony doesn't have much else to offer.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 11 hours in Agony. A complimentary review code was provided by the developer.

Title: Golem Review: Hidden In Plain Sight
Review: Golem‰Ûªs gorgeous presentation is undercut by poorly designed puzzles and frustrating navigation.
Author Information: Alessandro spent over eight hours exploring this stunning world with his new golem buddy. He also spent far too much time clicking away at the environment to determine what was actually part of each puzzle. Complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Pillars Of Eternity 2: Deadfire Review - A Pirate's Life For Me
Review: Ship management and naval battles fit neatly into the dark fantasy setting of Pillars of Eternity 2: Deadfire.
Author Information: Dan Starkey‰Ûªs a DnD and CRPG obsessive. He has fond memories of late nights by the glow of a CRT, probing the secrets of Knights of the Old Republic‰Ûªs Ebonhawk, or the imaginative levels of Planescape Torment. He spent the better part of 55 hours in the Deadfire Archipelago over the course of a week. Code was provided by the publisher for the purposes of review.

Title: Vampyr Review: The City That Never Sleeps
Review: Dontnod follows up Life Is Strange with a surprisingly enthralling supernatural thriller.
Author Information: Justin Clark gave about 48 hours over to the dark embrace on PS4, and further testing of the PC version was handled by GameSpot staff. A complimentary copy of the game was provided for review.

Title: Detroit: Become Human Review - To Err Is Human
Review: Detroit: Become Human presents a gripping tale that's occasionally sullied by blatant missteps.
Author Information: Peter completed Detroit in a weekend, and despite doing his best to go back and replay old sections while making new decisions, he stopped short of replaying too many chapters in order to preserve the impact of the story he experienced the first time through. Sony provided GameSpot with complimentary copies of the game.

Title: FAR: Lone Sails Review: Come Sail Away
Review: A meditative, breezy puzzle adventure game that's light on challenge, but likely to stick with you after you finish it.
Author Information: James O'Connor spent three hours getting unexpectedly attached to the ship in FAR: Lone Sails before hitting the end credits. Code was provided to GameSpot for review.

Title: Battletech Review: A Tactical PC Game That Will Mech Your Day
Review: Battletech's brand of mechanized tactics is as deep as it is slow. But with patience and attention, its detailed mechanics and tonal presentation are incredibly rewarding.
Author Information: Edmond Tran shamefully owns two big-box copies of Heavy Gear for some reason. He has spent over 35 hours with Battletech so far. This might just be the last time he uses a review bio to request a spiritual successor to Front Mission 3.

Title: Runner 3 Review: A Bit Of A Trip
Review: Runner 3 is the most ambitious in the series yet--and also the toughest.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent eight hours with Runner 3, completing the main stages in five hours. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: State Of Decay 2 Review: The Limping Dead
Review: State of Decay 2 implements some interesting mechanics but fails to engage with them in a meaningful way.
Author Information: Alessandro pummeled over 1000 zombies and eradicated all those pesky Plague Hearts in his pursuit to see a hopeful future. He also spent some time with new communities and alternative starting areas. Code was provided by Microsoft for the purposes of this review.

Title: Destiny 2: Warmind Review - Back To Work
Review: Destiny 2: Warmind is geared toward high-level players, but it offers little in the way of motivation while you grind levels to get to the endgame.
Author Information: Kallie finished Warmind's campaign in about two hours, including detours to grind a few Milestones. She then messed around in Strikes, Escalation Protocols, and more to try out her new-and-improved exotics. She is really loving the changes to Riskrunner.

Title: Wizard Of Legend Review: Fast-Paced Action
Review: The fast movement and skillful action of Wizard of Legend sets it apart among a sea of indie roguelikes.
Author Information: Heidi has played a whole mess of roguelikes. She's also played a whole mess of action-RPGs and overhead action games. So when a game came along combining all of those... well, she jumped at it. She's still trying to collect some of the spells and artifacts, but she put a lot of time into exploring Wizard of Legend.

Title: Battle Chasers Nightwar Review: Switch It Up
Review: Justin Clark spent 50 hours with Battle Chasers on its original release, and an additional 20 between the Switch and the current version on PS4. It was not till his ...
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 50 hours with Battle Chasers on its original release, and an additional 20 between the Switch and the current version on PS4. It was not till his current playthrough that he realized he was saying ‰ÛÏNO! MONIKA!‰Û like Ja Rule in The Fast and the Furious whenever Red Monika died in-game. A code for the Switch version was provided by the developer, and the PC and Xbox One versions were tested by GameSpot staff.

Title: Conan Exiles Review: Dull And Dense
Review: This hardcore survival sim is too dense for its own good.
Author Information: Having spent over 40 hours building, climbing, and trudging through the exiled lands, James Swinbanks is looking forward to getting home and having a hot shower. He spent over 40 hours playing across PC and Xbox using both PC code purchased during Early Access and Xbox code provided by the publisher for review purposes.

Title: Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze Review - A Blast From The Past
Review: Tropical Freeze is another wonderful Donkey Kong Country game, and it's better than ever on Switch.
Author Information: Peter completed Tropical Freeze as Donkey Kong and surfed through a couple worlds as Funky Kong before writing his review. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Jotun: Valhalla Edition Switch Review - A Slight Downgrade
Review: Jaw dropping beauty and a hefty challenge await you in in the hallowed realm of Jotun.
Author Information: With no small amount of luck, and hundreds of deaths, Justin Clark was able to complete Jotun‰Ûªs campaign. To his dismay, Chris Hemsworth was not the final boss. In addition to playing Jotun on PC, PS4, and Xbox one back in 2015, Justin spent a couple hours with the Switch version for this updated review.

Title: Nintendo Labo Review: Variety Kit And Robot Kit
Review: Nintendo Labo is a great tool for learning and creation, but the games themselves lack lasting appeal.
Author Information: Kallie spent around 25 hours building the Variety Kit's Toy-Cons, playing their games, learning how they work, and then trying her hand at making a Toy-Con game herself. She then spent another 5 with the Robot Kit. Complimentary kits were provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: City of Brass Review - Hidden Treasure
Review: City of Brass may not be solid gold, but the luster of its well-balanced gameplay loop makes it worth a look.
Author Information: Alexander spent many hours fighting skeletons, avoiding floor spikes, and bribing genies in order to conquer the City of Brass. GameSpot was provided a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for this review.

Title: The Invisible Hours Review: From Every Angle
Review: The Invisible Hours is less about solving a murder and more about appreciating the interwoven stories of its compelling characters.
Author Information: Kallie spent 10 hours playing The Invisible Hours on Xbox One, following every character through each chapter to get the full picture. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Total War Saga: Thrones Of Britannia Review - Rule Britannia
Review: Total War Saga: Thrones of Britannia makes a hearty meal out of pig-sticking, pillaging, and politics.
Author Information: Ginny Woo leans towards military carnage of a distinctly Warhammer flavor, but now and again she craves some good, old-fashioned historical intrigue. For the purposes of this review, Ginny spent 40 hours putting out the flames of rebellion across all the major cultural groups, granting divorces, and putting traitors to the sword. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Sega.

Title: Fortnite: Battle Royale Review - Laying The Foundation
Review: Fortnite: Battle Royale offers lots of depth with a fun and unique take on the last-person-standing premise.
Author Information: Michael has completed a battle royale trifecta having reviewed PUBG, H1Z1, and now Fortnite. He was totally on that wave before everyone else (pinky up) with early ARMA mods and H1Z1: King of the Kill. He put over 40 hours in Fortnite: Battle Royale for review, and a majority of that time was spent on the PC version, although time went into the PS4 and Xbox One versions as well. He provided his own copy of the game, since it's free.

Title: Frostpunk Review: Damned If You Do Damned If You Don't
Review: Frostpunk is a brutal city-survival sim that thrives on forcing you to make tough choices in harrowing scenarios.
Author Information: Dan Starkey‰Ûªs a big fan of building cities. Starting with SimCity 3000 Unlimited, he‰Ûªs been building up all kinds of municipalities, hoping that they will stand the test of time. He was provided with a copy by the publisher for the purposes of this review and managed to complete two of three main scenarios over 25 hours (in the last one, all his people froze to death. RIP.)

Title: Extinction Review - A Giant Mess
Review: Extinction is a clumsy and frustrating game that struggles to put its potential to good use.
Author Information: Peter finished Extinction's story mode on PS4 and did further testing on Xbox One and PC before writing his review. Complimentary copies of the game were provided by the publisher.

Title: God Of War Review: Out With The Old In With The New
Review: God of War is every bit the over-the-top action game you expect, but it's the story and setting that end up stealing the show.
Author Information: Peter completed God of War's story in roughly 30 hours before writing his review. He's eagerly continuing his search for greater treasure and more powerful opponents. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Sony.

Title: The Alliance Alive Review: A Change Of Pace
Review: Good pacing, engaging mechanics, and an interesting setting help make The Alliance Alive a noteworthy RPG.
Author Information: Heidi‰Ûªs been playing JRPGs practically since she could hold a controller. She spent about 35 hours with The Alliance Alive on her playthrough for this review, but she‰Ûªs strongly considering going through it again.

Title: Life Is Strange: Before The Storm Review - Keep the Good Times Rolling
Review: Before the Storm is an impactful prequel that accomplishes something very different than the original Life is Strange.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Before The Storm and its bonus episodes in about 6 hours. A season pass was provided by the publisher.

Title: Penny-Punching Princess Review: In For A Pound
Review: Penny-Punching Princess is a solid, often fun brawler, but its emphasis on grinding and repetition make it too easy to step away from.
Author Information: James O'Connor appreciates the irony of playing a game about a princess with a complicated relationship with money purely so he can write a review and get paid for it. Review code for this game was provided by the publisher.

Title: MLB The Show 18 Review: A Home Run
Review: MLB The Show 18 controls like a dream, and is the best-looking baseball game ever made.
Author Information: Eddie spent more than a dozen hours across all of MLB The Show 18's modes. He nearly threw two no-hitters, one of which was broken up with two outs in the ninth. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Sony.

Title: The Swords Of Ditto Review: One Good Turn Deserves Another
Review: This compact action-RPG will charm you for days on end.
Author Information: James Swinbanks is a game reviewer by day and cartoon superhero by night. He spent 35 hours with The Swords of Ditto across PC and PS4, using codes provided by Devolver Digital.

Title: Orwell: Ignorance Is Strength Review - Staunch Surveillance
Review: The follow-up to Orwell, which asks you to take down an anti-government blogger, is a slighter take on the original game's mechanics and themes.
Author Information: Since reviewing the original Orwell for GameSpot, James O'Connor finally got around to reading Animal Farm (it's very good). He spent 5 hours playing and then revisiting Orwell: Ignorance is Strength. Code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Far Cry 5 Review: Rocky Mountain High
Review: With some smart changes to exploration, discovery, and progression, Far Cry 5 makes engaging and experimenting with its gorgeous open world more exciting than ever.
Author Information: Edmond Tran is an Australian who has road-tripped across America's rural south, but has never been to Montana. He thinks Far Cry 2 had all the best ideas. Far Cry 5 was reviewed on a PS4 Pro. Additional testing of the PC and Xbox One versions were handled by GameSpot staff. Copies of the game were provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Kerbal Space Program: Making History Review - Shoot For The Mun
Review: Kerbal Space Program's first expansion brings a universe of new possibilities, but it might be a little behind in the space race.
Author Information: Justin Clark gave the Making History expansion 35 hours, on top of the 120 he's poured into the base game since it officially released. He's pretty sure this means he has a Bachelor's in Astrophysics now. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Yakuza 6: The Song Of Life Review: Tokyo Drifter
Review: Exciting changes to combat and an endearing narrative see the final chapter in Kazuma Kiryu's decade-long saga refine what has made the series great.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has been an ardent fan of the Yakuza series since 2006. He spent around 65 hours completing literally everything Yakuza 6: The Song of Life has to offer, and all he got was a lousy Platinum trophy. The game was provided by the publisher.

Title: Minit Review - Gone In 60 Seconds
Review: Minit might impose a daunting time limit on each of your lives, but its cleverly designed world and enriched puzzles make the cycle of exploration and death well worth investing ...
Author Information: Alessandro spent well over three hours chopping down trees, finding coins, fighting scorpions and going on treacherous fishing trips across two playthroughs on PS4, including New Game+. Additional testing of the PC version was handled by GameSpot staff. Code was provided by Devolver Digital for the purposes of this review.

Title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice Review
Review: Hellblade is a spellbinding and sympathetic game about loss and redemption.
Author Information: Alessandro finished Hellblade's story in about 8 hours on hard mode. Playing on the PC, he was able to clear through the initial playthrough of the game without experiencing permadeath. The GameSpot staff also played through the game on PS4 and PS4 Pro. GameSpot was provided complimentary codes by developer and publisher Ninja Theory for the purpose of this review. Also, DmC: Devil May Cry was a great game.

Title: A Way Out Review: You Can't Have One Without The Other
Review: A Way Out is a unique, enjoyable adventure that has a number of problems.
Author Information: Oscar and GameSpot senior video producer Adam Mason were forced to sit next to one another for around eight hours while playing A Way Out. They enjoyed both the game and each other's company (mostly). EA provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Sea Of Thieves Review: Set Sail With Trepidation
Review: Sea of Thieves' promising foundation is muddied by shallow quests and the pervasive cynicism of other players.
Author Information: Peter sunk roughly 30 hours into Sea of Thieves before tying up his sails, and he hopes to revisit the game down the road if Rare can build on its more enticing aspects. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies by Microsoft.

Title: Ni No Kuni 2: Revenant Kingdom Review - A Regal Joyride
Review: Ni No Kuni 2's adorable exterior masks the impressive RPG within.
Author Information: Peter completed Ni No Kuni 2's story in 35 hours, which included a few hours dedicated solely to developing his new kingdom. Bandai-Namco provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Attack on Titan 2 Review: Colossal Action
Review: A surprising and satisfying action RPG with giant saggy butts.
Author Information: James Swinbanks is a half-human, half-Titan hybrid. He spent 18 hours with Attack on Titan 2 using a code provided by Koei Tecmo for review purposes.

Title: Surviving Mars Review: Building The Final Frontier
Review: Surviving Mars tasks you with leading humanity's first colonies on the Red Planet. But Mars is hardly forgiving, and it will fight you every step of the way.
Author Information: Starkey has been fascinated by space since childhood. He started a dozen colonies, abandoning the first eight to the swirling clouds of dust on the Red Planet. He brought the other four up to self-sufficient state, taking them into the late game. An early code was provided by the developer for this review.

Title: Detective Pikachu Review: Elementary My Dear Watt-son
Review: Detective Pikachu's simple gameplay and story is made better by its goofy and entertaining star.
Author Information: It took Kallie 12 hours to finish Detective Pikachu's story. She was very happy that Trubbish made an appearance. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Mulaka Review: Of Myth And Monsters
Review: A magical setting and engaging gameplay make Mulaka a worthwhile adventure.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent around ten hours exploring the magical world of Mulaka using a copy of the game provided by the developer.

Title: Batman: The Enemy Within Episode 5 Review - No More Joking Around
Review: Telltale finishes strong with an introspective look at the relationship between Batman and Joker.
Author Information: Tamoor now wants a series in which he can play as Joker the vigilante, if only to use the chattering teeth grapnel. GameSpot was provided with a code for this review.

Title: H1Z1 Review: Still On The Ground Floor
Review: In many ways, H1Z1 still captures the magic of battle royale games, but there isn't enough to make it stand out from the competition.
