Author Information: Michael is a veteran of battle royale games, having poured dozens of hours into the earlier Arma 2 mods and H1Z1: King of the Kill. He also reviewed PUBG for GameSpot and became a sort of Fortnite expert on accident. He spent a little over 30 hours with the 1.0 release of H1Z1.

Title: Pit People Review
Review: The Behemoth's turn-based strategy game carries the studio's usual sense of humor and a fun PokÌ©mon-style "catch 'em all" twist.
Author Information: James O'Connor thinks that this genre peaked at Fire Emblem Awakening and would have loved to have married off the weird monsters and even weirder humans on his team. He spent 16 hours with Pit People using a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Q.U.B.E. 2 Review: Think Inside The Box
Review: Q.U.B.E. 2 presents satisfyingly complex puzzles, but a messy narrative underpins its lack of personality.
Author Information: Alessandro rotated, created, and levitated all sorts of colourful blocks over his six hour stay within Q.U.B.E. 2's mysterious alien artifact. A complimentary code was provided by Toxic Games for review.

Title: Kirby Star Allies Review: Take It Easy
Review: With heaps of personality and invaluable extra content, Kirby Star Allies rises to greatness.
Author Information: Peter breezed through story mode in about five hours, walking away with over 100 extra lives. Another couple hours were spent cleaning up puzzle pieces, and in the speedrun and boss rush modes. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Bravo Team Review: Back To Basics
Review: Though VR co-op is a nice touch, Bravo Team brings nothing else new to the table.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent three hours with Bravo Team's campaign and an additional 2 was spent in co-op. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: The 25th Ward: The Silver Case Review: Obstruction Of Justice
Review: The 25th Ward's splintered narrative will frustrate and confuse, but also fascinate.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed every episode in The 25th Ward in just over 20 hours. Not coincidentally, he has refused to go to an ATM all week. A complimentary review code was provided by NIS America.

Title: Payday 2 Switch Review: Mo' Money Mo' Problems
Review: Marred by compromise, Payday 2 on Switch pales in comparison to other versions.
Author Information: James Swinbanks is a world-renowned criminal mastermind said to be living in an underwater palace in the Pacific Ocean he built using his stolen millions. He spent just over 20 hours with Payday 2 using a code provided by Starbreeze Studios for review purposes.

Title: Gravel Review: Slow And Steady Doesn't Win The Race
Review: Gravel's arcade sensibilities conjure occasional moments of flat out fun, but unimaginative track design and a lack of depth means most races are just dull.
Author Information: Richard spent roughly 15 hours on Gravel‰Ûªs uneven tracks, using a complimentary copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Moss Review: Tiny Triumph
Review: Moss makes it easy for you to connect to its adventurous, adorable protagonist as you accompany her on a whimsical journey though a surprisingly inventive platformer.
Author Information: Alessandro and Quill explored every inch of Moss' world they could find over a period of four hours, taking in the sights and hunting down some collectibles during their adventure. A code was provided by Sony for the purposes of review.

Title: Where The Water Tastes Like Wine Review: Hard Travelin'
Review: A unique game about collecting and trading stories across the American Dust Bowl doesn't give much room to craft your own story in the process.
Author Information: James O'Connor isn't an American (he's Australian, in fact), but he loves a good story. He spent 12 hours reaching the conclusion of Where the Water Tastes Like Wine, code for which was provided by the publisher.

Title: Pac-Man: Championship Edition 2 Review
Review: Pac-Man: Championship Edition 2 builds on the success of its predecessor, reinvigorating classic Pac-Man gameplay with new mechanics and eye-catching visuals.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile has been gobbling dots with Pac-Man since the beginning, and after around 6 hours with this new Pac, he expects to continue doing so until well into the future. GameSpot was provided with complimentary download codes for the purpose of this review.

Title: Metal Gear Survive Review: Too Harsh To Enjoy
Review: Metal Gear Survive's punishing systems drag down what could have been a good survival game for PS4, Xbox One, and PC.
Author Information: Tamoor is lifelong Metal Gear fan. He still plays Metal Gear Solid 5 at least once a week, and Survive has been an interesting shock to the system for him. GameSpot was supplied with a complimentary code to conduct its review.

Title: Bridge Constructor Portal Review
Review: Bridge Constructor Portal lacks the charm and cleverness that made the original Portal games so enthralling.
Author Information: Until a bug halted his progress at test chamber 50, Tom spent 25 hours building bridges and saving stickmen using a complimentary Switch copy of the game provided to GameSpot.

Title: Fe Review: Strike A Chord
Review: Fe's ethereal world compels you to explore, but its adventure never builds to something greater.

Title: Aegis Defenders Review
Review: Platforming and tower defense do not mix well in Aegis Defenders.
Author Information: Oscar jumped gaps, placed turrets, and shot enemies in Aegis Defenders for around 20 hours. A complimentary code was supplied to GameSpot for the purposes of this review.

Title: Age Of Empires: Definitive Edition Review: Antique Revival
Review: Age of Empires: Definitive Edition introduces gameplay tweaks and 4K visuals to a 20-year old classic, but not everything holds up to modern standards.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been playing Age of Empires almost since its inception. While he (like many) started with Age of Kings, he's since developed a perplexing passion for each of the quirky games in the series--yes, even Age of Mythology. He received a pre-release code from the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Attack Of The Earthlings Review: The Tables Have Turned
Review: Attack of the Earthlings is a humorous, inverted take on the familiar alien invasion story, packaged within a decent turn-based strategy game.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey survived the human invasion, expelling the intruders in about 10 hours. He was provided with code by the publisher for the purposes of this review.

Title: Rust Review: Life Is Fleeting
Review: Rust's dated survival mechanics and overwhelmingly unwelcoming player base make it an experience more interesting to talk about than actually play.
Author Information: Alessandro spent over 30 hours hitting a rock against a bigger rock only to have his handful of stones stolen by a roving band of armed militia. GameSpot received a complementary code from Facepunch Studios.

Title: Bayonetta 2 Review
Review: Bayonetta 2 is a classic, and one of the finest, most wonderfully insane action games ever made.
Author Information: Mark adored the original Bayonetta, but even all that time spent with Platinum Games' classic didn't prepare him for just how wonderful its sequel would be. He completed Bayonetta 2's story mode, beat all the challenges, and continues to try and uncover the game's many secrets.

Title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance Review: The Past Comes At You Fast
Review: Kingdom Come: Deliverance offers enthralling medieval history alongside demanding systems and troublesome bugs.
Author Information: Brett spent 40 hours (on PC) in the feudal pleasures and pitfalls of the Holy Roman Empire as depicted in Kingdom Come: Deliverance. Additional testing of the PS4 and Xbox One versions were handled by GameSpot staff. All versions were complimentary copies provided by the publisher.

Title: Dandara Review: Off The Wall
Review: Dandara‰Ûªs inventive movement mechanics help keep this sometimes frustrating platformer afloat.
Author Information: Tom took more than 10 hours to play through Dandara using a Switch copy provided by the publisher. He explored 98% of the map but found a mere 77% of the treasure chests.

Title: Secret Of Mana Review: Where Secrets Go Trouble Follows
Review: The Secret of Mana remake is mostly the same game you know and love, for better and for worse.
Author Information: Justin Clark put 22 hours into Secret of Mana, finally settling an angry, twenty-year grudge against Thunder Gigas in the process. A complimentary code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Civilization 6: Rise And Fall Review: A New Era
Review: Rise and Fall introduces smart new features to Civ VI that enhance the base game without overcomplicating it.
Author Information: Kallie played two full games in Rise and Fall, winning a science victory as Korea and a culture victory as the Cree. She experimented with a few of the other new civs before deciding that Korea is her new go-to. A complimentary copy was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Dynasty Warriors 9 Review: A New World
Review: A new open world breathes life into this ancient franchise.
Author Information: Belying his usual peaceful nature, James Swinbanks spent nearly 50 hours carving through and laying waste to thousands of soldiers with a complimentary copy of Dynasty Warriors 9, provided by Koei Tecmo for the purposes of this review.

Title: Dissidia Final Fantasy NT Review: A Messy Mashup
Review: Square-Enix and Team Ninja have brought its popular arcade-fighter Dissidia Final Fantasy to the home platform, but it unfortunately isn't able to live up to the series it seeks to ...
Author Information: Alessandro is long-time fan of the Final Fantasy series, and has clocked in over 70 hours in Dissidia 012 [Duodecim] on the PSP. Though he enjoyed combat in Dissidia Final Fantasy NT, he was disappointed with how much less content there was to dive into. Square-Enix provided a complimentary code for the game for the purposes of our coverage.

Title: Dragon Quest Builders Review: Working The Land
Review: A clever concept begets outstanding execution as the world of the original Dragon Quest is reimagined as a riveting sandbox.
Author Information: Miguel needed 50 hours to complete Dragon Quest Builders' campaign, a playthrough that also included free-roaming for optional treasures. He spent an additional five hours on the Vita version. Review codes for both platforms were provided by Square Enix in advance of release. This review gave Miguel an unsurprising hankering to replay the original Dragon Quest.

Title: Shadow Of The Colossus Review: A Timeless Classic
Review: Shadow of the Colossus is a beautiful reconstruction of an extraordinary title, a modern classic that everyone must experience.
Author Information: Edmond Tran still remembers the day he bought the PAL cardboard sleeve version of Shadow of the Colossus for PlayStation 2 over a decade ago. He cherishes it, and even kept the original shrink wrap because that's not a weird, obsessive thing to do at all. He patted Agro about 87 times in this remake with a copy provided by SCE.

Title: Crossing Souls Review: Stuck In The Past
Review: Crossing Souls is a serviceable action-adventure fueled by 1980s nostalgia, but its dependence on classic tropes isn't enough to make it remarkable.
Author Information: Edmond Tran's life is full of non-stop 80s music weekends, and he also shares Chris' unique ability to climb ladders. Crossing Souls was completed in approximately 7 hours using a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: Radiant Historia Perfect Chronology Review: Time After Time After Time
Review: A seemingly novel time-travel mechanic shows depth in this engrossing 3DS enhanced port of a Nintendo DS RPG.
Author Information: Miguel spent 60 hours on the story, which also included sessions in the Vault of Time. A code was provided by Atlus for review purposes.

Title: Night In The Woods Review
Review: Night in the Woods delivers an evocative take on the early-20s existential crisis with awkward humor and charming characters.
Author Information: Kallie took 12 hours to play through Night in the Woods using a complimentary copy provided to GameSpot. She successfully raised the baby rats.

Title: The Longest Five Minutes Review: The Power Of Memories
Review: The Longest Five Minutes‰Ûª intriguing premise and charming visual style is hampered by poor design elements.
Author Information: Heidi put about 15 hours into The Longest Five Minutes, completing and re-completing several quests and investigating multiple story branches. NIS America provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: OK K.O.! Let's Play Heroes Review: Pulling Punches
Review: OK K.O. Let's Play Heroes perfectly captures the tone of the show, but the shallow mechanics prove to be its kryptonite.
Author Information: Instead of going out and doing heroic deeds, Alexander spent many hours playing superhero in the OK K.O. universe instead. GameSpot was provided a complimentary PC copy of the game for this review.

Title: UFC 3 Review: A Tense Exciting And Dynamic Recreation Of MMA
Review: UFC 3's overhauled striking is wince-inducingly brilliant, but its cumbersome grappling continues to lag behind.
Author Information: If the grappling in EA Sports UFC series ever catches up to the striking, Richard might finally stop wishing for a new Fight Night. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by EA.

Title: Owlboy Review: A Heartfelt Tale
Review: Owlboy's touching story is brought to life through beautiful art and an unforgettable soundtrack.
Author Information: Peter kept his eye on Owlboy for years and was thrilled when he discovered that good things indeed come to those who wait. He completed the campaign in roughly 10 hours using a copy of the game provided by developer D-Pad Studio.

Title: Subnautica Review: A Water Wonderland
Review: Subnautica is a terrifying, mystifying, massive, and brilliant survival game.
Author Information: Brett spent around 40 hours swimming and scaring himself stupid amidst the reefs, wrecks, and alien ruins of Subnautica. The game was reviewed using a complimentary copy provided by the developer.

Title: The Inpatient Review
Review: A rare prequel that actually enhances its predecessor, The Inpatient takes a subtle but effective approach to psychological horror in VR.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through The Inpatient three separate times over seven hours, achieving three different outcomes. He spent 25 minutes using the voice function to verbally berate Dr. Bragg. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Celeste Review: More Than Just A Great Platformer
Review: Celeste is a difficult, powerful, rewarding adventure.
Author Information: Oscar completed Celeste's main campaign in a little under seven hours, but the adventure within will stay with him for much, much longer. Matt Makes Games provided GameSpot with complimentary copies of Celeste for the purposes of this review.

Title: Gorogoa Review
Review: Gorogoa provides a beautiful and clever trip through surreal art.
Author Information: Jason played through Gorogoa on Nintendo Switch using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Annapurna Interactive. GameSpot provided additional testing on PC.

Title: The Red Strings Club Review
Review: The Red Strings Club is a deeply gratifying cyberpunk adventure whose strong writing and exciting scenarios enhance its themes about the manipulation of human emotion.
Author Information: David Rayfield has made some questionable choices in bars in the middle of the night. Fortunately, only a few have led to him attempting to bring down global corporations. The Red Strings Club was reviewed on PC. A copy of the game was provided by the publisher.

Title: Iconoclasts Review
Review: Iconoclasts captivates with over-the-top battles and a riveting story.
Author Information: Matt jumped into Iconoclasts completely unaware that it had been in development since 2010. He's a big fan of Metroidvania games and spent 13 hours playing through the adventure. Suffice to say, he enjoyed every second of it. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds Review
Review: Despite glaring technical flaws, PUBG emerges as the most thrilling battle royal game to date.
Author Information: Michael is a veteran of battle royale games, having poured dozens of hours into the earlier Arma II mods and H1Z1: King of the Kill. He spent over 150 hours in PUBG in early access, and he, with help from other GameSpot staff, put further testing into version 1.0 before finalizing his review. He's eating good now with all them chicken dinners.

Title: Hello Neighbor Review
Review: Hello Neighbor seems inviting at the outset, but its clumsy, obtuse approach to stealth will have you searching for the exit.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent seven hours with Hello Neighbor, in both its Early Access and post-release versions. A code was provided by the publisher.

Title: L.A. Noire: The VR Case Files Review
Review: LA Noire VR shows that Rockstar has a deep respect and passion for virtual reality.
Author Information: Jimmy completed the VR version of LA Noire in roughly seven hours on the HTC Vive. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: AO Tennis Review
Review: With more errors (forced and unforced) than winners, AO Tennis is a disappointing return to the tennis game world.
Author Information: Rather than play the real thing, Alexander spent countless tennis matches worth of time playing AO Tennis. GameSpot was provided a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for this review.

Title: Lost Sphear Review: Short Of The Mark
Review: Tokyo RPG Factory's follow-up to I Am Setsuna improves on the first game's combat, but feels like a by-the-numbers RPG in other areas.
Author Information: James O'Connor spent most of the 30 hours it took to finish Lost Sphear thinking about Chrono Trigger, and how long it has been since he last played through it. GameSpot was provided with a PS4 code for review.

Title: Tiny Metal Review
Review: Tiny Metal brings accessible turn-based military strategy back into the spotlight
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through Tiny Metal's campaign on PC in about 6 hours, and he spent another 4 in Skirmish stages. The Switch port was also tested, and is the first game to drag him away from Mario Odyssey since October. Review codes were provided by the publisher.

Title: Spellforce 3 Review
Review: RPG and RTS join together for the somewhat unwieldy but still engaging SpellForce III.
Author Information: Brett spent around 30 hours exploring dungeons and building bases in SpellForce III. Complimentary review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Brawlout Review
Review: Brawlout is a Smash Bros.-like fighting game that's equal parts admirable and frustrating.
Author Information: Heidi has played a fair bit of Smash, and while she's by no means a competitive expert at the game, she's played enough Smash-likes to know what works and what doesn't. Heidi unlocked as much as she could playing Brawlout over the course of a week while also trying to get in online matches. A review code was provided by the developer.

Title: Destiny 2: Curse Of Osiris Review
Review: Destiny 2's first DLC expansion, Curse of Osiris, adds lots of filler and little substance.
Author Information: Kallie played 15 hours of Curse of Osiris and had the most fun with the very broken Prometheus Lens. She played on PS4 using a copy of Destiny 2 provided by Bungie.

Title: Doom VFR Review
Review: Doom's trademark demon slaying translates well to virtual reality, but Doom VFR feels more like a warning shot than a BFG blast.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through Doom VFR‰Ûªs campaign in 4 hours on PSVR. He was looking forward to fistbumping the little Doomguy bobbleheads in VR, dangit. A review code was provided by Bethesda.

Title: Batman: The Enemy Within - Episode 4: What Ails You Review
Review: Telltale puts Bruce Wayne and John Doe's relationship under the microscope in the strongest episode of the Batman: The Enemy Within.
Author Information: Tamoor thinks everyone deserves a chance, even The Joker. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Street Fighter 5: Arcade Edition Review
Review: A variety of offline modes, a fresh coat of paint, and a big new gameplay addition gives Street Fighter V a new lease on life.
Author Information: Tamoor is now having to split time between Street Fighter V and Overwatch, and it's proving to be very difficult. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Rumu Review
Review: Rumu combines some superb character work and heady sci-fi themes into a heart-wrenching story about love, family, and loneliness.
Author Information: He may not be as cute or affectionate as Rumu, but Alexander Pan can clean the heck out of spilled tea and toast, and would gladly do so again. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: The Legend of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild - The Champions' Ballad Review
Review: The Champions' Ballad is a satisfying send-off for one of the year's best games.
Author Information: Peter completed every quest in The Champions' Ballad before writing his review. Nintendo provided a complimentary Breath of the Wild expansion pass to GameSpot.

Title: GT Sport Review
Review: GT Sport's refined multiplayer racing makes up for a relatively small selection of cars and tracks.
Author Information: After nearly 50 hours of racing, including numerous online races and completing the entire campaign mode, James Swinbanks is temporarily hanging up his helmet until the next championship series. His copy of Gran Turismo Sport was provided by Sony.

Title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim Switch Review
Review: A strong foundation and a high-quality port make Skyrim worth revisiting on Switch.
Author Information: Kallie played ten hours of Skyrim on Switch, playing a sneaky archer (of course). She finally tried magic for the first time in six years and loved it. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Xenoblade Chronicles 2 Review
Review: Xenoblade Chronicles 2 is a massive and dense game littered with small issues that hold it back from greatness.
Author Information: Peter has played both Xenoblade Chronicles and Xenoblade Chronicles X (which he also reviewed), and he put 90 hours into Xenoblade Chronicles 2 before writing his review. He uncovered 18 of the game's 38 rare Blades, and concluded the story at level 65. A complimentary copy of the game was provided by Nintendo.

Title: Football Manager 2018 Review
Review: With a significant new addition and impactful overhauls built atop its already-solid foundations, Football Manager 2018 is every bit the compelling time sink as its predecessors.
Author Information: Richard spent over 50 hours playing Football Manager 2018

Title: Steep: Road To The Olympics Review
Review: Steep's Road to the Olympics expansion features a disappointing story mode, but it has just enough other content to make it still worthwhile.
Author Information: Alex is an avid skier in real life and has put about 70 hours into Steep. He spent 10 hours in Road to the Olympics, three of which were devoted to the story mode. He reviewed the game on PS4 Pro with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 Review
Review: It may be formulaic, but Lego Marvel Super Heroes 2 still retains the series' trademark charm and fun.
Author Information: Randolph completed the game with the assistance of his 8-year-old son, who for some strange reason thought Black Bolt was the best character available. Warner Bros. provided the reviewer with a copy of the game.

Title: LA Noire Switch Review
Review: Despite a few technical issues, L.A. Noire is well worth playing on Switch.
Author Information: Matt played ten hours of L.A. Noire on Switch, managing to clear 11 of the game's 21 main cases. He's a huge fan of film noir

Title: Ashes Cricket Review
Review: While it doesn‰Ûªt quite score a century, Ashes Cricket still puts in a decent knock.
Author Information: It's been a few years since James Swinbanks opened the bowling for Kincumber Cricket Club, but he still knows his Fine Leg from his Long Off. He played Ashes Cricket for 10 hours with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: Need For Speed Payback Review
Review: Dull and uninspired, with a relentless emphasis on grinding, Need for Speed Payback is neither fast nor furious.
Author Information: Richard reached Payback's ending in 15 hours, and walked away wishing he had played Criterion's Need for Speed Hot Pursuit instead. Additional testing of the Xbox One version was handled by GameSpot staff. EA provided complimentary copies of the game for review.

Title: Sonic Forces Review
Review: Sonic Forces consistently fails more than it succeeds, squandering the opportunity to build on the series‰Ûª past successes.
Author Information: Matt played Sonic Forces for 8 hours and has managed to achieve S-ranks for 22 out of the 30 main stages. His OC is a bird named Jigen, who wears Salt Bae glasses and fingerless gloves (plz dont steal). Matt was a huge fan of 3D Sonic games growing up. His favorite 3D Sonic game remains Sonic Colors. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: Oure Review
Review: Take to the skies as a dragon in Oure, but don't expect to find much to do up there.
Author Information: James O'Connor took Oure for a spin within moments of its Paris Games Week reveal, and spent about four hours exploring and finishing the game (it would have taken less time if he had not gotten briefly caught up looking for collectables). A copy of the game was purchased by the reviewer.

Title: Steven Universe: Save the Light Review
Review: Grumpyface's second RPG based on Steven Universe is made of love, but it's the bugs that are stronger than you.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to clear Save the Light in around 20 hours with 78% completion. May God grant him the courage to one day do a square afro in public like Garnet. Review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Doom Switch Review
Review: Doom remains a blast to play on Switch despite some persistent performance issues.
Author Information: Peter played ten hours of Doom on Switch heading into his review, splitting his time between the campaign, arcade mode, and multiplayer. Bethesda provided advanced copies of the game to GameSpot.

Title: Horizon: Zero Dawn - The Frozen Wilds Review
Review: The Frozen Wilds gives a generous boost to Horizon: Zero Dawn's big and beautiful open world.
Author Information: Peter put 15 hours into The Frozen Wilds completing the main quest line and the majority of the remaining side quests. He began at level 45, and finished at level 55. Complimentary code was provided by SCIE.

Title: Pokemon Ultra Sun And Ultra Moon Review
Review: Pokemon Ultra Sun and Ultra Moon update last year's games in a series of small but welcome ways.
Author Information: Kallie finished Ultra Sun and Moon in just over 30 hours and is ready to start training competitive Pokemon. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Etrian Odyssey 5: Beyond The Myth Review
Review: Etrian Odyssey 5 further refines a winning dungeon-crawling formula while sticking closely to its roots.
Author Information: Heidi has played almost every Etrian Odyssey game since the series made its debut a decade ago, and she spent about 60 hours working her way through the Beyond the Myth's main quest. Atlus provided GameSpot with a copy of the game.

Title: Spelunker Party Review
Review: Solo Spelunker Party is an unforgiving grind, but a strong multiplayer component makes for a fun time with retro-minded friends.
Author Information: Heidi mined her way through a healthy chunk of Spelunker Party, completing the main four worlds of the game and numerous quests.

Title: Rocket League Switch Review
Review: Rocket League survives its conversion to Switch with minimal wear and tear.
Author Information: Peter has played roughly 200 hours of Rocket League on PS4, and he put in 40 matches on Switch before writing his review. A copy Rocket League was provided by Psyonix.

Title: Hand Of Fate 2 Review
Review: A much-improved sequel that blends disparate gameplay styles to create a compelling roguelike experience.
Author Information: James O'Connor enjoyed the original Hand of Fate, but was far keener on this sequel, which he spent 15 hours with on PC. Somehow, he has never played Dungeons & Dragons. A review code was supplied by the game's developer.

Title: Star Wars Battlefront II Review
Review: The sequel to DICE's 2015 Star Wars game makes some big changes to the formula, but not all are for the better.
Author Information: Alessandro is an admirer of the Star Wars saga, and played way too much of the original Battlefront on Xbox back in the day. Finishing the new Battlefront II's campaign in 4-5 hours, he was also able to spend quite a bit of time checking out the intense online multiplayer. EA provided a complimentary codes for the purpose of this review.

Title: Megaton Rainfall Review
Review: Megaton Rainfall pulls off some feats and squanders others, but one's thing's for sure: there's no other superhero game like it.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to complete Megaton Rainfall's primary missions in about four hours, half in and half out of VR. How Lois Lane flies with Superman so much and doesn't hurl up her last three meals is a mystery. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Call Of Duty: WWII Review
Review: Sledgehammer Games superbly takes Activision's marquee shooter franchise back to its boots-on-the-ground roots.
Author Information: It took Miguel a little over six hours to finish Call of Duty: WWII's campaign, and he spent approximately 20 additional hours progressing through the multiplayer and Zombies modes. This playthrough was experienced on a PlayStation 4 at a four-day Activision-hosted review event in San Francisco.

Title: Batman: The Enemy Within - Episode 3: Fractured Mask Review
Review: Telltale digs deep into Bruce Wayne's relationships, as things get complicated for the Dark Knight.
Author Information: Delving into Batman: The Enemy Within Episode 3 helped Tamoor get over Justice League a bit. GameSpot was provided a code for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Mummy Demastered Review
Review: The Mummy Demastered is an attractive side-scrolling action game from WayForward that tries to makes the most of a gloomy license.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent about seven hours taking down the forces of evil in glorious retro splendor. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Arktika.1 Review
Review: Metro developers 4A Games deliver one of the best action games available on Oculus Rift.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent around six hours shooting bad dudes in virtual Russia with a copy of the game provided by Oculus.

Title: Rive Review
Review: Rive is a challenging side-scrolling shooter with tight platforming and a tenacious affection for over-the-top action.
Author Information: A dyed-in-the-wool child of the ‰Ûª90s, Dan Starkey is a fan of over-the-top action. He played through Rive once on Hard mode (the default setting) and part way through again on Soft. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Super Lucky's Tale Review
Review: Super Lucky's Tale isn't a direct port of its VR predecessor, but it's no less simplistic.
Author Information: Kallie finished Super Lucky's Tale in about five hours with 100% completion. She also played Lucky's Tale on Oculus Rift. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Life Is Strange: Before The Storm - Episode 2 - Brave New World Review
Review: Chloe Price's terrible, horrible, no good, very bad day goes to some fascinating places in this middle chapter.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through Episode 2 twice to see each narrative path play out. A season pass was provided by the publisher.

Title: Assassin's Creed Origins Review
Review: In charting out a new storyline and the largest setting for the series yet, Assassin's Creed Origins makes a few stumbles along the way.
Author Information: Alessandro is an admirer of the Assassin's Creed series. Though the series became too convoluted for his tastes, Origins did a lot to win him back with its new formula. Ubisoft invited GameSpot to a review event where they played through the 30 hour campaign for five days on an Xbox One X developer unit. Ubisoft also provided copies of the PS4 version for additional testing.

Title: Wolfenstein 2: The New Colossus Review
Review: Wolfenstein II: The New Colossus' story of resistance is made more powerful by giving you the tools in combat to overcome incredible odds.
Author Information: Kallie took the stealthy approach, finishing The New Colossus in around 15 hours on the third difficulty and completing Wyatt's timeline. A complimentary PS4 code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: A Hat In Time Review
Review: Despite a lackluster beginning, A Hat in Time is a charming 3D platformer full of heart.
Author Information: Kallie finished A Hat in Time with 100% completion in about 15 hours. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Super Mario Odyssey Review
Review: Super Mario Odyssey is a massive and magnificent celebration of Nintendo's most iconic hero.
Author Information: Peter spent roughly 40 hours with Super Mario Odyssey, earning 515 Power Moons and most of the unlocks in the game. Nintendo provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga + Bowser's Minions Review
Review: A stunning visual overhaul and subtle gameplay enhancements make this already charming, funny RPG even better.
Author Information: Heidi spent about 20 hours on the main story of Mario and Luigi and about six to seven hours on the Minion Quest game. She still hates the final boss with a passion. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Fire Emblem Warriors Review
Review: Fire Emblem‰Ûªs heroes are a natural fit for a Warriors game, but their world adds little depth to the aging and shallow hack-and-slash series.
Author Information: After he finished the campaign, Jeremy Winslow spent the majority of his time trying to unlock his favorite Fire Emblem character, Lyndis, and level her up to be the most powerful character in the game. He spent roughly 30 hours with Fire Emblem Warriors using a complimentary copy provided by Nintendo.

Title: Gundam Versus Review
Review: Big robots trash big cities and other big robots in the faulty-yet-enjoyable Gundam Versus.
Author Information: As a keen saver of worlds, James has kicked over his fair share of mechs over the years. He put eight hours into Gundam Versus on PlayStation 4 Pro using a code provided by Bandai Namco.

Title: The Flame in the Flood Review
Review: The Flame in the Flood is an harsh and absorbing survival game that never lets you rest on your laurels, with fantastic audiovisual design direction.
Author Information: Edmond Tran spent over 15 hours rollin‰Ûª on the river, and roughly the same amount of time listening to the Flame in the Flood soundtrack together with ambient water sounds. The Molasses Flood provided GameSpot with a PC copy of the game for this review.

Title: Golf Story Review
Review: Sidebar Games' charming golf RPG hits it out of the park.
Author Information: Ginny Woo played a whole lot of golf growing up and hated it. Unexpectedly, Golf Story has gone a long way in changing how she feels about the sport, even if the only golf she'll play from now on is virtual. For the purposes of this review, Ginny played both the Story mode and the Quickmatch mode.

Title: Stardew Valley Review
Review: Stardew Valley is a seemingly simple game strengthened by complex systems of time, people, and the town itself.
Author Information: Mary played Stardew Valley for more than 100 hours across PC and PlayStation 4. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the PlayStation 4 version.

Title: Middle-earth: Shadow Of War Review
Review: The follow-up to Shadow of Mordor is bigger in scope, but not always better than its predecessor.
Author Information: Justin played a little over 60 hours of Shadow of War, not including the time he spent reading through the game's extensive appendices on Middle-earth ephemera. An advance copy of the game was provided by Warner Bros. for review.

Title: The Evil Within 2 Review
Review: The sequel to the mind-bending survival-horror game is a clever follow up that makes some big changes.
Author Information: Alessandro enjoys survival horror games and thinks the Resident Evil remake is one of the best games ever made. While he found the original Evil Within to be mostly entertaining, he was very surprised at how much of an improvement the sequel is. Bethesda provided a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for the purposes of this review, with other members of staff playing the PC and Xbox One versions.

Title: WWE 2K18 Review
Review: With the glitches piling up and very little in the way of innovation, WWE 2K18 continues the series' floundering output.
Author Information: Richard spent around 30 hours split between WWE 2K18's various game modes, which meant having to endure more than enough Kid Rock to last a lifetime. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for review.

Title: Destiny 2 Review
Review: Destiny 2 is very similar to the original, but a variety of tweaks and additions make it a far better experience.
Author Information: Kallie played over 40 hours of Destiny after publishing the Review In Progress. She's going to start up an alt character tonight. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Activision.

Title: Elex Review
Review: Elex is an open-world RPG that aims big, but only manages to shoot itself in the foot.
Author Information: Never one to shy away from exploring large open worlds, James Swinbanks spent 35 hours wandering the wilds of Magalan on the PlayStation 4 Pro, with a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Cuphead Review
Review: Cuphead is an artistic tour de force and a brutal side-scrolling action game that pushes you to become a better player.
Author Information: In the span of 24 hours, Peter got to the end of Cuphead's last world but fell two bosses short of the finale. He played through the majority of the game on Xbox One, but spent two hours with the PC version at the start. Microsoft provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Star Fox 2 Review
Review: Star Fox 2 could have been an impressive game in the '90s but it fails to make a favorable impression today.
Author Information: Michael wasn‰Ûªt very good at the original Star Fox when he played it over and over as a kid, but found his pilot wings with countless hours in Star Fox 64 a few years after. Returning to Star Fox 2 brought back those space-faring memories as he spent around 5 hours with Star Fox 2 and finished the game three times for this review. Nintendo provided GameSpot with the SNES Classic on which the game was played.

Title: South Park: The Fractured But Whole Review
Review: Ubisoft's follow-up to the Stick of Truth shines with a rewarding combat system wrapped around South Park's distinct brand of humor.
Author Information: It took Miguel 22 hours to save South Park, thanks to the help of Coon and Friends. Additional time was spent exploring the town to ensure that his team's Might was high enough to tackle everyone from bigoted rednecks to unsavory priests. Review codes for all platforms were provided by Ubisoft for this review.

Title: Forza Motorsport 7 Review
Review: Turn 10 Studios' 2017 edition of its main racing series shines thanks to its deep weather customization options.
Author Information: Miguel spent 18 hours racing to the Forza Driver's Cup and 7 additional hours evaluating all other modes available at Forza Motorsport 7's launch. A review code of the Ultimate Edition was provided by Microsoft for review purposes.

Title: Batman: The Enemy Within - Episode 2: The Pact Review
Review: Telltale flips the script on Joker and presents a cool new take on Harley Quinn in episode 2 of Batman: The Enemy Within
Author Information: Tamoor is struggling to get over how disappointed Jim Gordon was in him. GameSpot was supplied a complementary code for the purpose of this review.

Title: FIFA 18 Nintendo Switch Review
Review: FIFA 18 is replicated well on the pitch, but there's not enough to do once the whistle blows for full time.
Author Information: Oscar spent around 10 hours playing FIFA 18 on Nintendo Switch, and double that trying to think of a Switch / life's a pitch pun. He was not successful. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Echo Review
Review: Echo is a marvel of A.I. programming bolstered by a compelling sci-fi storytelling, and injects new life into the stealth genre.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent seven hours getting through Echo. Luckily for him, the only thing he's taught his Echo is how to make pancakes and beat Battletoads. A digital copy of this game was provided by the publisher.

Title: NBA Live 18 Review
Review: EA Sports' basketball series returns from a one-year hiatus with new features that outshine its traditional modes.
Author Information: Miguel needed about 15 hours to make a name for himself in The One and spent and additional 10 hours evaluating NBA Live 18's other modes. Codes were provided by EA Sports for review purposes.

Title: NHL 18 Review
Review: EA Sports NHL 18 is quite possibly the most accessible sports game on the market, as well as being a load of fun.
Author Information: The copy of NHL 18 was provided to GameSpot by publisher EA. I put in roughly 20 hours of gameplay for this review.

Title: Total War: Warhammer 2 Review
Review: Total War: Warhammer II is a hybrid turn-based strategy and real-time tactics game that stands among the best of both. Its emphasis on campaign pacing, fantastical battles, and complex battlefield ...
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been playing RTS games for more than 20 years, and he's always excited to see one try new and creative ideas. He spent two weeks playing through two full Warhammer II campaigns and a few multiplayer maps using pre-release code provided to GameSpot by the publisher.

Title: Battle Chasers: Nightwar Review
Review: Battle Chasers: Nightwar brings the cult comic book series to life, but breaks a few of its bones in the process.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 50 hours with Battle Chasers on PS4 using a complimentary copy of the game provided by developer Airship Syndicate. Additional testing of the PC version was handled by GameSpot's internal editorial team.

Title: FIFA 18 Review
Review: Superb presentation and small gameplay tweaks make FIFA 18 an improvement over last year--albeit a slight one.
Author Information: Oscar likes to imagine himself playing top-level football, but he definitely can't do it on a cold, wet Tuesday night at Stoke. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary PS4 copy of FIFA 18 for the purposes of this review.

Title: Project Cars 2 Review
Review: Project Cars 2 builds on its predecessor with improved handling and impressive scope, but it still suffers from unruly AI and a slew of bugs.
Author Information: Richard spent over 15 hours on the hot asphalt of Project Cars 2's various motorsports. Stick him on an icy track and his Bambi impression is second to none. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Tooth And Tail Review
Review: Tooth and Tail is an exhilarating, minimal RTS set during an animal Civil War in the 1910s. With plenty of gallows humor and a 16-bit Don Bluth aesthetic, it breathes ...
Author Information: Dan Starkey‰Ûªs been playing RTS games for more than 20 years, and he‰Ûªs always excited to see one try new and creative ideas. He received two download codes for the sake of review, one for the PS4, which he completed the campaign on, and another for PC where he spent the bulk of his time in multiplayer.

Title: Ruiner Review
Review: Ruiner's world of pure and absolute murder is one teeming with interesting concepts, and its stellar combat makes it a journey well worth taking.
Author Information: David Rayfield would prefer to convey his emotions via a face helmet covered in pretty lights. But until someone hacks his brain, a non-committal shrug will have to do. He spent around 10 hours completing the story, replaying missions, and soaking up the atmosphere. Ruiner was reviewed on PC.

Title: SteamWorld Dig 2 Review
Review: SteamWorld Dig 2 is a brilliant evolution of the first that not only expands upon its hybrid formula, but presents it in its best light.
Author Information: Matt spent about 10 hours playing SteamWorld Dig 2. He was a light fan of the previous SteamWorld games and found this latest entry to be a pleasant surprise. He hopes to keep playing to unearth all the secrets the game has to offer, while making a multitude of digging puns about his exploits to his friends along the way. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: NBA 2K18 Review
Review: NBA 2K18 is the gold standard for sports simulations, but this year's entry is overloaded with microtransactions.
Author Information: Seth reviewed NBA 2K18 using copies of the game provided by Take-Two Interactive, which included 200,000 VC. He put it in 20 hours on the Xbox One version and roughly 5 hours on the Switch, with additional testing of the PlayStation 4 version handled by GameSpot stuff

Title: Figment Review
Review: Figment is a delightful isometric puzzler that skillfully uses storybook imagery to tackle weighty themes associated with trauma and depression.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For the purposes of this review, he played Figment for around eight hours using a complimentary copy of the game provided by the developer.

Title: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony Review
Review: Danganronpa V3: Killing Harmony's murder cases aren't the series' best, but they lead to a stunning ending.
Author Information: Kallie is a longtime Danganronpa fan and finished V3 in around 40 hours. Maki is her favorite character. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: WRC 7 Review
Review: WRC 7 faithfully recreates the challenges of rallying--bumps and all.
Author Information: Growing up in Australia's countryside, James Swinbanks has been hammering down dirt roads since his uncle first put him behind the wheel of a Ford Escort at six-years old. He spent 12 hours with WRC 7 on PS4 Pro with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: ARK: Survival Evolved Review
Review: Unforgiving difficulty and atmosphere are the main characteristics of dino-survival sim Ark: Survival Evolved.
Author Information: About 30 hours of skinning dinos, starting fires, running for his life, and cursing, loads of glorious cursing, went into Brett‰Ûªs review of Ark: Survival Evolved. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Studio Wildcard.

Title: Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite Review
Review: Marvel Vs. Capcom: Infinite is a deep and rewarding fighting game for both hardcore and casual players alike, but has a few rough edges.
Author Information: Tamoor is currently running a team of Dante and Gamora with the Power Stone. He's desperately trying to unlearn years of three button-based muscle memory. The nerves on his fingertips are all dead. RIP. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary PS4 copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Knack 2 Review
Review: Knack returns in a surprisingly fun sequel that makes great use of its shape-shifting hero.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent about 10 hours bashing things into submission in Knack 2 with a nine-year old in tow to argue about who has to pull switches and who gets to run through the doors. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Everybody's Golf Review
Review: Sony's long-running golf series hits a birdie in its feature-rich PlayStation 4 debut.
Author Information: It look Miguel about 25 hours of tour competition to reach Everybody's Golf's end credits, and he spent an additional five hours checking out its online modes. A code was provided by Sony for this review.

Title: Ys VIII: Lacrimosa Of Dana Review
Review: The latest entry in the Ys series delivers a fast-paced and very satisfying action-RPG experience.
Author Information: Heidi wandered around on the island of Seiren for about 45 hours, completing the main story and numerous optional quests along the way. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Metroid: Samus Returns Review
Review: Metroid: Samus Returns is a return to form and an exciting evolution of the series' beloved formula.
Author Information: Peter is a lifelong Metroid fan who fell in love with the series on NES. He completed Samus Returns on the standard difficulty with 100% item completion in just under 20 hours. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: PES 2018 Review
Review: The most satisfying football game ever, wrapped in a frustratingly ugly shell.
Author Information: Oscar is a Bristol City fan. He's looking forward to modding them in to PES 2018 so he no longer has to play as South West Red. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dishonored: Death Of The Outsider Review
Review: This stand-alone follow-up is a well-designed and inventive stealth-action game that closes out the story set by its predecessors.
Author Information: Alessandro is an admirer of the Dishonored series, and usually chooses the stealthy and most non-lethal approach--but will make exceptions if a particular target deserves a far more brutal fate. If getting a target's comeuppance means throwing them off a balcony or feeding them to the rats, then he will gladly make it happen. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game by Bethesda for the purposes of this review.

Title: Yakuza Kiwami Review
Review: Yakuza Kiwami picks up where Yakuza Zero left off, upholding its dramatic storytelling, offbeat humor, and flashy yet frustrating combat.
Author Information: Peter finished Yakuza Kiwami in 30 hours on PlayStation 4 using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Sega.

Title: The Pillars Of The Earth Review
Review: The Pillars of the Earth tells a gripping story of personal and political drama, but its slow pace may not make it a good fit for everyone.
Author Information: A fan of adventure games, Blake Hester took his time with The Pillars of the Earth, talking to as many NPCs as possible and collecting as many story scraps as he could. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Yonder: The Cloud Catcher Chronicles Review
Review: A meditative game about exploring and gathering that offers great beauty but not much else.
Author Information: James O'Connor completed Yonder's main quest and explored the full map, building farms and completing sidequests long after the credits rolled. He loved Breath of the Wild so much that he might have brought it up even if Yonder had nothing to do with it. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Guardians Of The Galaxy - Episode 3: More Than A Feeling Review
Review: Episode 3 of Telltale's Guardians of the Galaxy series has well-developed relationships and conflict but suffers from similar problems as its predecessors.
Author Information: Kallie just wants Gamora and Nebula to get along. Telltale provided GameSpot with a complimentary code for the purposes of this review.

Title: Distrust Review
Review: Distrust is a roguelike isometric survival game inspired by The Thing where hunger and sleepiness are as frightening as the aliens hunting you.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For the purposes of this review, he played Distrust for around ten hours using a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: F1 2017 Review
Review: Codemasters sweeps the podium with the best Formula One game ever made.
Author Information: When James was 5 he asked his Dad for a mini-Formula One car for Christmas...it never came. So he settled on enjoying F1 racing games instead. He spent 26 hours in total across both PS4 and PC versions of F1 2017 with both a wheel and gamepad for the purpose of this review, using complimentary codes provided by Codemasters

Title: Mario + Rabbids: Kingdom Battle Review
Review: The unlikely collision of Mario and Rabbid franchises is delightfully charming, and features a deeply satisfying turn-based tactics system.
Author Information: Edmond Tran loves turn-based strategy, and has been into tactical games ever since he played Front Mission 3. He's also one of those people that owns too many Amiibo. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy for the purposes of review.

Title: Last Day Of June Review
Review: Although Last Day of June's story has impactful moments of grief, loss, and companionship, it's limited by a frustratingly repetitive gameplay loop.
Author Information: Alex Newhouse completed Last Day of June in three hours and spent some additional time exploring for collectibles. He tried the game on both PS4 and PS4 Pro with a code provided by the publisher.

Title: Absolver Review
Review: Absolver's methodical combat would be superlative on its own, but the unique customisation of its Combat Deck takes this melee brawler to thrilling new heights.
Author Information: Richard spent over 15 hours with Absolver, and is currently trying to rank up enough to open his own fighting school. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Life Is Strange: Before The Storm - Episode 1 - Awake Review
Review: Deck Nine's Life Is Strange prequel ditches time travel, but finds power of a different sort.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Before the Storm Episode 1 in about two hours, and played a second time through to experience the game's alternate choices. Surprisingly, he didn't miss Ashly Burch. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Madden NFL 18 Review
Review: An intensely personal story mode, graphical upgrades, and frequent updates make Madden NFL 18 one of the series' best games in recent memory.
Author Information: Alex Newhouse played 25 hours of Madden NFL 18, five of which were spent completing Longshot. As a Patriots fan, he spent a lot of time delightfully playing with the team's too-good receiver corps. He played on a PS4 Pro with a code provided by EA.

Title: Don't Knock Twice Review
Review: One playthrough is quite enough for the brief and uninspired Don't Knock Twice.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent two hours on Don't Knock Twice, playing through in both 2D and VR.

Title: Thumper Review
Review: Thumper's unrelenting speed and menacing percussion are overwhelming, seeping into your subconscious in the best way possible.
Author Information: Peter made it to the final stage of Thumper over the course of eight hours before writing this review. It made his heart race, his complexion fade, and his eyes widen. He loved every minute of it. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: XCOM 2: War Of The Chosen Review
Review: Building upon the sturdy foundation laid out by XCOM 2, War of the Chosen sets a high mark for an already exceptional sci-fi strategy series.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's a big fan of defending Earth from extraterrestrials, and, more importantly, putting his tactical and strategic prowess to the test. He received an early preview copy and later a full retail build for the purposes of this review.

Title: Warriors All-Stars Review
Review: It's Dynasty Warriors as you've seen it before, except you can be a talking cat with a gun.
Author Information: Sean spent far too much time doing side-missions and saw two of the game's 15 endings. A copy of the game was supplied for this review.

Title: Nidhogg 2 Review
Review: Nidhogg 2 is more bloated and less refined than its predecessor, but it remains an engrossing and hilarious multiplayer game.
Author Information: Neither of Oscar's ears were harmed (too much) in the making of this article. A complimentary code was provided to GameSpot for the purposes of this review.

Title: Lawbreakers PC Review
Review: Boss Key's impressive debut offers a host of inviting anti-gravity battlegrounds.
Author Information: In the process of logging 20 hours of combat time (30 if you include the betas), Miguel tried out every class in every available map and mode combination. GameSpot purchased the game on both Playstation 4 and PC.

Title: Uncharted: The Lost Legacy Review
Review: A dynamic duo from Uncharted's rich cast of colorful characters proves there's life after Nathan Drake.
Author Information: As is his tradition with every Uncharted, Miguel's first playthrough of The Lost Legacy was on Hard difficulty, where he needed six hours to take Chloe and Nadine to the game's conclusion. As much as he would've like to put in more time into the game's online modes, Miguel only managed an hour of play. A PS4 code was provided by Sony Interactive Entertainment for this review.

Title: Lawbreakers PS4 Review
Review: Boss Key's impressive debut offers a host of inviting anti-gravity battlegrounds.
Author Information: In the process of logging 20 hours of combat time (30 if you include the betas), Miguel tried out every class in every available map and mode combination. GameSpot purchased the game on both Playstation 4 and PC.

Title: Observer Review
Review: This mind-bending cyberpunk masterpiece is a grim yet beautiful descent into the hell of being human.
Author Information: David Rayfield is still waiting until technology becomes convincing enough for him to live in a shipping container hooked up to a VR headset. It might be a while. Observer was played on PC using a complimentary copy of the game provided by the developer.

Title: The Long Dark Review
Review: Bugs and a rough story weaken what is, at its core, a great survival game.
Author Information: James Swinbanks has survived the dangerous wildlife in Australia for over 30 years and spent a combined 33 hours in The Long Dark's story and sandbox modes playing a copy he purchased on PC. Note: A scripting bug meant that a crucial element of the end game didn't trigger until after a number of patches had been put out. A patch worked and fixed the problem, but it also tacked on an extra few hours to the end.

Title: Agents Of Mayhem Review
Review: Obnoxious attitude, poor mission design, and technical bugs make Agents of Mayhem chaotic and repetitive.
Author Information: Brett played 35 hours of the PS4 version of Agents of Mayem for the purpose of this review, using a complimentary copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Matterfall Review
Review: PS4's Matterfall is a visually stunning yet uninspiring hybrid of Housemarque's past successes.
Author Information: Jeremy Winslow played through Matterfall three different times on multiple difficulties to test adaptability and challenge. And each time he hit the boss stages, he died--a lot. Death didn't stop him from trying to get the highest score possible, though. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Sony.

Title: Splatoon 2 Review
Review: Splatoon 2 is a fresh, vibrant sequel that introduces smart updates to the original's unique formula.
Author Information: Kallie spent just over a week playing Splatoon 2, finding all the collectibles in the single-player campaign and reaching level 13 in multiplayer. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Diablo 3: Rise Of The Necromancer Review
Review: The Rise of the Necromancer DLC offers a great new character class for Diablo III--but is it enough to keep the five-year-old game afloat?
Author Information: Brett spent about 10 hours raising the dead and adding to their numbers when revisiting Diablo III with the Rise of the Necromancer. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Pyre Review
Review: Pyre's wit and whimsy effortlessly usher you into a captivating world of punishment, sacrifice, and competition.
Author Information: Peter finished Pyre on PC in 15 hours, and then started a new game on PS4 where he also spent a few hours in multiplayer matches. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game for each platform by Greg Kasavin, the designer and writer of Pyre and former editor in chief of GameSpot.

Title: Sundered Review
Review: Sundered is an enjoyable journey that iterates upon the Metroidvania style in ways that are both satisfying and substantial.
Author Information: Matt spent about 18 hours playing Sundered. He's currently playing the game a second time to get the best ending, but he hopes to play through an additional time to fully embrace the darkness. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: Miitopia Review
Review: Once the silliness of Miitopia wears off, you're left with a cute and repetitive RPG.
Author Information: Heidi, thanks to the power of auto-battle and a fast-forward mode, breezed through Miitopia. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Hey Pikmin Review
Review: Olimar and his Pikmin are back for another charming adventure, but don't expect it to be as challenging as its console counterparts.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile enjoyed revisiting the adorable Pikmin and spent about 10 hours with them while contemplating the bleak nature of man‰Ûªs extinction--almost certainly at the hands of these absurdly cute little monsters. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Batman - The Enemy Within: The Enigma - Episode 1 Review
Review: Telltale starts strong with new characters and a charismatic villain.
Author Information: Tamoor is vengeance. Tamoor is the night. Tamoor is Batman ... He played on PC.

Title: Tacoma Review
Review: Tacoma tells a story that is made compelling by a well-written and -acted cast of characters, but it's just short of being truly satisfying.
Author Information: Kallie finished Tacoma in five hours and watched all the crew recordings. She also played a round of zero-gravity basketball and spent some time searching for Easter eggs. A complimentary code was provided for the purposes of this review.

Title: Rez Infinite Review
Review: With the addition of VR and its off-rails Area X, Rez Infinite is a new classic for the current generation.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea completed all of Rez Infinite both in and out of PSVR for the purpose of this review. Code was provided by Sony. It was a wild ride.

Title: Redeemer Review
Review: The will is strong with Redeemer, but the flesh is spongy and bruised.
Author Information: Justin Clark got through Redeemer's campaign in about seven hours using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Sobaka Studio.

Title: Gigantic Review
Review: Traditional MOBA gameplay with an impressive cast of characters and a great setting help Gigantic breathe fresh air into a familiar genre.
Author Information: Brett shot, slashed, and summoned for around 10 hours while reviewing Gigantic. Motiga provided GameSpot with a complimentary code for the $30 / å£24 ultimate pack add-on.

Title: Mega Man Legacy Collection 2 Review
Review: Capcom collects the Blue Bomber's post-NES career into another handy, albeit somewhat lackluster, Mega Man Legacy Collection.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through all four titles in the collection with copy of the game provided by Capcom, and has not stopped imitating Elmer Fudd Dr. Light from Mega Man 8 ever since. Please, for the love of God, help him.

Title: The Mage's Tale Review
Review: The Mage's Tale attempts to bring classic PC dungeon crawling into virtual reality, but disappoints at nearly every turn.
Author Information: Dan Starkey knows his way around some dungeons. Whether it‰Ûªs Legend of Grimrock, Arx Fatalis, or even The Elder Scrolls: Arena, Starkey‰Ûªs dived and delved into the depths of the dankest and darkest dens. He played through The Mage's Tale once with the Oculus touch controllers, which were provided by Oculus along with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Cities: Skylines - Mass Transit Review
Review: Both virtual mayors and their commuting citizens will enjoy the public-transportation options in the Mass Transit expansion for Cities: Skylines.
Author Information: When he wasn't performing his duties as a mayor in the real-world, Brett spent about 10 hours schlepping his citizens around town in ever more efficient and innovative ways in the Mass Transit expansion for Cities: Skylines. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the expansion for the purpose of this review.

Title: Rakuen Review
Review: Rakuen's unique setting and sweet sensibilities make up for its technical shortcomings.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins is always eager to hear a good story--even more so if it comes in the form of a game. It took her approximately six and a half hours to complete Rakuen.

Title: Final Fantasy 12: The Zodiac Age Review
Review: One of the best Final Fantasy games gets the remaster treatment it rightfully deserves.
Author Information: Having put 200 hours in the original Final Fantasy 12, Miguel was confident that playing through the first 30 hours of The Zodiac Age would suffice in evaluating the new features and improvements. A complementary PS4 code was provided for this review.

Title: Final Fantasy 14: Stormblood Review
Review: Final Fantasy 14: Stormblood tackles somber themes with unexpected polish, proving that an old dog can indeed learn new tricks.
Author Information: Ginny Woo has been a faithful fan of MMORPGs ever since World of Warcraft‰Ûªs The Burning Crusade. After sweating it out in a raiding guild, she took to Final Fantasy XIV during a hiatus a few years ago and never looked back. This review covers her experience getting to Level 70 and trying everything in the lead-up to the end-game raids, which have yet to be released.

Title: The Walking Dead: A New Frontier - Episode Five: Under the Gallows Review
Review: Some odd dramatic choices and a less-than-satisfying conclusion wrap up the New Frontier season of The Walking Dead.
Author Information: Brett has played every episode of Telltale's The Walking Dead so far, and it took him 90 minutes to complete the final chapter of A New Frontier. Telltale Games provided him with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Guardians Of The Galaxy - Episode 2: Under Pressure Review
Review: The second episode of Telltale's Guardians of the Galaxy series takes on a slower pace with more focus on characters (and drama).
Author Information: Kallie really likes dancing baby Groot, but romantic Rocket is pretty cute, too. Telltale provided GameSpot with a complimentary code.

Title: Nex Machina Review
Review: The spirit of Robotron lives again in Housemarque's brilliant and blistering Nex Machina.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent eight hours alternating between agony and ecstasy among five worlds and three game modes, wondering how 1983 got so far away. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Impact Winter Review
Review: Surviving in Impact Winter's brutally cold apocalypse makes for a tense adventure, but it's marred by a number of technical problems that exacerbate an already arduous task.
Author Information: Edmond loves tense PC survival games. He spent 20 hours with Impact Winter and was only killed by wolves a couple of times. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Ever Oasis Review
Review: Ever Oasis' story and progression aren't perfectly sound, but the consistent gratification of its incisive design makes it a satisfying adventure.
Author Information: Matt is still spending time building up his Oasis even after beating the game. He thinks all of the game's characters are adorable, especially the Noots. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Fidelio Incident Review
Review: The Fidelio Incident can be a beautiful and touching game, but it's too often bogged down by shallow objectives.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed The Fidelio Incident in about 3 hours using a complimentary copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Reservoir Dogs: Bloody Days Review
Review: Reservoir Dogs: Bloody Days attempts to pay homage to its source material, but it fails capture the essence of the cult-classic film that inspired it.
Author Information: Jeremy Winslow robbed hundreds of banks and shot countless cops to acquire as much money as possible for nearly eight hours in Bloody Days. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary code for the purpose of this review.

Title: Valkyria Revolution Review
Review: While satisfying at times, poor story presentation and an abundance of superfluous elements make Valkyria Revolution less than the sum of its parts.
Author Information: Heidi put approximately 30 hours into Valkyria Revolution. She's still holding out for an official English language release of Valkyria Chronicles 3...someday. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Star Trek: Bridge Crew Review
Review: Star Trek: Bridge Crew is a daring concept that goes where many games have gone before.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Star Trek: Bridge Crew's single-player campaign on PSVR in four hours, spending another three online before writing his review. By his count, seven of his suggestions when playing a role other than captain were shouted down by someone yelling ‰ÛÏShut up, Wesley!‰Û GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Wipeout Omega Collection Review
Review: This remastered trio splendidly captures Studio Liverpool's turn-of-the-decade hover racing renaissance.
Author Information: Miguel spent about eight hours exploring all the modes in all the games of this collection. Two of those hours were also spent online. A code was provided by Sony Interactive Entertainment for the purposes of this review.

Title: Arms Review
Review: Arms' unique take on fighting can be hard to adjust to, but once you do, it's a surprisingly deep fighter that has you thinking on your feet.
Author Information: Kallie played through Arms' Grand Prix mode with several characters

Title: Steel Division: Normandy '44 Review
Review: Steel Division is an aggressive, focused tactical game that deftly leverages historical realism to create unique twists on the RTS formula.
Author Information: Dan Starkey is a strategy-game obsessive. He‰Ûªs also just about tapped out on World War II‰ÛÒfocused games, Steel Division: Normandy '44 proves him wrong. He received an early copy, and a final review copy for the purposes of this review.

Title: Dirt 4 Review
Review: Dirt 4 is a grounded and thrilling racing experience with customisable difficulty options that should appeal to newcomers and veterans alike.
Author Information: Richard spent around 30 hours on the precarious tracks of Dirt 4, gradually improving enough to not hit every tree.

Title: Get Even Review
Review: The Farm 51's psychological thriller tells a story you won't forget.
Author Information: Eddie Makuch finished Get Even's campaign on PS4 in around 10 hours and he's still thinking about the dramatic ending. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Tekken 7 Review
Review: Despite some faults outside of the ring, Tekken 7's diverse cast and time-honored fighting system make it one of the best 3D fighting games around.
Author Information: Peter has been a home-schooled Tekken player since the series debut on the original PlayStation. He completed the main story mode of Tekken 7 and every individual character story on PS4, and spent a few hours fighting treasure and online battles on all platforms before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for all platforms.

Title: Friday The 13th: The Game Review
Review: A week after launch, Friday the 13th remains the buggy and sometimes-broken game it was on the day of its release.
Author Information: Peter spent ten hours with the PC version of Friday the 13th but had far less success playing the game on consoles, with server issues abound that limited the availability of matches. GameSpot was provided multiple complimentary copies of the game for each platform.

Title: Perception Review
Review: A novel and inventive approach to first-person exploration falls short of its ambitions.
Author Information: Miguel needed about three hours to complete his exploration of all the incarnations of the house where Perception takes place. A complementary PC code was provided for this review.

Title: Call Of Duty: Black Ops 3 Zombies Chronicles Review
Review: Black Ops 3's Zombies Chronicles upgrades some of the best Zombies maps for new and returning players alike.
Author Information: Kallie has played a lot of Zombies over the years with her younger brother and has really good Mystery Box luck. A complimentary code was provided by Activision.

Title: Danger Zone Review
Review: Though rough around the edges, Danger Zone does a commendable job recapturing some of Burnout's lightning in a bottle.
Author Information: Justin Clark got through all of Danger Zone's available courses in about 4 hours, give or take the time spent listening to Kenny Loggins on a loop. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Tokyo 42 Review
Review: This beautiful cyberpunk playground holds a staggering amount of detail but not enough reasons to stay.
Author Information: David Rayfield wishes to live in a real cyberpunk dystopia one day--the kind with retinal implants and dangerous contacts. For now, video games will have to fill that void. Tokyo 42 was played on both Xbox One and PC.

Title: Endless Space 2 Review
Review: Endless Space 2 provides loads of 4X strategizing and space-opera-styled storytelling in this epic about building an intergalactic empire.
Author Information: Brett spent around 30 hours of exploring, expanding, exploiting, and exterminating in Endless Space 2 to write this review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by its publisher.

Title: Rime Review
Review: Shallow puzzles and frustrating navigation mar an otherwise beautiful experience.
Author Information: Oscar spent around 14 hours playing Rime, and he now wants a magical disappearing fox for a pet. A complimentary PS4 code was provided to GameSpot for this review.

Title: The Town Of Light Review
Review: The Town of Light examines mental illnesses and the hospitals meant to treat them in the early 1900s, but ultimately fails to stick the landing.
Author Information: A fan of exploration-driven adventure games, Blake Hester completed The Town of Light on Xbox One and collected as many of the story bits as he could along the way. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Prey Review
Review: Prey squanders its narrative opportunities but develops into an engaging open-world shooter.
Author Information: Tamoor played Prey for 40 hours. At least 10 of those were spent rolling around Talos I as a coffee cup.

Title: NBA Playgrounds Review
Review: NBA Playgrounds matches NBA Jam's irreverent take on basketball, but it doesn't do enough to stand out on its own.
Author Information: Blake Hester is a longtime NBA Jam fan that was excited to see if Playgrounds could recapture a similar arcade feel. For his review, he played over 30 matches online and off, scored over 600 points, and unlocked 62 players from the game's roster. He also played the game on mute. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game for review.

Title: Mages of Mystralia Review
Review: Mages of Mystralia has charm and a lot of heart, but it falls a bit short of delivering a memorable adventure.
Author Information: Alessandro is an admirer of classic adventure games like The Legend of Zelda, and he was excited to try out this title that made its start on Kickstarter. After about six hours, he cleared through Mages Of Mystralia's adventure and found a lot to like over the course of the journey. He received a complimentary copy of the game from the publisher for review.

Title: Fire Emblem Echoes: Shadows of Valentia Review
Review: Fire Emblem Echoes' combat and exploration work so well that you won't lament the absence of the series' recent dating-sim whims.
Author Information: Heidi first got into the FE series with the original English release on Game Boy Advance and has followed the franchise since. She completed Echoes in 32 hours, using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Nintendo.

Title: Strafe Review
Review: Strafe doesn't do too much, but its exceptional execution and unique charm make for a truly intense, old-school FPS experience.
Author Information: Michael was strafing, jumping, and swiping his mouse around to land perfect shots as a kid in games like Unreal Tournament and Quake III. That hard work paid off, evident in the 12 hours he spent to complete Strafe after more attempts than he's willing to admit and getting through seven rooms in Murderzone mode. A complimentary copy was provided by Devolver Digital.

Title: The Surge Review
Review: The Surge is an entertaining twist on the Dark Souls formula that strikes a tenuous balance between iteration and invention.
Author Information: Starkey's played every major Souls game, as well their many spin-offs and inspirations. After spending some time with Lords of the Fallen, he didn‰Ûªt have high hopes for Surge, but he was pleasantly surprised. He received a complimentary review copy from the publisher.

Title: Farpoint Review
Review: Justin Clark completed Farpoint's campaign in about five and a half hours and spent another two fooling around in Challenge mode--and didn't even have to take a Dramamine this time.
Author Information: Bolstered by the Aim Controller, Impact Gear delivers a strong shooter experience on PlayStation VR but surprises and awes when it strives for more.

Title: Pinstripe Review
