Review: Pinstripe's spooky atmosphere will catch your eye, but its straightforward puzzles and clunky combat may cause you to look the other way.
Author Information: Jeremy Winslow thought it would be a great idea to visit the devil, so he booked a one-way trip to Hell. Though he zoned out during Pinstripe's battles and puzzles, he'd be lying if he said the dialogue didn't make him chuckle now and then. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Super Rude Bear Resurrection Review
Review: Super Rude Bear is a tough-as-nails platformer that gives meaning to your every death and provides a nonstop stream of new challenges from beginning to end.
Author Information: Chris Pereira spent more than a dozen hours dying across the PS4 and PC versions of Super Rude Bear Resurrection. He even finished quite a few levels without leaving behind a corpse. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game.

Title: Tumbleseed Review
Review: Tumbleseed is a challenging roguelike about literally and figuratively balancing, but some of its many moving parts are off-kilter.
Author Information: Kallie very slowly made her way up Tumbleseed's mountain of death and only ragequit a few times. A complimentary code was provided to GameSpot.

Title: Expeditions: Viking Review
Review: Expeditions: Viking is a rough-hewn game with an abundance of charm. Deep role playing and nuanced, tactical combat save this technical mess.
Author Information: As a resident of the Twin Cities, Dan Starkey's got a smidge of the Viking spirit. As a roleplayer, he's dipped into everything from White Wolf and loves having a bevy of tactical options available to think through any encounter. GameSpot received a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Syberia 3 Review
Review: For a game that relies on character interaction and puzzles to tell its story, Syberia 3 falls well short of being enjoyable and fails to deliver a captivating or impactful ...
Author Information: Michael was captivated by point-and-click adventure games early in life with the likes of Broken Sword: Shadow of the Templars and Escape From Monkey Island. Having played Syberia 1 and 2 all those years ago, he looked forward to what the third game had to offer and spent about 12 hours to complete Kate Walker's new journey. A copy of Syberia 3 was provided by Microids.

Title: Birthdays The Beginning Review
Review: The ambitious-but-flawed Birthdays the Beginning is packed with charm, but suffers from a clunky interface and confusing systems.
Author Information: Heidi, despite several episodes of frustration, managed to complete the game's story mode and a few of the optional challenges for this review.

Title: Outlast 2 Review
Review: Outlast 2's scripted chases can grow frustrating, but its gripping atmosphere and unnerving sound design deliver unparalleled tension.
Author Information: It took Scott nearly a dozen hours to trek though Outlast 2's desert hellscape, though he immediately started over at a higher difficulty once he finished his first run. He also reviewed Resident Evil 7 back in January, if you'd like a reference point for his taste in horror. GameSpot received complimentary download codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Puyo Puyo Tetris Review
Review: Two classic puzzle games meet head-on to form Puyo Puyo Tetris, a great mashup with multiple ways to play.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent 10 hours within the zany world of Puyos and Tetrominoes, and about a million playing Tetris over the last few decades. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary download code for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Disney Afternoon Collection Review
Review: Six retro games to remind you that games from the good old days were difficult, but relentlessly charming.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent around seven hours blissfully dying in a fit of nostalgic wonder while playing The Disney Afternoon Collection. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dragon Quest Heroes II Review
Review: A second re-imagining of Dragon Quest as a hack-and-slasher proves to be as fresh and involving as the first crossover.
Author Information: Miguel needed 25 hours to complete Dragon Quest Heroes II's campaign, using a pre-release version of the game. He played an additional five hours of the retail version to evaluate online multiplayer. Both versions were provided courtesy of Square Enix. Miguel came into this playthrough having reviewed the last Dragon Quest Heroes, while also having completed a handful of Dynasty Warriors and Dragon Quest games.

Title: Injustice 2 Review
Review: NetherRealm sets a new bar for fighting games in 2017 with Injustice 2, despite over-complicating its most distinct feature.
Author Information: Peter has played most Mortal Kombat and DC fighting games from Ed Boon and company since the '90s, and very much enjoyed NetherRealm's last game, Mortal Kombat X. He spent 15 hours with Injustice 2 on PlayStation 4, and a few hours with the Xbox One version, beating the story mode twice and raising Superman to level 20 after countless fights in the Multiverse. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Warner Bros. Interactive.

Title: What Remains of Edith Finch Review
Review: Giant Sparrow's follow-up to The Unfinished Swan is a beautifully melancholy collection of parables.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to play through What Remains of Edith Finch within two and a half hours, viewing all 11 stories and replaying two of them. A review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Sniper Ghost Warrior 3 Review
Review: A newfound focus on player choice pushes CI Games' series in a positive direction, but myriad issues keep it from being a top marksman.
Author Information: Richard spent roughly 15 hours in the muddy boots of protagonist Jon North. At least 45 minutes of that was probably spent in loading screens.

Title: The Walking Dead: A New Frontier - Episode Four: Thicker Than Water Review
Review: Storylines finally converge satisfyingly in Thicker Than Water, the penultimate chapter of the New Frontier.
Author Information: Two more hours with Javy, David, Kate, and the rest of the dysfunctional gang helped Brett review Thicker Than Water. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Hacknet - Labyrinths Review
Review: With its challenging puzzles and dark, intriguing narrative, Hacknet will upload itself to your must play list
Author Information: Despite being hopelessly inept at remembering his own passwords, James managed to complete both the Hacknet and Labyrinths campaigns in around 20 hours. Review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: Drawn To Death Review
Review: Drawn to Death has a big imagination, but it does not play well with others.
Author Information: Justin spent 8 hours with Drawn to Death, playing at least an hour with the game‰Ûªs entire roster (not counting time spent waiting for matches).

Title: Little Nightmares Review
Review: Little Nightmares' brief length may leave you craving more, but its haunting story and visuals make it a journey well worth taking.
Author Information: Matt spent about 2 hours playing Little Nightmares during his first playthrough. He completed the game twice on PC for this review with a copy provided by the Bandai Namco.

Title: Momodora: Reverie Under The Moonlight Review
Review: Momodora Reverie Under the Moonlight is a retro adventure with charm, but it runs out of steam a bit too soon.
Author Information: Peter enjoys "Metroidvanias," especially Super Metroid and Castlevania: Symphony of the Night. He played through Momodora: Reverie Under the Moonlight once, completing it in five and half hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Bulletstorm: Full Clip Edition Review
Review: Only six years have passed since the wildly inventive Bulletstorm originally released, which may be why this update looks so good and plays so smoothly.
Author Information: Scott reviewed Bulletstorm for another outlet back in 2011. He loved it then, so unsurprisingly, he loves it now as well, in spite of its self-consciously douchey characters. GameSpot was provided with complimentary download codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Cosmic Star Heroine Review
Review: This take on classic turn-based RPGs struggles to give its fresh ideas room to breathe.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins has never said no to a good, old-fashioned space adventure, though she's spent a few too many hours with middling early-'90s anime role-playing games to be swayed by nostalgia alone. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Sexy Brutale Review
Review: The Sexy Brutale is a beautiful puzzler that skillfully combines time loops and elements of Clue.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For this purposes of this review, he played The Sexy Brutale for around nine hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary download code for the purpose of this review.

Title: Toukiden 2 Review
Review: A new kind of Devil Crush.
Author Information: Heidi didn't play the first Toukiden, but she came away quite satisfied with its sequel. She played through Chapter 6, finished a few quests in Chapter 7, and spent a good deal of time joining and hosting multiplayer games. Maybe you ran into her if you saw a hyper-aggressive gauntlet user. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Mr. Shifty Review
Review: A scrappy underdog of a game that will send you on a short but glorious power trip.
Author Information: James finished Mr. Shifty on Switch in about 4 hours (needing to stop for breaks--because, wow, is this game intense) and tested out the first three levels of the PC version. He now longs for Switch ports of Hotline Miami 1 and 2. GameSpot was provided with complimentary download codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Guardians Of The Galaxy - Episode 1: Tangled Up In Blue Review
Review: The first episode of Telltale's Guardians of the Galaxy series has an engaging movie-style pace that's interrupted by its game-like elements.
Author Information: Kallie played through Episode 1 twice and had a really hard time disappointing Gamora. Telltale provided GameSpot with a complimentary code.

Title: Has-Been Heroes Review
Review: This roguelike‰Ûªs cool combat system is held back by a terrible structure.
Author Information: James O‰ÛªConnor spent 10 hours with Has-Been Heroes on Nintendo Switch before standing back and noting that the brick wall he‰Ûªd been hurling himself at was barely dented. A review code was supplied by the publisher.

Title: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Review
Review: Mario Kart 8 Deluxe makes significant updates to the original that make its racing chaos the definitive version.
Author Information: Kallie finished every cup on 150cc with three stars and plans to do the same on 200cc (again). A complimentary code was provided to GameSpot for the purposes of this review.

Title: Warhammer 40000: Dawn Of War III Review
Review: Dawn of War III mashes micromanagement and big-scale strategy together in a system that‰Ûªs messy but exhilarating.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been a Warhammer fan since college. While he prefers the fantasy universe to 40K, he‰Ûªs no stranger to the far-flung future. He's a huge fan of the original Dawn of War and the more recent Battlefleet Gothic: Armada. He was provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Wonder Boy: The Dragon's Trap Review
Review: Short but sweet, this superb remake reintroduces an overlooked classic in style.
Author Information: Heidi, despite being a huge Sega dork, didn't own a Master System back when Wonder Boy first hit the scene. (Shhh!) She completed a full playthrough of the new Wonder Boy: The Dragon's Trap and found several of the optional secret areas. GameSpot was provided with complimentary download codes for the purpose of this review.

Title: Rain World Review
Review: An endearingly designed creature and a captivating world in ruins cannot save this 2D platformer from its punishing gameplay.
Author Information: Miguel needed about 20 hours to complete Rain World. A complementary PS4 code was provided by Adult Swim Games for review purposes.

Title: Snake Pass Review
Review: Snake Pass is a unique and beautiful platformer, but one that is marred by a steep difficulty curve.
Author Information: Oscar took around eight hours to finish Snake Pass, and while his love for serpents is stronger than ever, he now hates hummingbirds. A complimentary Xbox One copy of the game was provided by Sumo Digital for the purpose of this review.

Title: Yooka-Laylee Review
Review: Yooka-Laylee delivers on nostalgia but is held back by outdated gameplay and underwhelming levels.
Author Information: Kallie finished Yooka-Laylee in 20 hours and found around 75% of the collectibles using a complimentary code provided to GameSpot. She replays Banjo-Kazooie at least once a year.

Title: Everything Review
Review: Everything is a grand experiment that manages to inspire and disappoint in equal measure.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent five hours with Everything before reaching what could be construed as an ending. Though really there are no endings. There is only a series of quantum transitions from state to state, with infinite possibilities of form, all distinct and yet all the same and familiar, a vessel that may change shape but carries the same content. A complimentary code for the game was provided by the developer.

Title: Stories Untold Review
Review: Short horror anthology Stories Untold preys on technological nostalgia, which works three times out of four.
Author Information: James O‰ÛªConnor is a fan of horror fiction, although he‰Ûªs just slightly too young to have used the retro machines featured in the game. He spent five hours playing through Stories Untold. The author was provided with code for this review.

Title: Persona 5 Review
Review: Persona 5's compulsive gameplay and infectious energy make it a standout RPG.
Author Information: Lucy spent over 80 hours with Persona 5, romancing the best waifu (Ann) and unlocking the true ending. A complimentary PS4 copy of the game was provided by Atlus.

Title: The Walking Dead: The Telltale Series - A New Frontier Ep. 3: Above The Law Review
Review: A satisfying story can't make up for the lack of action and interactivity in Above the Law.
Author Information: Brett spent about two hours with Javi and Clementine to write this review of the PC version of Above the Law.

Title: Dark Souls 3: The Ringed City Review
Review: The Ringed City is a well-executed conclusion to the revered Dark Souls series.
Author Information: Dan is a dyed-in-the-wool Souls fan and proud member of the Sunlight Covenant. They brought over a level-148 New Game+ character from Dark Souls III, playing through each over the weekend. Temporary early-access codes were provided by Bandai Namco for the sake of review, though Dan bought the expansion outright once the time was up.

Title: Snipperclips Review
Review: Snipperclips is an engaging puzzler that's fun to play in groups, even if there's no long-lasting appeal.
Author Information: Randolph made his seven-year-old son stop playing Breath of the Wild on the Switch for a few hours to play coop with him while reviewing Snipperclips. His wife also played (under duress, as she's not much of a gamer). But everybody loved it! Nintendo provided GameSpot with a copy of the game.

Title: Fast RMX Review
Review: Fast RMX injects Switch's launch lineup with lightning-fast futuristic racing.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent seven hours speeding across the tracks of the future in Fast RMX, both online and off. Nintendo provided a complimentary download code of Fast RMX for the purpose of this review.

Title: Flatout 4: Total Insanity Review
Review: Flatout 4 brings the franchise into the modern day and gets away from the line with a dash, but nonsensical progression and frustrating AI quickly kills its drive.
Author Information: A veteran of racing and driving games, James put nearly 15 hours into all game modes including the career, Flatout mode and quickplay and multiplayer, and even convinced his fiance to try out the party mode in split screen. The PS4 review code was provided by the publisher.

Title: MLB The Show 17 Review
Review: Sony's long-running baseball sim returns, with better action on the field, and more options off it.
Author Information: Richard divided his time between every mode in MLB The Show 17 over roughly 40 hours of playtime. He will still continue to watch replays of particularly sumptuous hits.

Title: Torment: Tides of Numenera Review
Review: Torment: Tides of Numenera is a fascinating old-school RPG that doubles down on the concept of role-playing.
Author Information: Dan Starkey loves two genres above all others: strategy games and RPGs. He‰Ûªs been an avid fan of everything from pen-and-paper classics all the way up to Fallout 4, but modern RPGs have left him wanting--that is, until Torment. He spent 40 hours over a week and a half diving into Earth‰Ûªs far-flung future with review code provided by the publisher.

Title: Thimbleweed Park Review
Review: Thimbleweed Park is a point-and-click adventure full of enticing secrets to uncover, but its adherence to the genre's unremedied issues sometimes brings it down.
Author Information: Matt spent 21 hours playing Thimbleweed Park. After beating the game, he has decided that he wants to attach the phrase "a-reno" to the end of random words in his sentences. He hopes to get away with adding it into his copy for the rest of his career at GameSpot. Oh, and he's a huge fan of point-and-click adventure games. A complimentary copy of the game was provided by Terrible Toybox for the purpose of this review.

Title: Ghost Recon: Wildlands Review
Review: Ghost Recon is a large scale cooperative shooter rich in content but with questionable lasting appeal.
Author Information: Miguel needed 40 hours on the PlayStation 4 version to take down El Sueno while also making time for numerous side quests. The PC and Xbox One versions were played for a couple hours as well. Review codes for all platforms were provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Loot Rascals Review
Review: Loot Rascals is a gorgeous, tactical turn-based roguelike that doesn‰Ûªt always give back as much as it takes.
Author Information: James O‰ÛªConnor‰Ûªs favorite roguelike is still Faster Than Light, but he enjoys any excuse to hurl himself at the same wall over and over again. He played Loot Rascals for eight hours on PC for this review. Gamespot was provided with complimentary review code for this game.

Title: Parappa The Rapper Remastered Review
Review: Parappa returns, looking like 2017, but still rapping like 1996.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent two hours with Parappa the Rapper Remastered, playing up through the final stage, as well as through the game's alternate soundtracks. A complimentary code was provided by Sony for the purposes of this review.

Title: Shovel Knight: Specter Of Torment Review
Review: Specter of Torment is a focused and satisfyingly challenging 2D platformer which retains Shovel Knight's strong aesthetic and sense of charm.
Author Information: Edmond Tran played through the main Shovel Knight campaign multiple times on PC, and spent around 6 total hours with Specter of Torment, exploring all its modes on Nintendo Switch using a Pro Controller.

Title: Styx: Shards Of Darkness Review
Review: Many of the pieces that make up Styx feel dated, but they still come together to make a competent stealth-action experience.
Author Information: Michael grew up revering stealth-action games like the original Thief and Splinter Cell. He spent about 20 hours with Styx‰Ûªs new adventure on PC, completing every side quest presented, experimenting with different play styles, and experiencing the co-op mode. A complimentary copy was provided by Focus Home Interactive.

Title: Malicious Fallen Review
Review: Malicious Fallen delivers some serious flash and flair alongside some serious frustration.
Author Information: Justin Clark went through each Malicious Fallen boss twice for the purposes of this review. So far, he has yet to find a clothing shop selling cloaks that turn into fists. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary download code for the purposes of this review.

Title: Mass Effect: Andromeda Review
Review: Andromeda's combat soars but its storytelling sputters, making the series' first venture into uncharted space a shaky but occasionally satisfying new adventure.
Author Information: Scott explored Andromeda for over 60 hours, completing the main campaign and a large chunk of the side content. He founded outposts, tracked down missing ships, and ditched that chump Liam immediately. EA provided GameSpot with complimentary download codes for the purposes of this review.

Title: Horizon Zero Dawn Review
Review: Horizon Zero Dawn is an exciting and breathtaking odyssey.
Author Information: Peter played Horizon Zero Dawn for 55 hours, finishing the main questline and enough side quests for an 80% completion rating. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game by Sony.

Title: Ride 2 Review
Review: A confused spectacle that fails to promote the idea of a motorcycle game.
Author Information: A racing game junkie with an addiction to anything offering the chance to summit a podium, John raced for 15 hours around Ride 2‰Ûªs tarmac on PC.

Title: Berserk And The Band Of The Hawk Review
Review: Anime's most well known hack-and-slashing mercenary joins gaming's most prolific hack-and-slash series with mixed results.
Author Information: Miguel needed 15 hours to complete Berserk's Story Mode without skipping any of the anime and CG cutscenes. An additional hour was spent on the Free Mode and four more hours were needed to evaluate the Endless Eclipse Mode. The main playthrough was conducted on the PS4 version while the PS Vita and PC versions were spot checked at an hour each. Complementary review codes for all three platforms were provided by Koei Tecmo.

Title: Story of Seasons: Trio of Towns Review
Review: A handful of interface-related annoyances can‰Ûªt fully drag down the cheerful spirit of this farming-themed social simulation.
Author Information: Heidi has enjoyed her fair share of these social-simulation titles over the years. She played through several in-game years of Story of Seasons, finding her ideal husband in Ludus after much agonizing deliberation.

Title: For Honor Review
Review: For Honor is an incredibly entertaining fighter that's satisfying both in single and multiplayer, even despite the narrative flaws of its story mode.
Author Information: Matt played around 16 hours of For Honor before writing his review. He predominantly played on PS4, but also played a few hours extra on each the Xbox One and PC versions. His main Heroes are Nobushi, Berserker, and Kensei. Ubisoft provided GameSpot with complimentary copies of the game.

Title: The Legend Of Zelda: Breath Of The Wild Review
Review: The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild is Nintendo's most ambitious and impressive game to date.
Author Information: Peter spent 60 hours in Hyrule before reluctantly finishing the main quest on Switch. He spent an additional two hours testing the Wii U version. He looks forward to seeing everything Breath of the Wild has to offer, assuming he can unearth its secrets. Nintendo provided a complimentary console and a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Psychonauts In The Rhombus Of Ruin Review
Review: Our favorite psychic secret agents return, trading platforming for puzzles and flat displays for a VR headset. The results are sweet but far too short.
Author Information: Even as he tried to savor its immersive environments and silly dialogue, Scott sped through Rhombus of Ruin in just over two hours. At least he never felt motion sick. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: 1-2-Switch Review
Review: 1-2-Switch gets old very fast, but it's a great ride while the fun lasts.
Author Information: Oscar annoyed his housemates far too much in testing every 1-2-Switch minigame. No Joy-Cons were harmed in the writing of this review.

Title: Super Bomberman R Review
Review: Nintendo Switch gets a blast of nostalgia with the return of Bomberman.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile has been blowing up robots for as long as Bomberman and spent about five or so hours on Super Bomberman R. He was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Konami.

Title: Warhammer 40000: Sanctus Reach Review
Review: Sanctus Reach pits the hardy Space Marines against the fighty Orks in a massive war that‰Ûªs plagued with issues.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been a Warhammer fan since college. While he prefers the fantasy universe to 40K, he still knows his Tyranids from his Necrons. He's a huge fan of Dawn of War and Battlefleet Gothic: Armada. He was provided a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of review.

Title: Nioh Review
Review: By adapting the Dark Souls formula to the ways of the bushido, we find Team Ninja at the top of their game.
Author Information: Miguel needed about 85 hours to thoroughly explore all of Nioh's regions while also completing the main story missions and epilogue. Most of his playthrough was experienced solo, though a few of the boss fights were beaten using the game's co-op feature. Sony Interactive Entertainment provided a complimentary review code for PlayStation 4.

Title: Skylanders Imaginators Review
Review: Skylanders Imaginators is saved by its focus on character customisation.
Author Information: Randolph played through the Imaginators campaign and several side missions (and was joined during certain levels by his seven-year-old son, provided he did all his chores). He mainly stuck to playing with the toys you receive in the PlayStation 4 exclusive starter pack, but also experimented with creating other characters. Activision provided a copy of the game, as well as all of the new toys used for this review.

Title: Double Dragon 4 Review
Review: The completely retro Double Dragon 4 proves not everything was golden in olden times.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile spent about five hours getting knocked around in Double Dragon IV while wondering what happened to his lost youth. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary download code for the PC version of Double Dragon IV.

Title: Linelight Review
Review: Linelight is a minimalistic puzzle game that draws you in with its tranquil atmosphere and tests your mettle with ever-increasing challenges.
Author Information: Peter finished Linelight on PC and spent an hour with the PlayStation 4 version. GameSpot was provided with complementary codes for Linelight for the purpose of this review.

Title: Beholder Review
Review: Serving as a landlord under Beholder‰Ûªs totalitarian regime can be tense and exciting, but it can also be quite tedious.
Author Information: James O‰ÛªConnor appreciates the ‰Û÷perform a mundane job within a horrible regime‰Ûª genre, although nothing has topped Papers, Please yet. He spent seven hours with Beholder, restarting the game once after the first two hours. Review code was supplied by the publisher.

Title: Fire Emblem Heroes Review
Review: Fire Emblem Heroes has compelling draws for both fans and newcomers, but it also doesn‰Ûªt offer many reasons to keep playing in the long run.
Author Information: Kallie completed Fire Emblem Heroes‰Ûª main quest and spent about $10 on Orbs. Tharja is her best girl.

Title: Divide Review
Review: Divide‰Ûªs decent science fiction premise is undermined by tedious and repetitive design.
Author Information: A longtime sci-fi and RPG fan, Cassidee completed Divide in about 13 hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Halo Wars 2 Review
Review: Halo Wars 2 is an RTS game for Halo fans with stripped-down strategy elements and limited lasting appeal.
Author Information: Kallie finished Halo Wars 2‰Ûªs campaign in six hours using a code provided by Microsoft. She has been a Halo fan since Combat Evolved.

Title: Diluvion Review
Review: Diluvion tries to bring open-world exploration below sea level--but drowns in the process.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 20 hours with Diluvion, six of which were spent growling commands at his crew like Gene Hackman in Crimson Tide. He truly believes that the sense of vague resentment and fear he instilled in his gunner is why his torpedoes never aimed right. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of Diluvion for the purpose of this review.

Title: Poochy and Yoshi‰Ûªs Woolly World Review
Review: Poochy and Yoshi‰Ûªs Woolly World‰Ûªs format works well on 3DS, and the best parts of the original Wii U version still stand out.
Author Information: Kallie completed Poochy and Yoshi‰Ûªs Woolly World in under 10 hours with an early copy provided by Nintendo. She spent many, many hours playing Yoshi‰Ûªs Story as a small child and many more playing other Nintendo platformers.

Title: Sniper Elite 4 Review
Review: The grisly ballistics are still second to none, but it's the improvements made beyond the sniper scope that make Sniper Elite 4 a series standout.
Author Information: Richard completed Sniper Elite 4's campaign in around ten hours, before touching on the authentic difficulty level, and dying a lot in multiplayer. He inflicted quite the checklist of damaged organs, from ruptured brains, hearts, lungs, intestines, and, of course, testicles.

Title: Wild Guns Reloaded Review
Review: An enhanced remake of a cult classic, Wild Guns Reloaded offers up a rare breed of white-knuckle arcade-shooting action.
Author Information: Heidi loves‰ÛÏcrosshair shooter‰Û games--even though she is, admittedly, not that great at them. She gave up on trying to clear Wild Guns Reloaded without using continues before writing her review, much to her great shame. Natsume provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review purposes.

Title: Urban Empire Review
Review: Urban Empire is a dense city-building simulation with a twist. It focuses not just on zoning and taxes, but also on building your own political dynasty.
Author Information: Dan Starkey got his feet wet in the city-building genre with 1999‰Ûªs SimCity 3000. Since then, he's built countless settlements in everything from Banished to Clockwork Empires. For the purposes of this review, he played three games with three different families on each of the major maps, totaling over 40 hours. He was provided a free review copy by the developer.

Title: Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8: Final Chapter Prologue Review
Review: Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8: Final Chapter Prologue is a collection of three experiences that range from tantalizing to forgettable.
Author Information: For the purposes of this review, Leif Johnson played Kingdom Hearts HD 2.8: Final Chapter Prologue for around 20 hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy by Square-Enix.

Title: Tales of Berseria Review
Review: Thanks to its dark atmosphere and exciting combat, Tales of Berseria is a refreshing change of pace for the long-running RPG series.
Author Information: Jake completed Tales of Berseria in 50 hours with a complimentary advanced copy provided by Bandai Namco. He‰Ûªs played every Tales game since Tales of Symphonia.

Title: Gravity Rush 2 Review
Review: Gravity Rush 2 is a jam-packed sequel that fulfills its predecessor‰Ûªs untapped potential.
Author Information: Peter completed Gravity Rush 2 in about 20 hours using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Sony. He previously completed the original Gravity Rush on PlayStation 4.

Title: Yakuza 0 Review
Review: Yakuza Zero's humorous world is packed goofy quests and minigames, but the story cuts through it with powerful characters and high-stakes drama.
Author Information: Peter has dabbled in previous Yakuza games, but Yakuza Zero is the first game in the series he's completed. He beat Yakuza Zero in 38 hours, which included about 10 hours of exploring optional missions and minigames. Sega provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for review.

Title: Steep Review
Review: Steep is an enjoyable open-world game that excels in exploration but suffers from finicky controls and repetitive challenges.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For the purposes of this review, he completed Steep in 12 hours on Xbox One using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun Review
Review: Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun is a real-time tactical stealth game with gorgeous levels and clever mechanics.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's played stealth games for as long as he can remember, starting with Thief before branching out into all manner of sneaky adventures. He played through Shadow Tactics: Blades of the Shogun in 24 hours using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Daedalic Entertainment.

Title: Dragon Ball Fusions Review
Review: Fan service abounds in Dragon Ball Fusions--and, unfortunately, so does repetition.
Author Information: Heidi spent around 30 hours in the world of Dragon Ball Fusions, collecting an army of the strongest Saiyans, Namekians, and other odd combinations of characters to fill out her team of ultimate warriors. She was really hoping Launch, the most underrated Dragon Ball female character, might show up in this game for some fun fusion time--but at least we got Arale! GameSpot was provided with a complimentary game for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Walking Dead: The Telltale Series - A New Frontier Ep. 1: Ties That Bind Part One Review
Review: The third season of Telltale‰Ûªs take on The Walking Dead takes the franchise in a new direction, and brings back a familiar face.
Author Information: Brett hung out in (the virtual version of) Prescott for about four hours while playing through The Ties That Bind Part I twice. He was provided with a complimentary pre-release copy of the game by Telltale Games.

Title: Resident Evil 7: Biohazard Review
Review: Despite dragging in spots, Resident Evil 7's house of horrors recaptures the tension that first made the series a household name.
Author Information: Scott survived RE7's full campaign in roughly 12 hours before enduring a further few hours in VR. He only screamed out loud twice. Publisher Capcom provided a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Dynasty Warriors: Godseekers Review
Review: Dynasty Warriors: Godseekers eschews third-person action for turn-based strategy with mixed results.
Author Information: Sean Bell has been pursuing Lu Bu for roughly 15 years now and somehow still isn‰Ûªt bored of it. Seriously, there might be something wrong with him.

Title: The Walking Dead: The Telltale Series - A New Frontier Ep. 2: Ties That Bind Part Two Review
Review: The conclusion to The Ties That Bind is a gut-wrenching, gory masterpiece up there with the very best episodes of The Walking Dead.
Author Information: Brett hit the road with Javy, Clem, and crew for about two hours while wrapping up Episode Two of the third season of The Walking Dead.

Title: Silence Review
Review: Silence is a gorgeous point-and-click adventure that usually manages to make up for its lack of challenging puzzles with powerful imagery and emotion.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For the purposes of this review, he completed Silence in 7 hours.

Title: Killing Floor 2 Review
Review: Underneath the mayhem of Killing Floor 2 lies exciting wave-based combat and a rewarding progression system.
Author Information: Miguel spent 20 hours playing through all of Killing Floor 2's maps several times over. He also spent time upgrading all of the classes, which meant trying out each and every weapon. Tripwire Interactive provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Shantae: Half-Genie Hero Review
Review: Shantae‰Ûªs back with old-school charm and a shiny new coat of paint.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent seven hours exploring Half-Genie Hero and is still trying to find a few lingering secrets. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: Werewolves Within Review
Review: Ubisoft's Werewolves Within is an exciting demo of VR's social capabilities, even if the final product is somewhat bare bones.
Author Information: Don Saas spent way too much time in his youth watching professional liars ply their trade at the height of the poker boom and isn't sure if he should be proud of how many tricks of the trade he picked up. He spent eight hours with Werewolves Within for this review using a complementary code provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Space Hulk: Deathwing Review
Review: Space Hulk: Deathwing has great atmosphere and attitude, but is ultimately undone by its frustrating gameplay.
Author Information: Brett ventured into the grim, dark future for about 15 hours in the course of writing this review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: I Expect You to Die Review
Review: I Expect You to Die captures the tension, revelations, and exhilaration of a last-second escape in virtual reality.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy died many times on his way to escape in I Expect You to Die. He can now defuse virtual bombs in 10 seconds flat. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for review.

Title: Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization Review
Review: Sword Art Online is built on high-stakes drama and a compelling premise--Hollow Realization delivers on neither.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins enjoys MMOs, RPGs, visual novels, and even a little bit of fan service from time to time. The MMO-themed PS2 game .hack//INFECTION made a big impression on her back in the day, though its sequels did not. She put about 50 hours into Sword Art Online: Hollow Realization for the purposes of this review.

Title: Super Mario Run Review
Review: Mario's smartphone debut is a charming yet all-too-brief adventure.
Author Information: Peter finished every level in Super Mario Run, played a handful of levels with Peach and Toad, and competed against Nintendo-made ghosts in Toad Rally before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Nintendo.

Title: Robinson: The Journey Review
Review: Crytek takes on dinosaurs and science fiction in Virtual Reality.
Author Information: Jason spent about five hours trekking through jungles and tar pits, hiding from raptors, and marveling at giant herbivores and pterosaurs. He reviewed Robinson: The Journey with a copy of the game provided by Crytek

Title: Dead Rising 4 Review
Review: Dead Rising's core combat remains simplistic, but the expanded open world, compelling central mystery, and added combo weapons refresh the formula enough for some light, bloody fun.
Author Information: Scott razed the dead for roughly 20 hours across both the campaign and the new cooperative multiplayer mode. Capcom provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Orwell Review
Review: A smart take on surveillance and a focus on player choice makes Orwell exciting, engaging, and discomforting.
Author Information: James O‰ÛªConnor loves narrative-driven games, and should probably re-read Nineteen Eighty-Four soon. For this review, he put five hours into a first runthrough and two into a second. Review code was provided by publisher Surprise Attack.

Title: Hitman Review
Review: Agent 47 returns in one of the best Hitman games in the franchise‰Ûªs history.
Author Information: Killing people was Brett‰Ûªs business--and business was good--for more than 20 hours while he played Hitman for this review.

Title: Cities: Skylines - Natural Disasters Review
Review: Catastrophes finally come to Cities: Skylines in the Natural Disasters add-on.
Author Information: Brett watched the end of the world as he knew it over and over again for about a dozen hours while playing Cities: Skylines - Natural Disasters.

Title: Final Fantasy 15 Review
Review: Final Fantasy XV's world is filled with natural splendor and harrowing dungeons that far outlive the shallow story about a prince and his cliched bodyguards.
Author Information: Peter completed Final Fantasy XV's story in 35 hours on PlayStation 4. 30 hours later, he continues to travel around the continent of Eos in search of legendary weapons and beasts worthy of his sword. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Watch Dogs 2 Review
Review: Watch Dogs 2 offers loads of entertainment in a playground-like rendition of San Francisco that rises above the first game's soggy, downtrodden atmosphere.
Author Information: Peter spent almost 50 hours in Watch Dogs 2's ridiculous take on the San Francisco Bay Area. Ubisoft provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Planet Coaster Review
Review: Planet Coaster is an exemplary amusement park management simulation with fantastic construction tools and a wealth of high-quality user-created content.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has spent more than 45 hours playing Planet Coaster, building over a dozen parks. His favorite park mascot is Gulpee Rex, and he thinks Cosmic Cow should be locked away. A copy of the game was provided by Frontier Developments.

Title: Oceanhorn Review
Review: Oceanhorn pays respect to the top-down adventures of the past, but it doesn't do much to advance their ideas.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent five hours cruising the sea for the dread monster Oceanhorn. He‰Ûªs made a sworn vow that, given enough money, he would pay to have Nobuo Uematsu score his life for a week. It‰Ûªs good to have goals. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary download code for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dishonored 2 Review
Review: Dishonored's brand of creative stealth-action mayhem returns with excellent new weapons, powers, and gameplay options that overshadow a few late-game letdowns.
Author Information: Scott initially completed the campaign as Corvo--mixing stealth and action as necessary--then started a pure stealth run with new protagonist Emily. He also collected every single rune and explored most of the side content. Publisher Bethesda provided a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare Review
Review: Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare touches down with passable multiplayer, a tubular, neon-tinged zombie invasion, and the best campaign since the first Modern Warfare.
Author Information: Miguel spent 8 hours on Call of Duty: Infinite Warfare's campaign and logged approximately 38 hours of multiplayer time, primarily on the PlayStation 4 version and partially on the Xbox One and PC versions. Of those multiplayer hours, 15 were spent at a four-day review event in San Francisco in a closed online environment, while the rest of the time was spent on live servers using final retail code provided in advance by Activision. He has played every mainline Call of Duty release since the first game in 2

Title: Dragon Ball: Xenoverse 2 Review
Review: Dragon Ball Xenoverse 2‰Ûªs combat might not be top-tier, but it provides a strong enough foundation to let this fan fantasy shine.
Author Information: Heidi‰Ûªs reviewed a lot of Dragon Ball games over her freelance career--though, admittedly, she didn‰Ûªt play the first Xenoverse. However, she put about 15 hours into Xenoverse 2, completing the single-player story and playing numerous online and offline quests. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for review.

Title: Tyranny Review
Review: The banality of evil is on full display in the dark and disturbing Tyranny.
Author Information: Brett finished Tyranny in 25 hours using a copy of the game provided by Paradox Interactive.

Title: The Last Guardian Review
Review: The Last Guardian's peerless animation and character development bring a fascinating relationship between boy and beast to life.
Author Information: Peter completed The Last Guardian in 13 hours using a copy of the game provided by Sony.

Title: Butcher Review
Review: Butcher is a brutal action-platformer with an eye for clever level design and a commitment to excessive action.
Author Information: Dan Starkey will always have a soft spot for '90s-inspired action games, especially if they don't take themselves too seriously. He played through each of Butcher's 20 levels on Hard (the default setting). GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Transhuman Design.

Title: Pokemon Sun and Moon Review
Review: Despite its story stumbles, Pokemon Sun and Moon for Nintendo 3DS breathes new life into the 20-year-old franchise.
Author Information: After around 30 hours, Justin became the Pokemon Master of Alola. A copy of Pokemon Sun and Moon were provided for this review by Nintendo.

Title: Football Manager 2017 Review
Review: Smart refinements and an improved match engine mark a return to form for the long-running management sim.
Author Information: Richard spent more than 100 hours unevenly split between pre-launch code and the final version of Football Manager 2017. There were equal amounts of fist pumping and hair pulling.

Title: Dark Souls 3: Ashes of Ariandel Review
Review: A new painted world serves as the setting for the first Dark Souls III DLC--with a new host of goals, enemies, and loot, but not much else.
Author Information: Miguel toured his level-130 character from Dark Souls III throughout every area of Ashes of Ariandel on the PlayStation 4. The playthrough took about 6 hours, not counting failed boss fights. He also used a level 85-character in the Steam version for a partial 3-hour playthrough. Complimentary review codes for both platforms were provided by Bandai Namco.

Title: Batman - The Telltale Series: New World Order - Episode 3 Review
Review: Inconsequential decisions suck the momentum out of Telltale's Batman series.
Author Information: Tamoor played through Episode 3 multiple times to explore as many branches of the story as possible, but found there's not much different between them. Sad Batman.

Title: Overcooked Review
Review: If you're looking for rewarding, high-pressure couch co-op, it's hard to beat Overcooked's wild yet accessible culinary juggling act.
Author Information: Scott recruited various members of the GameSpot staff to help him test Overcooked. There was yelling. Lots of yelling. GameSpot purchased a copy of the game for this review.

Title: World of Final Fantasy Review
Review: World of Final Fantasy‰Ûªs cute character moments can only offset its various frustrations for so long.
Author Information: Heidi played World of Final Fantasy for 42 hours before writing her review, using a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Eagle Flight Review
Review: Eagle Flight offers a fun, competitive take on capture-the-flag that is completely unique to VR.
Author Information: Jimmy beat the single-player campaign within four hours and played roughly four hours of the multiplayer. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game on the Oculus Rift for the purpose of this review.

Title: WWE 2K17 Review
Review: Refinements to its measured combat make for a better game, but problems still persist in key areas both in and outside the squared circle.
Author Information: Richard started watching wrestling back before The Rock was cool. He spent more than 30 hours with WWE 2K17, and never found anything as good as Shinsuke Nakamura versus Sami Zayn from NXT TakeOver: Dallas. GameSpot was supplied a copy of the game from publisher 2K.

Title: Civilization 6 Review
Review: The series that cemented the 4X strategy formula continues to stand the test of time with a stellar entry that adds richness and depth in unexpected places.
Author Information: Scott powered through four matches in around 60 hours, but still feels like there's a lot left for him to learn. Thankfully, even after all those hours, he's still excited to dive back in. Publisher 2K provided a complimentary download code for this review.

Title: The Silver Case Review
Review: Suda 51's first game finally debuts on Western shores, the game fails to deliver on its best concepts.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 30 hours on The Silver Case. Nothing he said about The Silver Case has put a dent in how bad he needs Killer7 HD to happen. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game by the publisher.

Title: Titanfall 2 Review
Review: Titanfall 2 is more measured and intelligent than its predecessor, but just as fluid and kinetic.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy completed Titanfall 2's campaign in five hours, and spent four times as long playing every multiplayer mode. His favorite Titan is Scorch.

Title: 100ft Robot Golf Review
Review: 100ft Robot Golf lives up to the hilarity of its premise in every way, except when it has to be a golf game.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through all 36 holes of 100ft Robot Golf. He is, in fact, three squirrels and a manatee piloting a human suit.

Title: Giant Machines 2017 Review
Review: Driving huge vehicles can be cool in Giant Machines 2017, but it's a thrill that doesn't last long.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent about 5 hours across 14 missions generally moving at the speed of about a mile and a half an hour, which is basically how he drives normally.

Title: Rise of the Tomb Raider Review
Review: Lara Croft's new adventure blends gameplay and story into a seamless experience in a dangerous world.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 20 hours exploring Rise of the Tomb Raider's world. He still can't find enough coins to upgrade his bolt action rifle.

Title: Battlefield 1 Review
Review: EA‰Ûªs shooter franchise goes back in time to the end of the imperial age with spectacular results in both its single and multiplayer experiences.
Author Information: Miguel amassed 35 hours of combat time in Battlefield 1‰Ûªs multiplayer while spending six hours on the campaign. 12 of those multiplayer hours were spent at a two-day review event in Los Angeles in a closed online environment while the rest of the time was spent on live servers using final retail codes. He has played every mainline Battlefield release since Battlefield 1942, as well as the two Bad Company spin-offs. Codes for the game on Xbox One, PS4, and PC were provided by EA.

Title: Here They Lie Review
Review: Prog-rock album-cover aesthetics meets occult imagery in this gripping psychological horror excursion on PlayStation VR.
Author Information: Miguel took approximately 4 hours to beat Here They Lie and played two additional hours on a second playthrough. He's a huge fan of Silent Hill 1 and 2 and the first two Fatal Frames. Code for the game and PlayStation VR hardware were provided by Sony.

Title: Duke Nukem 3D: 20th Anniversary World Tour Review
Review: The Duke is back in a somewhat new (but very familiar) 20th-anniversary world tour.
Author Information: Brett blasted his way through the evil alien pigs, cats, and other extraterrestrial beasties of this 20th-anniversary take on Duke Nukem 3D for around 10 hours. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game.

Title: Shadow Warrior 2 Review
Review: Shadow Warrior 2's unfunny story gets in the way of an otherwise great game.
Author Information: Mat played Shadow Warrior 2 alone and in co-op with a friend for about 10 hours. He played on PC with a code provided by the publisher.

Title: PlayStation VR Worlds Review
Review: Can PlayStation VR Worlds do for PSVR what Wii Sports did for the Wii?
Author Information: Jimmy played through all of PlayStation VR Worlds, even though one experience made him motion sick. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: RIGS Mechanized Combat League Review
Review: The PlayStation VR shooter from Killzone studio Guerrilla Games nails first-person VR controls, but stumbles over the smaller details
Author Information: Justin got through a season and a half offline, a season online, and strongly preferred for the Hunter class. Sony provided a copy of the game and the PSVR hardware for this review.

Title: Batman: Arkham VR Review
Review: More of a VR experiment than a game, Batman: Arkham VR is light on gameplay but full of moments that will leave a lasting impression.
Author Information: Tamoor played Batman: Arkham VR on a PlayStation VR headset supplied by Sony. He played through the game three times and is now incorporating it to his morning routine. Start the day the Batman way.

Title: Paper Mario: Color Splash Review
Review: Returning after a 9-year break from consoles, Paper Mario goes Bob Ross on countless Shy Guys by teaching them The Joys of Painting.
Author Information: Miguel needed 25 hours to get through Paper Mario: Color Splash, which also included time spent trying to reach 100 percent colorization in all areas. He managed a 90 percent average. His favorite installment in the series is the original Paper Mario. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Battlezone VR Review
Review: The arcade classic returns, bringing challenging, cooperative tank combat into modern virtual reality. The results are flawed but ultimately still fun.
Author Information: Scott blasted his way through Battlezone VR's randomized campaign both solo and with a co-op buddy. GameSpot's PlayStation VR headset (as well as a copy of the game) was furnished by Sony.

Title: Atlas Reactor Review
Review: Atlas Reactor is a turn-based PvP game inspired by XCOM and Dota that's refreshingly fun.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. Much like Atlas Reactor's heroes, he's a freelancer--and thus, he's sad that Trion didn't include any heroes who use keyboards or pens as weapons. For the purposes of this review, he spent about 20 hours with Atlas Reactor, both in the live version and in open beta.

Title: Yo-Kai Watch 2 Review
Review: Yo-kai Watch 2's new additions to the series' lore aren't enough to save this sequel from feeling like old, stale territory.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea enjoyed the first Yo-kai Watch and finished the main campaign of Yo-Kai Watch 2, as well as played around in multiplayer. Copies of both versions--Bony Spirits and Fleshy Souls--were provided by Nintendo for this review.

Title: Gears of War 4 Review
Review: Gears of War 4 makes the best of the franchise's multiplayer modes, but delivers a lackluster campaign in the process.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy found his groove with the gnasher shotgun again, and continued to use it across Gears of War 4's versus modes. Microsoft provided a copy of the game for review.

Title: Mafia 3 Review
Review: Though Mafia III's storytelling is exceptional in every way, it's not quite strong enough to compensate for dated gameplay, repetitive missions, and technical issues.
Author Information: Scott marathoned Mafia III's single-player campaign in roughly 40 hours, though he's confident the game would have been stronger at a smartly edited 20 to 25 hours. He tested the game on Xbox One, PS4, and PC. All copies were provided by publisher 2K Games.

Title: River City: Tokyo Rumble Review
Review: River City: Tokyo Rumble isn‰Ûªt terribly complex or difficult, but it‰Ûªs plenty of fun for its brief playtime.
Author Information: It‰Ûªs been a long time since Heidi played River City Ransom, but she was glad to re-enter the world of Kunio and company once again. She played Tokyo Rumble for eight hours, completing many of the optional quests in the process, using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Natsume.

Title: XCOM 2 Review
Review: Firaxis' turn-based strategy sequel brings major improvements to the multilayered XCOM formula.
Author Information: Over the course of 40 hours, Mike failed four XCOM campaigns. He refused to load earlier saves.

Title: Sonic Boom: Fire and Ice Review
Review: Sonic Boom: Fire & Ice is an enjoyable if easy platformer with a good sense of speed and a handful of fun mini-games.
Author Information: Cassidee finished Sonic Boom: Fire and Ice in six hours before writing her review. GameSpot was provided with complementary copies of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Destiny: Rise of Iron Review
Review: In its third year, Destiny is showing signs of exhaustion, as it retreads old ground and struggles to find inspiration.
Author Information: Mike spent more than 20 hours grinding for Hunter gear, often fighting some variation of Sepiks Prime. Bungie provided a copy of Rise of Iron for review.

Title: Azure Striker Gunvolt 2 Review
Review: Azure Striker Gunvolt 2 is a satisfying experience that never lets up with its distinct, tightly-paced action and challenging platforming.
Author Information: Matt played around 8 and a half hours of Azure Striker Gunvolt 2 before writing his review. He's a huge fan of the Mega Man series and 2D action games in general. Nintendo provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: FIFA 17 Review
Review: FIFA's new story mode grabs the headlines, but its gameplay still makes the difference.
Author Information: Nathan played FIFA 17 on Xbox One for nearly 20 hours and put three hours into a single manual passing tutorial that he still hasn't managed an A rating on yet. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Until Dawn: Rush of Blood Review
Review: Until Dawn: Rush of Blood is filled with spooky sights and sounds, but falls short of being truly scary or fun to play.
Author Information: Peter played through Rush of Blood in less than two hours on the Normal difficulty setting using a copy of the game provided by Sony.

Title: Batman - The Telltale Series: Children of Arkham - Episode 2 Review
Review: Telltale gives Oswald Cobblepot some time in the limelight, but skimps on gameplay to do so.
Author Information: Tamoor played Episode Two of Telltale's Batman series on PC. He found there were no noticeable performance issues.

Title: Forza Horizon 3 Review
Review: From brand-building to a relentless reward system, this fast and friendly driving adventure in Australia has it all.
Author Information: While exploring all of Forza Horizon 3's modes, Miguel took 20 hours to complete the festival component of the campaign. He‰Ûªs still crossing his fingers for a Forza Horizon set along the Pacific coast of California, Oregon, and Washington. At least that would be less cliched than setting a Horizon festival in Ibiza. Microsoft provided GameSpot with complimentary download codes for the purpose of this review.

Title: Pro Evolution Soccer 2017 Review
Review: PES is playing its best soccer in years, but it still struggles with features and online matches.
Author Information: Nathan played PES 17 offline and online on PlayStation 4. He built a myClub team around James Rodriguez, and still hasn‰Ûªt really found his best position. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of PES 17 for the purpose of this review.

Title: God Eater 2: Rage Burst Review
Review: An accomplished, remastered sequel to the first God Eater comes fully loaded with otherworldly beasts to kill.
Author Information: Miguel spent 35 hours clearing God Eater 2: Rage Burst on PC while also spending a couple of hours on the PS4 version. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Worms W.M.D. Review
Review: Worms W.M.D. marks a return to form for the classic turn-based strategy series.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile has been playing with his Worms since the original Amiga version. In this case, he spent at least eight hours blowing away well-armed annelids controlled by AI, online players, and himself, across the Xbox One and PC versions of the game. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of Worms W.M.D. for the purpose of this review.

Title: NBA2K17 Review
Review: NBA 2K17's gameplay and presentation are on a whole other level when it comes to representing sports in video games.
Author Information: Mat hasn't played many entries in the NBA 2K series, but he loves basketball. Talk to him about the sport, and without fail, he'll let you know it was invented by a Canadian. He played NBA 2K17 for 15 hours on PlayStation 4 with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: Jotun Review
Review: Jaw dropping beauty and a hefty challenge await you in in the hallowed realm of Jotun.
Author Information: With no small amount of luck, and hundreds of deaths, Justin Clark was able to complete Jotun‰Ûªs campaign. To his dismay, Chris Hemsworth was not the final boss.

Title: World of Warcraft: Legion Review
Review: World of Warcraft: Legion proves that Blizzard still has enough tricks up its sleeve to keep WoW relevant more than a decade after its initial release.
Author Information: Don Saas has played World of Warcraft on and off since his freshman year of college during the Burning Crusade years, and spent 35 hours with Legion before writing his review. He tends to roll hunters and priests (Horde, naturally), but his toon for Legion was primarily a Demon Hunter. Lok'tar ogar.

Title: SuperHyper Cube Review
Review: SuperHyperCube is a simple-yet-difficult VR puzzle game set in a magical space, but VR doesn't benefit gameplay in a meaningful way.
Author Information: Peter played SuperHyperCube for three hours but never managed to make it past the fourth group's puzzles, despite his best efforts. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Spirit of Justice Review
Review: The latest courtroom adventure for the Wright Anything Agency may be its best yet, with a wide range of crime-solving tools and characters that create room for elaborate drama and ...
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has been with the Phoenix Wright series since its inception. She completed the full game for the purpose of this review with a copy provided by publisher Capcom.

Title: The Final Station Review
Review: The Final Station is a 2D side-scrolling zombie survival game with enough challenging combat to offset its predictable pace.
Author Information: Alex would totally panic in a zombie apocalypse, so don‰Ûªt depend on him to find survivors and hunt for food. It took him 10 hours to finish The Final Station. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: ReCore Review
Review: ReCore's solid mechanics are sullied by frustrating quest design.
Author Information: Tamoor played ReCore on Xbox One. He reached the final area of the game and will be spending the next few days finding those accursed Prismatic Cores, hoping there's something good behind the doors.

Title: The Tomorrow Children Review
Review: Resource gathering and city building have never been more tedious.
Author Information: Scott slogged through The Tomorrow Children Founders Pack for 15 hours before he finally surrendered. A free-to-play version of the game is still forthcoming. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei 4: Apocalypse Review
Review: This all-new adventure in the Shin Megami Tensei IV universe ranks among the best games for the 3DS.
Author Information: Heidi‰Ûªs played every official English-language Shin Megami Tensei release, and SMTIV: Apocalypse is among the best. Now that she‰Ûªs seen the Anarchy ending, shes tempted to go back and see some of the other endings available in the game. Heidi reviewed the game using a complimentary download code provided by Atlus.

Title: Valley Review
Review: Valley is an exciting experience in motion, but its momentum is cut short by the all too brief adventure.
Author Information: Mat finished Valley in just under 3 hours with a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Alone With You Review
Review: A cross between a visual novel and classic adventure game, Alone with You offers a strong and poignant narrative of love, tragedy, and relationships.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile can‰Ûªt resist a companion who loves to read and write, especially when stranded on a dying planet. He completed Alone With You using a complimentary download code provided by Sony.

Title: Grow Up Review
Review: Grow Up's frustrating physics and controls conflict with its charming presentation.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent eight hours getting stuck in high places with B.U.D. using a complimentary copy of the game provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Obduction Review
Review: Obduction is a beautiful, unrelenting adventure game whose complex puzzles can be both satisfying and frustrating.
Author Information: Edmond Tran completed Obduction in around 14 hours. He still has CD-ROM copies of Myst and Riven somewhere, but forgot the code to the cardboard box. He played Obduction using a complimentary code provided by the publisher.

Title: Jojo's Bizarre Adventure: Eyes of Heaven Review
Review: CyberConnect 2's latest Jojo's Bizarre Adventure brawler has some glaring issues, but series fans shouldn't hesitate to play this one.
Author Information: Matt played nearly 25 hours of Eyes of Heaven and his current mains are Lisa Lisa and Kakyoin. He's proud to say he's a huge Jojo fan and has read nearly the entirety of the series except for some of the latest chapters of Jojolion. His favorite parts are Diamond is Unbreakable and Steel Ball Run. Yes, he's watching the current anime and he loves it to death.

Title: NHL 17 Review
Review: The NHL series' gameplay continues to impress in NHL 17, but with only incremental upgrades, it feels like a game we've played before.
Author Information: Mat is Canadian, which means it's against federal law for him to not consume hockey on a daily basis. He's played every NHL game since 2001, and spent 20 hours with the Xbox One version of NHL 17 with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: Attack on Titan Review
Review: Attack on Titan's latest gameplay iteration doesn't win any technical achievements, but is a fun, faithful adaptation that can rope you in with its traversal alone.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has watched the show and read the manga, and now that's she's beaten the campaign and swung around in multiplayer mode for Attack on Titan, she doesn't know if she can stand to look at one more giant naked man.

Title: Mother Russia Bleeds Review
Review: Mother Russia Bleeds brings an older genre back into the limelight, with clever boss fights, intricate stage design, and complicated storytelling themes.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy beat Mother Russia Bleeds alone and cooperatively, and as was the case with Double Dragon and River City Ransom, prefers having a friend along for the ride.

Title: Master of Orion Review
Review: Despite some rough edges and frequent moments of boredom, Master of Orion is an engaging reboot of a classic sci-fi strategy title.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 25 hours exploring the stars and dismantling alien races in Master of Orion. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game by the publisher.

Title: Deus Ex Go Review
Review: Deus Ex Go's hacking-based puzzle-solving is so satisfying it makes you feel smarter than the game itself.
Author Information: Mat swiped through the story's puzzles in a couple of hours. Sadly, he did it with boring human hands instead of cool robot ones like Adam Jensen's. He reviewed Deus Ex Go on an iPad Air with a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Kentucky Route Zero Act IV Review
Review: Kentucky Route Zero returns with an episode that meanders, but enraptures all the same.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent two and a half hours with Kentucky Route Zero's newest act. He sincerely hopes to one day have a story as good those told on Lethe Lake. Fewer electric skeletons running around would be a plus, though.

Title: Bound Review
Review: What Bound lacks in challenging gameplay, it makes up for in breathtaking awe.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Bound in about three hours. He fully intends to play the game again when the PSVR patch hits and will spend his days until then hoarding Dramamine.

Title: No Man's Sky Review
Review: No Man's Sky is a massive machine with broken and missing parts, but dig deep enough and you'll be moved in ways you never expected.
Author Information: Peter played No Man's Sky for 40 hours on PS4, completing the Atlas quest and meandering planetside often enough to amass millions in currency and purchase new ships on a regular basis. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: F1 2016 Review
Review: F1 2016 rewards reflexes and tactful driving to create the most authentic F1 game to date.
Author Information: Danny often wakes up at silly hours of the morning to watch Formula One races taking place around the world. He co-hosts a Formula One podcast on Giant Bomb and splits his F1 gaming time between the Codemasters series and Project CARS. For this review, he spent 15 hours with F1 2016 across PS4, Xbox One, and PC, using complimentary codes provided by the publisher.

Title: Inside Review
Review: Inside is a beautiful, haunting tale of survival and individuality with engaging puzzles and an intriguing world.
Author Information: Alex Newhouse is a big fan of dystopian and post-apocalyptic fiction, and Inside's a great entry in the genre. He completed the game twice on Xbox One for this review with a copy provided by the developer.

Title: Batman - The Telltale Series: Realm of Shadows - Episode 1 Review
Review: Telltale begins breaking down Bruce Wayne with a strong first episode.
Author Information: Tamoor played Episode One on PC at a review event held by Telltale. He was vengeance, he was the night, he was Batman (for about two hours).

Title: Deus Ex: Mankind Divided Review
Review: Deus Ex: Mankind Divided refines and reinforces the defining foundations of the series.
Author Information: Edmond Tran played Mankind Divided on PC. He spent around 30 hours completing the campaign and nearly all side missions as a stealthy, pacifist hacker, before starting New Game+ and solving every problem with a revolver.

Title: Metroid Prime: Federation Force Review
Review: Metroid Prime: Federation Force plays it safe and drops the ball.
Author Information: Peter completed Federation Force's campaign through a mixture of solo and cooperative play, with players local and online. He participated in a half-dozen matches of Blast Ball, and chalked every one of his goals up to luck. He reviewed Federation Force using a copy of the game provided by Nintendo.

Title: The King of Fighters XIV Review
Review: The King of Fighters XIV may not impress you with its visuals, but the accessible-yet-complex mechanics make it a well-executed fighter worth your time.
Author Information: Matt played around 20 hours of The King of Fighters XIV before writing his review. His main team consists of K' (that's "K Dash" to you, pal!), Ralph, and Kyo. AtlusUSA provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: This is the Police Review
Review: This Is the Police is an enjoyable but flawed management sim that gives you a taste of what it's like to be the chief of police.
Author Information: Alex enjoyed his time solving crimes and exposing corruption as police chief Jack Boyd. It took him 20 hours to finish This Is the Police. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Madden NFL 17 Review
Review: A new commentary duo and improvements to on-field maneuvers helps usher in a new and (mostly) improved Madden era, though it‰Ûªs not without its issues.
Author Information: Having reviewed several Madden NFL games, Miguel was eager to see how Madden NFL 17 would stand out from past entries. He spent approximately 20 hours with the Xbox One version while also spot-checking the game on the PS4. As a San Francisco resident, he‰Ûªs keeping expectations low on the 49ers‰Ûª playoff chances. Miguel reviewed Madden NFL 17 using copies

Title: Quadrilateral Cowboy Review
Review: Quadrilateral Cowboy makes you feel like a skilled hacker in a memorable 1980‰Ûªs cyberpunk world.
Author Information: Edmond Tran spent around 6 hours completing Quadrilateral Cowboy, taking time to replay some missions for faster runs. He recommends playing the game with a mechanical keyboard.

Title: Necropolis Review
Review: Roguelike hack-and-slasher Necropolis offers intense combat and a quirky setting, along with repetition, confusion, and permadeath difficulty.
Author Information: Crawling through the polygonal dungeons of Necropolis occupied Brett for about six hours. He reviewed Necropolis with a copy of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: Brigador Review
Review: Brigador is a destructive romp filled with explosions and death, brought to you by some of the coolest robots around.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been a fan of mecha--in both games and anime--for years. He indulged his inner 10-year-old and blew up wave after wave enemy mechs, completing Brigador's campaign and several additional missions for the sake of this review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: I Am Setsuna Review
Review: I Am Setsuna proudly mimics classic Japanese RPGs, but at what cost?
Author Information: Peter grew up playing Japanese RPGs in the '90s, and I Am Setsuna triggered nostalgic feelings for him on a near-constant basis. He completed the game, switching between Wait and Active modes on occasion. By the end of the story, his characters were at level 40 and above. He reviewed I Am Setsuna using a copy of the game provided by Square Enix.

Title: Kerbal Space Program Review
Review: Kerbal Space Program is a monumental, exhilarating, and frustrating gaming achievement worthy of admiration.
Author Information: Justin Clark has put 57 hours into the final release of Kerbal Space Program so far. Countless spacecraft have exploded on his watch, but he's only killed four astronauts. He keeps waiting for the four of them to come back from deep space with The Power Cosmic, but still nothing. Modders, get on that.

Title: The Assembly Review
Review: The Assembly shows signs of promise, but it stumbles in its attempt to craft a compelling story.
Author Information: Mat completed The Assembly in around four hours. He played the game inside and out of virtual reality and saw both endings. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Abzu Review
Review: Abzu is deeply, transcendentally beautiful--not just visually splendid, but emotionally evocative. Without question, it is this year's Journey.
Author Information: Scott spent roughly four hours savoring his time with the admittedly brief Abzu, but he plans on playing through again as soon as possible. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Headlander Review
Review: Headlander's weird world overflows with color, power-ups, and personality.
Author Information: Peter completed Headlander in about nine hours on PlayStation 4, and played two hours of the PC version, with copies of the game provided by the publisher.

Title: God Eater Resurrection Review
Review: A new version of Gods Eater Burst transitions to PlayStation 4 with mixed results.
Author Information: Miguel brought in about 20 hours of prior God Eater and other monster-hunting experience to God Eater Resurrection. He needed about 30 hours to get through the story. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Pokemon Go Review
Review: Nintendo‰Ûªs first major foray beyond its own platforms is an imaginative, socially-driven take on augmented reality gaming and location-based exploration.
Author Information: Miguel brought in about 200 combined hours of Pokemon franchise experience before firing up Pokemon Go. Along with approximately five hours as a beta participant, Miguel put in about 15 hours in the public version of Pokemon Go, where he endured two unanticipated account resets.

Title: Monster Hunter Generations Review
Review: The latest installment in Capcom's popular monster-slaying franchise adds exciting ways to stay alive, but it doesn't solve the series long-standing issues.
Author Information: Justin spent about 60 hours playing Monster Hunter Generations on a New Nintendo 3DS. His primary weapon in 4 Ultimate was the Charge Blade, but for Generations he went with Sword & Shield.

Title: Breached Review
Review: Breached wants to evoke the sci-fi survivalism of The Martian but fails to get off the ground.
Author Information: Don loves existentialist sci-fi and will talk your ear off about the genius of Tarkovsky's Stalker if you let him. Don spent about four and a half hours with the game over three complete playthroughs. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Videoball Review
Review: Simple and stunningly fun multiplayer, both online and off, makes Videoball one of the surprise hits of the year.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile is also very retro, so he enjoyed busting out cool moves against pesky AI, complete strangers, and a certain precocious eight year old who beat him at Minecraft‰Ûªs Battle mode the other day. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Song of the Deep Review
Review: Though its patience-testing puzzles hit a few sour notes, Song of the Deep still delivers a rich, imaginative undersea adventure.
Author Information: Scott explored Song of the Deep's watery world for roughly nine hours, though completionists could spend even more tracking down all its hidden treasures. Publisher GameTrust provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Furi Review
Review: Furi is a beautiful and challenging game that exemplifies what makes boss fights so special.
Author Information: Peter beat Furi twice on the default difficulty before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: 7th Dragon III Code: VFD Review
Review: 7th Dragon III‰Ûªs extensive party customization and pleasing difficulty make for a great portable RPG.
Author Information: Heidi wandered in the world of 7th Dragon III for 50 hours, travelling all across time in the process. She has one burning question, however: why don‰Ûªt male Lucier also have cute kitty ears? GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy for the purpose of this review.

Title: I Get This Call Every Day Review
Review: Repetitive, aggravating, soul-destroying, and an experience everyone on either side of the telephone needs to have.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent an hour navigating the impenetrable abyss of Billy J. Swarth‰Ûªs mind. At which point, he refused to continue until someone paid him $15 an hour. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: The Technomancer Review
Review: The Technomancer is a jack of all RPG trades, master of none.
