Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile walked across Mars numerous times--boosting his electrical staff skills, locating missing people, delivering messages, and stomping on bugs--over the course of 10 hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Ghostbusters Review
Review: Ghostbusters fulfills your worst expectations of licensed games.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile is saddened by the six or so hours of his life he‰Ûªs never getting back after playing this game. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: 7 Days to Die Review
Review: 7 Days to Die is a bad console port of an unfinished game.
Author Information: Joab Gilroy is staying alive. Ah, ah, ah, ah, staying alive. He spent 18 hours playing 7 Days to Die, and only 10% of it was spent loading. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Asemblance Review
Review: Asemblance promises plenty of drama, but can‰Ûªt deliver.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile spent way too many hours walking through the same memories over and over in hopes of finding a point. Sadly, he failed. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Umbrella Corps Review
Review: Umbrella Corps is a sloppy competitive shooter with a score of issues that overshadow its redeeming qualities.
Author Information: Peter spent eight hours with Umbrella Corps. He played a dozen single player missions and got his online profile to level ten. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Division: Underground Expansion Review
Review: With its customizable missions and randomly generated areas, Underground's Operations breathe new life into an ailing game.
Author Information: Scott spent another 20 hours in The Division, exploring New York's infested subways and assembling exotic new gear sets. Ubisoft provided a copy of the game, though GameSpot purchased its own season pass.

Title: Space Run Galaxy Review
Review: Tower defense goes to the stars with Space Run Galaxy, a game that blends tactical thinking, twitch action, and starship trucking.
Author Information: Brett hauled cargo across the galaxy for 10 hours before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dead by Daylight Review
Review: Dead by Daylight can get its hooks in you, but it might not get you to stick.
Author Information: Joab Gilroy's a survivor. He's not gon' give up. He's not gon' stop. He's gon' work harder. For the purposes of this review he played for 20 hours and sacrificed 200+ unlucky souls.

Title: The Solus Project Review
Review: The Solus Project's story and survival mechanics look promising at first, but they ultimately fail to meet expectations.
Author Information: Mat completed The Solus Project in 10 hours. He explored for a bit and even tried out the experimental VR mode, though he got motion sick shortly after he started moving. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Lego Star Wars: The Force Awakens Review
Review: Lego Star Wars: The Force Awakens doesn't take the Lego series to new places, but is still a solid and enjoyable romp for families and Star Wars fans.
Author Information: Randy completed the story and played a few of the unlockable side missions in his roughly eight hours of play with Lego Star Wars: The Force Awakens. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game from Warner Bros. for review.

Title: Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness Review
Review: Star Ocean's return is a bumpy ride, with slick combat and smart upgrade systems bogged down by a watery story and some frustrating technical designs.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea spent more than 30 hours exploring Star Ocean: Integrity and Faithlessness, completing the main quest and numerous side stories. A copy of the game was provided by Square Enix.

Title: Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma Review
Review: Despite a slew of problems, Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma uses complex story techniques in a suspenseful tale about human nature.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy played Zero Escape: Zero Time Dilemma for 12 hours, and could only stand about three characters. Nintendo provided a copy of the game.

Title: Duskers Review
Review: Duskers is a cohesive science fiction simulation which is punishingly difficult, but a pleasure to master.
Author Information: Jason Imms has jumped between countless systems in search of humanity and has found none. You‰Ûªd think this would dampen his spirits, but as it turns out he really enjoys bending drones to his will via a command line interface. Do what you love, and all that. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Dangerous Golf Review
Review: Dangerous Golf is a game for people who yearn for destruction, however shallow.
Author Information: Peter unlocked every location in Dangerous Golf before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game by Three Fields Entertainment.

Title: Tropico 5 Penultimate Edition Review
Review: Tropico 5 is a clever, tongue-in-cheek riff on tiny, dictatorial countries, and its console port is an excellent counterpart to the modern PC classic.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey loves city building games. As tests of organization and logistical management, they're among his favorite time sinks. He spent 23 hours building up his dynasty in Tropico 5 with a copy provided by the developer.

Title: Edge of Nowhere Review
Review: Edge of Nowhere is a thrilling trip to the Antarctic, punctuated by disturbing horrors and hallucinations.
Author Information: Peter played through Edge of Nowhere in one four-hour session. Insomniac Games provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Sherlock Holmes: The Devil's Daughter Review
Review: Sherlock‰Ûªs powers of deduction are as enthralling as ever, but middling action gets in the way.
Author Information: It took Richard around eight hours to sleuth his way through Sherlock‰Ûªs five cases. He especially dislikes the monotonous bar fight in the third case, but admits that having to play dress-up was quite fun.

Title: Hearts of Iron 4 Review
Review: The king of World War II-era grand strategy has returned with more engaging choices and a streamlined interface.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey ran through two campaigns. His first, as England, ended in a swift defeat. His second, with the aid of an extensive nuclear bombing campaign against Germany and the Soviet Union was a resounding success. Along the way he managed to shuffle millions of men and tons of ammunition and supplies around the world to support his war effort. He received a copy of the game from publisher Paradox interactive.

Title: The Way Review
Review: The Way is a thought-provoking tale about life and death, but its lackluster gameplay continually frustrates.
Author Information: It took Alex 10 hours to finish The Way, and though he loved solving the game's opening puzzles, he had a hard time staying engaged towards the end. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Trials of the Blood Dragon Review
Review: Two great flavors that go pretty well together.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through all the main missions of Trials of the Blood Dragon within about 3 hours. He stopped counting his failed runs after about an hour or so. It‰Ûªs for the best.

Title: Mighty No. 9 Review
Review: Mighty No. 9 is occasionally fun and inventive, but it fails to leave a lasting impression.
Author Information: Peter completed Mighty No. 9 and played most of the its challenge stages on PS4. He also tested a few levels on Xbox One. GameSpot was provided with complimentary copies of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Mirror's Edge Catalyst Review
Review: Catalyst's combat stumbles, but the fluid freerunning and enticing open-world challenges overshadow most of its shortcomings.
Author Information: Scott dashed through Catalyst's campaign in roughly 14 hours, but happily explored the copious side content for at least another six. Also, yes, he did play and enjoy the original Mirror's Edge. Publisher EA provided copies of the game for this review.

Title: Odin Sphere Leifthrasir Review
Review: Odin Sphere returns in a beautiful package sure to bring glee to even the most jaded among us.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd will soon be joining Larian Studios to write for Divinity: Original Sin 2, and is also working with Cleaversoft as a designer for the upcoming EarthNight. He was glad to find 40 hours or so to spend with Odin Sphere Leifthrasir. He‰Ûªd love to see Vanillaware‰Ûªs strategy game GrimGrimoire also get the HD treatment, though he isn‰Ûªt holding his breath.

Title: Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE Review
Review: Tokyo Mirage Sessions #FE is a smart, fun collaboration between two franchises that feel like they were always meant to be together.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is deeply familiar with the Shin Megami Tensei and Fire Emblem series. She completed the campaign of Tokyo Mirage Sessions and many of its side quests for this review, with a copy provided by publisher Nintendo.

Title: Excubitor Review
Review: Excubitor is a fun and frantic mix of old school shooting and tower defense gameplay.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile is a fan of old-school scrolling shooters, and is still replaying levels in Excubitor after nearly 20 hours.

Title: Hitman Go VR Review
Review: Hitman Go comes to virtual reality, yet doesn't do enough to justify the new technology.
Author Information: Mat's played the original Hitman GO on iPad in the past, and spent a few hours with Hitman GO VR for the purpose of this review.

Title: Duelyst Review
Review: In a tide of games trying to capitalize on Hearthstone's success, Duelyst still stands out.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins isn't a hardcore competitor, but she's still susceptible to the charms of a well-built strategy game. She spent time with each of Duelyst's factions but employed a custom Abyssian deck for the majority on her online matches.

Title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Blood and Wine Review
Review: The Witcher 3: Blood and Wine concludes Geralt‰Ûªs latest saga with memorable quests, fearsome battles, and surprising wit.
Author Information: Kevin finished Blood and Wine in about 40 hours, finishing the main quest, almost every side quest, fully upgrading his vineyard, and unlocking almost every signpost. He was glad he was so thorough: there was so much to discover in the duchy of Toussaint. Kevin VanOrd is soon off on a new game design adventure: he will be joining the fine team at Larian Studios to work on Divinity: Original Sin 2. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Overwatch Review
Review: Overwatch meshes vastly different ideas and schools of thought into one frantic, exhilarating, layered shooter.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 70 hours playing as every hero in Overwatch, and plans to play many more. His favorite characters are Zarya and McCree. Blizzard provided a copy of Overwatch for review.

Title: Kirby: Planet Robobot Review
Review: Kirby's latest adventure is one of his best yet, packed with variety of charming moments and an impressive attention to detail.
Author Information: Peter finished Planet Robot's story mode, Kirby 3D Rumble, the boss rush arena in the span of 8 hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Party Hard Review
Review: Party Hard takes a disturbing premise and makes it silly.
Author Information: Alex likes to sleep, but he's not going to murder the neighbors for disturbing his peaceful rest. It took him 8 hours to finish Party Hard. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Fallout 4 Far Harbor Review
Review: Far Harbor takes Fallout 4 to the blustering coast of Maine with mixed results.
Author Information: Peter finished Far Harbor's main storyline and dabbled in side quests over the course of 10 hours. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Doom Review
Review: Doom doesn't shy away from the spirit that drove its forebearers to greatness

Title: Alienation Review
Review: Housemarque's Alienation delivers an excellent multiplayer shooter with timeless appeal.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile is still killing aliens in a quest to reach level 30 and unlock hero mode after almost 15 hours of play time.

Title: The Magic Circle: Gold Edition Review
Review: The Magic Circle is a fascinating, satirical look at life beyond the polygon curtain.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through the core game in about two and a half hours, and spent more hours than he‰Ûªs comfortable admitting fiddling around with the endgame.

Title: Tastee: Lethal Tactics Review
Review: Despite some visual impediments and a mediocre interface, Tastee delivers intelligent turn-based combat in a variety of intense scenarios.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy completed Tastee: Lethal Tactics single player missions, and lost a handful of missions to far better players in multiplayer. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for review.

Title: Stellaris Review
Review: Stellaris gives you the stars as your playground, proving that Paradox capably translates some of their strategy game prowess into space.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey spread his people across the stars, eager to uncover long-held mysteries. He spent 30 hours with the game over a week playing with his favorite race: the Molluscoid Reapers. GameSpot was provided with a copy of Stellaris for the purpose of this review.

Title: Soft Body Review
Review: Soft Body is a bizarre, captivating puzzle action game with great visual effects and challenging gameplay.
Author Information: Cassidee applied her knowledge of bullet hell and puzzle games during the handful of hours she spent on Soft Body. Her review copy of the game was provided by the publisher.

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants in Manhattan Review
Review: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutants in Manhatten is both basic and overly complex, delivering almost none of the magic that made previous four-player Turtles games so memorable.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through the campaign in about five hours, with an extra hour or two to find the secret bosses and try four-player co-op. A lifelong fan of the Turtles, especially in video game form, he would like to take this time to remind scientists that they have four more years to get us closer to the future promised in the Neon Night Riders stage from Turtles In Time. Just sayin‰Ûª, humanity. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Shadow of the Beast Review
Review: A reimagining of a cult classic is beset by uninspired level designs and unrefined combat.
Author Information: Miguel beat Shadow of the Beast‰Ûªs seven chapters, and went back to play a few after beating the game. He also spent time exploring the bonus content. He‰Ûªs had prior experience with the series, having played the Genesis version of Shadow of the Beast. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Homefront: The Revolution Review
Review: Despite its ambitious premise, Homefront's efforts to reclaim Philadelphia are sabotaged by technical issues, faulty mechanics, and predictable storytelling.
Author Information: Scott completed the campaign on PS4 in roughly 25 hours before moving on to PC and Xbox One. He spent an additional 10 hours in co-op. Publisher Deep Silver provided copies of the game for this review.

Title: Galak-Z: The Void Review
Review: Galak-Z: The Void maintains The Dimensional's frantic combat, but uses it to lesser effect.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 10 hours chasing high scores in The Void, and competed in several daily challenges. 17-Bit provided a review copy of the expansion.

Title: Battleborn Review
Review: Gearbox Software's first major IP since Borderlands borrows that series' shooting but confuses the proceedings with an overwhelming array of ideas. Can 25 heroes save the day?
Author Information: Scott beat all eight campaign missions, spent time with all 25 heroes, and lost a bunch in all three multiplayer modes, which added up to approximately 30 hours of play time. He reviewed this game using copies provided by publisher 2K.

Title: Chronos Review
Review: Chronos not only delivers highly enjoyable combat opportunities, it also sets the stage for third-person action-adventure games in virtual reality.
Author Information: Mat doesn't know how much time he spent with Chronos because he loses track of time when he's in virtual reality. His character died enough times to see her 65th birthday, and he blames the last 15 deaths on that damned dragon.

Title: Uncharted 4: A Thief's End Review
Review: Uncharted 4: A Thief's End blends its gameplay, characters, and world into a magnificent whole, making it the best game in the series, and a new watermark for storytelling.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy beat Uncharted 4's story mode in 14 hours. He has since played multiplayer, bullet time mode, and turned the cel-shading filter on. Sony provided a copy of the game for review.

Title: Total War: Warhammer Review
Review: The Warhammer universe blends with the tactical gameplay of Total War to create one of the best real-time strategy games ever.
Author Information: Daniel Startkey's been a fan of the Total War series for years. He spent several days going through a full campaign with the Vampire counts and running through a few hours with the other races. He also ran a couple dozen skirmishes including several online multiplayer matches with the developers. He received a copy of the game from Sega for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Walking Dead: Michonne - Episode 3: What We Deserve Review
Review: Telltale‰Ûªs miniseries comes to an emotional end.
Author Information: Justin Clark got through the finale twice, once with a critical character alive, one dead. He‰Ûªs pretty sure he‰Ûªs ready to go back to Clementine, now. For the levity.

Title: Severed Review
Review: Severed's distinct look and touchscreen controls make it more than your average dungeon crawler.
Author Information: Jason D‰ÛªAprile generally avoids severing limbs unless it‰Ûªs really necessary, but he did so countless times during the 12 hours it took him to beat Severed. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Invisible Inc. Console Edition Review
Review: Invisible, Inc. is a wonderful turn-based stealth game that deftly balances simplicity with depth.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd doesn‰Ûªt write about games as much as he used to, now that he makes them instead. But he certainly enjoyed writing about Invisible, Inc. after the 18 hours or so he spent with it. He‰Ûªs currently working with Cleaversoft on EarthNight. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human Review
Review: The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human offers challenging boss battles and serene exploration in a vast, beautiful world.
Author Information: Mat spent nearly six hours under the sea, searching for audio tapes and taking on the bosses of The Aquatic Adventure of the Last Human. He quickly learned that he didn't have to hold his breath just because the game took place underwater.

Title: Offworld Trading Company Review
Review: Offworld Trading Company trades nukes and armies for stocks and commodities--without losing any of the thrill.
Author Information: Dan Starkey spent more than 20 hours playing 30 games and two full campaigns of Offworld Trading Company. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Ashes of the Singularity Review
Review: Ashes of the Singularity is a big and bold 4X strategy game, but if you‰Ûªre looking for much beyond scale, you‰Ûªll be sorely disappointed.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey is still on the search for the perfect RTS. For the purposes of this review he played through the campaign and dipped into some skirmishes before dusting of his old Supreme Commander disc and replaying one of his favorites.

Title: Star Fox Zero Review
Review: The first full-fledged Star Fox game in years mixes classic stylings with unconventional controls. But does it deliver?
Author Information: Peter has been an avid fan of Star Fox fan since the series' debut on Super Nintendo. Using a copy of the game provided by Nintendo, he played through Star Fox Zero's campaign twice before writing his review.

Title: P.O.L.L.E.N Review
Review: Pollen seems to want to say something, but clarity isn‰Ûªt its strong suit.
Author Information: Jason Imms loves a good "walking simulator". Also a good adventure game. He just generally prefers them to have something to say. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for purpose of this review.

Title: The Banner Saga 2 Review
Review: The Banner Saga 2 is a successful adventure whose world-building and tactical combat stands strong, as is enhanced by experience with its predecessor.
Author Information: Edmond Tran imported his save game and took about 12 hours to finish The Banner Saga 2, after which he immediately went back through the original again, making different choices, eager to play it all again.

Title: Stranger of Sword City Review
Review: Stranger of Sword City does much to stand out from the herd, but it might not be for the better.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 34 hours wandering the wastelands with his motley crew. He is still dumbfounded how the blacksmith is able to stay in business with his outrageous pricing model. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Salt and Sanctuary Review
Review: This combat-intensive adventure manages to be more than the sum of its Dark Souls-influenced parts.
Author Information: Miguel beat Salt and Sanctuary and explored much of its optional content over the course of 16 hours. GameSpot was provided a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Baldur's Gate: Siege of Dragonspear Review
Review: Baldur‰Ûªs Gate gets an impressive expansion in Siege of Dragonspear, a new D&D epic that fills some blanks in the original saga after nearly 20 years.
Author Information: Brett visited the Forgotten Realms for around 35 hours en route to dealing with Caelar Argent and her minions.

Title: Dead Star Review
Review: Dead Star takes old-school space shooter action into the multiplayer age.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile has been destroying things in virtual space since the original Star Wars, and spent over 20 hours doing so in Dead Star on PlayStation 4. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Hyper Light Drifter Review
Review: The stunning Hyper Light Drifter is a masterful mix of exploration and combat.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd used to work at GameSpot. Now he just writes sometimes. When he isn‰Ûªt writing, he‰Ûªs making games, and hoping they turn out to be even half as good as Hyper Light Drifter. He‰Ûªs still amazed that people can string 1,000 drifts together. He can barely make it to 200. Kevin is currently working with Cleaversoft as a designer on Earthnight.

Title: Grim Dawn Review
Review: Hack and slash your way through the brilliantly realized horror-fantasy world of Grim Dawn, an instant classic in the action RPG genre.
Author Information: Brett waded through the blood of Grim Dawn for over 40 hours before writing this review, and he‰Ûªs still going back for more.

Title: Hitman Episode Two Review
Review: The second episode of Hitman takes place in a picturesque seaside destination, offering a very different atmosphere than the previous episode. But does it make for a better experience?
Author Information: Peter ran through Sapienza's main mission twice, and played through the two available escalation missions before writing his review. GameSpot was provided with a copy of the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Enter the Gungeon Review
Review: Enter the Gungeon is a challenging roguelike with awesome ideas that often contradict one another.
Author Information: Cassidee is a fan of roguelikes, especially ones with unique hooks like Rogue Legacy and Heavy Bullets. She spent about twelve hours raiding the Gungeon with a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: The Walking Dead: Michonne - Episode 2: Give No Shelter Review
Review: Michonne‰Ûªs second solo outing finally gets down to business.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through Give No Shelter twice, and to the sleeping cat and downstairs neighbors he startled at the line ‰ÛÏPeek-a-boo‰Û, he is dreadfully sorry.

Title: Ratchet & Clank Review
Review: Ratchet & Clank is a veritable power fantasy fueled by rockets and carried by specialty gadgets.
Author Information: Cassidee is a longtime Ratchet & Clank fan and completed a full play through in about eight hours. This review was conducted using a copy provided by the publisher.

Title: MLB The Show 16 Review
Review: Another year of subtle improvements and gameplay additions make MLB The Show 16 a must-buy for baseball fans.
Author Information: MLB The Show 16 rings in the start of a new season of baseball, and another week of Brett digging his cleats into virtual dirt. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Bravely Second: End Layer Review
Review: Despite a cloying story and poor dialogue, Bravely Second is a sweeping adventure.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 65 hours in Luxendarc, and continued grinding for the Yokai Job in the after hours. GameSpot was provided a review copy of End Layer by Square Enix.

Title: Lucky's Tale Review
Review: Oculus Rift enhances the familiar platforming in Lucky's Tale, but the VR adventure fails to leave a lasting impression.
Author Information: Peter is well-versed in 3D platformers, and the two hours it took him to beat Lucky's tale felt like a walk down memory lane. Oculus provided GameSpot with access to Lucky's Tale for the purpose of this review.

Title: Into the Stars Review
Review: Into the Stars delivers intense Roguelite space strategy, but reveals all of its cards too soon.
Author Information: Don Saas is a a sucker for Roguelikes and space strategy games. Into the Stars made him want to immediately rewatch Battlestar Galactica. He spent just over 10 hours with the game for this review.

Title: Trackmania Turbo Review
Review: Trackmania Turbo delivers thrills online and off thanks to high speed, crazy tracks, and a unique time trial focus.
Author Information: Jason D'Aprile has enjoyed beating his track times in this series for years, but is happy to finally go full Turbo on the big screen. Ubisoft provided GameSpot with access to the game for the purposes of this review.

Title: Dark Souls 3 Review
Review: Dark Souls 3 is a harrowing trek through a dark and gorgeous world, and despite a few missteps, is well worth the challenge.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy completed his first Dark Souls III playthrough in 23 hours. He spent another 20 hours on subsequent playthroughs and secret areas. He plans on making a Deprived run soon. Bandai Namco provided a copy of Dark Souls III for review.

Title: Quantum Break Review
Review: Quantum Break looks slick, but bouts of ineffective gameplay and its mixed-media construction make this a hit-and-miss experience.
Author Information: Peter finished Quantum Break and went back to change his decisions in a few spots to measure the impact--and as an excuse to jump back into combat. Microsoft provided GameSpot with a copy of Quantum Break for the purpose of this review.

Title: Slain Review
Review: Slain is a gorgeous spectacle that‰Ûªs a total drag to play.
Author Information: Alex Gilyadov enjoys a good 2D action-platformer. It took him 10 hours to finish Slain! GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for purpose of this review.

Title: Black Desert Online Review
Review: Much of Black Desert Online is a convoluted mess, but few games let you create a virtual life this absorbing.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is no stranger to massively multiplayer games, having played more than he can count--and having worked on one, too. He played about 80 hours of Black Desert Online, and promises they weren‰Ûªt all spent fishing. When he isn‰Ûªt busy making more games, he writes about them here and there. His favorite MMOG of all time is Anarchy Online. There will probably never be an Anarchy Online 2, but he can always hope. Kevin is currently work with Cleaversoft as a designer on Earthnight.

Title: Dirt Rally Review
Review: Dirt Rally‰Ûªs arrival on consoles lets more people join in Codemasters‰Ûª celebration of this brutal motorsport.
Author Information: Richard has spent almost a year playing the different iterations of Dirt Rally. He noticed no discernible differences between the PC and PlayStation 4 versions.

Title: EA Sports UFC 2 Review
Review: Hard-hitting and visually arresting, EA Sports UFC 2 refines its brutal action while still retaining some notable flaws.
Author Information: Richard played UFC 2 on Xbox One for more than 15 hours. He found it a little weird playing as CM Punk.

Title: Hyrule Warriors Legends Review
Review: Squeezed into a 3DS, do the thousands-strong battles hold up in handheld form?
Author Information: Ian played Hyrule Warriors on trains throughout London for about 14-16 hours. You may have seen him swearing at his 3DS on the Overground.

Title: Cities: Skylines Snowfall Review
Review: A winter wonderland comes to Cities: Skylines in the Snowfall DLC, a pleasing if pricey expansion featuring snow plows and hockey rinks.
Author Information: Brett put on his virtual mayor‰Ûªs sash for another eight hours and waded into the icy tundra of Cities: Skylines Snowfall. He received a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Republique Review
Review: Republique comes to PS4 as a complete package, and the game is all the better for it.
Author Information: Justin Clark completed Republique Remastered in 10 hours on PlayStation 4. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Galactic Civilizations III: Mercenaries Review
Review: Mercenaries is a disappointing expansion to last year's Galactic Civilizations III that limits your freedom on the battlefield.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey loves playing with pretend space-orcs and faceless aliens in 4X strategy games, and he spent 20 hours tinkering with the new content in Mercenaries. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the expansion for this review.

Title: Moon Hunters Review
Review: Moon Hunters has a good story to tell, but grinds it to dust in the process.
Author Information: Moon Hunters has a good story to tell, but grinds it to dust in the process.

Title: Adr1ft Review
Review: Adr1ft is a gorgeous game with a moving personal story, but its systems clash against one another, creating tedium and boredom throughout.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy finished Adr1ft in six hours, with an additional two on Oculus VR. GameSpot was provided review code for Adr1ft from 505 Games.

Title: Samorost 3 Review
Review: The studio behind imaginative indie hits Machinarium and Botanicula debuts its most ambitious game yet: a beautiful yet simplistic point-and-click adventure.
Author Information: Scott took his time with Samorost 3 and still completed the game--including the majority of its side puzzles--in roughly six hours. He received a complimentary Steam code for this review.

Title: Tom Clancy's The Division Review
Review: Despite oddly overpowered enemies and repetitive level grinding, The Division succeeds thanks to its rich world, strong campaign, and impressive online functionality.
Author Information: Scott spent more than 50 hours pretending to be Snake Plissken in The Division this week, and he's since gone back for more. His copy of the game was furnished by publisher Ubisoft.

Title: Shardlight Review
Review: Shardlight is a solid old-school adventure game with an overly familiar premise.
Author Information: Alex Gilyadov has been playing adventure games since the tender age of five. It took him roughly eight hours to finish Shardlight. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Casey Powell Lacrosse 16 Review
Review: In trying to capture the essence of a precise sport, Casey Powell Lacrosse instead results in a tedious grind against poor AI and frustrating controls.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy played real lacrosse for eight years, and Casey Powell Lacrosse 16 for 12 hours. A copy of the game was provided by Big Ant Studios.

Title: Pokken Tournament Review
Review: Bandai Namco has crafted a fighting game that is deep and rewarding, while also being accessible.
Author Information: Tamoor‰Ûªs Pokken character of choice is Gengar. It has been crowned champion of the Ferrum League and put Mewtwo in his place multiple times. Respect it.

Title: Dariusburst: Chronicle Saviours Review
Review: If it‰Ûªs high-quality arcade-style action you want, Dariusburst Chronicle Saviours has you covered.
Author Information: Heidi has put over 50 hours into Dariusburst: Chronicle Saviours across PC, PS4, and Vita, with plenty of challenges left to tackle.

Title: Fortified Review
Review: Fortified has an impressive pulp sci-fi pedigree and speedy co-op play, but the blending of shoot-em-up and tower defense gameplay stumbles.
Author Information: Brett spent about seven hours saving 1950s America from martian invaders, and is waiting patiently for his ticker-tape parade. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of Fortified for this review.

Title: The Legend of Zelda: Twilight Princess HD Review
Review: Nintendo‰Ûªs dark open-world epic dazzled fans when first released in 2006, but can this Wii U remaster do the same?
Author Information: Rob played Twilight Princess in normal mode for about 40 hours, mixing between GamePad and Pro Controller. He played hero mode briefly, but wasn‰Ûªt able to play the new Amiibo dungeon.

Title: Far Cry Primal Review
Review: Far Cry's new world and renewed focus on survival create a tense experience true to its setting, with higher detail on PC.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent about 30 hours riding mammoths, burning villages, and crafting spears in Far Cry Primal on PS4, Xbox One, and PC. Both console copies were provided by Ubisoft.

Title: Devil Daggers Review
Review: Devil Daggers compresses the shooter experience into a focused microcosm, stretching seconds into their own hectic chapters.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy played Devil Daggers for four hours before breaking 120 seconds. He plans on playing more.

Title: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition Review
Review: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition still plays well from a design perspective, but numerous technical issues hold the PC version back.
Author Information: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition made Mike want to play the next two games in the Gears of War trilogy.

Title: Project X Zone 2 Review
Review: Project X Zone 2 embraces its extensive cast of characters, but it often falls into exhaustion due to its nonsensical plot and overreliance on its combat system.
Author Information: Matt spent about 64 hours playing Project X Zone 2. His favorite Pair Unit to use was Strider Hiryu and Hotsuma, a ninja dream team that would've made his 4th grade self's mind explode.

Title: Klaus Review
Review: Klaus is an unusual, post-modern platformer that reflects on what it means to be alive.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's first game was Super Mario World. Since then he's loved taking occasional breaks from mind-melting strategy games to test his dexterity with platformers. GameSpot was provided a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Heavy Rain Review
Review: David Cage‰Ûªs breakout title gets prettier, but not smarter.
Author Information: This is Justin Clark‰Ûªs third playthrough of Heavy Rain, after two on PS3. Altogether, he has pressed X to Jason about 113 times, give or take. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: Russia Review
Review: Assassin's Creed Chronicles comes to a dull end in Russia.
Author Information: Justin Clark finished AC Chronicles: Russia in about 6 hours. Ubisoft provided a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Hitman Episode One Review
Review: The first episode of Hitman has a lot to offer creative assassins, but enjoying it requires you to look past an array of inconsistencies.
Author Information: Peter completed each mission multiple times, played a few custom contracts that other users submitted online, and did his best to push the limits of Hitman's stealth engine over the course of 10 hours. Square Enix provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of Hitman for this review.

Title: Street Fighter 5 Review
Review: Street Fighter 5 is missing essential elements, but its fighting engine is one of the best around.
Author Information: Peter has played Street Fighter daily for the past two weeks. Most of his time was spent playing the PS4 version of the game, but he also spent a few hours playing the PC version. Capcom provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright Review
Review: Fire Emblem Fates: Birthright polishes the series' time-tested strategy combat and adds intimate, exciting interpersonal relationships.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea completed the main campaign of Birthright on both Casual and Classic modes, and spent many long hours breeding her army of child super soldiers.

Title: The Walking Dead: Michonne - Episode 1: In Too Deep Review
Review: One of The Walking Dead‰Ûªs most mysterious characters has a story to tell, though it‰Ûªs similar to one we‰Ûªve heard before.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through In Too Deep twice--once on PC, once on Xbox One--with varying levels of surliness in his choices. Never forget, kids: Blades don‰Ûªt need reloading. Telltale Games provided GameSpot with a copy of the game for this review.

Title: Fire Emblem Fates: Revelation Review
Review: Fire Emblem Fates' neutral path delivers the biggest payoff of its three storylines, and is an incredible accomplishment in marriage of storytelling and gameplay.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea made it halfway through Revelation on Classic mode before switching to Casual to complete it. She got teary a few times. Nintendo provided GameSpot with copies of the game for this review.

Title: Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest Review
Review: Fire Emblem Fates: Conquest is a punishing strategy RPG that marches forward and never looks back.
Author Information: Peter Brown completed most of his journey through Conquest on Classic mode, before dropping down to Casual when the body count climbed and he realized he wanted more time with his steamy love interest, Niles. Nintendo provided GameSpot with copies of the game for this review.

Title: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 Review
Review: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 4 is a great-looking, fast-paced anime fighting game that remains true to its roots for better and for worse.
Author Information: Heidi went through all of story and adventure mode, and spent far too much time playing ninja dress-up for free battles. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of the game for this review.

Title: Layers of Fear Review
Review: Colouring your world with intense shades of terror.
Author Information: Matt took four hours to play through Layers of Fear in the dark, on a midrange laptop with decent headphones. The latter are for sale to raise money toward new trousers.

Title: Superhot Review
Review: Superhot is a clever blend of shooter and puzzle elements that's driven by a devious, dark narrative.
Author Information: Before writing his review, Peter spent the better part of a day completing every story level and a handful of challenge levels. GameSpot was provided with a complimentary copy of Superhot for this review.

Title: Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare 2 Review
Review: A more complete, more refined version of the already stellar original, though arduous progression and empty solo missions spoil some of the fun.
Author Information: Scott spent 18 hours gardening on Xbox One and PS4. Both copies were provided by publisher EA. He also participated in online multiplayer events organized by EA but hosted on the game's public servers.

Title: Pillars of Eternity: The White March Part 2 Review
Review: The White March Part II wraps up the Pillars of Eternity saga with heavy combat and a one-note mythological quest.
Author Information: Brett spent around 12 hours trudging through the snowy wastes of the White March.

Title: Arslan: The Warrior of Legend Review
Review: Omega Force‰Ûªs latest Warriors anime spin-off adapts an unlikely show that proves to be a surprisingly suitable fit.
Author Information: Miguel beat Arslan's campaign and spent three hours on the other modes. He approached Arslan: The Warriors of Legend as a fan of the anime.

Title: Blade & Soul Review
Review: Blade & Soul's phenomenal combat isn't enough to make up for its dated quests.
Author Information: Leif Johnson writes about video games on a remote ranch near the Texas coast. For the purposes of this review, he played Blade & Soul for around 60 hours.

Title: Hard West Review
Review: Hard West is a satisfyingly creepy mash-up of six-gun horror and tactical combat.
Author Information: Brett looked all over the place for Jonah Hex, but didn‰Ûªt find him in the 20 or so hours he spent out on the frightening frontier of Hard West.

Title: The Deadly Tower of Monsters Review
Review: The Deadly Tower of Monsters contains countless odes to the golden age of sci-fi B-movies, but its gameplay is rote to the core.
Author Information: Don loves a good cheesy sci-fi movie as much as the next person. You can catch him quoting Galaxy Quest at inopportune moments. He spent five hours on The Deadly Tower of Monsters' campaign

Title: The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare Review
Review: Great level design can't save this boring multiplayer shooter.
Author Information: Mat likes online multiplayer shooters, and he put The Mean Greens - Plastic Warfare to the test for 12 hours. He's now worried he's being followed by sinister tan army men he can't see because they're blending in with the environment.

Title: Dying Light: The Following Review
Review: Dying Light's latest DLC supplements the full game's first-person parkour with customizable dirt buggies, drastically different environments, and a conspiracy-driven mystery.
Author Information: Scott sunk 12 hours into The Following but can't wait to go back and race his friends through fields of the undead. Turns out zombies and racing actually work well together.

Title: Lego Marvel's Avengers Review
Review: Lego Marvel's Avengers is a familiar ride through some well-worn Lego territory, but it's a charming and fun one nonetheless.
Author Information: Randolph played through the entire main campaign, several side missions, and spent a few hours in the open world of New York to try and unlock as many characters as he could. Finding Squirrel Girl made him very, very happy.

Title: Devilian Review
Review: Devilian doesn't ask for much, and delivers just enough to pass the time.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins has tried out dozens of free-to-play MMOs over the years, and in spite of a few bad apples she's managed to retain the will to try just about anything at least once. She put two weeks into Devilian for the purposes of this review, reaching the current level cap and exploring the cash shop with one character while testing the limits of a cash-free Devilian experience with another. Trion Worlds provided GameSpot with a copy of the game and access to patron-specific items.

Title: The Witness Review
Review: In both structure and detail, The Witness is an original, difficult, and ultimately rewarding puzzle game.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent more than 30 hours trying to complete as many of The Witness' panels as he could. Many of them were too hard.

Title: Firewatch Review
Review: Though its plot doesn't fully pay off, Firewatch gives you a thorough, thoughtful insight into the formation of a meaningful relationship.
Author Information: Scott savored his first Firewatch play-through, completing the game in just over seven hours. He's since burned through again in just under five.

Title: SteamWorld Heist Review
Review: Tense combat, complex mechanics, and witty dialogue make this 2D turn-based strategy game an unexpected but worthwhile successor to 2013's SteamWorld Dig.
Author Information: Matt spent 15 hours playing SteamWorld Heist during his first time through. and now he's more than willing to put in more hours to max out the level of his in-game crew.

Title: Minecraft Story Mode--Episode 4: A Block and a Hard Place Review
Review: Despite some emotional beats not hitting as hard as they should, Episode 4 of Minecraft Story Mode feels like a satisfying ending (even though there's more to come).
Author Information: Randolph Ramsay played through this latest Minecraft episode twice. The next playthrough will be with his six-year-old son.

Title: Unravel Review
Review: Achingly beautiful, often inspired, but does it play as wonderful as it looks?
Author Information: Rob played the first two levels of Unravel at a review event hosted by EA and the remainder at home on his PS4. Altogether he spent more than eight hours playing.

Title: Final Fantasy Explorers Review
Review: Final Fantasy Explorers is a mashup of fanservice and Monster Hunter-like quests packed with deep character customization and genuinely fun multiplayer.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea spent entirely too much time with Final Fantasy Explorers already, and wrote her review after cresting level 80 (Pablo the Chocobo was level 61).

Title: Darkest Dungeon Review
Review: A richly satisfying and wonderfully executed masterpiece.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey loves roguelikes and eldritch horror. He lost 49 adventurers over the course of 29 hours in Darkest Dungeon.

Title: King's Quest Chapter 2: Rubble Without a Cause Review
Review: The revived King‰Ûªs Quest takes a step back in Rubble Without a Cause, the oddly depressing second chapter in this modern take on the legendary Sierra adventures from the 1980s.
Author Information: Brett spent nearly four hours trying to feed King Graham and his fairy tale pals in Daventry.

Title: Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak Review
Review: Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak is a prequel to the famed Homeworld Strategy series. It follows its inspirations closely, but adds its own touches to create something new and wonderful.
Author Information: Daniel spent 10 hours playing Homeworld: Deserts of Kharak's campaign, and another 15 hours in multiplayer and skirmish matches.

Title: Gravity Rush Remastered Review
Review: Gravity Rush's acrobatic heroine and fairytale metropolis feel at home in the PS4 remaster of the 2012 Vita hit.
Author Information: Peter played through Gravity Rush's story missions, deviated to explore the world and side quests, and played around for the joy of manipulating gravity, in twelve hours. Sony Computer Entertainment provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: This War of Mine: The Little Ones Review
Review: The war comes to consoles, but might have lost something along the way.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through three scenarios of This War of Mine. He‰Ûªs still yet to get a group to survive a full run. He‰Ûªs already resigned to probably being the person other survivors kill and eat first when the real collapse comes.

Title: Bombshell Review
Review: Bombshell is a disastrous mix of monotonous gameplay, annoying bugs, and atrocious writing.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd used to be Senior Editor at GameSpot before he embarked on a video game design career. Now he‰Ûªs between projects, so expect to see his byline from time to time. Kevin played 12 hours of Bombshell before a game-ending bug stopped him in his tracks.

Title: Dirt Rally Review
Review: The Dark Souls of driving games. Dirt Rally celebrates the unbridled purity of this brutal motorsport.
Author Information: Richard spent over 18 hours in the muddy tundra of Dirt Rally. He‰Ûªs now marginally above average in some of the cars.

Title: Tharsis Review
Review: Tharsis is a captivating but sadistic game of chance that puts your fate at the mercy of dice.
Author Information: So far, Edmond Tran has played over 10 hours of Tharsis and only made it to Mars a couple of times. He loves space and hates gambling.

Title: Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam Review
Review: Worlds collide in this risk-averse Mario RPG.
Author Information: Miguel needed 32 hours to play through and clear Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam. He has also beaten two other Mario & Luigi games as well as two Paper Mario games.

Title: Rainbow Six Siege Review
Review: With its destructible environments, diverse Operators, and distinctive attackers-vs-defenders setup, Ubisoft's multiplayer-focused shooter offers something rare among modern FPS games: tactical depth.
Author Information: Scott spent nearly 18 hours Sieging on PS4, though he also tested the PC and Xbox versions with the help of several GameSpot colleagues. They can all confirm that Siege is better with friends.

Title: Beyond: Two Souls Review
Review: David Cage‰Ûªs best ‰ÛÏinteractive drama‰Û experiment to date comes to PS4 in better shape than ever.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through the new version of Beyond to completion, which would be his third go-around with the game altogether. For all his efforts, he could not find a way to slip the phrase ‰ÛÏPress X to Jodie‰Û into this review. And for this, he is sorry.

Title: Amplitude Review
Review: The rhythm game that put Harmonix on the map returns with spot-on mechanics and a brand new setlist that can't quite compete with the original.
Author Information: Scott Butterworth spent a solid 12 hours cruising down Amplitude's trippy highways. He also roped in some coworkers for couch-based competitive multiplayer.

Title: Fat Princess Adventures Review
Review: Fat Princess Adventures' charm and humor fail to elevate it above its mediocre premise.
Author Information: Mat played Fat Princess Adventures to completion and played a few rounds of the Grindhouse mode. He was going to put way more food puns in this review, but he didn't want to sound too cheesy.

Title: Assassin‰Ûªs Creed Chronicles: India Review
Review: The middle chapter of the Chronicles trilogy improves the formula, but doesn‰Ûªt perfect it.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to slip in and out of AC Chronicles: India in about five and a half hours, compared to three and a half or so for China. Far too much of that time was spent remembering the Monty Python "How To Not Be Seen" skit at the worst possible moment, snickering, and Arbaaz catching a face full of lead as a result.

Title: Oxenfree Review
Review: Masterful audiovisual design and a witty script set Oxenfree's tale of angsty teens battling the supernatural apart from other horror games.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is a sucker for ghost hunts and replayed Oxenfree five times to explore possible choices and endings.

Title: Resident Evil 0: HD Remaster Review
Review: Resident Evil Zero HD makes an already good survival-horror game better with upgraded visuals, modern controls, and an exciting new way to play.
Author Information: Peter beat Resident Evil 0: HD Remaster on normal difficulty and played Wesker mode for two hours before writing his review. Capcom provided GameSpot with a complimentary copy of the game.

Title: That Dragon Cancer Review
Review: Heartbreaking, painful, and important.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to finish That Dragon Cancer in about two hours. He WAS going to make pancakes for breakfast the next morning. Those plans have changed.

Title: Anno 2205 Review
Review: Anno 2205 wears a distant future sci-fi aesthetic, but does nothing of substance or import with the premise.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey's been a fan of city-builders since he picked up a copy of SimCity 3000 at the ripe age of 10. Since then he's wanted to recapture the magic he first felt when he broke ground on his first fusion reactor.

Title: Star Wars Battlefront Review
Review: Star Wars Battlefront brings grand spectacle to the iconic sci-fi universe, but the overall experience wears thin with time.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 10 hours with Battlefront at a review event on PS4, and 15 hours more with a retail Xbox One copy that he played online through EA Access. He plans on testing the PS4 retail servers following launch.

Title: Bloodborne: The Old Hunters Review
Review: The presumptive first and last expansion to one of the best games of 2015 is worth every death, every item discovery, and every visceral attack.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs prior work on Bloodborne walkthrough for Gamespot gave him more than enough preparation for The Old Hunters. What resulted was an eight-hour playthrough through all of this expansion‰Ûªs locales and an additional hour using the new gear in the main game.

Title: Mario Tennis: Ultra Smash Review
Review: After more than a decade of handheld titles and digital re-releases, Mario Tennis finally returns to consoles with Mega Mushrooms, online multiplayer, and a disappointing lack of content.
Author Information: Scott once broke a Nintendo 64 controller while playing Mario Tennis. It was not his controller. Thankfully, all controllers survived his 16 hours with Ultra Smash.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode Six ‰ÛÓ The Ice Dragon Review
Review: Game of Thrones' finale includes surprising twists, gut-wrenching decisions, and myriad branching paths, encouraging you to return to Westeros one more time.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played through The Ice Dragon four times, twice using each different world state from the end of the previous episode. In total she spent around 8 hours with this episode making various choices.

Title: Yakuza 5 Review
Review: One of the last exclusives on the PlayStation 3 tops off the console‰Ûªs software library on a high note with brawling gangsters and idol singers.
Author Information: Miguel played Yakuza 5 for 45 hours before writing his review. He beat the main storylines, almost all the optional content, and achieved some degree of success in all the minigames. While not fluent in Japanese, Miguel imported and beat the original Yakuza (Ryu Ga Gotoku) long before its U.S. localisation was official, and has beat every other game in the series, including Dead souls. Sega provided a Miguel with an advanced copy of the game for his review.

Title: Skyshine's Bedlam Review
Review: Shallow strategy and the lack of meaningful progression overshadow moments of amusement in this post-apocalyptic roguelike.
Author Information: Mat is a big fan of Mad Max and thinks puking lizards are pretty hilarious. He played 15 hours of Skyshine‰Ûªs Bedlam for this review.

Title: Xenoblade Chronicles X Review
Review: Xenoblade Chronicles X is an ambitious game that succeeds on many fronts, but tapping into its greatness requires patience and perseverance.
Author Information: Peter spent 65 hours in Xenoblade Chronicles X and still longs to uncover all of its secrets, but more importantly, all of its Skells. Nintendo provided a copy of the game for the purpose of this review.

Title: Minecraft: Story Mode Episode Three--The Last Place You Look Review
Review: The best episode in Minecraft Story Mode so far will make your fears about creepy Endermen flare up all over again.
Author Information: Randolph played through Episode Three on both the Xbox One and PC. One playthrough was with his six-year-old son.

Title: The Crew: Wild Run Edition Review
Review: The Wild Run expansion improves Ubisoft's lackluster "carPG" The Crew in a number of ways but can't quite redeem the entire experience.
Author Information: Scott spent roughly 14 hours getting reacquainted with The Crew and its giant, unwieldy world map. He wishes he could have spent all that time in the monster truck arena.

Title: Starcraft 2: Legacy of the Void Review
Review: Starcraft II: Legacy of the Void is an excellent follow-up to 2013's Heart of The Swarm, even if it doesn't quite match the brilliance of Wings of Liberty.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey's been a rabid Starcraft fan since one fateful LAN party back in 2000. He traded an old audio card for a copy of the game and its expansion, and has since purchased the game five more times just to satisfy cravings. He spent 50 hours over a week running through the campaign, training against AI, and then breaking into ranked matches for the purposes of this review.

Title: Just Cause 3 Review
Review: Just Cause 3 is a stunning display of cause and effect, despite weak story missions and occasional technical problems.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 30 total hours with Just Cause 3 across every platform. He blew up a lot of stuff.

Title: Sword Coast Legends Review
Review: Sword Coast Legends promised a true multiplayer RPG. If it doesn‰Ûªt live up to that, does it still have something to offer?
Author Information: Dan Griliopoulos has been playing Dungeons & Dragons video games since he was machine spirit-high to a modron. He played Sword Coast Legends over the course of a week.

Title: Yo-Kai Watch Review
Review: Yo-Kai Watch is a quirky tale with deeply strategic combat, but the way you collect its creatures leaves too much up to random chance.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea was once a part-time paranormal investigator for extra cash. She completed Yo-Kai Watch's main story and most of its side quests, clocking in around 35 hours with the game.

Title: Downwell Review
Review: Challenging, accessible and engaging. Downwell is a focused action-platformer done well.
Author Information: Edmond Tran has spent over seven hours with Downwell on PC, and countless more on iOS. He recommends you play Downwell with a DualShock 4 and vertical monitor setup.

Title: Fallout 4 Review
Review: Fallout 4 rewards your curiosity with excellent storytelling and hearty doses of tense combat in a wasteland full of possibilities.
Author Information: Peter completed the main storyline and dozens of side quests with over 40 hours under his belt. He played the game primarily on PlayStation 4, but also spent a couple of hours testing the Xbox One and PC versions of the game. Bethesda provided GameSpot with a promotional copy of the game for all three platforms.

Title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 3 Review
Review: Black Ops III presents fine-tuned multiplayer, engaging fights against the undead, and a boring campaign.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy still remembers how good the first Black Ops was. He hopes someone can bottle that lightning again.

Title: Read Only Memories Review
Review: Read Only Memories is an eye-catching, cyberpunk-themed adventure that cleverly presents and explores important societal issues.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey spent 10 hours digging through the mysterious disappearance of a legendary computer programmer with the help of a delightful, snarky robot.

Title: Warhammer: End Times -- Vermintide Review
Review: Left 4 Dead's frantic four-player co-op gets medieval with melee combat, mutant rats, and mixed results.
Author Information: Scott was lucky enough to stumble across several helpful strangers while battling through 15 hours of Vermintide--and that means a lot in a team-based game.

Title: WWE 2K16 Review
Review: Devoid of the character and personality that makes wrestling fun, WWE 2K16 continues to fail to deliver the spectacle of pro wrestling while further muddling the game's core mechanical experience.
Author Information: Don Saas wants nothing more than a wrestling game that feels as exciting as the Sasha Banks/Bayley Iron Woman match at NXT: Takeover, but WWE 2K16 is far from that mark. He spent over 22 hours with the game for review.

Title: Life is Strange Episode Five Review
Review: The finale of Life is Strange undermines its powerful, heartfelt story and cracks its tense atmosphere with tedious gamey sequences and a disappointing climax.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea rewound until she couldn't rewind anymore, exploring all possible outcomes for Life is Strange.

Title: Mushroom 11 Review
Review: This inventive and arresting puzzle game depicts the ruins of a world far beyond armageddon.
Author Information: Rob played Mushroom 11 for about ten hours on both a home PC and Macbook Pro. The save file doesn't transfer over -_-

Title: The Legend of Zelda: Tri Force Heroes Review
Review: The newest installment in the storied franchise tries a lot of new things, but accomplishes only a few.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy has played every Zelda game, and cares about the chronological order of the series.

Title: Football Manager 2016 Review
Review: Football Manager 2016 enjoys a few smart incremental updates, as well as a new take on Classic Mode that trims some of the series' more laborious features.
Author Information: Tom has spent thousands of hours playing a dozen different iterations of Football Manager over the course of fifteen years, including the ones where matches were just text.

Title: The Legend of Legacy Review
Review: The Legend of Legacy offers a role-playing campaign without the training wheels.
Author Information: If you count all of the progress he lost to horrible deaths along the way, Jason Venter spent most of 50 hours exploring the hostile island of Avalon. For the purposes of this review, he cleared the game with Garnet and friends and then started through it a second time with Eloise.

Title: Assassin's Creed Syndicate Review
Review: Syndicate is a return to form for the Assassin's Creed franchise, delivering a unique, engaging story in a world that feels alive.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has made it a point to never miss an Assassin's Creed game. She finished the main campaign of Syndicate along with enough side operations to net 75 percent synchronization for this review.

Title: Armikrog Review
Review: Armikrog is a lackluster adventure that never manages to capitalize on the charm of its unique visuals and premise.
Author Information: Matt Espineli loves point-and-click adventures and enjoyed playing with Play-Doh as a child. He always found The Neverhood charming and was hoping to feel the same about Armikrog.

Title: Halo 5: Guardians Review
Review: 343 Industries introduces a new multiplayer mode to great effect, but its campaign story holds the overall experience back.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy's favorite Halo is Halo 2. His favorite mission is Truth and Reconciliation from Combat Evolved. His favorite weapon is the Covenant Carbine.

Title: Guitar Hero Live Review
Review: Embarrassing acting, questionable songs choices, and unwelcome microtransactions spoil the biggest mechanical improvement to music gaming in years.
Author Information: Scott endured some music he truly hates during his many, many hours in Guitar Hero Live. But he also got to play some classic Weezer, so it's cool.

Title: Tales of Zestiria Review
Review: The first Tales game on the PlayStation 4 hits the series‰Ûª familiar notes while proving that it‰Ûªs better to be raised by angels than by wolves.
Author Information: It took Miguel 65 hours to beat Tales of Zestiria which included time spent with the game‰Ûªs optional content. He beat six Tales games prior to this review. If you described a Tales plot in one sentence, he might be able to tell you the name of that Tales games.

Title: NBA Live 16 Review
Review: NBA Live 16 takes incremental steps forward in ball control and online functionality, but its underdeveloped modes and inconsistent mechanics make it a chore to play.
Author Information: For the purposes of this review, Josiah Renaudin played through two seasons of Rising Star, won a championship as a GM in Dynasty, and built an all-star team in Ultimate Team.

Title: Need For Speed Review
Review: Need For Speed borrows from the series' past to create an excellent street racer with a handful of obnoxious but ultimately forgivable problems.
Author Information: Scott Butterworth needs lots of things. Speed is one of them. But he also needed around 25 hours to fully upgrade his Lamborghini Aventador.

Title: The Park Review
Review: The Park is filled with very creepy moments but relies too much on a story which suffers from disjointed pacing.
Author Information: A seasoned horror game veteran, Zorine finished The Park twice for this review. Her first playthrough took two hours and she was thrilled each time she found a reference to The Secret World.

Title: Minecraft: Story Mode Episode Two -- Assembly Required Review
Review: Episode Two is a fast-paced affair that once again proves to be a charming, winning adventure for both fans and newbies to the world of Minecraft.
Author Information: Randolph completed Episode Two twice to see both the Magnus and Ellegaard stories.

Title: Sid Meier's Civilization: Beyond Earth - Rising Tide Review
Review: Firaxis introduces naval colonization and an expansive new diplomacy system to the futuristic 4X game.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent 24 hours with Rising Tide, and still hates siege worms.

Title: Prison Architect Review
Review: Tonally uneven, yet still one of the more fascinating game experiences ever made.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 12 hours with Prison Architect. He has not been able to get System of a Down‰Ûªs Prison Song out of his head all 12 of those hours.

Title: Animal Crossing: Happy Home Designer Review
Review: Despite revamped controls and a cheerful aesthetic, Happy Home Designer still feels like a dead-end job.
Author Information: Justin spent over 20 hours in Happy Home Designer, and he's a little embarrassed to admit he has spent over 400 hours in its predecessor Animal Crossing: New Leaf.

Title: Grand Ages: Medieval Review
Review: Grand Ages: Medieval encourages you to conquer by controlling trade routes and strong-arming the economy instead resorting to military force.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey has conquered Europe a thousand times in a thousand ways. For the purposes of this review, he spent 65 hours fiddling with trade routes and hoarding gold.

Title: Chibi-Robo Zip Lash Review
Review: Chibi-Robo Zip Lash has charming moments, but it's a mostly-bland adventure defined by disappointing design choices.
Author Information: Peter traveled the globe with Chibi-Robo in about ten hours, doing his best to delivery candy to sugar-crazed characters.

Title: Fatal Frame: Maiden of Black Water Review
Review: Fatal Frame's debut on the Wii U builds a chilling, believable atmosphere but mars it with clunky controls and a forgettable story devoid of real drama.
Author Information: As someone who was a part time paranormal investigator to earn extra money during college, Alexa Ray Corriea is well acquainted with the Fatal Frame franchise. She played Maiden of Black Water to completion for this review and spent some extra time just snapping ghosty pics.

Title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt - Hearts of Stone Review
Review: CD Projekt Red's first paid expansion is well worth the return to the Northern Kingdoms.
Author Information: Mike wishes he could talk about Hearts of Stone's plot points here, but doesn't want to spoil them for you. Let him know when you beat it.

Title: Transformers: Devastation Review
Review: The war between the Autobots and Decepticons receives a superficial yet satisfying new chapter.
Author Information: Scott Butterworth was born in the '80s, so he loves Transformers by default.

Title: Tales from the Borderlands: Episode Five ‰ÛÓ The Vault of the Traveler Review
Review: Tales from the Borderlands' finale wraps up a masterful story in an equally masterful package, ending its poignant and witty story on a high note.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played every conceivable outcome for Tales from the Borderlands' finale.

Title: Runbow Review
Review: Runbow may lack some bite, but its nine-player races make for a wild, chaotic party game and an incredibly varied platformer.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor loves a good platformer, with some of his recent favorites being 1001 Spikes and Electronic Super Joy. After six hours, he can add Runbow to that list.

Title: Elite: Dangerous Review
Review: Although slow and complicated at times, Elite: Dangerous nevertheless provides a rewarding open-world experience on Xbox One.
Author Information: Leif Johnson grew up practically next door to NASA in the Houston area, where he gained an early love of space exploration games. For the purposes of this review, he played Elite: Dangerous for approximately 20 hours.

Title: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5 Review
Review: Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 5 is riddled with glitches and offers almost nothing new to longtime fans of the series.
Author Information: Peter played 10 hours of THPS5 before he was unable to cope with the boring challenges, constant loading screens, and relentless glitches.

Title: Afro Samurai 2: Revenge of Kuma Volume One Review
Review: Afro Samurai 2: Revenge of Kuma is an irredeemable mess.
Author Information: Peter endured Revenge of Kuma Volume One for two hours, completing the game and unlocking every ability.

Title: Cities: Skylines After Dark Review
Review: City life after the sun goes down is the focus of After Dark, an expansion for Cities: Skylines that adds nightlife and other new features to the reigning champion of ...
Author Information: Another dozen hours in the virtual municipalities of Cities: Skylines just flew by for Brett, who can always find the time to hang out in the late-night bars of After Dark.

Title: Uncharted: The Nathan Drake Collection Review
Review: The remastered collection brings us back to the treasure hunter's roots, and prepares us for his next adventure.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy still enjoys Uncharted 3 more than any other in the series, despite that arduous desert scene.

Title: NBA 2K16 Review
Review: NBA 2K16 injects the series with powerful new mechanics, but without proper guidance, it leaves training up to you.
Author Information: For the purposes of this review, Josiah played through a few seasons in MyCareer, brought a championship home in MyGM, and spent hours in each of the additional game modes.

Title: The Beginner's Guide Review
Review: The Beginner‰Ûªs Guide is a fascinating journey into the thoughts and processes involved in the creation of a video game, and the people that make them.
Author Information: Edmond Tran spent two hours completing The Beginner‰Ûªs Guide, but he's still thinking about what it all means.

Title: Rock Band 4 Review
Review: Rock Band 4 attempts to revitalize the music/rhythm genre with a slightly updated take on its classic hard-rocking, note-matching gameplay.
Author Information: Scott Butterworth is a lifelong musician and a shameless karaoke fiend. He's been rocking out on plastic instruments ever since the original Guitar Hero.

Title: Minecraft: Story Mode Episode One--The Order of the Stone Review
Review: It's a slow start, but a pleasant one, for Telltale's narrative take on one of the world's most popular games.
Author Information: Randolph played through Episode One twice, making different choices to see how the narrative would be affected. Game reviewed using a PC version supplied by the developer.

Title: FIFA 16 Review
Review: The biggest gameplay changes in years leave FIFA feeling fresh for the new season.
Author Information: Nathan played FIFA 16 offline and online on PlayStation 4 and on Xbox One, where he got George Best in Draft mode and didn‰Ûªt want to say goodbye.

Title: Dragon Quest Heroes: The World Tree's Woe and the Blight Below Review
Review: The slime army awaits, wide-eyed and smiling as worlds collide in this inspired Dragon Quest spin-off.
Author Information: It took Miguel 40 hours to handily beat Dragon Quest Heroes with over 100 side quests completed. He comes into Dragon Quest Heroes having beaten five mainline Dragon Quests, his favorite being Dragon Quest VIII.

Title: Skylanders SuperChargers Review
Review: Now in its fifth iteration, the Skylanders series continues to provide some of the best kid-friendly gaming available.
Author Information: Randolph completed the game solo on the PS4 version, and is about halfway through the Wii U version with his son. All toys and starter packs were provided by Activision.

Title: Blood Bowl 2 Review
Review: Brutality and turn-based gameplay make an unlikely combination in this sports management game.
Author Information: Dan has been playing Blood Bowl as a board game since the early 90s, and put too many hours into the previous Blood Bowl game

Title: LEGO Dimensions Review
Review: LEGO Dimensions' franchise mash-ups provide many wonderful moments, and it works equally well as a toy and a game.
Author Information: Playing LEGO Dimensions made Randolph realise he needs to work on his fine motor skills. He completed the main campaign using mostly the characters and vehicle in the starter pack, but did open a Chima and Scooby Doo pack at the insistence of his six-year-old son. All sets and toys provided by Warner Bros Interactive Entertainment.

Title: Dropsy Review
Review: Dropsy is a genuine and somber adventure about a creepy clown that exceeds its quirky premise in the most meaningful way.
Author Information: Dropsy brought many warm feelings to Matt Espineli's heart. He doesn't have a fear of clowns, but imagines that the game would be a completely different experience for someone who does.

Title: Act of Aggression Review
Review: Act of Aggression is set in a near-future sci-fi world where three factions vie for control of the Earth.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey is a strategy game obsessive, always on the hunt for the perfect test of mental acuity. For the purposes of this review, he played a dozen multiplayer matches and finished the campaign over the course of 20 hours.

Title: SOMA Review
Review: It may not stir the hordes of wailing YouTubers looking for the next best haunted house, but SOMA succeeds at crafting something much more meaningful than jump-scares.
Author Information: Richard spent 10 hours in SOMA's murky depths, preferably with the lights off and a pair of headphones on.

Title: PES 2016 Review
Review: Konami's dethroned soccer series has entered a new golden age.
Author Information: Rob played PES 2016 on PlayStation 4 throughout a full week prior to review. The servers were inaccessible during this period.

Title: Destiny: The Taken King Review
Review: Bungie's newest expansion not only offers a compelling experience in itself, but transforms Destiny altogether.
Author Information: Mike's hunter reached level 40 within 15 minutes of starting The Taken King. 35 hours later, he's now at Light level 296.

Title: Persona 4: Dancing All Night Review
Review: The combination of a flawed rhythm game and a disappointing narrative make Persona 4 Dancing All Night an underwhelming experience.
Author Information: Heidi is still angry nobody put the funky dorm music from Persona 3 in this game. Or the Persona 3 boss music. Or anything Persona 3, really.

Title: NHL 16 Review
Review: NHL 16 fixes the mistakes of its predecessor, bringing the NHL franchise back to form.
Author Information: Mat is Canadian, so he‰Ûªs basically required by law to love hockey. He‰Ûªs also played every NHL game since 2001 and spent more than 30 hours with NHL 16. (Twitter: http://twitter.com/MatPaget)

Title: Satellite Reign Review
Review: Satellite Reign allows you to create the cyberpunk team of your fantasy, but the game's broken pathfinding and enemy AI are too easy to exploit.
Author Information: Don digs the beat poetry inspired cyberpunk of William Gibson and the comic absurdity of Neal Stephenson as well as a great tactical strategy game. He spent just over 20 hours with Satellite Reign in order to finish his mission.

Title: Forza Motorsport 6 Review
Review: Forza Motorsport 6 builds off of the series' bright past by introducing new features that make it more than just a pretty trip down memory lane.
Author Information: Miguel has put at least 200 combined hours into the last three Forza games, including Forza Motorsport 6, where he spent over 30 hours in career mode and multiplayer races.

Title: World of Warships Review
Review: World of Warships delivers thrilling naval combat and puts you in command of an impressive number of WWII-era ships.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey still has a tough time telling the difference between aft and stern, and also wants to know if a poop deck is what he thinks it is. For this review, Cameron played for around 40 hours, unlocking up to tier five of the Japanese vessels on his own, while experiencing aircraft carriers and high-tier ships on a Wargaming press account.

Title: Sorcerer King Review
Review: Sorcerer King is a new 4X game from Stardock, producers of classics like Sins of a Solar Empire and Fallen Enchantress.
Author Information: Dan Starkey is a 4X fanatic, always looking novel takes on one of gaming's oldest genres. He spent over 50 hours mixing it up with the dreaded Sorcerer King for this review.

Title: Dishonored: Definitive Edition Review
Review: A better version of a great game, but not as definitive as it could be.
Author Information: This would be Justin Clark‰Ûªs third playthrough of Dishonored, though only the first time playing through the DLC. He will be the first to tell you he only killed the Broadcaster in the name of Carrie Fisher. He regrets nothing.

Title: Super Mario Maker Review
Review: The ultimate 2D Mario experience puts the creative reigns in your hands with a simple and satisfying level-building experience.
Author Information: The version of the game Nintendo provided for review exists on a separate server that will be cleared out once the game's actual servers go live. However, you can find examples of the stages we created, and some gameplay highlights, in our PAX Prime 2015 Mario Maker challenge video.

Title: Pillars of Eternity: The White March Part 1 Review
Review: The White March Part 1 is a testing and slightly predictable expansion for Pillars of Eternity.
Author Information: The frosty setting of The White March made Brett realize what he has to look forward to in just a few months up in Eastern Ontario. All Canada needs to do is add some dwarves.

Title: Shadowrun: Hong Kong Review
Review: Shadowrun takes a successful, though familiar trip to the Far East.
Author Information: Most of Justin Clark‰Ûªs Shadowrun experience was on SNES and Genesis. Most of that time was spent getting shot to death by dudes with pink mohawks. He is glad to see things haven‰Ûªt changed much.

Title: Disgaea 5: Alliance of Vengeance Review
