Review: Disgaea 5 is bigger and more complex than any Disgaea game before it.
Author Information: Jason Venter has spent dozens of hours with each previous Disgaea game except for the visual novel, and he happily spent around 50 hours on this campaign before devoting another 30 to the post-game content for the purposes of this review.

Title: Tearaway Unfolded Review
Review: Tearaway Unfolded leverages the DualShock 4's unique inputs to recreate the charm and wonderment of the original Vita adventure.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin played and enjoyed the original Tearaway on the PlayStation Vita, and has a strong affinity for 3D platformers. For the purposes of this review, he reached the end of Unfolded‰Ûªs story while trying his hardest to avoid drawing anything vulgar.

Title: Mega Man Legacy Collection Review
Review: Mega Man Legacy Collection is a fascinating peek into the 8-bit roots of one of gaming's most beloved franchises', but it can be unforgiving for a modern audience.
Author Information: Don's first Mega Man game was Mega Man X on the SNES which he was not good enough to beat as a little kid. He spent just under 20 hours with this game for review.

Title: Zombi Review
Review: This charming survival horror game is a Wii U exclusive no more, but can it compete on other platforms?
Author Information: ZombiU was one of Britton Peele's favorite experiences from the Wii U's launch library. He enjoyed revisiting the undead adventure through a roughly 10 hour standard difficulty playthrough, which he managed to get through by killing only a handful of survivors.

Title: Toy Soldiers: War Chest Review
Review: Toy Soldiers: War Chest is a fun tower defense game marred by paywalls and glitches.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey was an avid collector of action figures (not toys!) back in his day. He oversaw incredible battles for supremacy between green anthropomorphic turtles and Bat-men hailing from both film and television. Most of them now are listed as missing in action, i.e., buried in a backyard somewhere. For the sake of this review, Cameron played more than 15 hours, completing the campaign and a handful of online matches.

Title: Devil's Third Review
Review: Devil's Third is entertaining in bursts, but its many frustrations far outweigh any of its positives.
Author Information: Sean Bell has plenty in common with the hero of Devil's Third--he's going bald, and only a 12 year-old could ever think he's cool.

Title: Mad Max Review
Review: Mad Max offers great car combat and some gorgeous scenery, but with simplistic fighting mechanics and tedious activities, it quickly loses its luster.
Author Information: Peter spent over 15 hours exploring the dangerous yet beautiful world of Mad Max for this review, completing the story mode and looking for cars to blow up just for the fun of it.

Title: LBX: Little Battlers eXperience Review
Review: Despite some rather clunky design choices, Level-5's LBX: Little Battler‰Ûªs eXperience is an action-RPG that is complex and entertaining.
Author Information: Matt‰Ûªs combined love for robots and hokey anime narrative tropes made his time with LBX: Little Battler‰Ûªs eXperience appropriately enjoyable.

Title: Disney Infinity 3.0 Review
Review: This is the best Infinity's structured play sets have ever been, but the Toy Box remains a wonderful, awe-inspiring and simultaneously overwhelming experience.
Author Information: Randolph completed Twilight of the Republic, played several more hours in the Toy Box Hub, and created a few levels using the new tools in Infinity. His six-year-old son Sebastian assisted, but was really confused as to why Olaf couldn't have Force powers, too.

Title: Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls Review
Review: Though Ultra Despair Girls' action components stumble at points, the superb narrative and character development make the rest of the game a riveting experience.
Author Information: Heidi spent a little over 18 hours in the wreckage of Towa City. She‰Ûªs quite tempted to go back and find all the files and scraps she missed on her first playthrough. How will the riveting storybook tale of Socki the ultra-kawaii sock end?

Title: N++ Review
Review: The ninja returns, better than ever.
Author Information: Justin Clark blew through the intro and made it through half the main stages before writing his review. He will neither confirm or deny the number of times he has caught himself humming Revenge of Shinobi music during gameplay.

Title: Red Goddess: Inner World Review
Review: Red Goddess is a frustrating, uninspired platformer that‰Ûªs neither fun nor fair.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin loves platformers of both the 2D and 3D variety, citing Super Mario World as the greatest game of all time. For the purpose of this review, he (begrudgingly) made his way through Red Goddess and defeated the final boss.

Title: Tales from the Borderlands: Episode Four - Escape Plan Bravo Review
Review: Tales from the Borderlands' penultimate episode stretches thin its gamey bits, but its emphasis on character relationships and humanity make it a heartbreaking experience.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has far too many save files for Tales from the Borderlands because she wants to experience everything and it's driving her absolutely nuts.

Title: Volume Review
Review: Volume's tight mechanics, smart visual vocabulary, and level-editing tools combine to create something that is as much a puzzle game as it is a stealth title.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy spent about 10 hours playing Volume's campaign, and later found at least 50 user-created maps that were far better than his.

Title: The Bridge Review
Review: Years after its initial release, The Bridge is still a great example of 2D puzzle gaming.
Author Information: From Myst to Braid to the sides of cereal boxes, Britton Peele enjoys having a good puzzle to solve. After finishing all eight chapters of The Bridge he sought the Internet's help in getting every single one of the game's achievements ...mostly so his Gamerscore would be divisible by five again.

Title: Everybody's Gone to the Rapture Review
Review: The studio behind Dear Esther and Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs have achieved audiovisual and narrative excellence with their latest adventure.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea explored every square inch of Everybody's Gone to the Rapture's world to exhaustion.

Title: The Talos Principle: Road To Gehenna Review
Review: Though the puzzles this time prove vestigial, Road To Gehenna delivers the same smart environmental puzzles and thoughtful commentary on humanity as its predecessor.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor considered The Talos Principle one of his favorite games of 2014 and, after fifteen hours with Road To Gehenna, is slightly disappointed it doesn't quite reach the same heights.

Title: Metal Gear Solid V: The Phantom Pain Review
Review: Kojima's open-world opus succeeds in delivering incredible gameplay and captivating storytelling.
Author Information: Peter has played every Metal Gear game there is, and spent almost 50 hours with The Phantom Pain for this review. His total completion percentage, after beating the main storyline and playing a few dozen side ops, amounted to 40 percent. He played the game for one day at a review event at Konami's Los Angeles headquarters, but completed it at home using a copy of the game provided by Konami. For the review event, Konami paid for travel and other accommodations.

Title: Cabal 2 Review
Review: If you've played a free-to-play MMOG in the past 5 years, then you've played Cabal 2.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins went through a few years of deep dives into F2P MMOG after F2P MMOG, from Shaiya to Vindictus to the original Cabal. That said, her time with Cabal 2 has not made her reflect fondly on that period of her life.

Title: Dragon Age: Inquisition - The Descent Review
Review: Hacking and slashing are the highlights of a so-so expedition to the Deep Roads in the Descent DLC for Dragon Age: Inquisition
Author Information: Spending seven or eight hours underground in The Descent made Brett realize that he might be claustrophobic after all.

Title: Until Dawn Review
Review: Until Dawn is a thoughtful game that exploits its tropes and sets up a system of mechanics and branching narrative that make for a chilling, irresistible experience.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played Until Dawn religiously for about a week, and has completed four total playthroughs with some dabbling in rewinding to specific chapters. She still hasn't' seen everything.

Title: Gears of War: Ultimate Edition Review
Review: The Coalition has crafted a faithful homage to a nine-year-old game, but hasn't completely erased the blemishes of the past, especially on PC.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy still remembers the first time he chainsawed his friend, and Gears of War: Ultimate Edition helped him relive that moment.

Title: Madden NFL 16 Review
Review: EA‰Ûªs juggernaut sports series delivers its 2015 installment with finesse and prowess, making it worth the attention of both fans and newcomers.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs review was based off approximately 15 hours of play time spread across all of Madden NFL 16‰Ûªs modes including a thorough dive into the Gatorade Skills Trainer. He completed a season run using the Eagles in Franchise mode even though he has no emotional or residential ties to the team. As a San Francisco resident, Miguel is baffled at the 49ers‰Ûª recent implosion. He also enjoys rewatching the Butler play about once a week.

Title: Rare Replay Review
Review: Rare Replay is a massive collection of great games and interesting documentaries, but not everything is as good as it could have been.
Author Information: Peter played a little bit of every game in Rare Replay, but spent the most time playing Battletoads, R.C. Pro Am, Conker's Bad Fur Day, and Banjo and Kazooie: Nut 'n' Bolts, a game he's been wanting to try for seven years.

Title: Galak-Z: The Dimensional Review
Review: Galak-Z is a brutal, demanding, and ultimately rewarding 2D shooter.
Author Information: Mike Mahardy died a lot during Galak-Z: The Dimensional. He's now terrified of space pirates.

Title: Tembo The Badass Elephant Review
Review: Tembo‰Ûªs big action setpieces prove the old adage that great things come in small packages.
Author Information: Heidi is glad that Game Freak has once again visited their roots in platforming games. She sees herself replaying Tembo regularly, much like another of her favorite Game Freak games, the Genesis platformer, Pulseman.

Title: King's Quest Chapter 1: A Knight to Remember Review
Review: What‰Ûªs old is new again in A Knight to Remember, the first chapter in a new King‰Ûªs Quest saga that perfectly matches the spirit of the legendary adventure series.
Author Information: Brett‰Ûªs eight hours spent in Daventry felt more like a trip back 25 years to the glory days of King‰Ûªs Quest, Police Quest, and the rest of the Sierra adventure classics.

Title: Lost Dimension Review
Review: Lost Dimension successfully blends challenging tactical combat with unique judgment sequences that force you to eliminate various party members.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin enjoys saving the world from maniacal anime villains, and prefers to do so through turn-based combat. For the purposes of this review, he completed Lost Dimension and played through each of the side missions.

Title: Etrian Odyssey Untold 2: The Fafnir Knight Review
Review: This enhanced remake of Etrian Odyssey 2 has a lot to offer both series veterans and newcomers.
Author Information: Heidi has played every single entry in the Etrian Odyssey series. She didn‰Ûªt realize how much she really, really missed the War Magus class from EO2 until she got her hands on it again. She also silently judges you if you pick the orchestral soundtrack over the old-school FM synth sounds.

Title: Rory McIlroy PGA Tour Review
Review: Rory McIlroy PGA Tour is an empty, unimpressive debut lacking in both content and finish.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin has been golfing since the age of five and played four years on his high school varsity team. For the purposes of this review, he brought his created golfer to the top of the Official World Golf Rankings, competed in multiple online tournaments, and even had a hole-in-one.

Title: Journey (PS4) Review
Review: Journey has only improved with time, earning its status as one of the best games ever created.
Author Information: Kevin has played Journey on the PS4 three times now, making for eight total Journey playthroughs in all. He considers Journey one of the best games ever made.

Title: Card Hunter: Expedition to the Sky Citadel Review
Review: Card Hunter comes to Steam with the same skillful mix of classic RPG and card-styled gaming as its browser-based predecessor.
Author Information: Over 20 hours in the AD&D-inspired Card Hunter made Brett long for a time machine, but he had to settle for just flipping through his old copies of ‰ÛÏTomb of Horrors‰Û and ‰ÛÏExpedition to the Barrier Peaks.‰Û

Title: Victor Vran Review
Review: Victor Vran treads familiar ground, bringing exciting combat to an overall sufficient action RPG.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent many hours playing action RPGs, scouring their worlds, constantly on the lookout for shinier loot. Deep in his heart, he will always count Phantasy Star Online as his favorite, but he never turns down the opportunity to explore new horizons. For the sake of this review, Cameron played around 30 hours, reaching the highest level of 50, all the while hording a handful of legendary weapons that are his and his alone so back off.

Title: Dreamfall Chapters Book 3: Realms Review
Review: Dreamfall Chapters positions itself for great things after a touching and successful Book 3.
Author Information: Jay Pullman writes, podcasts, and wrangles three-legged cats when he‰Ûªs not playing video games. He spent 4-5 hours with Dreamfall Chapters Book 3 and feels pleasantly refreshed. Full Disclosure: Jay donated $25 to Dreamfall Chapters‰Ûª Kickstarter campaign.

Title: Prototype Biohazard Bundle Review
Review: With this Prototype bundle, the virus is back, but it's been rendered inert.
Author Information: Justin Clark sank 20 hours apiece into the two Prototype games for this go-around. He has sincere regrets about not gluing a couple of boxes of spaghetti to his arms and going as James Heller for Halloween when Prototype 2 came out.

Title: Blues and Bullets: Episode One Review
Review: Blues and Bullets makes its debut with a stylish first episode that sets a striking‰ÛÓif slightly uneven and glitchy‰ÛÓcrime noir tone.
Author Information: Brett likes his film noir, but prefers it in novel form. Jim Thompson would have liked Blues and Bullets.

Title: Trove Review
Review: Trove generally mixes elements of Minecraft and traditional MMOGs well, but it grows tedious in the late game.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelance writer who has played a ridiculous number of MMOGs, and he recently started playing Age of Conan again for reasons even he's not sure of. And he likes it. For the purposes of this review, he played Trove for about 30 hours.

Title: Rocket League Review
Review: Rocket League delivers all the refinements and improvements befitting a sports sequel, and is a brilliantly boisterous and enthralling game in its own right.
Author Information: It took Miguel one match to get the appeal of Rocket League and about 30 more before he scored a bicycle kick goal that was intentional. As a fan of single player campaigns in sports video games, playing the 36-week season--the longest season allowable--was a no-brainer. He enjoyed scoring against bots from midfield at Rookie level and appreciated the option to increase the difficulty mid-season. He is equally satisfied with his above .500 online win average.

Title: Trials Fusion: Awesome Level Max Edition Review
Review: The wackiest bits of Trials Fusion's Awesome Level Max DLC end too soon, but there's plenty of other content to savor.
Author Information: Leif Johnson loves platformers of all types, and he's been doing the sidescrolling dirtbike thing ever since he picked up Excitebike in 1985. He's never actually ridden a dirtbike, but he's ridden plenty of horses, and thus he winced every time the unicorn landed on all fours. For the purposes of this review, he played the Awesome Level Max DLC for about nine hours.

Title: F1 2015 Review
Review: F1 2015 has the best on-circuit action the series has ever seen, buts serious technical issues, a dearth of game modes, and multiplayer which is functionally broken sour what is ...
Author Information: Danny first fell in love with F1 games while playing Geoff Crammond's F1 Grand Prix on his Amiga 600. He is co-host of Giant Bomb's Formula One podcast Alt+F1 and frequently wakes up at 5AM to watch races live.

Title: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited Review
Review: Despite it's vastness and beauty, The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited's halves never unite to form a consistent whole.
Author Information: Don bought his Xbox 360 specifically for The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, and he's lost hundreds of hours between it and Skyrim. He spent circa 60 hours with The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited for this review.

Title: Life is Strange Episode Four Review
Review: Life is Strange's penultimate episode abuses its own mechanics and drags the pace down, but bookends its slog with two powerful, well-worth-it gut punches.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is in Life is Strange for the long haul, and played this latest episode exploring different options presented in previous episodes.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode Five ‰ÛÓ A Nest of Vipers Review
Review: Game of Thrones' fifth episode is a return to what we expect from something attached to the HBO series: bloodshed, intrigue, and bitter heartbreak.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played through A Nest of Vipers three times to explore all possible outcomes. They are all terrible and sad but she did it for you anyway.

Title: Godzilla Review
Review: Godzilla is a boring, badly-balanced game that asks you to pay a lot of money for too little content.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd loves big monsters, big robots, and big guns. He does not, however, like this Godzilla game, and after eight hours of drudgery, he cannot be convinced to return.

Title: Guild of Dungeoneering Review
Review: Guild of Dungeoneering is deceptively simple but full of fun.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 5 hours crawling dungeons to building up his guild into a flourishing estate. He has found himself wondering how they managed to keep the graveyard so pristine with the astonishingly high number of dead adventurers he‰Ûªs piled onto it over time.

Title: Legends of Eisenwald Review
Review: Atmosphere and a good story make the tactical RPG Legends of Eisenwald a compelling trip back to Germany in the Middle Ages.
Author Information: More than 20 hours in medieval Germany, and strategy veteran Brett is still looking for Martin Luther.

Title: Lego Jurassic World Review
Review: Lego Jurassic World is a joyful, brightly-colored tribute to Jurassic Park that fails to channel the franchise's trademark tension and excitement.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor was obsessed with dinosaurs as a kid, and Jurassic Park holds a special place in his heart. He spent fifteen hours hoping the game would properly capture the spirit of the movies. Also, he still enjoys dinosaurs.

Title: Traverser Review
Review: Traverser boasts a fun presentation, but the gameplay doesn't always follow suit.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelance writer who has enjoyed 3D platformers ever since Super Mario 64 came out. For the purposes of this review, he played Traverser for around five hours.

Title: God of War 3 Remastered Review
Review: God of War III on the PS4 is the same exciting game that it always was--just a little prettier.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played and enjoyed every God of War game except Ascension, which is still sitting on his shelf and waiting to be played. He still thinks God of War II is the best God of War, but hardly regretted the eight hours it took to play God of War III again.

Title: Ronin Review
Review: Ronin is a challenging action platformer with vengeance on its mind.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey loves stealth games, and couldn‰Ûªt get enough of silently taking out enemies from the shadows in Ronin. For this review, Cameron played around eight hours, completing the campaign and playing some new-game-plus.

Title: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure Review
Review: Dr. Mario: Miracle Cure introduces a fresh new twist on an old formula.
Author Information: Jason Venter willingly admits that he is not a Dr. Mario savant, but for the sake of this review he conquered all of the new puzzles and showed those viruses who the boss is. Unrelated: now he has a cold.

Title: Whispering Willows Review
Review: Whispering Willows is modest in its scares and challenges, but is rich in heart.
Author Information: Miguel beat Whispering Willows in three brisk, stump-free hours and managed to collect all the notes in the process. This playthrough has motivated Miguel to finish White Night and replay Fatal Frame. He resides on the former site of a newspaper office and assumes ghosts of deceased deadline-pressed editors frantically roam his house.

Title: The Red Solstice Review
Review: Once you get through its rough exterior, The Red Solstice offers deep tactical action that's fun with friends.
Author Information: Britton Peele wouldn't mind visiting Mars, but he'd rather not die there. He spent roughly 20 hours completing the game's single-player campaign and ranking up several times in multiplayer, despite dying more often than not.

Title: Wander Review
Review: Wander is a broken and hollow shell of an MMO that lacks more than just combat.
Author Information: Jefferson Geiger roamed for ten hours on the islands of Wander and won‰Ûªt return. He spent a whole summer grinding to level 60 in World of Warcraft and loves exploring environments in games like Gone Home and Journey. He wishes he did one of those things instead of play Wander.

Title: Devil May Cry 4: Special Edition Review
Review: The Special Edition of Devil May Cry 4 brings notable improvements, but they‰Ûªre not enough to cover up its repetitive core.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin has spent his fair share of time slicing and dicing demons as Dante. For the purposes of this review, he completed the campaign, tested each difficulty, and experimented with each additional characters‰Ûª special abilities.

Title: Final Fantasy XIV: Heavensward Review
Review: Square Enix's MMO has gone from turmoil to triumph, but can the latest expansion take it even further?
Author Information: Pete has been playing Final Fantasy XIV since A Realm Reborn's closed beta in 2013, and just about managed to clear the Final Coil of Bahamut before Heavensward launched.

Title: PlanetSide 2 Review (PS4) Review
Review: PlanetSide 2 on the PlayStation 4 suffers from a lot of technical issues--but not enough to dissuade you from the rigors of its massive battles.
Author Information: Kevin played many dozens of hours of PlanetSide 2 on the PC, and spent dozens more with the PS4 version. He's not the best pilot, but he's killer with a rocket launcher. He's played different factions for review purposes, but his heart will always be with the Vanu.

Title: Tales from the Borderlands: Episode Three ‰ÛÓ Catch a Ride Review
Review: Tales from the Borderlands' third episode is its best yet, a shining example of Telltale's branching narratives and a gut-busting, heart-pounding thrill ride.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea went back to the previous episode and changed her final choice twice--then played through Catch a Ride exploring both options. Her mind was blown.

Title: The Masterplan Review
Review: Clumsy controls make The Masterplan more gawky than graceful.
Author Information: Between Invisible Inc, Neon Struct, and The Masterplan, Justin Clark has been immersed in the stealth genre this year, to the point that he has taken a liking to kicking in bathroom doors and threatening toilets to self-flush at gunpoint, before demanding they tell him where the non-existent safe is. He has since been given a prescription copy of GTA V. By order of a city court.

Title: Her Story Review
Review: In Her Story, an old game mechanic has been put to captivating new use.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to piece together the story in about 2 hours. As one of maybe 13 people on the planet who owned a Sega CD, he‰Ûªs no stranger to FMVs and things that don‰Ûªt last as long as you want them to.

Title: Batman: Arkham Knight Review
Review: Arkham Knight is another slick and enjoyable Batman adventure, though what it brings to the series' table is not always for the best.
Author Information: Kevin is now well into a new-game plus in Batman: Arkham Knight, and has spent about 30 hours with the game in all. He played the PlayStation 4 version provided by WB Games on a debug console. He welcomes debate on whether Arkham City or Arkham Asylum is the better game, but scoffs at anyone who thinks it's Arkham Origins.

Title: Massive Chalice Review
Review: Massive Chalice can create hilarious moments of eugenics disasters, but other elements leave a lot to be desired.
Author Information: Don has been a fan of tactical RPGs since the Final Fantasy Tactics days, and XCOM: Enemy Unknown was a major event in his life a couple years back. He spent around 14 hours with Massive Chalice for review.

Title: Dirty Bomb Review
Review: Dirty Bomb is frantic and entertaining, but doesn‰Ûªt exactly sparkle with originality and stability.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent much of his youth playing twitch shooters like Unreal and Quake, and that experience helped him settle into Dirty Bomb without much difficulty. For the purpose of this review, Cameron spent around 30 hours shooting, reviving, bombing, and generally having a good time, despite the frequent problems. Splash Damage's official public relations provided game code, along with a statement that Dirty Bomb's open beta period is actually considered full, reviewable release.

Title: Heroes of the Storm Review
Review: Lots of colorful Blizzard characters cross paths in the sensational Heroes of the Storm.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks is a seasoned MOBA veteran and longtime fan of Blizzard IPs Diablo and StarCraft, with thousands of hours in each. For this review, Tyler reached account level 22 in Heroes of the Storm and leveled up several characters to level 5.

Title: Yoshi's Woolly World Review
Review: Mario's super-powered sidekick takes the spotlight, but can he steal the show?
Author Information: Rob resisted playing The Witcher 3 just so he could review Woolly World for you. Please understand.

Title: Sym Review
Review: Awkward platformer Sym speaks to a vulnerable issue, but it's difficult to figure out what exactly it's trying to say.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor is extremely familiar with anxiety issues, having dealt with them himself, so he can relate to hiding from stressful situations. Even so, the five hours he spent with Sym didn't speak to him.

Title: Shadowrun Chronicles: Boston Lockdown Review
Review: Shadowrun Chronicles is a bad use of the Shadowrun license, and a bad tactical RPG.
Author Information: A fan of all things Western RPG, Dan Starkey suffered through Boston Lockdown's boring, monotonous campaign before trying some co-op. Sadly, adding people didn't save a fundamentally dull game.

Title: Kholat Review
Review: Kholat's poor attempts to creep and confound you fail to capitalize on its terrific premise.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd loves snowy horror games

Title: Interloper Review
Review: Interloper condenses a whole lot of RTS into a small package of smart tactics and challenging puzzles.
Author Information: Brett spent five hours swimming around with his Sentinels in Interloper.

Title: Technobabylon Review
Review: Technobabylon combines tricky puzzles with fantastic world-building and storytelling.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelance writer who's been a fan of cyberpunk ever since he found a used copy of Neuromancer in a dentist's office in the mid-1980s. For the purposes of this review, he played Technobabylon for about 10 hours, although much of that was just clicking around cluelessly. He wrote this review on a table by the Hermitage in St. Petersburg, Russia.

Title: Splatoon Review
Review: Splatoon is surprising because it bucks trends that have held back shooters for years, opening the genre up to all comers, casual and hardcore alike.
Author Information: Peter played Splatoon for the better part of two weeks and loved almost every minute of it. He wants more, and he wants it now.

Title: Schrodinger's Cat And The Raiders Of The Lost Quark Review
Review: Schrodinger's Cat is smarter than the average platformer, but still a pretty average platformer.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 6 hours with Schrodinger's Cat, an hour and half of which spent obsessively netting unconscious gluons before saying to hell with it. The fact that Justin was a Liberal Arts major and thus has no idea about how to science had no bearing on this review, he swears.

Title: Carmageddon: Reincarnation Review
Review: Carmageddon: Reincarnation is a tired and clunky reboot of a better game suited for a different time.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey played a lot of car combat games back in his prime, including Carmageddon and such gems like Vigilante 8. For the sake of this review, Cameron spent around 17 hours in the game, partly on his roof, partly tweaking graphics settings, but still managed to finish the single-player campaign and unlock all vehicles in the process.

Title: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing 3 Review
Review: Van Helsing III is fun, but its reliance on old assets and disappointing brevity make this action role-playing game less than incredible.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey was one of the first fans of the Van Helsing series. After the 10-hour campaign and some forays into both PvP and co-op multiplayer, he's finally ready to say goodbye to the land of Borgovia. He only wishes they were parting on better terms.

Title: Puzzle & Dragons Z + Puzzle & Dragons: Super Mario Bros. Edition Review
Review: The two games in this package make for a solid introduction to Puzzle and Dragons‰Ûª collecting and matching mechanics, but they aren't as substantial as they should be.
Author Information: Heidi opened up a bunch of friend slots on her mobile Puzzle and Dragons account just for you fine folks who actually read the whole review (and to clear any doubts about her PAD prowess). Add 313,548,207 to your pals list for some great helpers. Dark and Red leads preferred!

Title: Stretchmo Review
Review: While there isn't much to the free section of ‰ÛÏfree-to-start‰Û Stretchmo, the full product is a pleasant puzzler.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins dipped in and out of both Pushmo and Crashmo in the past, but left each feeling lukewarm. She had a much easier time sticking with Stretchmo thanks to its variety.

Title: Neon Struct Review
Review: Neon Struct is a retro stealth experience that is a bit too retro for its own good.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 4 hours wandering the long halls and corridors of Neon Struct. Perhaps his biggest disappointment was not getting a twist ending where it‰Ûªs revealed Jillian is actually a sentient mass of fluorescent lighting made only for non-lethal killing.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode Four ‰ÛÓ Sons of Winter Review
Review: Game of Thrones' fourth episode prioritizes verbal sparring over the physical kind, slowing down the action and packing in new twists to tension's detriment.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played through Sons of Winter several times, exploring the consequence of each major decision.

Title: Sunset Review
Review: Sunset is a creative, powerful story of personal, political, and social conflict.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin completed Sunset for the purposes of this review. Additionally, he started a new game and made different choices in order to see how the story changes.

Title: Magicka 2 Review
Review: Magic combat and co-op play remain brilliant in Magicka 2, but the sadistic solo experience along with a few bugs and design problems cause some of this spell to fizzle.
Author Information: Even after many hours of running around with his cowl on in both Magicka games, Brett will likely never be very good at hot-button spell-slinging. But he tries hard.

Title: Magnetic: Cage Closed Review
Review: Magnetic: Cage Closed's reliance on imprecise platforming and nondescript storytelling makes the game's prison setting an unintended and accurate metaphor.
Author Information: Puzzle-platformers are easily Don's third favorite genre behind RPGs and 4X strategy games, but neither Magnetic: Cage Closed's platforming or puzzling were redeemable. He spent around 7 hours with the game.

Title: Galactic Civilizations III Review
Review: The Galactic Civilizations series has returned with more ships, bigger maps, and new ways to explore, expand, exploit, and exterminate.
Author Information: 4X is Dan Starkey's favorite game genre. Starting with Civilization II, he's spent the past twenty years waiting for the perfect strategy game. Dan spent 48 on three games over the course of a week, and while he loved GalCivIII, he's still waiting.

Title: Life is Strange Episode Three Review
Review: The third episode of Life is Strange marks the series' high point, with poignant emotional moments and a twist that turns the narrative on its head.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea can't stop rewinding time because she triple-guesses all of her choices. She played Chaos Theory twice, exploring both scenario options from the end of Episode Two.

Title: Swords And Soldiers 2 Review
Review: It's light on features, but Swords and Soldiers II is successful at boiling an RTS down to its entertaining essentials.
Author Information: Britton Peele spent a lot of time playing (and often cheating in) the Age of Empires games in his youth, and Swords and Soldiers reminded him of the series in positive ways. He spent five hours completing the story, but went back to replay several levels and play a number of local multiplayer matches.

Title: Hatred Review
Review: Hatred isn't fun, interesting, or titillating enough to command your time or attention.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through Hatred's campaign in about 3 1/2 hours. And that's all he's got to say about that.

Title: Wolfenstein: The Old Blood Review
Review: The Old Blood's madcap attitude shines throughout its campaign, but the game fumbles when it strays from its Nazi-filled levels.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor spent around ten hours killing Nazis, zombies, dogs, and robots. In the process, he realized he's been doing some variation of this for decades now. The more things change...

Title: Not A Hero Review
Review: The humor won‰Ûªt always make you laugh, but Not a Hero‰Ûªs 2D action makes it worth your time.
Author Information: The humor won‰Ûªt always make you laugh, but Not a Hero‰Ûªs 2D action makes it worth your time.

Title: Invisible Inc. Review
Review: Invisible, Inc. has the right tools and the right talent, but it's not quite the flawless caper it almost was.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 13 hours with Invisible Inc, 8 on Beginner, 2 on normal, then an additional 3 getting shot at like crazy on Intermediate. Given there's a calm, determined female spy named Internationale, his biggest disappointment is that there isn't a psycho, gun-crazy Southern Belle named Domestique in the game.

Title: Vertiginous Golf Review
Review: Vertigo, mini-putt, and steampunk come together rather well in the deeply weird Vertiginous Golf.
Author Information: After sharpening his mini-putt skills in Vertiginous Golf, Brett‰Ûªs now ready to take on the local kids down at the amusement park.

Title: Last Word Review
Review: Last Word is mechanically dense, but its consistently sharp writing and layered battle system shine through the noise.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin enjoys RPGs of all shapes and sizes--even those that replace swords with wordplay. For the purposes of this review, he completed Last Word and explored much of the side content.

Title: Toren Review
Review: Toren shoots for the moon but lands nowhere special.
Author Information: Janine Hawkins played through Toren twice and still doesn't feel strongly about it. She has one single achievement left to complete, but that's not enough incentive to go back for thirds.

Title: Windward Review
Review: Windward is less of a high seas adventure and more of a soporific cruise for the geriatric crowd.
Author Information: Don was intrigued by Windward's promise of exploration and playing your own style but either found himself falling asleep or bitterly cursing in frustration with every second during the hours he spent with the game.

Title: Inside My Radio Review
Review: Inside My Radio's synesthetic experience is hypnotic.
Author Information: Don is also a professional music journalist, and when he has the chance to write about something that combines video games and music--two of his greatest passions--he grabs it. He spent just over two hours with Inside My Radio.

Title: Magicka: Wizard Wars Review
Review: Magicka: Wizard Wars does a lot of things right, but there is too little under the cowl.
Author Information: Magicka veteran Brett Todd put enough effort into learning the skill-based magical combat system of Magicka: Wizard Wars that he should be able to cast some real spells anytime now.

Title: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt Review
Review: The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is one of the best games ever made.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played all three Witcher games and read several of the novels. He spent about 100 hours with The Witcher 3 on a PlayStation 4 debug system, a version that included the games' day-one patch. He uses the word "ploughing" in everyday speech.

Title: Action Henk Review
Review: Action Henk is a speed-running platformer that keeps your heart racing.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey misses his glory days playing Sonic the Hedgehog, and Action Henk allowed him to relive that thrill for a short while. Now, does anyone know of some sturdy jeans? I have this hill I‰Ûªd like to try.

Title: StarDrive 2 Review
Review: StarDrive 2 is a competent 4X entry, but lacks standout features and is hampered by its ground combat.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli has spent thousands of hours eXploring, eXpanding, eXploiting, and eXterminating his way across galaxies. For the purposes of this review, he played through multiple campaigns on a variety of settings.

Title: Project CARS Review
Review: Project CARS offers a sharp racing simulation with an open-ended structure.
Author Information: Austin Walker spent 15 hours hugging the corners and shifting gears in Project CARS, but this isn‰Ûªt his first race. He grew up on Gran Turismo, learned to drive on Forza Motorsport, and isn‰Ûªt afraid to admit that he misses Project Gotham Racing.

Title: JumpJet Rex Review
Review: This 8-bit throwback perfectly emulates the era, for better and for worse.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through JumpJet Rex in about 4 1/2 hours total. His first ever thrown controller was at the wee age of 9, after losing his last turtle in the final Technodrome level of the NES Ninja Turtles game. It has been 12 years since he last threw a controller, during a particularly disastrous Contra: Shattered Soldier run. He didn't quite get to that point with Jump Jet Rex, but he thought about it reeeal hard.

Title: Attack On Titan: Humanity In Chains Review
Review: The anime and manga's kinetic action may seem primed for a video game adaptation, but Attack on Titan: Humanity in Chains is not likely what you were hoping for.
Author Information: Miguel watched and enjoyed the Attack on Titan anime and can only fantasize how much better it would‰Ûªve looked had it been produced in the 1980‰Ûªs. He has not read the manga nor has he played the visual novels. Combined, Miguel needed about 12 hours to clear the Story Mode and World Mode.

Title: The Weaponographist Review
Review: Speedy arena combat and a cartoon personality make The Weaponographist a retro-flavored dungeon worth crawling.
Author Information: A dozen or so hours later and Brett's no smarter, but his wrists hurt a whole lot from the merry mayhem in The Weaponographist.

Title: Remnants of Isolation Review
Review: Remnants of Isolation leans too heavily on a narrative that fails to deliver an emotional punch.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin was raised on turn-based RPGs, arguing to this day that Final Fantasy VIII is the best game Square has ever released. For the purpose of this review, he played Remnants of Isolation to completion and saw each of the three endings.

Title: Shin Megami Tensei: Devil Survivor 2 Record Breaker Review
Review: Devil Survivor 2: Record Breaker expands tremendously on an already excellent strategy RPG.
Author Information: Has it really been three years since the original Devil Survivor 2‰Ûªs release? Heidi thought she remembered every detail her original outing, but replaying the Septentriones scenario in Record Breaker brought back a lot of memories. Also, she still giggles when she hears characters say ‰ÛÏSaiduq‰Û because she imagines an all-powerful Pokemon.

Title: Color Guardians Review
Review: Color Guardians offers relentless difficulty and beautiful visuals but not much else.
Author Information: Jason Venter has jumped through magical worlds and even restored the occasional spot of color over the years, but he has seldom faced a stiffer challenge than the one he encountered within Color Guardians as he clawed his way to the final battle for the purposes of this review.

Title: BoxBoy! Review
Review: This 3DS game's disarming simplicity is a ruse that hides an addictive depth.
Author Information: After just over 10 hours, Justin collected all of the crowns, unlocked all the costumes, and had a lot of fun.

Title: Verdun Review
Review: Verdun brings multiplayer shooting to World War I in all its glory, as well as the frequent boredom.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has played dozens of military shooters, but none could prepare him for the more grounded life in the trenches. For the sake of this review, Cameron played about 20 hours, claiming enemy territory while occasionally meeting his match against barbed wire.

Title: Age of Wonders III: Eternal Lords Review
Review: The excellent Eternal Lords adds two new races, a new class, and lots of other features to an already solid core.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's fantasized about having a benevolent race of zombies for years. After 15 hours of tinkering in Eternal Lords, he finally got his wish.

Title: Lost Orbit Review
Review: It's simple and relatively short, but Lost Orbit's high-speed dodging action is fun while it lasts.
Author Information: Britton Peele's affinity for collecting things quickly led him to spend too much time playing NiGHTS: Into Dreams as a kid. He made sure to collect all the obtanium strewn around space in Lost Orbit, completing the game in under three hours but going back for some high score attempts afterward. He has has died in space more than 450 times so far.

Title: Halo: Spartan Strike Review
Review: This follow-up to Halo: Spartan Assault gives as much as it takes, adding Promethean weapons while depriving you of multiplayer.
Author Information: Since his last Halo review (Spartan Assault), Miguel‰Ûªs time with the series were spent on the Halo 5: Guardians beta and about 10 combined hours on Halo: The Master Chief Collection. It took Miguel about 5 hours to get through Halo: Spartan Strike, which included some Assault Ops-driven replays.

Title: I Am Bread Review
Review: In I Am Bread, both the joke and the game carry on far too long.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 5 hours on I Am Bread, averaging roughly an hour a stage.

Title: State of Decay: Year One Survival Edition Review
Review: State of Decay still hasn't become the game it wants to be.
Author Information: Don's never really thought too much about what he'd do if there was a zombie apocalypse, but State of Decay forced him to. He spent around 23 hours with the game.

Title: Ziggurat Review
Review: Ziggurat is a short but fast-paced roguelike shooter with only a few minor hang-ups.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent more than 12 hours sprinting through rooms and blasting skeletons in Ziggurat. He completed it multiple times, unlocking seven characters. His favorite so far is Kraz the Novice, a female wizard with exceptional wand mastery.

Title: Mortal Kombat X Review
Review: Mortal Kombat X successfully continues the tradition of mixing a fighting game with gore-laced slapstick.
Author Information: Peter got his first taste of Mortal Kombat with the original arcade game, and with only a few exceptions, has kept up with the series since. He spent the majority of his time with the PlayStation 4 version of the game for this review, taking his profile to level 38, and his faction profile to level 36.

Title: Tower of Guns Review
Review: The fantastic Tower of Guns combines the elegant dodging dance of bullet hell gameplay with a first-person shooter roguelike
Author Information: Tyler Hicks has played console shooters since the days of Goldeneye. At one point, he was number one on the Tower of Guns leaderboard, and currently sits at number six, with several multiple-hour dives into the game.

Title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions Evolved Review
Review: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions Evolved advances the challenge, satisfaction, and frustration of Geometry Wars 3 at every turn.
Author Information: If Don stopped and thought about how many hours he lost playing Geometry Wars Retro Evolved 2 in his dorm room (especially Pacifism mode), he'd experience a mild existential crisis. Don spent about 14 hours with the expansion (and at least two dozen hours with the base game when it was released).

Title: We Are Doomed Review
Review: We Are Doomed delivers a satisfying-feeling twin stick shooter, but does so without any flair whatsoever.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor is terrible at twin stick shooters, but managed to beat the game in relatively short order. You probably can beat it in actual short order, though.

Title: Crypt of the NecroDancer Review
Review: Rhythm and roguelike sync up in a fun twist on a common concept.
Author Information: Britton Peele doesn't spend a lot of time in crypts, but he did spend enough time playing Dance Dance Revolution as a teen that he was sure his rhythm skills would get him a girlfriend (they didn't). He spent more than 10 hours with Crypt of the Necrodancer for this review, beating the game with multiple characters.

Title: The Charnel House Trilogy Review
Review: The horror of The Charnel House Trilogy makes a slight mark, but it's not a lasting one.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd loves creepy games, adventure games, and narrative games, but The Charnel House Trilogy didn't click with him during the 90 minutes he spent playing it. Full disclosure: The Charnel House Trilogy's author, Ashton Raze, used to write reviews for GameSpot.

Title: Slow Down Bull Review
Review: Slow Down, Bull is a friendly and occasionally frustrating game with plenty of good morals to share and an admirable goal.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey was never that much of an artist, and not nearly as dedicated to the craft as Esteban the bull. During the course of this review, Cameron smiled more often than he grumbled in frustration, though he may have done so a good few times.

Title: Slender: The Arrival Review
Review: With the move to current-gen consoles and a few new levels, horror hit Slender continues to offer up scares, but at the cost of its own mystique.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey has now played through Slender: The Arrival three times (once on PC, twice on consoles), and is convinced that he'll have nightmares about the ghastly ghoulie for the rest of his life.

Title: Broken Age: Act 2 Review
Review: Broken Age: Act II solves nearly all of the sins of the first half of the game while stumbling into a fair share of new ones.
Author Information: Don is a Double Fine type of guy. He'll talk your ear off about the Milkman Conspiracy. (The truth is out there.) Don spent around 9 hours with Act II of Broken Age, although a good hour and a half was backtracking.

Title: Infinite Crisis Review
Review: Infinite Crisis is not the hero to save the MOBA genre.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks could be labeled a MOBA connoisseur if such a thing existed, he has tasted and sampled a full array of the DotA-cloned games. For the purposes of this review, he reached account level 12 and dominated several Coast City games from the Urban Jungle.

Title: Titan Souls Review
Review: Titan Souls stretches its simple structure to its breaking point, but before that time comes, it's an intriguing game and a fair but fun challenge.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd finished Titan Souls in about four hours, and is tired of people comparing it (and lots of other games) to Dark Souls just because it's hard and requires repetition. Kevin is also, apparently, a curmudgeon.

Title: Assassin's Creed Chronicles: China Review
Review: It is the most sumptuous and stealth-focused Assassin's Creed yet, but Chronicles: China doesn't assemble its pieces into a gratifying whole.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played almost every Assassin's Creed game, though he hasn't yet finished Unity or even started Rogue--and isn't sure he ever will. He also fondly recalls Assassin's Creed II: Discovery, a 2D Assassin's Creed that captured the series' spirit better than Chronicles: China does.

Title: VoidExpanse Review
Review: VoidExpanse's boring rendition of space exploration makes staying on Earth the more appealing option.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has explored space (digitally) more times than he can count. He played VoidExpanse for a couple dozen hours. He finds this byline almost as boring as he found VoidExpanse.

Title: Dungeons 2 Review
Review: Dungeons 2 is a decent mashup of Dungeon Keeper and real-time strategy conventions, but oversimplification keeps it from being a keeper.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelance game critic from Goliad, Texas who's been raiding and keeping dungeons since the the '80s, and who kinda sorta enjoyed Dungeons when it first came out in 2011. For the purposes of this review, he played Dungeons 2 for around 14 hours.

Title: Affordable Space Adventures Review
Review: The fun and atmospheric Affordable Space Adventures lives up to its quirky title.
Author Information: Jason Venter has never left Earth's atmosphere, but he likes Velcro and Tang as much as the next guy. He spent around eight hours with Affordable Space Adventures prior to writing his review, and played through to the closing credits.

Title: Harold Review
Review: Harold is an infinite-runner platformer that's as pretty as it is punishing.
Author Information: No stranger to soul-crushing games, Matt didn't expect Harold to be so difficult. After not achieving better than 3rd place in any race--and failing to finish others--he was set straight faster than a trouble-making toddler in a time out.

Title: Paperbound Review
Review: Paperbound is a thrilling multiplayer arena game, but too few game modes and lack of an online feature makes it only an occasional party favorite.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent several hours with Paperbound and several friends. He now counts Paperbound among his favorite party games, and looks forward to taking the monk, his favorite character, back to the winner‰Ûªs circle in the near future.

Title: Dark Souls II: Scholar of the First Sin Review
Review: Dark Souls II comes to current gen with a vengeance.
Author Information: Justin Clark has been getting the holy hell kicked out of him by From Software since Demon's Souls. After 105 hours, and deaths numbering surely into the thousands, this new version was no different, but this represents the first time he has actually persevered and beat the game. Full of hubris, he currently awaits a copy of Bloodborne, while re-enacting that torch scene from Predator on top of his roof.

Title: Worlds of Magic Review
Review: Worlds of Magic is the spiritual successor to the 1994 game Master of Magic, but it disappoints even by 1990s standards.
Author Information: Dan Starkey spent about 24 hours waiting for something interesting to happen in Worlds of Magic. He's kept up with the recent influx of fantasy 4X games, and Worlds of Magic is the worst by far.

Title: Pillars of Eternity Review
Review: Pillars of Eternity is a lengthy and enjoyable role-playing game that springs from a time-honored tradition.
Author Information: Kevin has played every Infinity Engine game several times over, though he thinks Planescape: Torment remains at the apex. He does have a fondness for Icewind Dale, however, due to its fantastic soundtrack. He finished Pillars of Eternity in about 55 hours, with good reputations with Gilded Vale, Defiance Bay, Dyrford Village, Twin Elms, Knights of the Crucible, Ovates of the Golden Grove, and The Fangs. The Dozens, House Doemenel, and Ethik Nol hate him, though.

Title: Bastion Review
Review: Bastion remains as strong of a game as it was in 2011, but there's no need to buy this version if you already own it.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelancer who writes about games on a ranch north of Goliad, Texas, which has known its fair share of calamities. Fortunately, even though he's pretty good with a bow, he's never had to use it against slimy monsters of the like in Bastion. For the purposes of this review, he played Bastion for around six hours.

Title: Etrian Mystery Dungeon Review
Review: Etrian Mystery Dungeon is a punishing RPG that's difficult to put down thanks to a rich supply of loot and deep dungeons.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin delves into his fair share of virtual dungeons, picking up anything shiny that catches his eye. For the purpose of this review, he played Etrian Mystery Dungeon to completion and finished many of the quests following the story's end. The game was provided for review by Atlus.

Title: Story of Seasons Review
Review: Despite its nagging restrictions, Story of Seasons is an absorbing farming game with a wonderful sense of progression.
Author Information: Josiah (begrudgingly) worked on a farm in his younger years, and has spent countless hours with the Harvest Moon series. For the purpose of this review, he explored the different seasons and expanded his farm far beyond its humble beginnings.

Title: Three Fourths Home: Extended Edition Review
Review: Three Fourths Home is a tense and personal interactive short story.
Author Information: Austin Walker has spent hundreds of hours driving around aimlessly at night. He also spent last year playing interactive fiction games like 80 Days, Elegy for a Dead World, and Skulljhabit.

Title: Xenoblade Chronicles 3D Review
Review: Xenoblade Chronicles 3D is a valiant attempt at bringing an ambitious and expansive RPG to the handheld realm. For the most part it works, but the original undoubtedly shines brighter ...
Author Information: Having ploughed over 100 happy hours into the original game, John was more than ready to put the 3DS re-release through its paces. He now craves something that can be completed in a weekend.

Title: Sunless Sea Review
Review: Amazing writing and a good sense of discovery makes Sunless Sea's glacial pace and mismatched roguelike elements worth plodding through.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor went through six different zee captains over 80 hours to bring you this review, and he still has yet to unravel all of what the Unterzee has to offer.

Title: Life is Strange Episode Two Review
Review: Life is Strange still suffers from some problematic dialogue and "gamey" sequences, but the emotional payoff is worth the effort.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea played through Life is Strange's second episode multiple times to see just how much impact she had on Max's world. She cried every time.

Title: Dragon Age: Inquisition - Jaws of Hakkon Review
Review: Jaws of Hakkon recalls the best bits Dragon Age: Inquisition, with a couple of caveats.
Author Information: Austin Walker has spent hundreds of hours in Dragon Age‰Ûªs world of Thedas over the last six years. When he isn‰Ûªt slaying dragons and fighting the blight, he‰Ûªs exploring the wastelands of Fallout or zooming across the galaxy of Mass Effect. He was last seen knee-deep in the sewers of Bloodborne‰Ûªs Yharnum. Send help.

Title: MLB 15: The Show Review
Review: Minor refinements have noticeable impact on MLB 15: The Show, another rousing simulation of the national pastime.
Author Information: Brett spent the better part of a week getting lost in one of his favorite rites of spring, the latest edition of MLB: The Show.

Title: Dyscourse Review
Review: Dyscourse's charming writing and sense of urgency makes this island one on which you won't mind getting lost.
Author Information: Don loves Lost. It's one of his top five favorite shows ever. And Dyscourse is a way better Lost video game than Via Domus was. He spent a little over 3 hours with the game over the course of three playthroughs.

Title: Borderlands: The Handsome Collection Review
Review: Borderlands: The Handsome Collection rolls out enhanced visuals and a massive amount of content, though problems with its weaker half prevent it from completely reaching the stars.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has carved a legacy for himself on Pandora and Elpis. He has slipped into the shadows as a haiku-reciting cyber ninja, and annoyed the hell out of his allies as yammering, wheeled trashcan robot. With The Handsome Collection, he plans on doing it all again, while looking forward to his next adventure on Pandora.

Title: Axiom Verge Review
Review: Axiom Verge is an excellent example of inspired game design that takes old ideas and improves upon them, leaving a mark that won't soon be forgotten.
Author Information: Peter spent nearly 20 hours playing Axiom Verge, and still can't get enough of it.

Title: Dreamfall Chapters Book Two: Rebels Review
Review: Book Two's excellent cast of characters kicks Dreamfall Chapters into action.
Author Information: Jay Pullman‰Ûªs favorite adventure game of all time is The Longest Journey, even though he still gets a migraine whenever he sees a rubber duck. He spent over 10 hours with Dreamfall Chapters‰Ûª second episode and needs a nap. Full disclosure: Jay donated $25 to Dreamfall Chapters‰Ûª Kickstarter campaign.

Title: Bloodborne Review
Review: Bloodborne's excellent action, beautiful artistry, and religious melodrama make it another must-play in the Demon's Souls tradition.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd's favorite game of the preceding generation is Dark Souls, so he was prepared for the challenge that lay before him. He finished Bloodborne in about 60 hours, at level 90, and beat several--but not all--of its optional bosses. He is now at level 101 and two bosses into a new-game-plus.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode Three ‰ÛÒ The Sword in the Darkness Review
Review: Telltale's journey through Westeros has hit a high point.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is a masochist and played through Episode Three four times in an attempt to get every possible outcome. Her poor little heart can't take it anymore.

Title: Resogun Defenders Review
Review: Resogun: Defenders delivers more energetic action in two new modes.
Author Information: Peter played through both Protector mode and Commando mode for as long as his thumbs and eyes could handle, and still went back in from one more attempt at a high score.

Title: Sid Meier's Starships Review
Review: Sid Meier's Starships stretches a thin premise over barebones gameplay systems.
Author Information: Nick played numerous games of Sid Meier's Starships for the purposes of this review, using game code provided by 2K Games. He wishes it didn't run out of ideas just a couple of hours in.

Title: Woolfe - The Red Hood Diaries Review
Review: Underneath Woolfe's pretty veneer lies a broken, paper-thin game.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through the available missions in a shade under 3 hours, with an estimated 15 minutes total spent rolling his eyes at the poetry.

Title: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode Four Review
Review: Claire and Barry's trip to the island from hell is almost over, but how it ends is up to you.
Author Information: Peter played through Episode Four twice (and part of Episode Three) during the course of this review.

Title: Frozen Cortex Review
Review: Frozen Cortex has developed an entertainingly simple, scalable future sport.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli played sixteen hours of Frozen Cortex for the purpose of this review. His favorite multiplayer match he played was a 2-0 grind-it-out victory because DEFENSE WINS CHAMPIONSHIPS.

Title: LA Cops Review
Review: Playing LA Cops is like doing hard time.
Author Information: Jason Venter spent around six hours with LA Cops, which was time enough to complete the campaign and play around with post-game content and multiple difficulty settings. He was last spotted wishing the game's second half were as enjoyable as its first half.

Title: Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball Review
Review: It‰Ûªs an audiovisual treat, but Robot Roller-Derby Disco Dodgeball just doesn‰Ûªt have staying power.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin never got picked first for dodgeball in gym class, but he still knows how to throw with some serious heat. For the purpose of this review, he tested all of the game‰Ûªs single and multiplayer offerings, spending hours on the neon battlefield.

Title: Tales from the Borderlands: Episode Two ‰ÛÓ Atlas Mugged Review
Review: Tales from the Borderlands continues to tickle your funny bone and warm your heart with its second episode.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea tried several different paths through Atlas Mugged, and ultimately, all of them made her snort-laugh.

Title: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel - Claptastic Voyage Review
Review: Claptastic Voyage tries to shine with awesome new weapons, enemy types, and some incredible environments, but lackluster missions tarnish the luster.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent dozens and dozens of hours shooting and looting across Pandora and its moon. Borderlands 2 is his favorite of the series, but Claptrap will always be his first choice as vault hunter. For this review, Cameron spent around 10 hours, completing the main mission and all the side quests.

Title: There Came An Echo Review
Review: In this strategy game where you command real-time tactical battles entirely with your voice, the greatest threat is the voice recognition system itself.
Author Information: Daniel spent roughly ten hours talking to his squad members and trying to get them to listen, alternately tweaking the voice recognition settings and just using the mouse to actually issue commands instead.

Title: Shelter 2 Review
Review: Shelter returns, bigger than before, yet somehow lesser for it.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to get through Shelter 2 in about two hours after two dismal false starts, one in which the cubs starved to death, and another in which all the cubs got eaten by wolves. Fact of life: You're not a real parent unless you've had to bite your kid on the neck and drag him away before he gets eaten by wolves.

Title: Bladestorm: Nightmare Review
Review: A mix of Musou, strategy, and pure insanity, Bladestorm ends up missing the mark with all three.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent 10 hours on the Hundred Years War scenario, and five on Nightmare. His favorite memory of the game came from his mother, a retired history teacher who, when told about evil Joan of Arc's story, said, ‰ÛÏThat sounds like something she'd do.‰Û

Title: White Night Review
Review: White Night hints at a horror story of quality, but it's hidden in the shadows of tedium and visual ambiguity.
Author Information: Britton Peele is afraid of being alone in the dark, and he's smart enough to keep a flashlight handy instead of relying on matchsticks. He finished White Night after seven hours of play time, gathering most of the collectibles along the way.

Title: Deathtrap Review
Review: Deathtrap is a solid genre mash-up that goes on the (tower) defensive.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 10 hours running through Deathtrap's dungeons, primarily as a sorceress, and ended up at level 17. For the record, his favorite deathtraps were the frost beam, the spear trap, and the Arby's about 3 miles down the road from his old apartment.

Title: Trash TV Review
Review: Trash TV is a fun sidescrolling puzzler about weapon-wielding TVs, but its conventional platforming and short running time spoil some of the fun.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a freelancer who writes about games on a ranch north of Goliad, Texas, where he often has to contend with roosters crowing as he plays games like Trash TV. For the purposes of this review, he played Trash TV for around five hours, using the second playthrough as an attempt to pull off a speed run.

Title: Code Name S.T.E.A.M Review
Review: Code Name: S.T.E.A.M. fails to live up to its potential, offering a clunky and frustrating tactical experience.
Author Information: Austin Walker has spent the last few years enjoying the renaissance of tactical RPGs. He dumped dozens of hours into XCOM, devoured Shadowrun Returns, and leaped for joy at the PC re-release of Valkyria Chronicles. He even drew a chart to plan his Fire Emblem: Awakening character pairings.

Title: Ori and the Blind Forest Review
Review: Ori and the Blind Forest is a rapturous platformer that is as fun as it is beautiful.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent about 12 hours with Ori and the Blind Forest, but has yet to find every collectible and earn every skill upgrade. It is the first game of 2015 that has made him imagine putting it on his end-of-year top 10 list.

Title: Final Fantasy Type-0 HD Review
Review: Final Fantasy Type-0's storyline may not be the most engaging, but it's combat system makes it hard to put down.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea took close to 30 hours to save the world of Orience. This fantasy is definitely not her final one.

Title: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode Three Review
Review: The third episode of Resident Evil: Revelations 2 takes the partner system and the story to great places.
Author Information: Peter played through Episode Three in just under three hours.

Title: DmC: Devil May Cry Definitive Edition Review
Review: In its Definitive Edition form, DmC Devil May Cry isn't just a better version of DmC--it's a bonafide hack 'n' slash classic.
Author Information: Mark is a huge hack 'n' slash fan and has reviewed the likes of the amazing Bayonetta 2, and well as the original DmC: Devil May Cry. He played through the Definitive Edition with Hardcore and Turbo modifiers activated on Nephilim difficulty.

Title: Mario Party 10 Review
Review: While there are some moments to be had with Mario Party 10's minigames, it doesn't have the depth or the challenge to hold your attention for long.
Author Information: Having grown up with the NES and Gameboy, Mark has long been a big Nintendo fan. For the purposes of this review, Mark enlisted the help of the GameSpot UK crew, as well as members of sister sites XCAR and CNET for several trips round the board.

Title: Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number Review
Review: Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number is a challenging and stylish game which entertains throughout, and delights in forcing you out of your comfort zone.
Author Information: Danny is a lifelong fan of electronic music and loved the first Hotline Miami. Upon completing Hotline Miami 2: Wrong Number, he spent $70 on the limited edition vinyl LP and returned to complete it again on hard mode. He reviewed the PC version mostly using the keyboard & mouse.

Title: Battlefield: Hardline Review
Review: As Battlefield leaves the battlefield, Visceral Games tailors the series‰Ûª distinct vehicular-based multiplayer for the crime-ridden streets of Miami and L.A. with mostly positive results.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs review is based on 18 hours in multiplayer across all its modes, and completion of the campaign on Expert difficulty. He still grins that the thought of holding up another braindead thief in the single-player mode, while Hardline‰Ûªs stealth gameplay makes him crave a Metal Gear Solid marathon.

Title: Q*Bert Rebooted Review
Review: Q*bert: Rebooted will leave you struggling with awful controls when you‰Ûªre not nodding off to the tedium.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey grew up playing his dad‰Ûªs Atari 2600, and grew up with icons such as Pac-Man, Frogger, and of course Q*bert. He still believes that a proper return for Q*bert is possible, but Q*bert: Rebooted isn‰Ûªt it.

Title: Lords of the Fallen - Ancient Labyrinth Review
Review: Lords of the Fallen's long-awaited add-on is an unimaginative rip-off.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd loved Lords of the Fallen. Imagine his disappointment when Ancient Labyrinth turned out to be so, so unnecessary. It took him about 30 minutes to reach The Keeper, and a good 10 tries to defeat it.

Title: OlliOlli2 Review
Review: OlliOlli2 adds few changes to the original game's formula, but "more of the same" is enough to make this excellent sequel a consistent joy.
Author Information: The original OlliOlli was one of Britton Peele's favorite games of 2014. In OlliOlli2 he cleared every Amateur stage, completed many of the game's challenges, and nailed hundreds of perfect grinds before writing this review.

Title: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Tipping Stars Review
Review: Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Tipping Stars takes too long before it truly tickles your brain.
Author Information: Don was never much of a Lego kid, but "construction puzzlers" like World of Goo have always been fun diversions. Don spent around 5 hours with Mario vs. Donkey Kong: Tipping Stars and is considering going back to beat those tough bonus levels soon.

Title: Homeworld Remastered Collection Review
Review: Not every change in this collection is for the best, but Homeworld and Homeworld 2 remain gorgeous classics that withstand the test of time.
Author Information: Homeworld is one of Kevin VanOrd's lifetime top-ten games. He has played it and its sequel many times, and he was happy to again revisit its epic strategizing. For this review, he finished both campaigns, with took him about 16 hours in all, give or take, and played a number of one-off skirmishes.

Title: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode Two Review
Review: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode 2 offers a few great action sequences, but it's still plagued by mundane puzzles and forced reliance on your partner.
Author Information: Peter breezed through episode two of Resident Evil: Revelations 2 in about two hours, and was glad it only took 36 minutes to complete Barry's chapter.

Title: Dragon Ball: Xenoverse Review
Review: Dragon Ball Xenoverse doesn‰Ûªt excel as a fighting game, but the customization options and fresh story beats add a new spin to a stagnant series.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin has seen every Dragon Ball Z saga at least seven times, and is still recovering from Dragon Ball Evolution. For the purpose of this review, he played Xenoverse to completion and created a character using each of the provided species.

Title: Oreshika: Tainted Bloodlines Review
Review: The Vita gets some more JRPG love, but with a remarkable twist.
Author Information: Justin Clark's clan went through 9 generations of his clan before writing his review. His only regret is sleeping with the wolf god. It gave all the kids on that side ratty green hair. And the mange, he's pretty sure. Don't ask where.

Title: Aaru's Awakening Review
Review: Aaru's Awakening is gorgeous to behold and a chore to play.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is currently playing Rayman Legends, whose fluid gameplay provides a sharp contrast to Aaru's Awakening's clumsiness. He played Aaru's Awakening for about five hours, two of which were spent trying to finish the game's third boss.

Title: Republique Review
Review: Strong dystopian storytelling powers this fascinating and fresh take on the stealth genre.
Author Information: Justin Clark got through all three available episodes in about 5 hours, spent a half hour frantically trying to find out if there was a release date for Episode 4, and 15 minutes screaming at an uncaring laptop screen that there isn't one yet.

Title: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 - Episode One Review
Review: Resident Evil: Revelations 2 gets off to a rough start with poor writing and safe design choices, but it's redeemed by strong doses of tension during the second act.
Author Information: Peter beat the first episode of Revelations 2 in less than three hours before giving co-op a try, and he spent a few more hours chasing high scores in raid mode as both Barry and Claire.

Title: Oblitus Review
Review: Oblitus is a entertaining and challenging 2D roguelike inspired by Dark Souls, with only a few issues marring its success.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a South Texan who loves platformers and Dark Souls, so playing Oblitus was a match made in Boletaria. He also loves the ridiculously awesome posters that were designed to hype Oblitus' release. For the purposes of this review, he dodged condors and stabbed forest mutants for around eight hours.

Title: Hand of Fate Review
Review: Hand of Fate blends various elements of role-playing games and card games into a single, satisfying romp.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has been playing role-playing games longer than he can remember. (Insert old joke here.) He has spent 20 hours or so with Hand of Fate, playing through the campaign and seeking success in Endless Mode.

Title: Screamride Review
Review: Screamride is good, destructive fun in spite of some frustrating limits on creation.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has rarely ridden a roller coaster he didn't like. His first was The Big Bad Wolf at Busch Gardens Williamsburg, and he never looked back. He played Rollercoaster Tycoon and Rollercoaster Tycoon 2 religiously, and of the hundred hours he spent with Rollercoaster Tycoon 3, at least a dozen were spent creating fireworks displays. Kevin spent about a dozen hours with Screamride, completing the career and digging into creation.

Title: Helldivers Review
Review: Helldivers is a persistent online universe rich in combat but low on story.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is no stranger to playing a bug-stomping space marine. He‰Ûªs always on the lookout for new planets to claim and new foes to liberate--hopefully with a big space gun. For this review, Cameron played more than 25 hours, reaching level 16, and making it all the way to the bug home planet before being kindly, but firmly, asked to leave.

Title: Grow Home Review
Review: Grow Home combines experimental animation and beautiful world-building to create something unique.
Author Information: Austin Walker finds himself playing lots of open world games with vertical exploration, like Saints Row 4 and the Assassin‰Ûªs Creed series. When he isn‰Ûªt scaling rooftops, he‰Ûªs digging into intimate games like Bientot l‰Ûªete and Thirty Flights of Loving.

Title: Heroes of Might & Magic III - HD Edition Review
Review: Heroes of Might & Magic III is still an all-time classic, although there are better and cheaper ways to revisit the past than this HD remake.
Author Information: Brett lives in the past pretty much all the time, anyhow, but even more so this last week thanks to the high-res version of 1999 on offer in HOMM III HD.

Title: Criminal Girls: Invite Only Review
Review: Criminal Girls' interesting combat isn't enough to legitimize this tawdry slog through lifeless dungeons.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin often finds himself playing the oddest imports coming out of Japan, spending hours crawling through dungeons and picking up side quests. For the purposes of this review, he scoured every floor of Hell in Criminal Girls.

Title: Kirby and the Rainbow Curse Review
Review: Kirby and the Rainbow Curse oversimplifies its mechanics, making for an experience alternating between frustrating and dull.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea stuck with Kirby all the way to the end for Rainbow Curse. Everything is rainbows.

Title: Total War: Attila Review
Review: Total War: Attila is an arranged marriage between a capable (and aging) battle simulator, and a fussy political one.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is no stranger to war of the most total variety. He spent a few dozen hours with Total War: Attila, as the Huns, the Vandals, the Ostrogoths, and the Sassanids in their grand campaigns, as well as a smattering of one-off historical battles.

Title: The Legend of Candlewind: Nights & Candles Review
Review: Even the most committed retro RPGer should pass on the appalling Legend of Candlewind.
Author Information: Brett needs a better Eye of the Beholder clone, or a trip back to 1991 where he can play the real thing all over again.

Title: Elite: Dangerous Review
Review: Elite: Dangerous is an inch deep, and 100,000 light years wide.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli spent dozens of hours in Elite: Dangerous, traveling, trading, fighting, and discovering new and interesting ways to run afoul of space station security systems.

Title: The Legend of Zelda: Majora's Mask 3D Review
Review: New time management tools and tweaked battles make Majora‰Ûªs Mask 3D a comfortable fit for Nintendo‰Ûªs handheld.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has met with a terrible fate. But she has successfully ushered Termina into better days without a leering satellite plummeting towards it.

Title: Apotheon Review
Review: Apotheon builds a wonderfully modern game upon classic Greek tragedy.
Author Information: Dan Starkey has always been enamored with Greek myth. He spent ten hours battling his favorite gods and goddesses for the sake of this review.

Title: Raven's Cry Review
Review: A game where its most tolerable moments are tedious at best, Raven's Cry is a shipwreck of poor decisions and atrocious execution.
Author Information: Don doesn't mind being a pirate in video games, but he probably wouldn't want to be one in real life just cause of the puffy shirts alone. He spent 17 hours with Raven's Cry before a game-killing bug forced him to stop.

Title: The Order: 1886 Review
Review: The Order: 1886 is a boring collection of game cliches that betrays its fascinating premise.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has rarely met a game set in Victorian London he didn't like, but The Order: 1886 has proven to be the exception. It took him six hours to finish The Order, playing some at medium difficulty and some on hard, and he has no desire to return to it.

Title: #IDARB Review
Review: #IDARB combines the interactivity of Twitch Plays Pokemon with simple, raw competition.
