Author Information: Tyler Hicks has yet to drop a game of #IDARB in matchmaking, and has even been known to school professional gamers in the intricacies of the 5-point shot. For this review he completed the single player campaign and went on a reign of terror in matchmaking as Divekick's Mr. N.

Title: The Escapists Review
Review: The Escapists is a thrilling game that challenges you to break out of prison in a number of different ways.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey believes he‰Ûªs too pretty to survive in prison, but feels he‰Ûªs somewhat more prepared after playing The Escapist (he‰Ûªs most likely incorrect.) In this review, Cameron spent more than 50 hours completing the six primary prisons, and feels excited to return to finish off the bonus ones soon.

Title: Evolve Review
Review: Evolve is a tense and gratifying online shooter.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent a good 30 hours with Evolve, playing with strangers, friends, and bots via matchmaking and invite both. His favorite online shooter is still probably Battlefield 2, though Unreal Tournament 2004 and Half-Life 2 Deathmatch also hold special places in his heart. He'll also patiently explain why Killzone 2's competitive play is awesome to anyone willing to listen. Kevin's favorite Evolve hunter is Parnell, and his favorite monster is the Wraith.

Title: Life is Strange Episode One Review
Review: The episodic Life is Strange is off to a good start, featuring sympathetic characters and tense social situations.
Author Information: Kevin finished the first episode of Life is Strange in about 2 hours, and noticed he missed a few conversation opportunities when the game summarized his choices at the end. He might not be Max's age anymore, but the game made him feel 19 all over again.

Title: Gravity Ghost Review
Review: Gravity Ghost combines gorgeous art with haunting themes in a slick physics platformer that is over far too soon.
Author Information: Don has a soft spot in his heart for well-crafted children's fiction, and Gravity Ghost scratches that itch with aplomb. He spent just over three hours with the game for review.

Title: Blackguards 2 Review
Review: Sinister protagonists and smart tactical combat make Blackguards 2 a compelling exercise in evil.
Author Information: Slaughtering innocents and hanging peasants occupied Brett even more than usual this week, especially during the 20 or so hours he played Blackguards 2.

Title: Monster Hunter 4 Ultimate Review
Review: Do you enjoy murdering wild animals and then wearing their skins as trophies? Everyone needs a hobby, but consider giving it a rest and play this instead.
Author Information: Sean Bell has spent in excess of 500 hours playing the Monster Hunter series, and once nearly lost his mind hunting the same monster over 30 times in one afternoon.

Title: Switch Galaxy Ultra Review
Review: Switch Galaxy Ultra provides a thrilling sense of speed, but a lack of meaningful incentives dulls the fun.
Author Information: Don is down for intense arcade racers and has fond memories of wasting too many hours with Audiosurf. He spent over 10 hours with Switch Galaxy Ultra for this review.

Title: Saints Row IV: Gat out of Hell Review
Review: Saints Row rides onto new platforms, and a good standalone expansion follows with it.
Author Information: Justin Clark finished Gat Out Of Hell in just under five hours, with about 69% complete, and an extra hour spent on the loyalty missions after the fact. Mostly, just to keep hanging out with MC Shakespeare.

Title: The Marvellous Miss Take Review
Review: This accessible heist game demands confidence from you, but ultimately short-circuit that aim due to inconsistent AI and dull level design.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor knows a good stealth game when he plays it, but thirty hours banging his head on the crowded, difficult levels in The Marvellous Miss Take over and over was a bit much. Shame, because it was almost good.

Title: Grim Fandango Remastered Review
Review: Grim Fandango remains an absolute delight--funny, good-hearted, and fun to play.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played Grim Fandango in 1998, the year it came out. He was 26. Yes, he's old.

Title: Nosgoth Review
Review: Nosgoth isn‰Ûªt quite what Legacy of Kain fans are looking for, but provides plenty of exciting multiplayer battles starring humans and vampires.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is a huge fan of Legacy of Kain: Soul Reaver, the first game he experienced in the series, which he played on his Dreamcast many years ago. While Cameron still holds onto hope that a proper return for Legacy of Kain is in the future, he still enjoyed his time in Nosgoth, but now his neighbors would like him to stop stalking them from the rooftops.

Title: Citizens of Earth Review
Review: Citizens of Earth wins hearts and minds, but still loses in a few key states.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent many hours meeting and greeting the good people of Crystal City, 30 of which spent seriously hemming and hawing about what to name the vice president before settling on "V.P. Likeaboss."

Title: Grey Goo Review
Review: Great gameplay and a modern look make Grey Goo an excellent traditional RTS.
Author Information: Brett got gooey for over 18 hours in the course of writing this review.

Title: Dying Light Review
Review: Dying Light has plenty of rewards to offer as long as you're willing to overlook its frustrations.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent about 40 hours with Dying Light. He was never a fan of the Dead Island games, but he developed a fondness for Dying Light, and absolutely enjoys it more than Dead Island.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode Two - The Lost Lords Review
Review: With the stage setting done, the second episode of Game of Thrones feels like something plucked straight from the source material--gut wrenching, tense, and bloody.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea always pays her debts. In order to do so, she played through the episode multiple times to explore all choices available to her.

Title: Sunset Overdrive and the Mystery of the Mooil Rig! Review
Review: This first return to Sunset City succeeds as a dessert-sampler complement to Insomniac Games‰Ûª 2014 hit.
Author Information: Going into this assignment, Miguel had completed the main story of Sunset Overdrive and amassed a complete collection of Sunset City smartphones. Miguel took about two hours to complete this expansion‰Ûªs story and another three hours on the side content. As a former Sega fanatic, the comparisons to Jet Set Radio aren‰Ûªt lost on Miguel, though he appreciates both games‰Ûª positive differences as well.

Title: Resident Evil HD Remastered Review
Review: Resident Evil HD--a high-definition re-release of a remake of a classic--proves that sometimes the best adventures are the simplest ones.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played most of the Resident Evil games, and RE4 still remains his favorite. His review of Resident Evil 6 has to this day earned him more ire than any other, but he believes history will be on his side. He played Resident Evil HD twice, once as Jill and once as Chris, but he missed the best ending both times.

Title: Loadout Review
Review: Loadout brings its robust weaponcrafting, extreme violence, and goofy sense of humor to the PlayStation 4, and with entertaining results.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is always on the hunt for great free-to-play games, and Loadout is one of his top choices. After crafting 10 weapons, Cameron's favorite is Scorched Earf, a lovely rocket launcher that either sends enemies running, or turns them into piles of ash. They're good friends.

Title: Kalimba Review
Review: Kalimba's multitasking isn‰Ûªt as gimmicky as its two-character gameplay premise implies.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs seasoned (but not encyclopedic) knowledge of side-scrolling platformers was more than enough to tackle all of Kalimba‰Ûªs story mode while his wife helped him with the co-op portion of the game. This complete playthrough--which included a handful of gold totems--makes Miguel wish for a remake of the PlayStation 2 version of The Adventures of Cookie and Cream.

Title: Scrolls Review
Review: Scrolls offers new depth to the collectible card genre, but a sluggish endgame robs some of the charm.
Author Information: Don has played dozens upon dozens of hours of Hearthstone and Magic: The Gathering. He put 30 hours into Scrolls for this review.

Title: Lost Constellation Review
Review: Lost Constellation is a brief and unique adventure game with nothing and everything to say, all at once.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played Lost Constellation three times now, each time playing out just a little differently than before. He calls his favorite snowman "Binky." It's a pet name.

Title: Persona Q: Shadow of the Labyrinth Review
Review: Persona Q is a cute and exceptionally enjoyable role-playing game that amplifies the series' humor to great effect.
Author Information: Heidi got Marie on her first run through the group date cafÌ©, but she was actually trying for Mitsuru. She got Naoto the second time. Maybe they really weren‰Ûªt destined to be. Heidi finished Persona Q in about 75 hours.

Title: World of Warcraft: Warlords of Draenor Review
Review: Warlords of Draenor is an exciting look at what it would be like if Draenor was never ripped asunder by the corruption of the Burning Legion.
Author Information: Brittany Vincent, Lady of War, has been an on-again, off-again (definitely on-again now) WoW player since its inception. She spent more than 35 hours in-game prior to this review and hopes to quadruple that amount in the near future.

Title: Tropico 5: Waterborne Review
Review: Giving El Presidente water wings in this gimmicky and skimpy expansion to Tropico 5 doesn‰Ûªt add much to the franchise‰Ûªs familiar Caribbean corruption.
Author Information: Corrupting the hearts and minds of Tropico 5's peasants was at the top of Brett‰Ûªs priority list for around eight hours while he was reviewing the Waterborne expansion.

Title: The Talos Principle Review
Review: Excellent puzzles are only the tip of the iceberg for The Talos Principle, an existential journey about what it is to be human.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor reasoned his way through forty hours of The Talos Principle, and after completing dozens of puzzle rooms, is pretty sure he needs a puzzle break.

Title: Destiny: The Dark Below Review
Review: Destiny gets darker with its new add-on, but the game itself isn't better for it.
Author Information: Not counting grind time, Justin Clark was able to get through the new Dark Below content in about five hours, spent many more with the Crota's End raid, and one quiet hour lounging on top of a bus in Skywatch contemplating the meaning of life before Urzok went and spoiled it for everybody.

Title: Shadows: Heretic Kingdoms Review
Review: Shadows: Heretic Kingdoms has fresh ideas, but needs more time to develop everything else.
Author Information: Brandin Tyrrel spent 30 hours marching through the Heretic Kingdoms with multiple starting characters despite the main quest line requiring only a third of that. Slaying the Lords of Hell in Diablo II remains his favorite hack-and-slash memory, though Titan Quest and Torchlight are not far behind.

Title: Elegy for a Dead World Review
Review: Elegy for a Dead World is an intriguing and attractive creation tool that fills a highly specific, highly underserved niche.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent about eight hours with Elegy for a Dead World, writing and reading stories until his creative well went dry and was filled again.

Title: Secret Ponchos Review
Review: Secret Ponchos exudes depth despite its limited features.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs review is based on a 101 matches where he boasts a respectable 40% win percentage, including Free For All matches (where he had five 1st place wins). His favorite Westerns include Once Upon A Time In The West, Unforgiven, and Tombstone.

Title: Assassin's Creed Unity: Dead Kings Review
Review: The now-free downloadable content for Assassin‰Ûªs Creed Unity kicks off with a passable new chapter that is neither a conclusion nor epilogue.
Author Information: Going into Dead Kings, Miguel had already become familiar with Ubisoft‰Ûªs vision of Paris after about 20 hours in Assassin‰Ûªs Creed Unity. (That included a 100-percent sychronization playthrough of the story.) Dead Kings served as a reminder that Miguel dislikes playing a gofer in open world storylines.

Title: Kingdom Hearts 2.5 HD 2.5 ReMIX Review
Review: Ten years later, Kingdom Hearts' stories suffer under preposterous complexity, but a refreshing heart still shines through.
Author Information: Don can remember eagerly awaiting the first Kingdom Hearts game's release when he was in middle school. He put 37 hours into Kingdom Hearts 2, 27 hours into Kingdom Hearts Birth by Sleep, and 3 hours with Re:Coded.

Title: JuJu Review
Review: Juju reaches valiantly for magic and finds out that someone broke the staff.
Author Information: Jason Venter has played through so many platformers that they've started to form a rainbow mass in his brain, but he happily spent several mostly relaxing hours bopping his way through the worlds featured in Juju for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Crew Review
Review: The Crew has a lot of missions and environments to explore, but there are myriad issues that get in the way of its positive aspects.
Author Information: For the majority of his time with The Crew, Peter played on his own with the same car. He only explored other options in the game because they were available, but quickly realized that playing with a crew and upgrading other cars simply wasn't with the effort.

Title: Tetris Ultimate Review
Review: It‰Ûªs a fine version of a classic, but there's little that's "ultimate" about Tetris Ultimate.
Author Information: Britton Peele has been staying up past his bedtime playing Tetris since the days of the original Game Boy. He conquered Tetris Ultimate's marathon mode, played against more than 10 online opponents and spent some time with local multiplayer before writing this review.

Title: Limbo Review
Review: The mystery and moodiness of Limbo remain beautifully intact on its new platform.
Author Information: Kevin played Limbo twice upon its initial release on the Xbox 360, and once more on the Xbox One for the purposes of this review. It took him about two hours this time around, in part because he got stuck on one of the late puzzles.

Title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Trilogy Review
Review: Phoenix Wright's first three adventures return on the 3DS, prettier but not better than ever.
Author Information: Justin Clark played the first two games in this compilation to death on the original DS, though this was his first full playthrough of the third. This is now the 5th time in a decade he has had to explain to someone out in the real world what exactly he was objecting to so vehemently in public.

Title: Geometry Wars 3: Dimensions Review
Review: Geometry Wars 3 is yet another great game in this dual-stick series that will leave your brain buzzing and your fingers numb.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played dozens of hours of Geometry Wars: Retro Evolved, and possibly hundreds of hours of its sequel. He's played about 20 hours of Geometry Wars 3, and suspects his playtime will reach the hundred-hour mark before the year ends.

Title: Defenders of Time Review
Review: Defenders of Time is an exciting tower defense game that no one's playing, making it difficult to actually enjoy its fast-paced action.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin isn't exactly a strategic mastermind, but he still enjoys testing his wits against other players online. For the purposes of this review, he played each of the six maps multiple times and even tried to lead a handful of teams as the Commander.

Title: Tales from the Borderlands: Episode One - Zer0 Sum Review
Review: Tales from the Borderlands is a beautiful new twist on the Borderlands experience with lovable leads and breathless action sequences.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is excited to return to Pandora under Telltale‰Ûªs guidance. She loves shooting and looting with her Mechromancer, but may love manipulating narratives to suit her whims even more.

Title: Game of Thrones: Episode One - Iron From Ice Review
Review: Game of Thrones‰Ûª first episode is a slow-burn beginning to a bloody political thriller with an original cast that shines.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea is the absolute worst about accidentally dropping Game of Thrones spoilers because she gets too excited and can‰Ûªt help herself. Don't talk to her.

Title: Super Smash Bros. for Wii U Review
Review: Super Smash Bros. for Wii U is among the best fighting games ever made.
Author Information: Dan Starkey can‰Ûªt remember a time when he wasn‰Ûªt playing Smash Bros. on a semi-regular basis. He met his best friend through Smash, he‰Ûªs got entire groups of friends that get together just to chat and play Smash Bros. He feels lucky to have spent around 90 hours so far with a game this superb, holding a Smash party, playing against the CPU, and competing online when he was lucky enough to enter a smooth match.

Title: Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker Review
Review: Captain Toad: Treasure Tracker is bound to warm your heart and challenge your intellect.
Author Information: Peter played through the entire game, minus a few bonus levels, while enjoying his time in the Toads' shoes, and for the first time with a Wii U game, he preferred to play on the GamePad instead of the TV.

Title: The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth Review
Review: More weirdness, more blasphemy, and more great action makes this remake of The Binding of Isaac spectacularly absorbing.
Author Information: Brett Todd confronted poo in all of its insidious guises for about seven hours in the course of writing this The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth review.

Title: Never Alone Review
Review: Upper One Games succeeds at bringing Native Alaskan cultural heritage to the fore, but fails at making a good platformer.
Author Information: Being Australian, Daniel has no idea what snow looks like, but after completing the game in just over four hours in a mixture of singleplayer and co-op, and watching all the Cultural Insights vignettes, he has a sudden desire to travel somewhere far north.

Title: Space Hulk: Ascension Edition Review
Review: A broader focus makes this Space Hulk sequel a better experience despite its brutal difficulty.
Author Information: Brett Todd flamed Genestealers for about 15 hours while reviewing Space Hulk: Ascension.

Title: How To Survive: Storm Warning Edition Review
Review: How to Survive returns in a fun but unimaginative compilation edition.
Author Information: It took about ten hours for Miguel to go through every mode of How To Survive: Storm Warning Edition, playing every section on Normal difficulty. He‰Ûªs played his share of zombie-themed games though he‰Ûªs not what one would call a zombie enthusiast. Unlike some, he doesn‰Ûªt believe there such a thing as too many (good) zombie games.

Title: Escape Dead Island Review
Review: Escape Dead Island is a competent yet unremarkable side story with remarkably shallow action.
Author Information: Miguel‰Ûªs 30-hour playthrough of the original Dead Island was the most time he has ever spent on a zombie game. Between the PC version, a completed playthrough of the PlayStation 3 version, and a sufficient look at the New Game+ mode, Miguel spent 15 hours in Escape Dead Island. This marks his fourth review game in a row that features a jungle. He now longs for a vast dense city or a fire level.

Title: Lego Batman 3: Beyond Gotham Review
Review: Lego Batman 3: Beyond Gotham celebrates the history of Batman while offering loads of extra content.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey, a fan of Lego and Batman for many years, couldn‰Ûªt decide if he should play Lego Batman 3 first, or build the included Batwing toy set and run it around the house making whooshing noises. Cameron finished the main story in around 15 hours, and spent more than five hours completing side quests and unlocking super heroes.

Title: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris Review
Review: Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris is a nice slice of good, lighthearted fun.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has embarked on all sorts of tomb-raiding adventures, so he felt at home with Lara Croft and the Temple of Osiris. He spent six hours with the game, some of them solo, but most of them with at least one other player.

Title: The Wolf Among Us Review
Review: Telltale's riff on the Fables series is far from child's play.
Author Information: Justin Clark has played through The Wolf Among Us twice, first on the PS3, episode by episode, and then on the PS4. He's read the first four compilations of the Fables graphic novels in the interim. For the record, he actually kinda prefers the game to the novels.

Title: Freedom Wars Review
Review: Exhilarating missions and a wonderfully versatile grappling hook make Freedom Wars a premiere cooperative experience.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor loves any and all games with satisfying grappling hook action. He played through the entirety of Freedom Wars' main campaign and dabbled in the postgame and multiplayer modes.

Title: WWE 2K15 Review
Review: Although the series' combat has never felt better, WWE 2K15 fails to deliver on the pomp and pageantry of professional wrestling.
Author Information: Don lost far too many hours playing the PS2-era WWE games at middle school lock-ins. He put roughly 20 hours into the last-gen version of WWE 2K15 and another 13 for the current-gen.

Title: Pokemon Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire Review
Review: Pokemon Omega Ruby and Alpha Sapphire resurrect two beloved games in style, and for better or worse, not much has changed.
Author Information: Peter fell in love with Pokemon years ago, but after a decade hiatus, he jumped back in the saddle for Pokemon X/Y and Omega Ruby/Alpha Sapphire. He played over 30 hours of Omega Ruby for the purposes of this review, and plans to continue playing until he catches, well, most of them.

Title: Speakeasy Review
Review: The drinks aren't the only thing watered down in Speakeasy.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to see all Speakeasy has to offer in an hour, though that hour ultimately stretched into several more.

Title: Little Big Planet 3 Review
Review: Little Big Planet 3‰Ûªs focus on creative expression is underutilized in its story campaign but shines in its level editor.
Author Information: Alexa Ray Corriea has been BFFs with Sackboy since his debut in 2008 and still can‰Ûªt get enough of those sweet, sweet prize bubbles. She played the entire story campaign and spent an inordinate amount of time building stuff.

Title: Adventure Time: The Secret of the Nameless Kingdom Review
Review: The Secret of the Nameless Kingdom is an unabashed if uninspired Zelda clone.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin loves the classic Legend of Zelda formula, even when it‰Ûªs dressed up as an Adventure Time game. For the purposes of this review, he watched many episodes of the TV show and saved the different princesses in The Secret of the Nameless Kingdom.

Title: Rollers of the Realm Review
Review: Rollers of the Realm is a good idea let down by its execution.
Author Information: Jason Venter has enjoyed a video pinball game or two on very nearly every system he has ever played, and more RPGs than he would care to count, so he was doubly disappointed when the several hours he spent with Rollers of the Realm failed to do justice to either genre.

Title: Randal's Monday Review
Review: Randal's Monday's strict adherence to bad design and unpleasant humor makes this one Monday you don't want to relive.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor spent over 20 hours puzzling over the nonsense in this game, even after breaking down and consulting the hint system numerous times.

Title: This War of Mine Review
Review: This War of Mine is survival horror game of a very different, very literal kind.
Author Information: Justin Clark went through This War of Mine with 5 separate groups of survivors, never making it more than a month. The longest survivor was a coffee drinking journalist named Katia. She killed herself after her last companion died on a scavenge. Justin then spent the rest of the evening watching Looney Tunes and cuddling his cat.

Title: Grand Theft Auto 5 PS4/Xbox One/PC Review
Review: GTA V remains a benchmark game, and its graphical improvements are hugely impressive, but it's the addition of a first-person mode that transforms it into a very different beast.
Author Information: In the 90s Mark bought a 3DFX card for his PC just so he could play the original Grand Theft Auto in all its high(ish) resolution glory. He has played every game in the series since, including the entirety of the original release of GTA V. For this new version Mark made his way through a hefty chunk of the campaign, and jumped online to take on jobs and rampages around Los Santos.

Title: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric Review
Review: Sonic Boom: Rise of Lyric is another plummet in the sad decline of the Sonic franchise.
Author Information: Sonic the Hedgehog was, alongside the Sega Genesis version of Aladdin, one of the first video games Don ever owned. Beating Rise of Lyric took him roughly 11 hours.

Title: Halo: The Master Chief Collection Review
Review: The Master Chief Collection's four campaigns are evergreen, but serious problems with online multiplayer are a blight on this compilation.
Author Information: A fan of Halo since its Macworld unveiling, Chris has played countless hours of Halo over the years. For this review, he played sizable chunks of each campaign using code provided by Microsoft. Once servers went live, he spent he better part of three days trying to get into online matches.

Title: Assassin's Creed Rogue Review
Review: Despite some intriguing Abstergo revelations, Assassin's Creed Rogue is a uninspired and only mildly entertaining adventure.
Author Information: After being a little disappointed with Assassin's Creed Unity, Mark was hoping Rogue might renew his faith in the franchise. Oh, how wrong he was.

Title: Dragon Age: Inquisition Review
Review: With the entertaining and thematically rich Inquisition, the Dragon Age series returns to its former glory.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played every major Dragon Age release. (Admittedly, he's never touched a Dragon Age on mobile platforms, or on Facebook.) His favorite party member in the series is Varric. He does not miss his previous Dragon Age love interest, Anders. (That jerk!) He spent 85 hours on the campaign, and several more in multiplayer. He played on Xbox One and PlayStation 4

Title: Assassin's Creed Unity Review
Review: Assassin's Creed Unity's recreation of a battle-scarred Paris is a joy to behold, but its so-so story doesn't make the most of this gorgeous setting.
Author Information: Mark has been a member of the brotherhood since Assassin's Creed II, but prefers to forget about ACIII. For the purposes of this review he completed the single-player, indulged in some co-op, and played through a good chunk of Unity's side quests.

Title: WWE 2K15 Review
Review: WWE 2K15's last-gen outing is a sad afterthought at the end of a console era.
Author Information: Don Saas would love to talk to you about how Seth Rollins and Dolph Ziggler should headline this year's Wrestlemania in an Iron Man match but knows it won't happen. He spent roughly 20 hours in the game for this review.

Title: Far Cry 4 Review
Review: Far Cry 4 is all about more: more fun things to do, more chances to create explosive chaos, and more opportunities for the story to make you cringe.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played every Far Cry game, beginning with the original PC classic. He thinks Blood Dragon might still be his favorite Far Cry experience, though he has liked every entry in its own way. He spent about 25 hours with Far Cry 4 in all, playing solo, cooperatively, and competitively.

Title: Ultimate NES Remix Review
Review: The NES Remix series finds the perfect home on 3DS.
Author Information: Mark's first console was a NES, which came boxed with a copy of Super Mario Bros. It was the best Christmas ever. He's managed to three star his way through most of NES Remix's challenges, but remains confused by Balloon Fight.

Title: NBA Live 15 Review
Review: NBA Live 15 is a step in the right direction, but that still doesn‰Ûªt make it a good basketball game.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin watches more basketball than he cares to admit, and plays just about everything carrying the NBA name each year. For the purposes of this review, he slogged his way through NBA Live 15‰Ûªs Rising Star mode, played multiple offline and online games, and explored the Dynasty feature.

Title: Call of Duty: Advanced Warfare Review
Review: Sledgehammer Games lays the groundwork for more futuristic Call of Duty games with a comprehensive multiplayer experience and a faulty but stimulating campaign.
Author Information: As a veteran of every mainline Call of Duty campaign, it took Miguel seven hours and change to complete Advanced Warfare‰Ûªs campaign on Hardened mode. He then spent approximately 25 hours combined on the adversarial multiplayer and co-op modes. He just might plan a trip to the real life version of Seoul, South Korea.

Title: A Bird Story Review
Review: A Bird Story is a short but bittersweet tale that uses sparse interaction to great effect.
Author Information: Justin Clark was able to clear A Bird Story in an hour. He promptly placed a phone call to his landlord about all the unexpected dust in his apartment getting into his eyes.

Title: Gabriel Knight: Sins of the Fathers 20th Anniversary Edition Review
Review: Gabriel Knight returns with a modern twist, bringing with him the good and the bad.
Author Information: Brandin Tyrrel maneuvered Gabriel Knight through 16 hours of murder, mystery, and melodrama, though he regularly stopped to smell the roses. His favorite point-and-click adventure series is still King‰Ûªs Quest.

Title: Planetary Annihilation Review
Review: It may be souped-up fast and super tough, but Planetary Annihilation still hooks you with intense combat and brilliant enemy AI.
Author Information: Brett Todd enjoyed but generally failed to keep up with Planetary Annihilation for about 14 hours in the course of writing this review.

Title: Pro Evolution Soccer 2015 Review
Review: PES 2015 is a genuine return to form for the series, one that competes with FIFA on every step, pass, and shot.
Author Information: A sports game obsessive, John has been hooked on football games since he was a mere eight years old. He is now significantly older than that. Many trophies were won and lost across the 15 hours spent playing PES 2015 for the purposes of this review, but more finals beckon in future. You might see him playing online as AS Roma.

Title: Football Manager 2015 Review
Review: Football Manager 2015 is the same game we've come to know and love, but in this case that's no bad thing.
Author Information: John Robertson has 18 years experience playing Football Manager, stretching back to when it was known as Championship Manager and Eric Cantona was considered a star signing. After failing with Dagenham and Redbridge, he started a new game and won the triple with Real Madrid. Glory hunter.

Title: Depth Review
Review: Depth's underwater twist on a familiar design comes up all wet.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is not an experienced diver or shark expert, and if he ever finds himself underwater in a shark cage, he will be happy to keep the door closed. But if he ever decides to go explore an undersea cave for treasure, he feels that Depth taught him enough to survive the experience. So long as someone else goes first.

Title: Dungeon of the Endless Review
Review: Dungeon of the Endless blends many different gameplay styles into a satisfying dungeon crawler.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey enjoys a good dungeon crawler, and Dungeon of the Endless quickly became one of his favorites. For the purpose of the review, Cameron spent more than 20 hours playing the game both online and off, unlocking a dozen characters in the process.

Title: The Unfinished Swan Review
Review: The Unfinished Swan on the PlayStation 4 is a pretty game made prettier, and a gentle charmer in its own right.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent three hours on The Unfinished Swan, 20 minutes of which were spent looking at the giant white labyrinth halfway through while humming appropriate David Bowie tunes.

Title: Lords of the Fallen Review
Review: Satisfying combat and a darkly beautiful, interconnected kingdom make Lords of the Fallen more than just a clone.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played Demon's Souls, Dark Souls, and Dark Souls II, so he was right at home with Lords of the Fallen. He spent over 20 hours with Lords of the Fallen and just started a new-game-plus, which is proving to be an even richer experience than the initial run.

Title: Neverending Nightmares Review
Review: Neverending Nightmares is an apt name for an unnerving but meandering experience.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent two hours on Neverending Nightmares, and managed to personally earn two of the endings.

Title: Civilization: Beyond Earth Review
Review: Civilization: Beyond Earth's brave new world feels pretty familiar, but that's okay.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli spent hundreds of hours with Civilization V, and a couple dozen hours with Civilization: Beyond Earth, with hundreds more still clearly in store.

Title: Minecraft Xbox One Edition Review
Review: Minecraft: Xbox One Edition lays the foundation for incredible constructions and grand adventures, both large and small.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey feels that the best Minecraft has to offer is not only in massive structures, but with the smaller things. Cameron has spent dozens of hours scouring caves and forests for materials, but some of his favorite moments include watching the sun fall on a distant horizon, and peering into awe-inspiring crevasses where water and lava flow free.

Title: Legend of Grimrock 2 Review
Review: Legend of Grimrock II is another fantastic trip to the grid.
Author Information: Brandin Tyrrel has loved grid-based dungeon crawlers since he played his SNES copy of Eye of the Beholder. He spent 30 hours plundering Grimrock II, took 58,000 steps, and turned into a bear once. His party was level 15 when he finally shut it down, and he still hadn't found every secret.

Title: Sunset Overdrive Review
Review: Sunset Overdrive doesn't take itself too seriously, and it's bursting at the seams with colorful action and creativity.
Author Information: Peter blasted his way through the main mission path, taking the time to dabble in side missions and multiplayer matches along the way.

Title: Skylanders Trap Team Review
Review: Fun villains and a joyful campaign make Trap Team another delightful entry into the Skylanders series.
Author Information: Randolph played through the main campaign of Skylanders Trap team twice--once going solo, and once with his five-year old son.

Title: Fairy Fencer F Review
Review: Heidi is a huge fan of JRPGs, and is always eager to see new entries in the genre get localized and released in the West. While Fairy Fencer F was ...
Author Information: There are glimpses of fun times in Fairy Fencer F, but they‰Ûªre buried under irritating characters and confounding technical issues.

Title: Dreamfall Chapters Book One: Reborn Review
Review: Dreamfall Chapters' first entry isn't wholly satisfying on its own, but it lays a great and characterful foundation for the episodes to come.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd's favorite game of all time is The Longest Journey. He has spent countless hours devising theories related to The Six, The Prophet, and the Dreamtime. He sometimes talks like the character Abnaxus just for the fun of it. It took him three hours or so to finish Dreamfall Chapters' first episode. Full disclosure: Kevin contributed $25 to Dreamfall Chapters' Kickstarter fund.

Title: TRI: Of Friendship and Madness Review
Review: TRI: Of Friendship and Madness redefines the first-person puzzler through creative simplicity.
Author Information: Brandin Tyrrel never thought he would find another first-person puzzle game as engaging as Portal. Yet, as he discovered over a dozen hours with TRI: Of Friendship and Madness, mind-bending mechanics and smartly designed puzzles are alive and well.

Title: A City Sleeps Review
Review: A City Sleeps is a great looking shooter with compelling mechanics, but it suffers under the weight of its ambitions and prohibitive difficulty.
Author Information: Peter cut his teeth on Gradius and R-Type growing up, and has had a fondness for shoot-em-ups ever since. He made it through six stages in A City Sleeps before hitting a wall.

Title: Falling Skies: The Game Review
Review: Falling Skies is a functional, unattractive, and uninspired XCOM clone.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about seven hours with Falling Skies: The Game, another two-and-a-half giving the TV show another shot, an hour looking up what happened to that show where Jason Lee was a cop in Memphis, and another 15 minutes being sad it got cancelled after one season.

Title: Fluster Cluck Review
Review: This top-down arena shooter runs afoul of fun.
Author Information: Miguel needed five unfortunate hours to clear Fluster Cluck's single-player mode and managed to convince three friends to suffer with him for two hours on couch multiplayer. His most recent meal at KFC was delicious.

Title: F1 2014 Review
Review: F1 2014 does little different to last year's game, but fans will dig the great handling and new season of cars.
Author Information: Alex Goy is the Cars Editor of sister site XCAR.com and a huge F1 Fan. He's lost many hours to racing around all manner of wobbly circles over the years, both on the track and in front a TV. Alex spent around 24 hours hammering the most out of F1 2014 for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Legend of Korra Review
Review: The Legend of Korra doesn't even come close to capturing the spark of the universe it depicts.
Author Information: Kevin has seen every episode of Avatar: The Last Airbender, every episode of The Legend of Korra that has aired as of this article, and even the awful Last Airbender film. He finished The Legend of Korra (the game, that is) in a single sitting, and has dabbled in the pro-bending mode and additional difficulty level that are unlocked once the story is complete.

Title: Disney Fantasia: Music Evolved Review
Review: Fantasia is an excellent and joyful game that turns rhythm gameplay into performance art.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd went to the Oberlin Conservatory to study violin performance and composition, and he's seen the films Fantasia and Fantasia 2000 more times than he can count. His favorite film vignette is Rhapsody in Blue from Fantasia 2000

Title: Costume Quest 2 Review
Review: Costume Quest 2 is a charming sequel that fixes most of its predecessor's flaws, though it remains a very short, overly simple experience.
Author Information: Justin is a senior editor at GameSpot. He spent about six hours wandering through Costume Quest's world collecting candy and costumes. Halloween is his favorite holiday, and dentists freak him out a little.

Title: Sleeping Dogs: Definitive Edition Review
Review: One of the best games of 2012 gets a mild makeover.
Author Information: Miguel fondly recalls the holidays of 2012 as the time he reached 100-percent completion in Sleeping Dogs. Miguel spent 15 hours on the Definitive Edition and found this review assignment as a fine opportunity to finally complete the two post-release downloadable stories. It‰Ûªs games like Sleeping Dogs and Yakuza that make Miguel want Shenmue 3 less and less.

Title: Hack 'n' Slash Review
Review: Hack 'n' Slash's puzzles esoteric puzzles are alternately delightful and discouraging.
Author Information: Daniel spent roughly eight hours sticking his sword into every in-game USB port he could find and fiddling with the variables. He was unable to find all of the endgame secrets, because he is not John Carmack.

Title: The Evil Within Review
Review: The Evil Within is a captivating return to the glory days of survival horror whose various issues keep it just short of greatness.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis has a long history with survival horror and counts Resident Evil Code Veronica on the Dreamcast as his favorite game in the genre. He completed The Evil Within on PS4 in just under 20 hours and fully intends to play some more on New Game Plus.

Title: Sherlock Holmes: Crimes & Punishments Review
Review: All-new game mechanics, first-rate graphics, and involved sleuthing make Sherlock Holmes: Crimes & Punishments a great adventure game.
Author Information: Brett Todd repeated "Elementary, my dear Watson" over and over to himself through the 20+ hours he spent playing Sherlock Holmes: Crimes & Punishments.

Title: Styx: Master of Shadows Review
Review: Clunky combat, bad AI, and so-so stealth leave Styx lingering in the shadows of mediocrity.
Author Information: Britton Peele has crept through the shadows with Metal Gear Solid and Splinter Cell, but his more modern stealth favorites are Dishonored and Mark of the Ninja. He took 20 hours to complete Styx's story, finished many of the side-objectives, and replayed a few sections on different difficulty levels.

Title: Fantasy Life Review
Review: Fantasy Life is an ambitious but repetitive RPG that makes fails to make the mundane magical.
Author Information: Aoife, as a mercenary wordsmith, crack-shot and frequent slayer of demons, found that cooking the perfect fish stew and knitting a pair of fancy mittens were easily the most fantastical things she's done in a game for a very, very long time. She'll stick with just ordering take-out next time, thank you very much.

Title: NBA 2K15 Review
Review: NBA 2K15‰Ûªs overhauled movement system and improved shooting mechanics make it the best-playing basketball game in existence.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin is a basketball fanatic who loves watching the NBA, but always manages to hurt himself during pick-up games. He played hundreds of hours of NBA 2K14, dozens of hours of 2K15‰Ûªs many game modes, and won a championship with his custom small forward in MyCareer.

Title: Persona 4 Arena Ultimax Review
Review: Persona 4 Ultimax is a worthy upgrade to a solid fighter, with plenty of new content for competitive players and Persona fans alike.
Author Information: Heidi‰Ûªs been fervently playing--and reviewing--the Persona titles for many years now. While she‰Ûªs a little bit sad that P4AU‰Ûªs story mode wasn‰Ûªt quite as good as hoped, she also appreciates how it wraps up a lot of the various character stories. Bring on Persona 5!

Title: Short Peace: Ranko Tsukigime's Longest Day Review
Review: Short Peace's four animated shorts are wonderful examples of modern animation, but the game portion, Ranko Tsukigime's Longest Day, is a letdown on almost every front.
Author Information: Peter's sampled the world of anime over the course of the last 20 years, and Katsuhiro Otomo is one of his favorite artists. He played through Ranko Tsukigime's Longest Day twice for this review just to make sure he didn't miss anything that would have characterized it as anything better than mediocre.

Title: Driveclub Review
Review: Driveclub is a solid, basic racing game with lots of tracks, lots of cars, and very little in the way of personality.
Author Information: Kevin completed Driveclub's single-player tour, led his club to level 17, and participated in all sorts of challenges and races.

Title: Dark Souls II: Crown of the Ivory King Review
Review: Dark Souls II, in all its epic designs, fittingly concludes in the harshness of winter.
Author Information: By Dark Souls II's stats, Miguel is just a couple hours short of passing 250 hours in his entire playthrough, including all DLCs. With Crown of the Ivory King complete, he has officially stuck a fork in Dark Souls II. He won't weep, for there are still other worlds to conquer--just not in this game.

Title: Watch Dogs: Bad Blood Review
Review: A finely-made Watch Dogs quasi-epilogue finds a new playable protagonist struggling to tie loose ends
Author Information: Miguel has probably played more Watch Dogs than most of those who bought Watch Dogs, so he was more than ready to take on Bad Blood. After completing this campaign, a handful of optional content was the break Miguel needed before diving head first into the holiday season.

Title: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel Review
Review: Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel brings you more of the loot and lighthearted humor you love, though it never quite overcomes the gravity of its predecessors.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is a longtime fan of shooting and looting, and has spent an embarrassing amount of hours taking out enemies and rifling through treasure chests on the hunt for shiny things. Cameron spent about 45 hours on Pandora‰Ûªs moon. There, he completed the story and nearly every side quest, and defeated the raid boss as the mighty Claptrap, reaching level 33. He also played as Wilhelm for about 10 of those hours.

Title: Endless Legend Review
Review: Endless Legend adds fantastic twists to familiar strategy.
Author Information: Brandin Tyrrel has invested untold hours into turn-based strategy endeavors. He enjoyed the 35 he spent reviewing Endless Legend, and the promise of each unique faction. He'll soon start the most massive campaign he can, before getting distracted and finishing it up 2-3 years from now, like he always does.

Title: Kraven Manor Review
Review: It's scary and has some great ideas, but Kraven Manor doesn't live up to its potential.
Author Information: Britton Peele is too much of a coward to go into a haunted house, but he has a great appreciation for great horror games like Amnesia, Fatal Frame and Silent Hill. He completed Kraven Manor twice (once on each difficulty) before writing this review.

Title: Ryse: Son of Rome Review
Review: Ryse: Son of Rome is a repetitive and tedious homage to the gruesome battles showcased in the film 300.
Author Information: Kevin played Ryse: Son of Rome three times on the Xbox One, but only once on the PC. Explaining why that is would require more space than he has here, as well as the help of a neuroscientist.

Title: Super Smash Bros. 3DS Review
Review: Smash Bros. is a cavalcade of cartoonish violence and chaos, and it's never been better.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's been playing Smash Bros. since he was eight years old. He's unlocked every character and stage and almost every trophy in each game. His new main is Pac-Man, and he can't wait to start playing in some local tournaments.

Title: Fenix Rage Review
Review: Fenix Rage is sadistic platformer that tests your skills, and, sometimes, your sanity.
Author Information: Matt appreciates the tough-but-fair challenges offered by Fenix Range and similar thumb-numbing platformers. His wife, who's picked up the pieces of one too many shattered controllers, would rather he just play Lego games with the kids.

Title: The Vanishing of Ethan Carter Review
Review: The Vanishing of Ethan Carter is a beautiful adventure that slowly unravels its superficial veneer to reveal a touching and personal story.
Author Information: As a fan of first-person narrative games like Dear Esther and Gone Home, Shaun was happy to see Ethan Carter turn out so well. He completed the story in six hours, slowly wandering about in order to take in all the scenery. He raced through it a second time in a little over an hour.

Title: Gauntlet Review
Review: An old-fashioned game in a newfangled era, Gauntlet does too much and too little all at once.
Author Information: Justin Clark spent about 6 hours running the new Gauntlet. Being so very ancient, he has fond memories of playing the original in arcades as a kid, and playing the elf just so he could shoot the food faster than everyone else and laugh at his brother when he died. He was always a lonely child.

Title: Alien: Isolation Review
Review: Alien: Isolation harbors legitimate frights, but they're nestled between endless stretches of bland lever-pulling and button-pressing.
Author Information: Kevin appreciates the film Aliens, but still prefers the original Alien, and prefers never to think about Prometheus at all. He spent about 16 hours with Alien: Isolation, and he enjoyed them more than the hours he spent with Aliens: Colonial Marines, though that isn't saying much.

Title: Stronghold Crusader 2 Review
Review: Stronghold Crusader 2 brings smart army strategy, but squanders its most interesting asset: the castle.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor spent over 20 hours playing Stronghold Crusader 2, and came to the realization that he's utterly terrible at it. At least he still can manage to play Starcraft without embarrassing himself.

Title: Spacecom Review
Review: Spacecom hovers between minimalist and incomplete.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli spent ten hours with Spacecom, mostly being instructed in the finer points of military strategy by better tacticians online. He has a tendency to fall for very basic ploys.

Title: Forza Horizon 2 Review
Review: There's a party in Forza Horizon 2, and everyone's invited.
Author Information: Kevin wishes he reviewed more driving games than he does, and admits to liking the Midwestern setting of the original Horizon a bit more than the pastoral European vistas. He's finished the Horizon Festival finale, but has a lot more to do before he can call himself a Horizon 2 completist.

Title: Five Nights at Freddy's Review
Review: Chuck E. Scream.
Author Information: Justin Clark played through all five nights at Freddy's, over two real nights, after 11 p.m. A sixth night opened up promptly after. The flabbergasted ‰ÛÏnope‰Û he screamed afterwards apparently woke two of his neighbors. He would like to take this time to publicly apologize.

Title: Natural Doctrine Review
Review: Natural Doctrine takes strategy role-playing games one step forward, and several clumsy steps back.
Author Information: Justin Clark commands legions of people to move in tight, limited squares in real life, too. He's sent thousands of warriors to their screaming deaths in Final Fantasy Tactics, Tactics Ogre, and Jeanne D'Arc over the years, so spending 25-ish hours getting destroyed in single turns by multiple low-level gun-wielding grunts in Natural Doctrine makes for a pretty apt comeuppance, all things considered.

Title: Cannon Brawl Review
Review: Cannon Brawl finds the tools it needs but doesn't know what to do with them.
Author Information: Jason Venter loves defending castles and destroying them too. For the purposes of this review, he cleared the campaign and kept right on demolishing enemy castles for a few more hours, just because he could.

Title: FIFA 15 Review
Review: FIFA 15 might not be wholly realistic, but it brings more flair and excitement than any game in the series so far.
Author Information: John has been playing FIFA since FIFA '96, a time when hair was bad, Giggs was young and Man City were relegated. For this review John accumulated some 25 hours of match time, finishing fifth in the Premier League with Liverpool and getting fired in the process. He was subsequently offered the Torino job. He rejected it.

Title: Wasteland 2 Review
Review: Wasteland 2 is an intricate and triumphant return of a role-playing classic.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey is enamored with all things post-apocalyptic precisely because they seem to highlight just how silly much of our modern life is. For this review he wandered the wastes for 57 hours over the course of a week.

Title: Neverwinter Updated Review
Review: Neverwinter now offers more classes and zones than ever before, but combat still outshines every other aspect.
Author Information: Leif Johnson spends much of his free time in MMORPGs, and he has two characters at the level cap in Neverwinter. Yes, they're both dwarves. He writes and plays games on a ranch in South Texas.

Title: D4: Dark Dreams Don't Die Review
Review: D4 is all kinds of crazy, and you may not take to its unique brand of humor. But if you do, there's no forgetting it.
Author Information: It took Kevin VanOrd about four hours to finish D4's first installment, and he can't wait to see where the story goes next. He has played another Swery 65 game, Deadly Premonition, three times now. And he doesn't care if you make fun of him for it. So says Mr. Stewart.

Title: Middle-earth: Shadow of Mordor Review
Review: Shadow of Mordor's political machinations and rambunctious action make it a cut above your everyday Lord of the Rings game.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has read every Lord of the Rings novel, seen every Lord of the Rings movie, and played many Lord of the Rings games, but he recognizes that there are countless Tolkien geeks far more familiar with the universe than he is. He played Shadow of Mordor for about 30 hours, finishing the story and performing countless side missions.

Title: Roundabout Review
Review: Roundabout's story is short-lived, but it's jam-packed with humor and crazy, quirky action.
Author Information: Britton Peele doesn't drive as crazily as the protagonist of Roundabout (a statement his wife might disagree with), but he's always enjoyed living on the zany side of arcade-style driving games. He completed all of Roundabout's story and challenges, then went back for some more collectibles and higher scores before writing this review.

Title: Hatoful Boyfriend Review
Review: Hatoful Boyfriend is a bizarre, surprising, and unforgettable journey into the world of literal lovebirds.

Title: Minecraft: PlayStation 4 Edition Review
Review: Minecraft: PlayStation 4 Edition is a sandbox gem, and one of the best games to own for PlayStation 4.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has traveled the worlds of many sandbox games, but always seems to come back to Minecraft. In his time playing the game on PlayStation 4, he built several houses, traveled to the nether, boated along a snaking river, and accidently set himself on fire about a dozen times.

Title: Murasaki Baby Review
Review: Murasaki Baby is a visual treat, even if all the hand-holding detracts from what's taking place on screen.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin enjoys a good puzzle game, especially one that tests both his mental and physical reflexes. For the purposes of this review, he helped guide the scared child all the way to the edges of this chilling world.

Title: Minimum Review
Review: Minimum puts a fresh and exciting spin on the online arena.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has competed in online shooting arenas since he first played Quake. He is always ready to delve into an online shooter, and thinks Minimum is worth returning to in spite of its glitches.

Title: Destiny Review
Review: Destiny's essentials are there, and they're great--but the game surrounding them is cold and shallow.
Author Information: Kevin spent about 40 hours playing Destiny, playing every story mission, every strike mission many times, every competitive match type many many many times, and being glad he had such good friends--and found such nice strangers--to play with.

Title: Hyrule Warriors Review
Review: An unlikely pairing of Dynasty Warriors and The Legend Of Zelda yields greatly satisfying results.
Author Information: Miguel spent approximately 15 hours on Hyrule Warriors, which included mission replays with different characters. Fun fact: Miguel‰Ûªs first 1000-point Xbox 360 Gamerscore was for Dynasty Warriors 6: Empires, though he cannot say the same about Fist of the North Star: Ken‰Ûªs Rage, One Piece: Pirate Warriors, or Dynasty Warriors: Gundam. Regardless, he‰Ûªs hoping Dragon Quest: Heroes gets localized for Western release.

Title: Theatrhythm Final Fantasy: Curtain Call Review
Review: Theatrhythm Final Fantasy: Curtain Call is a massive dose of nostalgia for Final Fantasy fans, and even though it's very similar to its predecessor, there are plenty of reasons to ...
Author Information: Peter has been playing Final Fantasy games for almost twenty years and loved the original Theatrhythm Final Fantasy. During his review, he spent six hours steeped in Curtain Call's massive catalog of music.

Title: Dance Central Spotlight Review
Review: Dance Central Spotlight is a lean but thoroughly enjoyably sequel that shifts its focus toward the core dancing experience.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis' real-life attempts at dancing are generally constrained to weddings and the occasional post-touchdown celebration during Seahawks games. For the purposes of this review, he unlocked most routines on the core selection of songs as well as 10 downloadable songs. He may or may not have gone through three t-shirts in a single day while trying out the cardio routines.

Title: Dead Rising 3: Apocalypse Edition Review
Review: Dead Rising 3 combines bland gameplay and colorful stereotypes into one unfortunate adventure.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli played through Dead Rising 3's normal mode and downloadable missions over the course of two weeks. He is afraid of things that wear weird masks, but don't move or speak. Like that dog with the mask in The Unborn. Did anyone see The Unborn? That dog was creepy.

Title: Lichdom: Battlemage Review
Review: Its core combat is sensational, but Lichdom: Battlemage never evolves a proper game around it.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played Lichdom: Battlemage's story from beginning to end and tested himself the combat arenas that unlock once the game is complete. He spent somewhere around 20 hours with Lichdom, but doubts he'll ever return--even if the many spelling mistakes get fixed!

Title: NHL 15 Review
Review: New generation graphics and marginal gameplay improvements clash with a lot of missing features in NHL 15.
Author Information: Brett Todd skated, shot, and slashed the best players in the NHL for over 10 hours while putting together this review of NHL 15.

Title: The Sims 4 Review
Review: The Sims 4 is beautiful and charming, but its constricted structure makes it disappointingly limited.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd can't count the number of times he wearily dragged himself to bed at four in the morning while playing the original Sims. He has nurtured two large households over the course of 30 hours or so for this review. He still feels weird having watched the maid walk around his digital sim's dead body while she cleaned the kitchen.

Title: Disney Infinity: Marvel Super Heroes -- 2.0 Edition Review
Review: The Toy Box is back and better than ever in Disney Infinity 2.0, and it's still a great way to have a shared gameplay experience with the favorite little child ...
Author Information: Randolph spent about 14 hours in Disney Infinity Marvel Super Heroes, finishing the Avengers play set and spending quite a bit of time trying to unlock his own creative spark in Toy Box mode. His son Sebastian played, too, but only when he was good and ate all his vegetables.

Title: The Last Tinker: City of Colors Review
Review: The Last Tinker‰Ûªs colorful art style isn‰Ûªt enough to overcome its tired mechanics and dreadful framerate.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin holds 3D platformers close to his heart. He collected every single banana in Donkey Kong 64, and still thinks Banjo-Kazooie is one of the best games of all time. He hopped, skipped, and jumped his way through the entirety of The Last Tinker, which took about six hours.

Title: Firefall Review
Review: Firefall's shooter/MMORPG hybrid combines genres to produce mediocrity.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli doesn't have as much time for MMORPGs as he did when he could devote months at a time to turning iron ingots into iron daggers or thinning a virtual world's rat population. He devoted the better part of three weeks to Firefall.

Title: Infamous: First Light Review
Review: Infamous: First Light benefits from Second Son's excellent fundamentals. Its missions and storytelling, however, lack spark.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd finished Infamous: Second Son earlier this year. In First Light, he earned diamond-level scores in every battle arena, earned every power, finished the story, and performed every side activity.

Title: Dark Souls 2: Crown of the Old Iron King Review
Review: A splendid second DLC for Dark Souls II offers an insightful visual history lesson without saying a word.
Author Information: Having thoroughly played Dark Souls II, Miguel Concepcion felt that Crown of the Old Iron King was a proverbial old pair of shoes, one that he walked in for an additional ten hours. His appreciation for the history of places and objects hits close to his own home, a townhouse built on the former site of a newspaper publisher.

Title: Azure Striker: Gunvolt Review
Review: Gunvolt is an inventive and fast-paced twist on the Mega Man formula that will keep you riveted to your 3DS while the ride lasts.
Author Information: Peter spent eight hours battling Sumeragi, getting Gunvolt up to level 40, and tackling optional sub-missions during the course of his review. He's played some of every Mega Man series since its debut on the NES, and counts it among his all-time favorite franchises.

Title: Madden NFL 15 Review
Review: Madden 15 is a beautiful football game, but its biggest achievement stems from much improved defensive mechanics that make both sides of the ball fun to play.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin will be spending each of his Sundays over the next few months glued to his couch, cursing the deficiencies of his fantasy football team. He‰Ûªs been playing Madden since he was a kid, and put time into each of Madden 15‰Ûªs game modes for the purpose of this review.

Title: Velocity 2X Review
Review: Velocity balances platforming and shoot-em-ups as well as modern aesthetics and retro play to create a nearly perfect action experience
Author Information: Daniel has mastered the first 26 levels, and hopes to get perfect scores on the remaining 24 soon. For this review he spent about 20 hours over the course of two weeks playing the game on both the Vita and the PS4. He also bugged his friends relentlessly, muttering that the game "looked like silky butter dripping on [his] eyeballs."

Title: Metro Redux Review
Review: Metro Redux is a terrific package that combines two bleak games into a single cohesive whole.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd's favorite game of 2013 was Metro: Last Light, and returning to both it and Metro 2033 was a pleasure. He revisited the original versions of the games in addition to playing these new iterations, spending about 15 hours in total to complete Redux.

Title: Akiba's Trip: Undead and Undressed Review
Review: Even if you can tolerate the inane stripping mechanic, Akiba's Trip does little with its battle system or narrative to warrant your time.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin spent most of his childhood maxing out any JRPG that he could get his hands on. He still enjoys exploring some of the most obscure Japanese titles that hit PlayStation consoles, and played Akiba's Trip to completion for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Walking Dead: Season Two Episode Five ‰ÛÒ No Going Back Review
Review: A brutal showdown and zombies on ice mark the final, oddly slow-paced, episode of season two of The Walking Dead.
Author Information: Brett Todd hung out with Clementine and pals for a little over five hours while twice playing through this final episode of season two of The Walking Dead.

Title: Might and Magic Duel of Champions: Forgotten Wars Review
Review: Duel of Champions is the most epic card game you've already played.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor knows a bit about card games thanks to the countless hours he's spent on Magic: The Gathering, dabbling in any competitive CCG that comes out, and generally immersing himself in tabletop games. Jeremy spent ten hours completing the main campaign for this review and played many ranked matches online.

Title: Surgeon Simulator: Anniversary Edition Review
Review: The PS4 port of the hilariously macabre PC game could do with a few operations of its own.
Author Information: To give you an idea of the difference in control schemes, Daniel Hindes completed the opening heart transplant on PC on his first go, but it took him over two hours on the PS4. For playtime, multiply that by how long you find that funny.

Title: The Golf Club Review
Review: Golf returns to the PC with The Golf Club, a rigorous simulation that falls just short of the green.
Author Information: Frequent golfer Brett Todd hacked away for about 12 hours in the course of writing this review of The Golf Club.

Title: CounterSpy Review
Review: CounterSpy is short, but its stylized presentation and alluring gameplay hooks make it too sweet to pass up.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin tends to shoot first and ask questions later when he plays games, but he at least tries to sneak through levels when the opportunities present themselves. For the purpose of this review, he played CounterSpy to completion and saved the moon.

Title: Shadowgate Review
Review: It doesn't move the genre forward in any way, but Shadowgate is a wonderful return to the early days of adventuring.
Author Information: Britton Peele took his first step into the castle with Shadowgate Classic on the Game Boy Color, which kept him up way too late for many nights afterward. He took a couple thousand turns to beat the new Shadowgate and spent some time with the various difficulty levels before writing this review.

Title: Hohokum Review
Review: The lack of direction can lead to repeated frustrations, but the striking visuals and hypnotic character movement make Hohokum a joy.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin probably works too much, so he can appreciate a game all about relaxation. He‰Ûªs enjoyed ‰ÛÏart‰Û games like Journey and Flower in the past, and completed all 17 worlds of Hohokum during the review process.

Title: Sacred 3 Review
Review: Tedium is at the heart of Sacred 3, a successor to the earlier games in the series in name only.
Author Information: Brett Todd spent about 14 hours mindlessly mashing his mouse in Sacred 3 for this review.

Title: Danganronpa 2: Goodbye Despair Review
Review: Memorable characters, sharp writing and engaging mystery-solving gameplay make this deadly island adventure a trip to remember.
Author Information: Heidi loves Japanese story-driven games, and both Danganronpa games have been among her favorite gaming experiences in recent years. She also feels the need to warn people that even typing Danganronpa related terms into Google search can result in spoilers, as a character's fate was autofilled into the search box when just trying to find info on a voice actor. Argh!

Title: Diablo 3: Ultimate Evil Edition Review
Review: Console owners reap the benefits of two years worth of changes and updates in this conclusive version of Diablo III.
Author Information: Miguel spent the better part of this week in Diablo‰Ûªs world of Sanctuary on the PS4 and Xbox One, clearing the campaign‰Ûªs five acts and several Adventure Mode quests.

Title: Mind: Path to Thalamus Review
Review: The Path to Thalamus is not free of bumps, but the journey should be taken, if only because the sights are so vivid.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent about four hours puzzling over Path to Thalamus and drinking in its scenery.

Title: Risen 3: Titan Lords Review
Review: Like it's predecessors, Risen 3 provides a rollicking adventure that doesn't quite deliver on the details.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played all three Risen games. It took him about 35 hours or so to finish Risen 3, during which time he aligned with the demon hunters, collected all but one buried treasure, and helped Patty work her wiles on all of her targets.

Title: Road Not Taken Review
Review: Road Not Taken treads an unconventional trail, and is mostly better for it.
Author Information: Jason Venter has been playing and enjoying puzzle and adventure games for most of his life, so spending another 20 or so hours with Road Not Taken for the purposes of this review suited him just fine.

Title: Only If Review
Review: Its conclusion may be putrid, but Only If's primary redeeming feature is that it does eventually end.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is no stranger to story-driven mysteries, but he wishes he'd never unearthed this one. He spent about five hours with Only If--enough time to have played it thrice.

Title: The Walking Dead: Season Two Episode Four - Amid the Ruins Review
Review: Clementine is no longer a spectator in Amid the Ruins, the action-packed latest episode in season two of The Walking Dead.
Author Information: Brett Todd spent about two hours contemplating the futility of human existence while not coincidentally playing Amid the Ruins for this review.

Title: Magic the Gathering - Duels of the Planeswalkers 2015 Review
Review: Magic 2015 gives you fewer reasons to love a fantastic game.
Author Information: Jeremy Signor started playing Magic: The Gathering ten years ago and got back into the game with Magic 2012. He played Magic 2015 for 13 hours, getting through the main campaign, playing online matches, and browsing the in-game store.

Title: Halfway Review
Review: Halfway is an emotional tale of mystery and survival that occasionally lacks the courage of its own convictions.
Author Information: Dan Starkey is a huge fan of classic, slow-paced science fiction, with Alien and Blade Runner at the top of his list of favorite films. He hoped Halfway would live up to the pedigree of its inspirations.

Title: Wii Sports Club Review
Review: This repackaging of the classic Wii Sports drops the ball when it comes to connectivity.
Author Information: Wii Sports is the only game that practically everybody in Heidi Kemps' large extended family has played. She was eager to see if Wii Sports Club would forge that same connection. Alas...

Title: Metrico Review
Review: Metrico hits a few high notes, but fails to stay on key throughout its brief performance.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin loves a good puzzle, whether it's found in a platfomer or a cardboard box. For the purpose of this review, he solved every riddle Metrico had to offer and walked away feeling just a bit smarter for it.

Title: Rogue Legacy Review
Review: Great exploration and combat make Rogue Legacy a game you will want to play (and die in) over and over again.
Author Information: Britton Peele fell in love with Rogue Legacy when he reviewed the original PC release for GameSpot in 2012, in part because it tugged at the strings of his Castlevania-loving heart. He finished one full playthrough and a bit of new game plus, switching between all three PlayStation platforms throughout.

Title: Super Comboman Review
Review: Super Comboman fuses platforming, action, and fighting into a single failure.
Author Information: Dan Starkey is no stranger to hard games, fighting games, or beat-'em-ups, but he could only barely make it through Super Comboman. He's glad he can finally put this cramp-inducing nightmare behind him.

Title: Siesta Fiesta Review
Review: While it's just a charming Breakout clone on the surface, Siesta Fiesta has enough tricks to make it something you don't want to sleep through.
Author Information: Britton Peele is no stranger to chips off the Breakout block, from Arkanoid to Firestriker to Wizorb. He spent about four hours completing all of Siesta Fiesta's levels, occasionally going back to try (in vain) for a gold medal.

Title: Unrest Review
Review: Unrest is an unconventional but erratic adventure game that inspires empathy even as it undercuts its own message.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey enjoys the simplicity of traditional morality systems in games, but found Unrest to be refreshing. For the purposes of this review, Cameron spent around 10 hours playing the game multiple times, completing his first run in around four and a half hours.

Title: Dark Souls II: Crown of the Sunken King Review
Review: Crown of the Sunken King sets an effective tone for Dark Souls II's Lost Crowns trilogy with inventive environments and fearsome new foes.
Author Information: Having video-captured GameSpot's Dark Souls II boss battles, Miguel was naturally inclined to take on the game's first DLC. Eight hours later, he doesn't miss the corrosive egg crawlers.

Title: The Last of Us Remastered Review
Review: The Last of Us Remastered is a spruced-up edition of one of the most well-crafted action adventure games of the last console generation.
Author Information: Carolyn originally played through The Last of Us when it was released on the PlayStation 3 last year. For the purposes of this review, she participated in a multiplayer session organized by Sony.

Title: King's Bounty: Dark Side Review
Review: Lengthy quests and catchy tactical combat are at the black heart of King's Bounty: Dark Side.
Author Information: Brett Todd cruised the dark side to check out the selling points of evil for around 30 hours in the course of writing this review. Having played (and reviewed) several King's Bounty games, he is intimately familiar with the series.

Title: Divinity: Original Sin Review
Review: The excellent Divinity: Original Sin isn't a look into the history of role-playing games, but instead a look into their future.
Author Information: Longtime role-player Kevin VanOrd spent 65 hours playing Divinity: Original Sin, and still feels like he's only touched on some of the intricate systems that makes the game so extraordinary. His favorite Divinity talent is Leech

Title: Sniper Elite III Review
Review: Sniper Elite III can be a chore, but its gleeful X-ray kills help make up for its deficiencies.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin is a sucker for a good sniping sequence, and has patiently sat atop perches in dozens of shooters to set up the perfect shot. He completed Sniper Elite III's campaign and continuously tried to connect to multiplayer games for the purpose of this review.

Title: Infinity Runner Review
Review: It tries to add something new with its story mode, but Infinity Runner isn't much more than a rote Temple Run clone.
Author Information: Britton Peele spent more time than he would like to admit playing Temple Run 2 and has played enough Canabalt to know that he's not very good at Canabalt. He finished Infinity Runner's story one and a half times and earned a majority of its achievements before writing this review.

Title: MouseCraft Review
Review: A cheesy puzzler with plenty of charm, MouseCraft favors style over substance.
Author Information: After spending six or so hours with MouseCraft's malnourished, mistreated lab rats, Matt Cabral grew to appreciate the hungry rodents' plight. Well, either that or he was just really craving a grilled cheese sandwich.

Title: Gods Will Be Watching Review
Review: Emotional storytelling and challenging gameplay can't wholly save Gods Will Be Watching from some of its bad design choices.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey enjoyed the majority of Gods Will Be Watching, but he would walk over hot coals before playing through its desert mission again. For the purpose of this review, Cameron played around 18 hours, gaining a few more gray hairs in the process.

Title: Wayward Manor Review
Review: A host of glitches keep Wayward Manor feeling anything but welcoming.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent several hours as the bump in the night, though he wishes less of that time involved hitting the reset button. For the purpose of this review, Cameron completed the game, winning the hard-fought battle against an army of game-ending bugs.

Title: Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty Review
Review: The most fragile hero of side-scrolling platforming returns in a beautiful reimagining of Abe's Oddysee.
Author Information: Daniel survived the Stockyards, persevered through the Paramonion Temple, and bested the Scrabanian Nests to complete Oddworld: New 'n' Tasty in six hours. He rescued 170 of the 300 captive Mudokons, netting himself the good ending. About 20 Mudokons "accidentally" perished.

Title: Child of Light Review
Review: Child of Light is a wonderful fairy tale of a game, with a gorgeous and imaginative realm to explore and a melancholy story at its heart.
Author Information: Carolyn first started playing Child of Light when it was released on consoles, but when she heard it was coming to Vita, she waited, thinking that the game would be a good fit for the handheld. She was pleased to find that it is, and spent about 12 hours accompanying Aurora on her adventure.

Title: Xenonauts Review
Review: Xenonauts is an excellent strategy game that casts you as Earth's only line of defense against an apparently omnipresent extraterrestrial threat.
Author Information: This is the third time Dan Starkey has used his strategic talents to collect and reverse-engineer alien technology to repel an invasion. He's gotten pretty good at it, but Xenonauts still claimed 61 hours of his life. They were well spent.

Title: War Thunder Review
Review: Smooth and exciting aerial and tank action is at the heart of War Thunder, a big and broad multiplayer excursion back to World War II.
Author Information: Brett Todd flew the not-so-friendly skies and rumbled around on the terra firma of War Thunder for about 10 hours in the course of writing this review.

Title: Richard & Alice Review
Review: Strong writing isn't enough to establish the apocalyptic stakes at play in Richard & Alice.
Author Information: It took Nick three hours to play through Richard & Alice's story. He‰Ûªs more of a warm weather guy.

Title: Ace Combat Infinity Review
Review: Ace Combat Infinity casts a cynical eye at its own pedigree, but some vestiges of joy remain.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli has done more trademarked Ace Combat trench runs than he cares to admit. For the purposes of this review, he played through Infinity's available campaign missions and a few weeks' worth of multiplayer.

Title: Spoiler Alert Review
Review: Spoiler Alert's reverse platforming isn't a strong enough gimmick to make it worth bothering with.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin has been jumping from platform to platform since the early days of the original Nintendo, with Super Mario World standing as one of his all-time favorite platformers. For the purpose of this review, Josiah completed all 100 levels and created a few stages of his own.

Title: The Wolf Among Us Episode 5: Cry Wolf Review
Review: Cry Wolf brings The Wolf Among Us to an uneven conclusion, but still packs the occasional emotional punch.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played The Wolf Among Us in its entirety, but wishes it had concluded on a stronger note. He continues to make his way through the Fables comics, and will be sad when he runs out of Fables-related stories to experience.

Title: Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark Review
Review: Offering no more than meets the eye, Transformers: Rise of the Dark Spark is just a shallow, frustrating, and incoherent third-person shooter.
Author Information: Carolyn has been following the Transformers in one form or another since they first went up against the Gobots for the hearts and minds of American children in the 1980s.
