Rise of the Dark Spark isn't the worst Transformers game she's played. That honor goes to the Wii game Transformers: Dark of the Moon - Stealth Force Edition, in which you couldn't even transform.

Title: Blood of the Werewolf Review
Review: Blood of the Werewolf has never been better than on the Xbox 360, offering improved platforming and refined pacing.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is still waiting for the Young Frankenstein video game, but is content with playing Blood of the Werewolf a second time, for now. For the purpose of this review, Cameron spent about seven hours reacquainting himself with the game's smashers and deadly pitfalls.

Title: GRID Autosport Review
Review: Grid Autosport is often too ambitious for its own good, resulting in a diverse but inconsistent racer.
Author Information: Due to an unholy attraction to burnt rubber and garish paintjobs, as well as an obsession with the racing genre, John couldn't help but jump at the opportunity to get behind the wheel of Grid Autosport. Before writing this review, he won the Grid Legends Series, the elite event of Autosport and the symbol of digital racing prowess.

Title: Tales From Space: Mutant Blobs Attack Review
Review: The blob is back, but his adventure stumbles.
Author Information: Jason Venter has played dozens of platformers throughout the years, including the Vita version of When Mutant Blobs Attack.

Title: EA Sports UFC Review
Review: EA Sports UFC looks almost as good as a real MMA fight, but poorly balanced systems dull the excitement.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin has watched every UFC event since 2007, spending most Saturday nights glued to the TV. He's deeply invested in the sport, and often fruitlessly tries to properly grapple and box in real life. For the purposes of this review, Josiah earned the UFC lightweight belt and fought in more than 30 online fights.

Title: Valiant Hearts: The Great War Review
Review: With beautiful art, a sentimental story, and gameplay that emphasizes helping people rather than killing them, Valiant Hearts: The Great War is a refreshingly different kind of war game.
Author Information: Carolyn played through Valiant Hearts on the PC before writing this review. It took about six hours. She prefers Walt, the dog in Valiant Hearts, to Riley, the dog in Call of Duty: Ghosts.

Title: WildStar Review
Review: WildStar is a colorful and traditional online role-playing game that evokes the compulsive need to fight everything you can fight, and click everything you can click.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played so many massively multiplayer games that he's lost count of the exact number. He is usually drawn to pet classes, but he spent most of his 70-plus hours in WildStar as an offensive spellslinger of the Mordesh race.

Title: Shovel Knight Review
Review: Shovel Knight recalls, but doesn't rely on, many greats from gaming's past, but lacks the inventive spark that could have elevated it to classic territory.
Author Information: The retro resurgence has made Tom incredibly happy because he still believes that much of what made the games from his youth so appealing hasn't been improved upon. After sinking 15 hours into Shovel Knight, he enjoyed but wasn't enamored with this 2D adventure.

Title: Anomaly Defenders Review
Review: Anomaly Defenders ditches the series' prior innovations for something more familiar and far less thrilling.
Author Information: After playing through both previous games as the humans, Nathan was intrigued to hop to the other side of the fence in Defenders. Plowing through this far-less-interesting alien campaign in only a handful of hours, however, felt like it took eons.

Title: The Elder Scrolls Online Review - Familiar World Strange Territory Review
Review: For a fan of the series, The Elder Scrolls Online makes for a pleasant return to Tamriel. It's just not a terribly great MMO.
Author Information: After pouring hundreds of hours into the Elder Scrolls franchise over the years, Shaun McInnis used The Elder Scrolls Online as an opportunity to finally take a shot at the MMO genre. With his Nord Dragonknight, Shaun made it to level 22 before beginning this review.

Title: Magical Beat Review
Review: Solid puzzling and catchy tunes back up Magical Beat, but a dearth of content stops the show prematurely.
Author Information: Fighting games and MOBAs might be the hot genres for competition right now, but Heidi argues that a fierce battle in a competitive puzzle game results in some of the finest quality salt around. It's a shame Magical Beat is so feature-devoid, as she yearns for a new puzzle game in which to crush her enemies online. (Any hope of Puyo Puyo Tetris coming to the West? Probably not...)

Title: Nether Review
Review: Nether's dire world can be immersive, but glaring issues ranging from unbalanced mechanics to glitches prevent you from getting swept away.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has played many games where he spent untold hours fighting to survive against grueling odds. For the sake of this review, Cameron played for about 30 hours, reaching level 32 and an account level of 15.

Title: Hegemony Rome: The Rise of Caesar Review
Review: Repetitious play, shallow mechanics, and squandered potential all make Hegemony Rome a mediocre experience.
Author Information: Dan Starkey was a huge fan of the first Hegemony and had high hopes for the second. To date, he has spent about 24 hours pretending to be Julius Caesar and conquering what is now modern-day France.

Title: Killzone: Shadow Fall Intercept Review
Review: Killzone: Shadow Fall Intercept's mishmash of co-op ideas doesn't make for the most compelling of experiences.
Author Information: Mark might not be the shooting powerhouse he once was, but he enjoys the odd skirmish in Counterstrike and Titanfall. He's played his way through Killzone 3 and Shadow Fall, and has always admired the impressive technical achievements of the series, even if he hasn't been as impressed with the gameplay.

Title: 1001 Spikes Review
Review: 1001 Spikes will kill you, but it does so in a way that's both fair and fun.
Author Information: Britton Peele enjoys a challenge and thought he was a hotshot for beating Super Meat Boy until he realized that he would never able to finish every dark world stage. He completed the main game in 1001 Spikes, found 24 of the golden skulls, and completed the Tower of Nanner twice before writing this review. He woke up his wife only once by shouting at his Vita upon dying during a level.

Title: Entwined Review
Review: Comforting colors, excellent sound design, and simple gameplay make Entwined a lovely and fleeting experience.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has taken many an abstract journey in his day, and Flow and Flower remain two of his favorites. He played Entwined's story twice, and completed every challenge level.

Title: Kill the Bad Guy Review
Review: Destructive mayhem and revenge fantasies are at the heart of Kill the Bad Guy, a lightweight but engaging puzzler.
Author Information: Brett Todd electrocuted, crushed, flattened, speared, blew up, and otherwise slaughtered bad guys for about five hours in the course of writing the review for Kill the Bad Guy.

Title: Tomodachi Life Review
Review: Tomodachi Life brings the quirk in spades, but it's not long before the novelty wears off.
Author Information: Life sims might not be one of Mark's favorite genres, but he has dabbled with The Sims and tended a garden or two in Animal Crossing. For the purposes of this review, Mark's Miis got married, had some babies, and took part in the odd rap battle or two in the town square.

Title: Always Sometimes Monsters Review
Review: The alleys of Always Sometimes Monsters hide both trash and treasure alike
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli grinded through Always Sometimes Monsters' story over the course of a dozen hours, mostly carrying crates from one side of a factory to another. Watch out for that crate part.

Title: Munin Review
Review: Britton Peele is a fan of both ancient mythology and puzzle games, but Munin wasn't the chocolate and peanut butter combo he was hoping for. He solved all of Munin's ...
Author Information: Britton Peele is a fan of both ancient mythology and puzzle games, but Munin wasn't the chocolate and peanut butter combo he was hoping for. He solved all of Munin's puzzles before writing this review.

Title: Space Run Review
Review: Space Run is an exciting tower defense game in which you rocket through the galaxy at warp speed.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent many hours playing tower defense games and games set in space. Space Run was the first time he experienced both at once, and he looks forward to many more hours shipping cargo and fighting space pirates.

Title: Enemy Front Review
Review: The wartime journey of a gun-wielding news reporter is fraught with Nazi aggression, poor game design, frustrating glitches, and an unconvincing message of rebellion.
Author Information: Due to his adult-onset appreciation for World War II history and the fact that there are few games that deal with the war's resistance movements, Miguel jumped at the chance to play through Enemy Front's campaign and multiplayer. He's currently considering washing down the experience by replaying Medal of Honor: Underground.

Title: Air Control Review
Review: Air Control is 30 minutes worth of horrific, broken nonsense.
Author Information: Kevin has a fear of flying. But he now fears flying in Air Control even more. He spent two agonizing hours with Air Control, even though you can see everything in under 30 minutes.

Title: Among the Sleep Review
Review: Among the Sleep makes good use of its unusual concept, taking you on a distinctive journey through the frightening dreams of a young child.
Author Information: Carolyn is no stranger to scary games. Intrigued by Among the Sleep's concept, she backed the game's Kickstarter campaign last year. She played through Among the Sleep once before writing this review.

Title: Super Ultra Dead Rising 3 Arcade Remix Hyper Edition EX Plus Alpha Review
Review: Super Dead Rising 3 Arcade Remix is a fun, nostalgia-fueled romp through Capcom's history.
Author Information: Dead Rising 3 was Britton Peele's favorite game from the Xbox One launch. Super Dead Rising 3 Arcade Remix tugged at the strings of his nostalgic heart more than once, and he liked it enough to unlock everything and earn every achievement before writing this review.

Title: Project Temporality Review
Review: Glitches and a dire lack of puzzle variation keep Project Temporality from being time well spent.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is always up for a good puzzle game, but will happily knock one point off the score for every slide puzzle he comes across. For the purpose of this review, Cameron spent about 7 hours partying and crashing down doors with his favorite people in the whole world: his clones.

Title: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing 2 Review
Review: The Incredible Adventures of Van Helsing II taps the spirit of classic action role-playing games and delivers a great combat system and an exciting world.
Author Information: Dan Starkey hunted vampires, demons, and undead abominations with his trusty arcane grenade launcher. After being bored for the first couple of hours, he quickly warmed up to the gothic fantasy adventure.

Title: Where Is My Heart? Review
Review: A clever twist on puzzle platforming, Where Is My Heart knows to end before it gets tiresome.
Author Information: Britton Peele wouldn't mind getting lost in nature were it not for his fear of never finding his way back home. He saw the end in Where Is My Heart after a couple of hours and kept exploring stages for a while before writing this review.

Title: Ultra Street Fighter IV Review
Review: Ultra Street Fighter IV brings with it five new characters, four new stages, three new game mechanics, and a whole host of other changes that make it the definitive Street ...
Author Information: While he may have more L's than W's in his logbook, Maxwell McGee is still a longtime fan of both fighting games and Street Fighter IV. Together, he and Cody face down the many rivals who stalk GameSpot's offices. And for some reason, they're all Ibuki players.

Title: Drakengard 3 Review
Review: It's technically awkward, hard to look at, and sometimes tedious to play. But Drakengard 3's distinctly strange and fascinating world, characters, and structure make it a one-of-a-kind experience.
Author Information: Ever since she reviewed Nier for GamePro years back, Heidi has taken an interest in the games Yoko Taro has created. After spending dozens of hours with Drakengard 3 and reaching its true ending, she can confidently claim it to be one of her favorite games so far this year.

Title: Murdered: Soul Suspect Review
Review: It's easy to be overwhelmed by the many problems in Murdered: Soul Suspect, but if you dig a little deeper, there's an interesting story to uncover.
Author Information: Tom has always been drawn to virtual investigations, so the slow-paced investigations of Soul Suspect were right up his alley. He spent more than 10 hours in Salem completing as many side stories as time would allow.

Title: Mind Zero Review
Review: Mind Zero's attempts to mimic a proven success are foiled by a dull story and plodding, aggravating gameplay.
Author Information: Heidi didn't know much about Mind Zero going in. The lack of an in-game clock makes it hard for her to judge just how much time she spent playing it, but she's still pretty bitter about wasting a few dozen hours on Mind Zero when Mario Kart 8 is sitting right over there.

Title: Pushmo World Review
Review: Pushmo World's colorful conundrums are a pleasant and absorbing way to occupy your brain.
Author Information: Carolyn loves a good contemplative puzzle game, with the Picross series in particular having kept her happily occupied for many, many hours.

Title: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 4 - In Sheep's Clothing Review
Review: In Sheep's Clothing continues A Wolf Among Us' intriguing and violent story, with only a bit of wheel-spinning to slow it down.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd finished In Sheep's Clothing in about 90 minutes. His Bigby is a no-nonsense detective who is gentle with his friends but aggressive when cornered, and he hopes this season of The Wolf Among Us is successful enough that there will be more in the future.

Title: Borderlands 2 Review
Review: Borderlands 2 on the Vita preserves the lion's share of the game's significant appeal despite some shortcomings.
Author Information: Chris Watters reviewed Borderlands 2 on every other platform and spent many hours in various DLC packs. He loves the artistic style, sense of humor, and chaotic battles, and enjoyed the dozen or so hours he spent with the Vita version.

Title: Nutjitsu Review
Review: If the foxes in Nutjitsu want those mystic acorns so much, they can keep them.
Author Information: Jason Venter likes acorns as much as the next guy, and his appreciation for action puzzle games goes back to a time when arcade cabinets were more common than payphone booths, but spending several hours ranking up his squirrel in Nutjitsu was just about enough to drive him nutty.

Title: Mario Kart 8 Review
Review: Mario Kart 8 shifts its focus from chaotic weapons to precise driving, and that makes this one of the most rewarding entries in the series.
Author Information: Tom firmly believes that Super Mario Kart is still the best game in the franchise, but loves just about every new entry. He spent more than 40 hours playing Mario Kart 8 across every mode. Not to brag, but with the help of Max Hulburt, he got a three-star rating on every cup.

Title: Warlock 2 Review
Review: Warlock 2 is a strong sequel that deftly builds on the solid foundation of its predecessor. Unfortunately, not all of its ideas are fully realized.
Author Information: Dan spent over 27 hours in several matches conquering the planes of the elements and summoning an army of dragons to support his cause. His eternal search for a perfect strategy game is still far from over, but he's pleased to see people are still getting creative with one of the older genres around.

Title: Minecraft: PlayStation 3 Edition Review
Review: Minecraft: PlayStation 3 Edition provides the core gameplay experience you're looking for, though it takes a few steps back from the PC version.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has played Minecraft on nearly every system, including smartphones. In his combined time, he has built mansions, underground lairs, snaking railway systems, and a tree house in the jungle. But his favorite would have to be a farmhouse on the edge of a grassy plain and a lake, where he takes a break from mining to do a little fishing.

Title: Blade Symphony Review
Review: For all its slick flourishes, this intriguing sword-dueling game could still use a lot of sharpening.
Author Information: Battling through tons of multiplayer matches and fighting plenty of one-on-one duels with all four fighters and lots of different blades, Nathan thought he'd seen it all. That is, until one goofy opponent spent an entire match prancing around in a wild costume without bothering to try to land a single blow.

Title: Memento Mori 2: Guardians of Immortality Review
Review: It has lofty goals as a globe-trotting mystery, but Memento Mori 2 is a poor localization of a poor adventure game.
Author Information: Britton Peele has been on The Longest Journey, sailed to Monkey Island, and linked to Myst a half-dozen times. He's usually up for a good adventure, but he wishes he'd stayed home for this one.

Title: Watch Dogs Review
Review: Watch Dogs' attempts to say something serious are overshadowed by how enormously fun it is to create chaos in its impressive open world.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd spent 30-plus hours with Watch Dogs at a press review event and played many hours outside of the event. He finished the story, yet only reached 52 percent completion. He unlocked every ctOS tower, solved an optional murder case, and played every digital trip, and looks forward to reaching 100 percent completion.

Title: World of Tanks Updated Review
Review: When it comes to blowing up military monstrosities, no game does it better than World of Tanks.
Author Information: A casual interest in tanks quickly turned to a "gotta-catch-'em-all" obsession for Nathan, who has clocked hundreds of battles in both the PC version and Xbox 360 version of World of Tanks.

Title: Wolfenstein: The New Order Review
Review: In the Nazi-dominated alternate history of 1960, it takes more than big guns to topple this new regime.
Author Information: Daniel finds comfort in the aural feedback of a shotgun, in shattering a demon into tiny giblets, and in scrounging the environment for health packs and armour to stay alive, and keeps on shooting. He blasted through The New Order's singleplayer campaign on PS4 in roughly 12 hours, and replayed a few more hours on PC on a higher difficulty.

Title: Monochroma Review
Review: Monochroma wastes its gripping premise and eye-catching visual design by having clunky controls and a wealth of inconsistencies.
Author Information: Tom adores puzzle platformers, and was intrigued by Monochroma after playing it at the Game Developers Conference. But he struggled to finish Monochroma even though it's only five hours long because of its many unavoidable problems.

Title: Kentucky Route Zero - Act III Review
Review: Kentucky Route Zero: Act III is the boldest, most extraordinary chapter yet in this transcendent American road journey.
Author Information: There's something about Kentucky Route Zero, something haunting and sad, that reminds Carolyn of all those hours she spent watching America roll by out the window on family road trips as a child.

Title: Bound By Flame Review
Review: Bound by Flame is a rickety role-playing game that bites off far more than it can chew.
Author Information: Kevin likes an ambitious role-playing game, but after swearing his way through Bound by Flame's second half and vanquishing the final boss after countless tries, he's glad to leave this one behind. He finished at level 23 and spent most of his skill points in the warrior tree.

Title: Tropico 5 Review
Review: Tropico 5's irreverent wit and smooth difficulty curve make governing your own banana republic an easy and enjoyable experience.
Author Information: The shoes of El Presidente are hard to fill, but Maxwell is up to the challenge, even if he is a newcomer to the Tropico series. After 22 hours with the game he now spends his days sipping drinks on the beach and pondering whether building a casino next to a church is a bad idea.

Title: The Walking Dead: Season 2 Episode 3 - In Harm's Way Review
Review: Clementine's soul and skin are in peril in In Harm's Way, this season's most harrowing episode yet of The Walking Dead.
Author Information: Brett Todd watched it and regretted it in this episode of The Walking Dead. He also played the game through to completion in a couple of hours.

Title: Super Time Force Review
Review: Super Time Force gleefully shreds conventional concepts of time travel in both its writing and gameplay, making it a refreshing twist on the side-scrolling shooter.
Author Information: Carolyn has been playing side-scrolling shooters since the NES era and finished Super Time Force on the default difficulty setting. Her understanding of how time works owes more to Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure than to A Brief History of Time.

Title: Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn Review
Review: Final Fantasy XIV is reborn on the PlayStation 4, rife with new features and gorgeous visuals that will tempt PC and PlayStation 3 players all over again.
Author Information: Brittany Vincent is a Hyur black mage hailing from the world of Final Fantasy XI as a Mithra white mage. She spent upward of 35 hours for the purposes of this review in the PlayStation 4 edition of Final Fantasy XIV, though the PC edition has previously been her Eorzean home.

Title: Dark Souls 2 Review - A Newcomer in Drangleic Review
Review: Dark Souls II can be tedious and unwelcoming for someone who hasn't already come to terms with the series.
Author Information: For this review, Justin spent 25 hours in the game, killed five bosses, reached level 65, and lit too many bonfires.

Title: Sportsfriends Review
Review: Sportsfriends' simple games provide some of the best local multiplayer you and a few friends can have.
Author Information: Britton Peele has only minimal experience playing sports, but he has a lot of friends. He played dozens of matches of every game in the Sportsfriends collection before writing this review, varying up the number of players throughout.

Title: Grand Theft Auto Online Updated Review
Review: Grand Theft Auto Online is both exhilarating and infuriating, often at the same time, and a lack of structure makes your criminal exploits feel kind of meaningless.
Author Information: Carolyn has played and loved every major release in the Grand Theft Auto series since GTA III. After originally playing Grand Theft Auto Online when it first launched, she spent about 10 hours back in the Los Santos of GTA Online prior to writing this review.

Title: Titanfall Review - Through the Eyes of a Lapsed Combatant Review
Review: Titanfall mixes parkour and mechs for a competitive shooter that will entice even the most jaded player back onto the battlefield.
Author Information: Peter hasn't found a competitive shooter that he's truly liked since Halo 3, and was delighted enough with Titanfall's gameplay that he played around 20 hours between the PC, Xbox One, and Xbox 360 versions before writing his review.

Title: Sir You Are Being Hunted Review
Review: Sir, You Are Being Hunted doesn't execute on the premise in its own name.
Author Information: Sir Nick Capozzoli spent a dozen hours with Sir, You Are Being Hunted as a curiously savage aristocrat, and dabbled with a few of the alternate classes on hand.

Title: Broken Sword 5: The Serpent's Curse - Part II Review
Review: Broken Sword 5: The Serpent's Curse's second half charms and delights, but glitches and a more linear focus tarnish the overall delivery.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent years besting some of the finest adventure games, and gets strangely excited to find a use for a ball of yarn he's kept in his inventory for the majority of a game. For the purpose of this review, Cameron played around five hours, with a grand total of around 11 hours for both parts of the game.

Title: Batman: Arkham Origins - Cold Cold Heart Review
Review: Cold, Cold Heart fumbles its ending, but benefits from a solid narrative foundation and a strong sense of momentum.
Author Information: Carolyn has played through all of the Arkham games except Arkham Origins: Blackgate. Cold, Cold Heart took her about three hours to complete. Her favorite Batman is Michael Keaton.

Title: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: All Star Battle Review
Review: JoJo's Bizarre Adventure: All Star Battle faithfully captures the extreme personality of its source material, but the game itself is more style than substance.
Author Information: Before playing All Star Battle, Maxwell's knowledge of JoJo's Bizarre Adventure was a cobbled-together mishmash of the 1998 Capcom fighting game and some humorous Internet memes. Thankfully, his knowledge of fighting games is far more extensive.

Title: Mario Golf: World Tour Review
Review: Mario Golf: World Tour is built upon strong mechanics, but too often relies on novelty value.
Author Information: Stace Harman has been playing video game golf for more than two decades, and played close to 20 hours of Mario Golf: World Tour for this review. The Vita version of Everybody's Golf is a mainstay of his handheld gaming, and he has very fond memories of 2004's Mario Golf on the GBA.

Title: The Elder Scrolls Online Review
Review: The Elder Scrolls Online immerses you in its intricate quests and fantasy landscapes, only to undercut its strengths at every turn.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd's first massively multiplayer game was the original Asheron's Call, and he still thinks that Asheron's Call 2 was an underpraised gem. He's played every Elder Scrolls game since Daggerfall, and having spent 90 hours of adventuring in The Elder Scrolls Online, he's ready to hang up his staff.

Title: Fract OSC Review
Review: Fract OSC's chorus soars, but its verse languishes.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli spent a dozen hours working through Fract OSC's puzzles and fiddling with its in-game synthesizer program. He's pretty sure he'll eventually make something that doesn't shatter nearby glassware.

Title: NES Remix 2 Review
Review: NES Remix is a fun way to remind yourself to play through the classics again.
Author Information: Jason Venter has spent dozens of hours with most of the games that were reworked for NES Remix 2, and he happily spent most of another dozen hours chasing after three-star ratings and stamps for the sake of his review. He has clearly caught the Nintendo bug.

Title: Kirby: Triple Deluxe Review
Review: Kirby: Triple Deluxe is a wildly inventive and colorful platformer that makes great use of 3D.
Author Information: Mark's all-time favorite genre is the platformer, having spent many an hour with the likes of Super Mario, Rayman, and Kirby. He played all the way through to the end of Triple Deluxe for this review, and is currently working his way through a second time as King Dedede.

Title: Daylight Review
Review: Don't be afraid of the dark in the shallow and cliched horror adventure Daylight.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has loved scary games ever since he first visited the famous town of Silent Hill. He played Daylight seven times for the purposes of this review.

Title: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 Review
Review: The Amazing Spider-Man 2 is as fun as it is flawed, capturing the snarky joy of the webbed crusader amid the repetition of combat and tedious side quests.
Author Information: Tom spent his Saturday mornings in his youth watching the Spider-Man cartoon, though he's never read a comic book. He's not embarrassed by that fact. It took him more than 15 hours to bring peace to Manhattan.

Title: Moebius: Empire Rising Review
Review: Moebius: Empire Rising is a short adventure bogged down by dull characters and tedious puzzle solving.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey doubts that any adventure game will delight him as as much as Sam & Max Hit the Road did, but he's wide open to the possibility. He spent around 12 hours playing Moebius, occasionally fighting off the urge to take a nap.

Title: 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil Review
Review: More than a cynical cash-in, 2014 FIFA World Cup's worth comes from the depth of its key game modes.
Author Information: John has been playing football games for over two decades, experiencing everything from the glories of Sensible Soccer to the horrors of David Beckham Soccer. Ten hours were spent in (digital) Brazil for the purposes of this review.

Title: Conception II Review
Review: Conception II has plenty of lust, but it lacks heart.
Author Information: Britton Peele is not a parent to any children, magical or otherwise, but he has been a big fan of RPGs for most of his life and counts Final Fantasy VI among his favorite games of all time. He completed Conception II's main story, dabbled with New Game Plus, and reloaded a final save to see multiple endings before writing this review.

Title: Life Goes On Review
Review: Life Goes On is a great, morbid puzzler that reminds you that there is no victory without sacrifice.
Author Information: More concerned with completing levels than earning achievements, puzzle-solving veteran Matt Cabral shamelessly sacrificed the lives of hundreds of brave warriors while playing Life Goes On. His Knights of the Round Table membership has since been revoked.

Title: Trials Fusion Review
Review: Trials Fusion delivers the same exciting racing action from previous games, with a beautiful new aesthetic and enough humor to keep you laughing.
Author Information: Tom eventually brute-forced his way to the expert tracks, though may have gotten a little help along the way. His masochistic tendencies bring him toward challenging games, so Trials has been a consistent favorite.

Title: Half Minute Hero: The Second Coming Review
Review: Ultra-fast-paced RPG gameplay, delightful parodies, and a wealth of new features make Half-Minute Hero: The Second Coming a blast to play.
Author Information: The original Half-Minute Hero still ranks among Heidi's favorite games of the past five years, and seeing the sequel finally surface in English has made her exceptionally happy. She invites any and all fake heroes to try to prove their worth in multiplayer mode against her. Bring it on, chumps.

Title: SimCity Updated Review
Review: SimCity may finally be playable offline, but all of its flaws are just as evident now as they were before.
Author Information: Brett Todd would have rather killed four or five hours proofreading old city bylaws than venturing once again into the mayor's office of SimCity.

Title: Lego The Hobbit Review
Review: Lego The Hobbit is charming, funny, faithful to the films, and incredibly tedious to play.
Author Information: Carolyn is a huge fan of J.R.R. Tolkien and thinks Peter Jackson's films based on Tolkien's work are pretty neat. Lego The Hobbit is the first Lego game she's played since the days of the Lego Star Wars games.

Title: Strike Suit Zero: Director's Cut Review
Review: The Director's Cut version of last year's Strike Suit Zero is periodically entertaining, but clogged up with too much repetition and an unconvincing Transformer ship gimmick.
Author Information: Space combat veteran Brett Todd played with his Transformer space ships in Strike Suit Zero: Director's Cut for over a dozen hours.

Title: Borderlands 2: Headhunter 5 - Sir Hammerlock vs. the Son of Crawmerax Review
Review: Sir Hammerlock vs. the Son of Crawmerax ends the story of Borderlands 2 on a great note, providing a beautiful new location to explore, tough enemies, and loads of humor.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent dozens of hours on Pandora slaying bandits and ending threshers with his trusty blade and sniper rifle. For the purpose of this review, Cameron spent about six hours enjoying the sun.

Title: Demon Gaze Review
Review: Demon Gaze's unique battle elements and engaging first-person exploration make it a solid, enjoyable dungeon crawler.
Author Information: Heidi honestly didn't expect much from Demon Gaze, and was pleasantly surprised to find out that it's a good Vita RPG. Strangely, the game doesn't have an internal timekeeper, but she played the game frequently for about two straight weeks to review it. Also, she assures us that all of the gazer memos she left you folks are totally helpful and not trolling at all. Hmm...

Title: Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII - A Newcomer's Take Review
Review: Lightning Returns proves to be a poor point of entry for a Final Fantasy newcomer despite its thorough explanations and extensive exposition.
Author Information: After enjoying only a select few JRPGs over the years, Chris Watters dedicated just under 20 hours to Lightning Returns, his first ever Final Fantasy game.

Title: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 3 - A Crooked Mile Review
Review: The Wolf Among Us hits its stride with an electrifying third installment.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is enthralled by The Wolf Among Us, and is voraciously reading the comics that inspired Telltale's newest series. He has a few theories about where this mystery is headed, and looks forward to having them proven wrong. He finished A Crooked Mile in about 90 heart-pounding minutes.

Title: Mercenary Kings Review
Review: Mercenary Kings heads down several familiar paths at once, to mixed results.
Author Information: Jason Venter spent nearly 50 hours exploring Mandragora Island to review Mercenary Kings, which is still a mere fraction of the time he previously enjoyed with many of the 8-bit and 16-bit action games that served as Mercenary Kings' obvious inspiration.

Title: Kinect Sports Rivals Review
Review: Kinect Sports Rivals is an uneven collection of sports-themed minigames that won't hold your interest for long.
Author Information: Carolyn doesn't spend as much time outdoors being athletic as she knows she should. She's played plenty of motion-controlled sports games in the past

Title: Planetside 2 Updated Review
Review: PlanetSide 2 is war, plain and simple.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks used to think Big Team Battle in the Halo series and Onslaught in Unreal Tournament were the true ways to play first-person shooters, until he played the original PlanetSide at a friend's house in high school. In PlanetSide 2, his battle rank 71 Vanu soldier has over 300 hours logged.

Title: Arma 3 Updated Review
Review: Arma III's new campaign isn't going to win hearts and minds, but its creation suite stands strong.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli abandoned dozens of soldiers across the fields of Altis during his run through Arma III's full campaign and jaunts into available mods. It wasn't his fault--they just wouldn't listen.

Title: Ragnarok Odyssey ACE Review
Review: Ragnarok Odyssey returns to the hunt with some new tricks tucked into its armor, along with some old irritants.
Author Information: After tackling both Toukiden: Age of Demons and Ragnarok Odyssey ACE this year, Matt Cabral has more than earned his black belt in monster hunting. If your fantasy world is ever threatened by hell-spawn or giants, you know who to call.

Title: MLB 14: The Show Review
Review: MLB 14: The Show delivers a fast, tight, great-looking game of baseball.
Author Information: Jack DeVries used to spend every day creating custom teams in RBI Baseball on the Genesis so that he could pretend he was an MLB star. Now he watches a lot of baseball-themed anime and has serious opinions on stadium architecture.

Title: Castlevania: Lords of Shadows 2 - Revelations Review
Review: Alucard's tale in Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 - Revelations DLC falls flat, and there are too few combat sequences to get the most out of his unique skill set.
Author Information: Peter's completed every game in the Lords of Shadow series, and he played through Revelations on the default and highest difficulty settings for this review.

Title: Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster Review
Review: Much more than a pretty role-playing game, Final Fantasy X/X-2 HD Remaster is an excellent collection of two PlayStation 2 classics.
Author Information: Josiah Renaudin filled out the entire sphere grid for all seven Final Fantasy X characters twice when he was in junior high. Those experiences, along with multiple playthroughs of other Final Fantasy games, have made him quite the series fan. For the purposes of this review, Josiah defeated Sin and still teared up at the ending.

Title: Escape Goat 2 Review
Review: It's not especially unique, but well-designed puzzles make Escape Goat 2 a lot of fun.
Author Information: Britton Peele has been solving block-focused puzzles since Chip challenged him on his father's PC as a child. He managed to solve about 80 percent of Escape Goat 2's puzzles before writing this review.

Title: Deus Ex: The Fall Review
Review: The PC port of last year's iPad prequel to Deus Ex: Human Revolution could do with a few augmentations.
Author Information: Daniel Hindes is a Deus Ex veteran, having poured countless hours into the 2000 original, its 2004 sequel Invisible War, and the 2011 prequel Human Revolution. He always opts for the stealth pistol and an inconspicuous ventilation shaft.

Title: Age of Wonders III Review
Review: The Age of Wonders series returns with a fun and dynamic turn-based strategy game that plants its focus squarely on creating exciting battles.
Author Information: Maxwell McGee is new to the Age of Wonders series, but had no trouble diving into and understanding Age of Wonders III. And even after a dozen campaigns, he still discovers something new with every battle.

Title: Betrayer Review
Review: The colorless world of Betrayer is home to an intriguing mystery, tense atmosphere, and inconsistent enemies.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has slept with the lights on ever since stepping foot into the Otherworld, and is considering taking up archery. For the purpose of this review, Cameron played around 15 hours, completing the game and collecting secret treasures.

Title: Infamous: Second Son Review
Review: The gorgeous world of Infamous: Second Son is brimming with delights, setting you loose in Seattle to partake in fast-paced, inventive combat that's an absolute blast.
Author Information: Tom adores the chaotic frenzy of the Infamous franchise. He played through Second Son twice for this review, getting 100 percent both times. It took him 16 hours his first time through as a good Delsin on medium and 10 hours the second time as an evil Delsin on expert.

Title: Dragons and Titans Review
Review: Dragons and Titans is a halfhearted and frustrating online arena that doesn't deserve your time.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks lives and breathes the MOBA genre. He couldn't pass up the opportunity to breathe various elements as a dragon, and gave Dragons and Titans eight levels, the single-player campaign, and many hours' worth of multiplayer matches to prove itself.

Title: The Witch and the Hundred Knight Review
Review: There's some meaty, complex gameplay to The Witch and the Hundred Knight, but you'll need to endure a terrible lead character and a plodding opening stretch to make it that ...
Author Information: Heidi counts herself among the fan base for NIS's distinct style of experimental and complex game systems. Witch has been on her radar for quite some time, and though the end product was disappointing, she has high hopes for NIS's announced PS4 game in development. Hopefully that one won't take three years to hit the market.

Title: Smite Review
Review: Smite puts the powers of the gods in your hands as you engage in a battle that will rattle the heavens.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks utters the word MOBA so often that he has been mistaken for a new Pokemon species. Although his roots in the genre are firmly with League of Legends, he mastered seven gods and reached level 14 in Smite in order to provide this review.

Title: BioShock infinite: Burial at Sea - Episode 2 Review
Review: The excellent Burial at Sea - Episode 2 marks a welcome return to form for BioShock Infinite.
Author Information: In spite of its post-release backlash, Kevin VanOrd still loves BioShock Infinite, even though he was gravely disappointed by Burial at Sea's first episode. He's on his second playthrough of the new episode, which took him about three and a half hours the first time through.

Title: Hearthstone: Heroes of Warcraft Review
Review: Hearthstone is a free-to-play collectible card game that embraces new players through its presentation and simplicity and satisfies veterans with complex strategies hidden between the lines.
Author Information: Leif Johnson was originally one of those folks who shied away from Magic: The Gathering events, but eventually he got over it. He‰Ûªs enjoyed the renaissance of sorts that collectible card gaming has enjoyed with new digital games, and he prefers to play with Hearthstone‰Ûªs Hunter deck. Leif has been playing Hearthstone since the first beta invites went out last year.

Title: Diablo 3: Reaper of Souls Review
Review: Reaper of Souls brings great new campaign content to Diablo III while also giving you tantalizing reasons to revisit the places you've already been.
Author Information: Carolyn spent some time playing as a crusader and exploring Adventure mode on a test realm set up by Blizzard prior to the expansion's release. She played through the new campaign content once the expansion went live. She prefers not to be reminded that she has now spent well over 100 hours playing Diablo III.

Title: Shadowrun: Dragonfall Review
Review: Fantastic atmosphere and stellar writing make Shadowrun: Dragonfall a great adaptation of its cyberpunk source material.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey has been running the shadows since he was a child, and is cautiously optimistic about the future of Harebrained Schemes' new system.

Title: Luftrausers Review
Review: Luftrausers' arcadelike simplicity makes conquering the skies feel natural and fun.
Author Information: The closest Britton Peele has come to the fantasy of being a world-class fighter pilot was probably that time he watched Top Gun and got his hair cut in the style of Tom Cruise. He played around 10 hours of Luftrausers across the PC, PS3, and Vita for the purposes of this review.

Title: Professor Layton vs. Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney Review
Review: Less crossover and more combination, the excellent Professor Layton vs. Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney provides each of its stars equal face time.
Author Information: John Robertson has been solving puzzles and defending accused innocents since the original Professor Layton and Phoenix Wright games transformed the original DS into one of the greatest handhelds of all time. Well over 30 hours were spent puzzling and objecting before writing this review.

Title: Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z Review
Review: The sloppy action of Dragon Ball Z: Battle of Z makes it a particularly poor entry in the long line of Dragon Ball Z games.
Author Information: Heidi believes in giving every game a fair shake, and anime licensed games should be no different. After all, Treasure made some pretty slick Bleach and Yu Yu Hakusho fighters, and Capcom's take on Jojo's Bizarre Adventure introduced her to one of her favorite manga series. Battle of Z, however, is something she'd just like to never have to touch again.

Title: Infested Planet Review
Review: This innovative alien bug-blasting indie real-time strategy game proves that fun runs deeper than meets the eye.
Author Information: A longtime RTS enthusiast, Nathan has been bored with many of the ho-hum offerings in the genre of late. Infested Planet proved to him once again that cool innovations can come in small packages.

Title: The Yawhg Review
Review: The Yawhg is a fine board-game-inspired diversion for a spell of rain, but don't expect to wait out a long storm with it.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is a regular at fictitious pubs throughout the RPG scene. For the purposes of this review, he played through The Yawhg a couple of dozen times.

Title: Yoshi's New Island Review
Review: Yoshi's New Island lacks the imagination that made its progenitor beloved, instead offering a slow-paced adventure that's too easy for its own good.
Author Information: Tom was one of the few who enjoyed Yoshi's Island DS and has even loved easy platformers such as Kirby's Epic Yarn. But after spending nine hours with Yoshi's New Island, he's incredibly sad about where this franchise has gone.

Title: NaissanceE Review
Review: The world of NaissanceE is mysterious, hostile, and starkly beautiful.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is an architect by trade, which might make him more receptive to NaissanceE than some. For the purposes of this review, he played through the game over the course of approximately 10 hours.

Title: Diablo 3 Review
Review: Significant changes to the loot system in a recent patch make Diablo III a more rewarding game than it's ever been.
Author Information: Carolyn has always enjoyed a good fantasy hack-and-slash RPG, with Baldur's Gate: Dark Alliance being a particular favorite. She's more motivated by the prospect of vanquishing evil than the allure of sweet gear. She's now logged a total of 90 hours with Diablo III.

Title: Resident Evil 4 HD Edition Review
Review: Resident Evil 4 finally gets the PC version it always deserved, with only a few visual stumbles to detract from its brilliance.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is no stranger to zombies or any sort of infected folk, and keeps a fire axe near his desk at all times---just in case. For the purposes of this review, Cameron played about 25 hours, completing the main campaign and unlockable side missions.

Title: Basement Crawl Review
Review: Basement Crawl tries to emulate Bomberman with a horror setting, but fails to ignite on all accounts.
Author Information: Britton Peele lives in Texas, where basements are practically nonexistent. Therefore, he has never crawled in one, but if he had one, he probably would have used it to play Bomberman with his friends all day. He played dozens of Basement Crawl matches before writing this review.

Title: South Park: The Stick of Truth Review
Review: South Park: The Stick of Truth is as simplistic as role-playing games come, but it captures the spirit of the animated show's riotous raunch.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has spent most of his life insisting that he is not fat, but big-boned, and has always looked to Eric Cartman as his primary inspiration. He loves South Park and crude humor, and has played more role-playing games than you can shake a Stick of Truth at. It took him eleven hours to finish the game's story and complete almost every side activity in the game.

Title: Metal Gear Solid 5: Ground Zeroes Review
Review: Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes has a brief narrative, but its short length is bolstered by flexible side missions and exceptional replayability.
Author Information: Peter has finished nearly every game in the Metal Gear Solid series, and spent over 15 hours playing Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes, divided between the PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and Xbox 360 versions of the game.

Title: The Walking Dead: Season Two Episode 2 - A House Divided Review
Review: Season Two of The Walking Dead starts coming together in the bleak and harrowing second episode, A House Divided.
Author Information: Brett Todd bashed zombie skulls and felt really, really sorry for Clementine while taking the two hours needed to play through this episode of The Walking Dead.

Title: Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z Review
Review: Scattershot action and awful writing make Yaiba: Ninja Gaiden Z one lifeless zombie invasion.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd loves Ninja Gaiden, bloody action, and crass humor, but Yaiba left him cold. He finished the campaign in about seven hours and spent about two hours squashing the undead in Arcade mode. If you're looking for some old-fashioned profanity and sexual imagery, he suggests playing MadWorld instead.

Title: Banished Review
Review: Banished is a clever network of interlocking systems and mechanics that accomplish a lot with very little.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey spent more than 60 hours over five days starting up over a dozen cities and struggling to keep his citizenry alive.

Title: Towerfall Ascension Review
Review: Towerfall Ascension is a fast and frantic multiplayer game that provides lots of interesting variations on its enjoyable archery combat--just make sure you have a few friends on hand to ...
Author Information: Maxwell McGee is relishing the fact that one-hit kills are breathing new life into the competitive brawler genre

Title: Rambo: The Video Game Review
Review: Rambo: The Video game is a fun, simple rail shooter.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks usually keeps to the indoor comfort of PC gaming, but will always have a soft spot for the nostalgia of an arcade rail shooter. Countless quarters and tokens have been spent on the Time Crisis series, and a few playthroughs of Rambo: The Video Game brought back those olden times.

Title: World of Tanks: Xbox 360 Edition Review
Review: Slow and strategic tank battles bring a different kind of fun to the fight in World of Tanks' multiplayer armored combat.
Author Information: After taking to the skies in World of Warplanes, Nathan found that a more grounded approach to combat fit the bill nicely. He battled extensively through World of Tanks' freebie and paid content for this review.

Title: Titanfall Review
Review: Exhilarating player movement and a brilliant blend of two distinct combat styles make Titanfall a thrilling shooter.
Author Information: Chris Watters played Titanfall for two days straight at a review event run by EA, where he encountered server issues allegedly caused by small player population. Over the weekend preceding publication of the GameSpot review, he played from home as the servers went up and was able to reliably enter lag-free matches in the most populated lobby. He played a dozen hours of the PC version post-release, and encountered no notable issues. He loves, loves, loves competitive shooters.

Title: Dark Souls 2 Review
Review: Dark Souls II is a terrific sequel and an amazing game in its own right, making every peek into the unknown a gut-wrenching thrill.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played over 100 hours of Dark Souls--his favorite game of its console generation--and almost as many of Demon's Souls. He finished Dark Souls II at soul level 131 playing on a PlayStation 3 debug. While his online access was limited during this time, he was able to test various multiplayer features and can't wait to unleash hell on unsuspecting invaders.

Title: Earth Defense Force 2025 Review
Review: Earth Defense Force 2025 is shallow and unattractive. It's also good, mindless, destructive fun.
Author Information: Earth Defense Force 2025 represents the first time that Carolyn has seriously dived into the EDF series. For the purposes of this review, she spent about 10 hours destroying--err, defending--Earth.

Title: Horizon Review
Review: Horizon is a strange, clumsy, and compelling composite of ideas and mechanics from many different games.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey was slowly becoming a jaded strategy game veteran. Then came Horizon, and he spent dozens of hours exploring this very unusual game. He also lost a few matches for the first time in years.

Title: Journal Review
Review: Journal has a compelling vibe, but disjointed storytelling gets in the way of what it has to say.
Author Information: Brett Todd spent just under two hours writing down all of his innermost thoughts and secrets in Journal.

Title: Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare Review
Review: The gameplay of Plants vs. Zombies: Garden Warfare is standard stuff, but the game's lighthearted tone makes it an appealing multiplayer shooter that stands out from the crowd.
Author Information: Carolyn got way into Call of Duty: Modern Warfare's multiplayer years back but hasn't gotten pulled into a competitive shooter in quite a while. She spent about six hours playing Garden Warfare at an event hosted by EA, and another four hours in a scheduled online session. There is no place for a garden in her apartment building.

Title: Outlast Review
Review: Outlast loses momentum occasionally, but its unsettling atmosphere and pulse-pounding chases keep pulling you along for the ride.
Author Information: Carolyn isn't quite sure why she sometimes enjoys scaring herself silly, but she does. The games that have haunted her dreams include Eternal Darkness, Dead Space, and Condemned: Criminal Origins. Carolyn played the PlayStation 4 version of Outlast to completion in the empty GameSpot offices one lonely, spooky Sunday.

Title: Thief Review
Review: At its best, Thief makes you feel like a devious outlaw. Sadly, such moments are too few.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has been sneaking in the shadows as Garrett since the release of Thief: The Dark Project. He spent about 15 hours with Thief, and reckons that he would have finished the game in eight hours or so if he'd focused on just the story.

Title: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 Review
Review: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow 2 starts off with a whimper, but the gripping second half of the game makes plodding through a few hours of tedium a worthwhile chore in ...
Author Information: Peter's played through both the original Lords of Shadow and Mirror of Fate, and is a big fan of older games in the series. He played through Lords of Shadow 2 on the default difficulty, discovering 65 percent of the game's hidden items in the process.

Title: Dustforce Review
Review: Dustforce is a delightful game that mixes its tranquil world with some seriously tough platforming.
Author Information: Maxwell prides himself on cleanliness, especially when it comes to his golden locks. Thankfully, it doesn't take a team of ninja hairdressers to keep his mane clean.

Title: Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze Review
Review: Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze's unimaginative level design saps the fun out of this retro-inspired platformer.
Author Information: Mark spent his Christmas break ignoring relatives and loved ones, and instead tried to earn a Platinum Trophy in Rayman: Legends. Suffice it to say, he loves a good platformer. For the purposes of this review, Mark made his way to the end of Tropical Freeze, but didn't manage to pick up all the puzzle pieces along the way.

Title: TxK Review
Review: TxK is totally Tempest, but it's some of the best dang Tempest you can play.
Author Information: Britton Peele's first memory of Tempest is playing the Microsoft Arcade port on his father's work PC as a youngster, and the vector visuals were burned into his brain instantly. He played through all 100 levels of TxK and chased many high scores before writing this review.

Title: The Last of Us: Left Behind Review
Review: The Last of Us: Left Behind offers an endearing look at Ellie's life before she met Joel, delivering a heartfelt story that makes an excellent character even more sympathetic.
Author Information: Tom was riveted during the three hours he spent with Left Behind. He was more involved in the story of Ellie's life before she met Joel than the story of The Last of Us, and loved the changes to the combat.

Title: Loadout Review
Review: Loadout's deep weapon-crafting system and outrageous violence make for boisterous fun.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey knows his way around online shooters, but shamelessly spent more time tinkering with and testing new weapons in Loadout than actually using them. For the purposes of this review, Cameron played for about 18 hours, crafting five weapons.

Title: Jazzpunk Review
Review: Loads of humor and outrageousness make this cyberpunk indie adventure worth playing.
Author Information: A connoisseur of peculiar indie gaming offerings, Nathan dove into Jazzpunk and got a kick out of being blasted by wave after wave of craziness. After beating the game, and then diving back in for more, he was still left craving another helping.

Title: Toukiden: The Age of Demons Review
Review: Toukiden: The Age of Demons duplicates the appeal of the Monster Hunter games while also establishing its own identity.
Author Information: As a fan of both Monster Hunter and Soul Sacrifice, Matt Cabral has reduced his fair share of beasties to pulpy puddles. After spending the better part of a weekend with Toukiden for the purpose of this review, his corpse pile is becoming a problem he can no longer hide in his bedroom closet.

Title: The Castle Doctrine Review
Review: The Castle Doctrine is a poorly balanced structure built on an unstable foundation.
Author Information: Even after many hours of play, Nick Capozzoli clearly doesn't have the sort of nefarious criminal mind required to succeed at The Castle Doctrine's game of trap-building and armed robbery. For the purposes of this review he was killed hundreds of times by pit bulls.

Title: Strider Review
Review: Strider is a high-speed, acrobatic action game with a hero that‰Ûªs fun to control from the first blade swipe to the final deathblow.
Author Information: While Maxwell's familiarity with Strider doesn't extend past the Marvel vs. Capcom series, he still knows a good hack-and-slash game when he sees one. After burning through this enjoyable adventure, he is excited to go back and discover the classic games that made this character a gaming icon.

Title: Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc Review
Review: Danganronpa: Trigger Happy Havoc presents a fascinating look at the human experience, using smart storytelling to invest you in this dark and creepy world.
Author Information: Tom has been fascinated by visual novels of late. Becoming a part of a clever story can be incredibly empowering. He spent a couple of dozen hours with Danganronpa and was sad to see the ending credits roll.

Title: Strike Vector Review
Review: Strike Vector needs refinement, but there's a promising foundation holding up its hybridized combat.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is a self-avowed technophile, and interested in any media with jets, robots, or any combination thereof. For the purposes of this review he played a week's worth of Strike Vector's multiplayer.

Title: Lightning Returns: Final Fantasy XIII Review
Review: Lightning Returns is a jumble of mechanics and story elements that don't mesh into a meaningful whole.
Author Information: Against all odds, Kevin VanOrd enjoyed Final Fantasy XIII and Final Fantasy XIII-2. He spent about 65 hours with Lightning Returns in total, and reached the final boss twice: once in a New Game Plus, and once in a New Game Plus Plus.

Title: The Lego Movie Videogame Review
Review: The Lego Movie Videogame re-creates and expands on most of the film's greatest moments.
Author Information: Jason Venter has played most of the Lego video games to date. He spent around seven or eight hours clearing the campaign for the purpose of this review and another few hours chasing collectibles, plus enjoyed watching the related film in 3D at the local movie theater.

Title: Star Wars: The Old Republic - Galactic Starfighter Review
Review: Galactic Starfighter serves up a richly featured expansion of The Old Republic's previously bare-bones space combat experience.
Author Information: Brittany Vincent is a Sith warrior who prefers to walk on the dark side of the Force. She loves dabbling in far-off alien worlds and finds your lack of faith in her disturbing. For the purposes of this review, she spent about 30 hours doing not-quite barrel rolls and cackling maniacally in the Galactic Starfighter expansion.

Title: Insurgency Review
Review: No-frills realism and tight teamwork make Insurgency a welcome break from the status quo.
Author Information: First-person shooters and multiplayer pew-pew are in Nathan Meunier's blood. He's been fragging dudes since the early days of home-networked Doom II matches. For this review, he spent more than a dozen hours in match after match of tactical team action.

Title: Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition Review
Review: Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition is as exciting as it is gorgeous, offering a robust adventure that satisfies on almost every front.
Author Information: Tom collected every hidden item when he played through Tomb Raider last year, though he unfortunately didn't have enough time to scour every environment in the Definitive Edition. Still, he was once again sucked into this incredible adventure, proving that its high placement on his Game of the Year list wasn't a mistake.

Title: Echo Prime Review
Review: Echo Prime offers a flawed but accessible mix of repetitive action and customization.
Author Information: Jason Venter has punched, shot, and stabbed his way through so many fictional worlds that at this point he has forgotten some of them even exist. He spent 12 hours clearing the Echo Prime campaign and another four hours grinding after that, just because.

Title: Rekoil Review
Review: Rekoil harks back to online shooters of old, but game-breaking problems keep it from hitting its mark.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent countless hours of his youth playing games like Quake II, Unreal Tournament, and Counter-Strike, and believes that sometimes simpler can be better. But everything else has to work, too.

Title: Fable Anniversary Review
Review: Not every element of Fable Anniversary holds up against its contemporaries, but it's an amusing and charming return to one of gaming's most delightful worlds.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd played and loved both the original Fable and Fable II, but was so disappointed with Fable III that he quit halfway through. He spent about 20 hours with Fable Anniversary, buying houses, getting married, and making whoopee.

Title: Might & Magic X: Legacy Review
Review: Might & Magic X: Legacy seems like a 15-year-old leftover, for better and for worse.
Author Information: Veteran role player Brett Todd spent about 15 hours on might and another 15 hours on magic in the course of reviewing Might & Magic X: Legacy.

Title: Naruto Shippuden: Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst Review
Review: Impressive visual flair cannot overcome the shallow core gameplay that plagues Ultimate Ninja Storm 3 Full Burst.
Author Information: John likes to downplay his dedication to anime and Japanese video games, but the truth is that rarely a week goes by without at least a few hours being consumed by the wonders of Tokyo-driven pop culture. For the purposes of this review, 20 hours were plowed into Full Burst.

Title: Team Fortress 2 Review
Review: Team Fortress 2 is an inspiring example of how great design and passionate players can keep a competitive game lively years after release.
Author Information: Chris Watters reviewed Team Fortress 2 for GameSpot almost six years ago when you could buy it off of retail shelves for $20. The 12+ hours he spent for this review have been like reconnecting with an old friend who doesn't just talk about the old days, but has fun new stories and fart jokes to share.

Title: Blackguards Review
Review: Blackguards is a grueling tactical role-playing game that thrives on brutal challenges.
Author Information: Leif Johnson always enjoys a good fantasy RPG, and Blackguards was no different. He admits he initially wanted to kill Zurbaran, but grew to like the fellow. For the purposes of this review, he completed one full playthrough and experimented with multiple builds in shorter sessions.

Title: Nidhogg Review
Review: Nidhogg isn't too satisfying alone, but it offers frantically enjoyable sword-dueling action with local friends.
Author Information: Britton Peele owns more than one sword, so it's sort of surprising that he also has friends to play Nidhogg with. He was responsible for the deaths of hundreds of virtual swordfighters both online and off before writing this review, and looks forward to new challengers.

Title: Don't Starve: Console Edition Review
Review: This brutal survival and crafting adventure delivers fun and punishment in equal measure.
Author Information: Having already submitted to the pleasant but punishing discipline of Don't Starve on the PC, Nathan Meunier knew what he was getting into with this updated PS4 port. After many more hours spent dying, grinding, slaying, and exploring, he knows the meaning of roguelike pain. And he's ready for more.

Title: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 2 - Smoke and Mirrors Review
Review: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 2 - Smoke and Mirrors is another engrossing chapter in this ongoing saga, though it doesn't blaze as brightly as the introductory episode.
Author Information: After playing the first episode of The Wolf Among Us, Kevin VanOrd ran out to purchase multiple volumes of the comic that inspired it. It took him about 90 minutes to complete Smoke and Mirrors.

Title: Octodad: Dadliest Catch Review
Review: Octodad: Dadliest Catch has moments of comic brilliance, but much of it is uninspired, and it ends before it really even gets going.
Author Information: Carolyn is not secretly an octopus living as a human, but her life has nonetheless taught her a thing or two about the importance of self-acceptance. She played through most of Dadliest Catch's stages twice for this review.

Title: Pandora: First Contact Review
Review: Pandora: First Contact looks to the stars, but it can't even achieve escape velocity.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey has been looking for a replacement for Sid Meier's Alpha Centauri for years, and he still wishes more games included a play-by-email option. After investing a few dozen hours in it, he's ready to leave Pandora behind for greener pastures.

Title: Consortium Review
Review: Consortium is a fun story-driven sci-fi role-playing game with some first-person shooter elements, but bugs and glitches mar the experience.
Author Information: Leif Johnson loves good characterization in an RPG, and Consortium presents one of the most authentic ensemble casts in a while. For the purposes of this review, he played several times to experiment with different choices.

Title: Broken Age Act I Review
Review: The opening act for Broken Age establishes a wonderfully vibrant world with a surprisingly somber tone. Hopefully, it will all pay off in the second act.
Author Information: Maxwell was enchanted by the whimsical and tragic world of Broken Age. He can't wait to see how it all pays off in the second act of this modern-day fairy tale.

Title: Dr. Luigi Review
Review: Dr. Luigi repackages the Dr. Mario formula with some new ideas, but limited options and slow pacing leave it feeling anemic.
Author Information: Heidi is a longtime puzzle game player and fan of competitive gaming. Her favorite puzzle series is Magical Drop. She's rather sad that puzzle games don't have as much organized competition as other player-versus-player genres, which is why she is currently a strong advocate for promoting the Global Yoshi's Cookie League.

Title: The Cat Lady Review
Review: It isn't its horror but rather its humanity that makes The Cat Lady such a worthwhile journey.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd owns only one cat, but he was still invested in The Cat Lady's titular character. He finished the game in about six hours.

Title: OlliOlli Review
Review: In OlliOlli, over-the-top skateboarding gets boiled down to a high-score chase that is difficult to master but intensely rewarding.
Author Information: Britton Peele's only experience with a real skateboard involved falling, but he's been a fan of over-the-top skateboard games since the early days of Tony Hawk. He mastered OlliOlli's amateur challenges, finished many pro challenges, and landed more than 1,000 perfect tricks before writing this review.

Title: Frozen Hearth Review
Review: Frozen Hearth doesn't offer anything that wasn't done better elsewhere, and long ago.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is a capable‰ÛÓif unspectacular‰ÛÓRTS player. For the purposes of this review he played through the campaign, and against the AI in multiplayer (the servers were bereft of human players).

Title: Assassin's Creed III: Liberation HD Review
Review: Ubisoft takes a former 5-inch Assassin's Creed adventure to much larger screens and brings its baggage along with it.
Author Information: Miguel previously beat Assassin's Creed III: Liberation on the Vita, which is why he managed to complete this HD version in less than six hours (with a couple more hours for side missions and general exploration). You can check out his assassin skills in GameSpot's 100 percent sync videos of Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag.

Title: Ballpoint Universe Infinite Review
Review: Fanciful landscapes and imaginative enemies give Ballpoint Universe Infinite lots of quirky appeal.

Title: Driftmoon Review
Review: Driftmoon is a simple role-playing game that enraptures with clever dialogue and memorable characters.
Author Information: Enthusiastic role-player Cameron Woolsey spent around 10 hours playing Driftwood, finishing the game to completion and checking out various mods.

Title: Halo: Spartan Assault Review
Review: Halo: Spartan Assault transfers adequately from mobile platforms to the Xbox One, with microtransactions in tow.
Author Information: Miguel has appreciated Halo as a game series, having beaten all of the mainline installments, though he hasn't read any of the novels or comics. Clearing all 35 missions in Halo: Spartan Assault took him about five hours.

Title: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood Review
Review: Max: The Curse of Brotherhood is pretty, and pretty decent.
Author Information: Jason Venter has vicariously run, jumped, crawled, and climbed his way through more worlds in peril than you'd care to know about, but he still managed to rack up more than his fair share of stumbles in the six or seven hours he spent clearing Max: The Curse of Brotherhood.

Title: 9.03m Review
Review: 9.03m tries to stir your emotions, but its attempts to honor the dearly departed are weightless.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has a soft spot for games, films, and novels that stimulate the heart, but believes that great art earns the right to manipulate you.

Title: Terraria Review
Review: Terraria Vita is the best version of an already amazing game because you can take this enthralling adventure with you wherever you go.
Author Information: Terraria was one of Tom's favorite games of 2011, and it's even better two years later. He sunk dozens of hours into it for this review and plans on playing many dozens of hours more.

Title: Continue?9876543210 Review
Review: Continue?9876543210 explores what happens to video game characters after the game-over screen fades, and in turn asks how we'll face our own mortality.
Author Information: After his time with Continue, Maxwell has spent several long nights and early morning contemplating what's important in his own life. He still doesn't have all the answers, but maybe that's the point.

Title: Violett Review
Review: Violett channels Salvador Dali and Tim Burton in a surreal and challenging tale.
Author Information: Longtime adventurer Daniel Starkey journeyed through Violett's rabbit hole and spent two nights racking his brain to escape.

Title: The Banner Saga Review
Review: More often than not, the gorgeous and intriguing Banner Saga successfully balances the conflicting ideas of strategic control and arbitrary consequence.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd enjoys leading giant armies to victory almost as much as he likes making difficult choices. He spent about 12 hours with The Banner Saga, finishing the campaign and tinkering with various decisions and their repercussions.

Title: The Walking Dead: Season Two Episode 1 - All That Remains Review
Review: All That Remains establishes characters and conflicts that may pay off in forthcoming episodes, but it doesn't stand up well on its own.
Author Information: Carolyn really enjoyed the first season of Telltale's The Walking Dead. She played through All That Remains on a literal movie screen at a literal movie theater, which was absurd. Then she played through it again on a PC monitor like a normal person.

Title: Dementium II HD Review
Review: A serviceable survival horror, Dementium II was better with a stylus.
Author Information: Matt Cabral has been a survival horror fan ever since that undead pooch pounced on him in Resident Evil. Having played both Dementium games on the Nintendo DS, he was eager to have his sanity tested again in this rerelease. After six or so hours in Dementium II HD's asylum, however, he'd rather be recommitted to the original's rubber room.

Title: Speedball 2 HD Review
Review: Speedball 2 definitely has the speed down, but the barebones multiplayer limits the fun.
Author Information: This is Daniel Starkey's first experience with the Speedball series, and he has since spent far too long wondering how it would work as a real sport. He spent about 12 hours playing Speedball 2.

Title: Baldur's Gate II: Enhanced Edition Review
Review: Baldur's Gate II retains some familiar flaws, but this enhanced model is one more reason to revisit a classic role-playing game.
Author Information: Dungeons & Dragons enthusiast Brett Todd dedicated a solid month of his spare time to Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn and its Throne of Bhaal expansion for the purposes of this review.

Title: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag - Freedom Cry Review
Review: A detour for a slave-turned-pirate-turned-assassin helps sow the seeds of a rebellion in this well-intentioned but flawed add-on.
Author Information: After a number of assignments, including a 100 percent sync walkthrough for GameSpot, Miguel has amassed about 100 hours in Assassin's Creed IV over multiple playthroughs. After beating the story of Freedom Cry as well as accomplishing some optional goals, the tally is up to 105 hours.

Title: Flow Review
Review: Flow remains a beautifully simple blueprint for the developer's later triumphs.
Author Information: Thatgamecompany's Journey ranks high on Britton Peele's list of favorite PlayStation 3 games, and he enjoys a game that can take things slowly and thoughtfully. He completed all of Flow on the PlayStation 4 and briefly revisited the PS3 version before writing this review.

Title: Bandfuse: Rock Legends Review
Review: A realistic tab-based approach to rhythm game rocking makes BandFuse: Rock Legends a wailing good time despite some tough love in the learning department.
Author Information: Playing in an assortment of oddball rock, punk, and metal bands since his early teens, Nathan Meunier is down with the face-melting goodness. Drums might be his instrument of choice, but he's no slouch on the six-string or low end either. For this review, he plowed through the extensive tracklist on all manner of difficulty settings, truly pushing his guitar and bass-playing skills to the limit...and then some.

Title: X Rebirth Review
Review: X Rebirth's endless deficiencies make it an inferior husk of the X games that came before it.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is a longtime X series lover, and longingly recalls the days when space games were common. His favorite X game remains X2: The Threat, though his favorite space game of all time is the original Homeworld. He played about 40 hours of X Rebirth for the purposes of this review.

Title: Strength of the Sword 3 Review
Review: The combat in Strength of the Sword is impressive and challenging, but boring enemies and a steep learning curve drag things down.
Author Information: Heidi laments that there are so few "boss rush" games on the market, and even fewer truly great games fitting that description. Hey, can I talk about Alien Soldier? I really love Alien Soldier. It's a genius game that has every kind of ultra-challenging boss you could ever--no? Well, how about I just say to play that instead?

Title: NES Remix Review
Review: NES Remix may bring back fond memories if you've played the games it features, but it doesn't actually capture what made some of those games great in the first place.
Author Information: Carolyn has an enduring love for the Nintendo Entertainment System, but even she knows that certain Nintendo-made games for it, like Urban Champion, were pretty terrible.

Title: State of Decay: Breakdown Review
Review: New content may be light in this add-on, but State of Decay: Breakdown ramps up the emphasis on survival.
Author Information: Leif Johnson loves open-world games, although he usually prefers to shoot arrows at trolls and bandits in The Elder Scrolls rather than bash in zombie heads. For the purposes of this review, he played about 20 hours.

Title: Saint Seiya: Brave Soldiers Review
Review: Saint Seiya: Brave Soldiers slathers lots of fan service over a simple fighting game core.
Author Information: Heidi was mystified as to why Brave Soldiers was entirely in Portuguese at first, only to realize that the game defaults to that language if the console's system settings aren't English, French, Spanish, or Italian. The story mode made marginally more sense after she realized this. She is extremely thankful to know lifelong Saint Seiya fans who helped fill in the gaps.

Title: Bravely Default Review
Review: Thanks to its excellent battle system, Bravely Default breathes new life into a traditionalist genre.
Author Information: John's time on the 3DS is dominated by the many quality Japanese role-playing games found on the machine, and he lives in the hope that one day something even better than Chrono Trigger will come along. Over 30 hours was spent in Bravely Default's world for this review.

Title: Tiny Brains Review
Review: Tiny Brains is big on personality but short on intellect.
Author Information: Brittany Vincent has puzzled through several PC and console adventures and considers herself well-versed in all things mind-bending. She completed Tiny Brains in both solo and cooperative modes for the purposes of this review, and though she was able to best it, that's more than she can say for her multiple playthroughs of The Secret Island of Dr. Quandary.

Title: DUST 514 Review
Review: Dust 514's bid to expand the EVE universe is an exercise in ennui.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli is a longtime EVE Online and first-person shooter player. He has spent time in Dust 514 since its beta, checking in intermittently to stay abreast of its progress.

Title: Samurai Gunn Review
Review: The frenetic Samurai Gunn provides an exciting competitive experience that demands precision and rewards fast fingers and thoughtful strategies.
Author Information: Tom has been aching for an exciting offline competitive game for far too long, so was immediately taken in by Samurai Gunn. He spent the majority of his time in four-player matches and rarely had much honor.

Title: Vector Review
Review: Vector is an exciting free-running platformer that flies high.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey, after playing several hours of Vector, attempted to parkour over his chair and slide under a coffee table. He is happy to report he will be as good as new after a couple of weeks of intense physical therapy.

Title: Ys: Memories of Celceta Review
Review: Well-constructed action and exploration make Ys: Memories of Celceta a delightful adventure.
