Author Information: After The Oath in Felghana and Ys Seven, Heidi was greatly looking forward to Memories of Celceta. After 25 hours with the newest YS game, she's happy that Falcom's first Vita game delivered the goods. She'll still argue that Ys I and II are pretty awful to play by modern standards, though.

Title: Darkout Review
Review: Its problems add up quickly, but there's enjoyment in Darkout's more advanced crafting systems if you dig deeply enough into them .
Author Information: Britton Peele has mined many depths and crafted many items, and is always up for some relaxing exploration. He spent more than 20 hours fumbling for a torch in Darkout for this review.

Title: Gomo Review
Review: Gomo has heart, but its brevity and lack of challenge keep it from being worth your while.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey travelled far and wide to reunite a burlap boy with his burlap dog, playing less than two hours in the process and unlocking two bonus games.

Title: Huntsman: The Orphanage Review
Review: Story and voice work trump dwindling fear in Huntsman: The Orphanage.
Author Information: Leif Johnson lives in Illinois, but he's never had the occasion to discover a ruined orphanage quite like the one found in The Huntsman, though he has explored his fair share of abandoned buildings blighted by urban decay. He thinks the huntsman would have been even more effective if set in snow. For the purposes of this review, Leif played about eight hours.

Title: Luxuria Superbia Review
Review: Luxuria Superbia momentarily kindles your fire, but quickly loses energy.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey spent the later part of Luxuria Superbia trying not to get distracted by shiny objects. For the purpose of this review, Cameron played each stage to completion.

Title: World of Warplanes Review
Review: A ton of unlockable planes and exciting dogfights overshadow World of Warplanes' tendency towards repetition.
Author Information: Nathan Meunier is no stranger to the unfriendly skies. From bombing runs to dogfights, he's been locking and loading in the cockpit since the early days of the flight combat genre. For this review, he tested out lots of different planes and engaged the enemy in more than 85 matches.

Title: Dead Sky Review
Review: Dead Sky merges tower defense and zombie action into one terrible mess.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks typically defends towers in League of Legends but took a break to instead defend himself in Dead Sky. He's now in the top 20 on the leaderboards for single-player attempts on every map in Dead Sky.

Title: Super Motherload Review
Review: Super Motherload offers a peaceful respite from the cacophony of civilization.
Author Information: Tom has developed a close relationship with digging in recent years. From the expansive worlds of Terraria to the robotic plunders in SteamWorld Dig, he seems to continually wield a digital shovel. He spent seven hours digging into Super Motherload and was stymied by many of its puzzles.

Title: Blacklight: Retribution Review
Review: There's fast-paced fun to be had in Blacklight: Retribution, but its demanding free-to-play model dulls the sheen.
Author Information: Nathan Meunier is no stranger to the Blacklight series and is an avid enjoyer of the first-person shooter. For the purposes of this review, he spent upward of a dozen hours killing and getting killed in countless online matches.

Title: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW Review
Review: Adventure Time: Explore the Dungeon Because I DON'T KNOW is a terrible excuse for a dungeon crawler with nothing to offer anyone.
Author Information: Carolyn has been playing dungeon crawlers since the days when "Warrior needs food badly!" could be heard echoing throughout arcades across the land. She thinks this might be the worst dungeon crawler she's ever played.

Title: Fighter Within Review
Review: Fighter Within is a laughable attempt at a fighting game.
Author Information: Mark completed the story mode of Fighter Within for this review, and took on some of his coworkers in two-player combat. He wishes both things had never happened to him.

Title: Peggle 2 Review
Review: Peggle 2 is an engrossing explosion of sights, sounds, and laughs.
Author Information: Mark has played the original Peggle relentlessly on his iPhone nearly every day for the past two years. He's not quite sure how many hours that adds up to, but he knows from all the virtual Peggle trophies he has that it was totally worth it.

Title: The Novelist Review
Review: The Novelist doesn't tell the most tightly constructed of stories, but the choices it forces you to make have real, affecting weight.
Author Information: Carolyn once entertained notions of being a novelist, but is perhaps more of a playwright at heart. She played through The Novelist twice for this review. It took her about six hours in all.

Title: Gran Turismo 6 Review
Review: Gran Turismo 6 celebrates the series' great legacy, but stutters toward the checkered flag.
Author Information: Joseph Barron is a virtual speed demon who'd rather have a bucket seat in his living room than an armchair. He has played hundreds of hours of every Gran Turismo game, but ever since GT3 on the PS2, he's always disappointed when the new game doesn't feature the early 2000s British rocker Feeder on the soundtrack.

Title: Two Brothers Review
Review: Two Brothers seems like just another nostalgia trip, but it hides more than its share of poignant secrets.
Author Information: Being a child of the '90s, Daniel Starkey spent far too much time with his face glued to a handheld. Glitched playtime notwithstanding, he also spent about 12 hours with Two Brothers over the course of four days.

Title: Doki-Doki Universe Review
Review: Doki-Doki Universe is a simple game that uses humor and eccentricity to carry its warmhearted message.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis was smiling like an idiot the entire time he played Doki-Doki Universe. To be fair, that's the only way he knows how to smile, but his dentist is currently working on that.

Title: AquaPazza: AquaPlus Dream Match Review
Review: You probably won't recognize any of its crossover characters, but Aquapazza is still an engaging, fun fighter.
Author Information: Heidi's curiosity about Aquapazza was piqued upon seeing it played during the Japanese Tougeki fighting game championship at Tokyo Game Show 2011. She became fully experienced with Aquapazza's mechanics and observed high-level play. Out of all the game's cast, Karulau is the strongest candidate to be her waifu.

Title: FIFA 2014 Review
Review: Improved player movement and fantastic stadium atmosphere ensure the quintessential FIFA 14 experience.
Author Information: Danny's passion for football games started with Sensible World of Soccer on the Amiga 600. He supported Pro Evolution during its glory days but made the switch to FIFA in 2009. He now uses the FIFA series to imagine a world where Arsenal actually win trophies.

Title: Mario Party: Island Tour Review
Review: If you're looking for on-the-go minigame mayhem, Mario Party: Island Tour is an enjoyable sojourn.
Author Information: Heidi has been reviewing a lot of the minigame collections being released for the holidays and thinks Island Tour is one of the better picks in the genre right now. Everyone has played a Mario Party game at some point in their life, but Heidi has thought way, way too hard about what makes a minigame collection work. Jeez, will you stop thinking and just roll the dice already?

Title: SimCity: Cities of Tomorrow Review
Review: Cities of Tomorrow doesn't add much to the deeply flawed SimCity aside from Blade Runner visuals.
Author Information: Longtime city-builder and real-life mayor Brett Todd moved his life about 15 hours into the future while playing SimCity: Cities of Tomorrow for the purposes of this review.

Title: Redshirt Review
Review: While Redshirt is a funny and clever sim that allows for interesting relationships, it can occasionally be as mindless as the social networks it parodies.
Author Information: Britton Peele has boldly gone deep into many life simulations, including a period of time when he reviewed little but expansion packs for The Sims 3. Over the course of 10 hours, Britton escaped Redshirt's space station twice.

Title: Ryse: Son of Rome Review
Review: Ryse: Son of Rome looks the part, but underneath its pretty exterior lies a shallow, mind-numbingly tedious action game.
Author Information: Mark loves a good action game, having reviewed the likes of DmC: Devil May Cry and God of War: Ascension. He somehow willed himself to play Ryse through to completion, and spent an evening hammering through some multiplayer on Xbox Live.

Title: Zoo Tycoon Review
Review: Zoo Tycoon's animals are adorable, but a clunky interface prevents this management sim from reaching its potential.
Author Information: Carolyn hasn't spent much time playing management simulations, and Zoo Tycoon is her first game with the word "Tycoon" in the title. However, she has been to the San Diego Zoo Safari Park many times, and has a particular fondness for capybaras.

Title: Madden 25 Review
Review: The definitive versions of Madden NFL 25 excel on subtlety.
Author Information: Miguel's charmed upbringing as a San Francisco native in the 1980s makes him expect a lot from his beloved Niners, virtual or otherwise. In 4th grade, he tackled the QB, not realizing it was a flag football game. The longtime Madden player has since gotten better at understanding the rules, leading to about 30 combined hours on both the Xbox One and PS4 versions.

Title: EVE Online Review
Review: EVE Online is one of the most unique and challenging MMORPGs running.
Author Information: Nick Capozzoli has been a pirate, a carebear, a soldier, a scavenger, a miner, and a wanderer in the EVE universe since 2005. For this review, he leveraged those experiences and a brief refresher stint.

Title: Powerstar Golf Review
Review: Powerstar Golf sticks to tried-and-true methods to deliver a reliably enjoyable take on the sport.
Author Information: It's been many years since Carolyn has played a golf video game, and even longer since she's been on an actual golf course. She spent upward of a dozen hours on Powerstar Golf's four courses.

Title: LocoCycle Review
Review: Its situations and story are riotous, but LocoCycle can't translate its fun humor into fun gameplay.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd likes when games bring the funny, and has played and enjoyed numerous Twisted Pixel games, 'Splosion Man and The Maw in particular. It took him about two hours to finish LocoCycle, at which point he returned to check out the various unlockables and other difficulty levels.

Title: Deadfall Adventures Review
Review: Deadfall Adventures is a boring, glitchy, and repetitive shooter with too few moments of clarity.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey, a longtime fan of adventuring into the wilds, knows all that glitters is not gold

Title: Super Mario 3D World Review
Review: Super Mario 3D World is a sublime platformer that's full of wonderful ideas and fabulous level design.
Author Information: Mark spent many a week planning out the perfect route through the Grandmaster Galaxy in Mario Galaxy 2, and still regards it as one of his greatest achievements. He played Super Mario 3D World through to completion, and fiercely fought the urge to try to collect all the green stars on his way there.

Title: Dead Rising 3 Review
Review: Dead Rising 3 has a lot of fun encouraging you to use its impressive array of barmy, brutal weaponry in an undead city.
Author Information: Martin played Dead Rising 3 for 18 hours on both Normal and Nightmare mode, but could not test the game's SmartGlass features as they were not available at time of writing. He is determined to one day obtain the 7 Day Survivor Achievement in the original Dead Rising, and delighted to report that 17,298 zombies were harmed in the making of the review.

Title: Risk of Rain Review
Review: Risk of Rain brings roguelike elements to a challenging 2D platformer that glorifies the item hunt.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is a veteran roguelike player and spent about eight hours playing Risk of Rain to completion, unlocking five characters in the process.

Title: Tearaway Review
Review: Tearaway's blend of the real and virtual worlds makes it a rare and charming treat.
Author Information: Regularly on the road, John is an enthusiastic Vita player with extensive experience with the handheld. From Mario to Rayman, he has been consumed by platformers for longer than he cares to admit and completed the game twice for this review.

Title: SimCity Review: A Real Mayor's Perspective Review
Review: SimCity has a lot of flaws, one of which is an extremely unrealistic depiction of what it's like to sit in a mayor's chair.
Author Information: Brett Todd is a longtime city-building enthusiast--not to mention, the mayor of an actual town in Ontario, Canada. He spent the equivalent of five or six real-life council meetings wearing a virtual chain of office in SimCity. That's around 20 hours, give or take a motion or two.

Title: Crimson Dragon Review
Review: Crimson Dragon attempts to bring on-rails shooters into the modern era, but fails to recreate the genre's classic straightforward action in the process.
Author Information: Panzer Dragoon is one of Peter's favorite Sega franchises, and the great Star Fox 64 sits snugly in the Nintendo 64 on his desk. He played through the entire story for this review, and evolved the default dragon all the way to its ultimate form in the process.

Title: Killer Instinct Review
Review: Killer Instinct successfully updates the '90s classic into a competitive fighter that can enter the ring with the genre's regulars.
Author Information: Maxwell is a long-time fighting game fan who was banned from playing the original Killer Instinct. He was excited to finally fill this gap in his fighting game knowledge, but is still trying to land the coveted double-ultra combo.

Title: NBA Live 14 Review
Review: NBA Live 14 struggles in just about every facet, resulting in an unsatisfying and frustrating version of basketball.
Author Information: Tom's adoration of NBA basketball was almost killed by NBA Live 14. He spent a dozen hours in the various modes and had only one loss in six online matches.

Title: Forza Motorsport 5 Review
Review: Forza's love for all things fast is more infectious than ever in this exquisite racing sim.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis learned to drive using his mother's Ford Aerostar minivan and has been compensating for it with racing video games ever since. His driver level currently stands at 48 and counting, having played mostly on the highly skilled drivatar difficulty level.

Title: Flower Review
Review: Flower remains a ravishing display of nature's grace.
Author Information: Kevin has enjoyed each of thatgamecompany's peaceful games, and Journey is one of his favorite games of the entire console generation. He played the PlayStation 4 version of Flower twice for the purposes of this review.

Title: Blood of the Werewolf Review
Review: Blood of the Werewolf is a fun and challenging platformer that pays homage to Hollywood's classic movie monsters.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey is a fan of playing platformers and shouting colorful expletives. Blood of the Werewolf let him live the dream of doing both at once. For the purposes of this review, Cameron played about seven hours, taking occasional breaks to fix his keyboard and quietly sob to himself.

Title: Killzone: Shadow Fall Review
Review: Killzone: Shadow Fall's multiplayer plays to the series' key strengths. It's too bad the campaign forgot to turn on the heat.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has played every console Killzone game to completion, and thinks Killzone 2 is the most underregarded shooter gem of its generation. (He also thinks Killzone 2 has the best flamethrower ever.) He played the Shadow Fall campaign in the GameSpot office, and it took about 8 hours, give or take. He played numerous online multiplayer sessions at Sony's offices.

Title: Sound Shapes Review
Review: Sound Shapes is a singular experience that uses the power of music to elevate its enthralling platforming.
Author Information: Tom has never been gifted musically, so he seeks out people who can fill that empty place in his heart. He is thankful that Sound Shapes exists, considering how important both music and platforming are to him. Tom played through Sound Shapes in a few glorious hours, and then designed his own stage before checking out what the community had created.

Title: Contrast Review
Review: Wonky physics and prosaic puzzles prevent Contrast from making the most of its intriguing concept and intoxicating atmosphere.
Author Information: Carolyn loves Casablanca and dreams of spending smoky nights in elegant jazz clubs but has not yet been to Europe. She played through the PlayStation 4 version of Contrast at the GameSpot offices. It took her about four hours.

Title: Knack Review
Review: Dull combat with little diversity banishes Knack to a dark realm normally reserved for the likes of foul goblins.
Author Information: Colorful adventures are where Tom wishes he could spend just about all of his gaming time. Tom played through a finished build of the game and it took roughly 10 hours.

Title: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds Review
Review: The Legend of Zelda: A Link Between Worlds is packed full of enough canny puzzles and clever dungeons to make the experience feel as fresh as its iconic predecessor.
Author Information: Martin Gaston has been playing Zelda games for most of his life. His favorite is Ocarina of Time, but A Link to the Past is definitely in the top three.

Title: Morphopolis Review
Review: It's a pleasure to exist in Morphopolis' gorgeous spaces. Making your way through them proves less inviting.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has been immersing himself in grand adventures since he first journeyed through the original Zork. He played Morphopolis twice for the purposes of this review, expending about 85 minutes in the process.

Title: Warface Review
Review: Warface brings tons of visual shine to the free-to-play space, but this generic first-person shooter doesn't go far beyond the basics.
Author Information: Nathan Meunier has been a first-person shooter enthusiast since the genre's early days of Doom and Duke Nukem 3D. For the purposes of this review, he spent around 10 hours busting virtual caps in strangers across tons of co-op and competitive matches.

Title: Journey of a Roach Review
Review: The short but sweet Journey of a Roach presents a charming postapocalyptic world.
Author Information: Britton Peele has had many an adventure pointing and clicking. He has sailed with Guybrush Threepwood and taken a long journey to Arcadia. Surprisingly, his experience with roaches that invade his house didn't help much in completing Journey of a Roach, which he did twice for this review.

Title: XCOM: Enemy Within Review
Review: XCOM: Enemy Within is a feature-packed expansion that makes a great game even greater.
Author Information: Leif Johnson has employed turn-based tactics against gangsters and aggressive superpowers in games like Omerta and Valkyria Chronicles, but he's always found XCOM's tale of guns and aliens the best fit for the concept. For the purposes of this review, Leif played about 27 hours.

Title: Stick It to the Man Review
Review: A clever tale of a man, a pink spaghetti arm emerging from his head, and a quest for justice.
Author Information: Chris Barylick has never had a pink spaghetti arm floating out of his head, but the day is still young. He grew up loving puzzle games like Maniac Mansion and Day of the Tentacle and spent approximately 12 hours playing Stick It to the Man to completion on a debug PlayStation 3.

Title: NBA 2K14 Review
Review: NBA 2K14 uses its incredible visual design to draw you in, and the top-notch action is closer than ever to the real thing.
Author Information: Tom has been infatuated with basketball since he was old enough to dribble a basketball. Although he doesn't spent much of his free time playing basketball games, he spent hours glued to the television for this review. He spent most of his time in My Career and a bit in My GM as well.

Title: BioShock Infinite: Burial at Sea - Episode 1 Review
Review: BioShock Infinite's mechanics don't play nicely with the underwater city of Rapture in Burial at Sea - Episode 1.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is an unabashed BioShock Infinite lover, and completed Burial at Sea - Episode 1 twice. His first playthrough was on the Xbox 360 at the San Francisco offices of a PR agency. He later played the PC version in the GameSpot offices.

Title: Need for Speed: Rivals Review
Review: Need for Speed: Rivals smartly builds on the strong foundation of its predecessors to deliver an aggressive arcade racer that bristles with energy.
Author Information: Carolyn was introduced to the thrills of wrecking her rivals in Criterion's racing classic, Burnout 3: Takedown. She spent four hours playing Need for Speed: Rivals at a multiplayer event organized by EA and played for many more hours in the GameSpot offices.

Title: Valhalla Knights 3 Review
Review: Awful combat, persistent load times, and a host of ever-building annoyances make Valhalla Knights 3 a miserable slog.
Author Information: Heidi loves a good RPG... the operative word here being "good," which Valhalla Knights 3 is most definitely not. She tried her best to wring fun out of this game, as she has with previous Valhalla Knights, but the game failed to deliver over the 30 hours it took to finish.

Title: Path of Exile Review
Review: Where action role-playing games are concerned, Path of Exile is as good as they come.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has clicked his way through countless role-playing games. Dungeon Siege 2 has always been his enduring favorite in the genre, but Path of Exile may have replaced it. For the purposes of this review, Kevin played about 50 hours.

Title: Intake Review
Review: Intake is a frenetic shooter that does a great job capturing the euphoria of modern electronic music.
Author Information: A semi-active raver, Dan Starkey knows a few things about flashing lights and pulsing bass, and he could not stop playing this addictive light-gun-style arcade shooter.

Title: Resogun Review
Review: Resogun takes a classic formula and supercharges every aspect, culminating in a game that challenges your reflexes and dazzles you with its explosive presentation.
Author Information: Peter's a hardcore shoot-em-up player with years of experience with the genre, and he blasted his way through the first two difficulties for this review.

Title: Ratchet & Clank: Into the Nexus Review
Review: Ratchet & Clank: Into the Nexus packs a lot of joyful action and hysterical dialogue into its short running time.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has made few things better by hitting them with wrenches, but that doesn't stop him from trying. For the purpose of this review, Cameron has played the game to full completion, spending around 15 hours going through normal and Challenge modes.

Title: Final Exam Review
Review: Final Exam provides sufficient cause to once again do everything you've already done before.
Author Information: Brawler lover Jason Venter has seen enough television shows to know that high school reunions always end badly, but he still spent over five hours clearing the campaign with a friend and messing around some more all on his lonesome.

Title: Forced Review
Review: Forced offers friends a unique cooperative brawler, but only if they can connect.
Author Information: Jason Venter lost himself in challenging arena battles and in matchmaking menus for more than a dozen hours, conquered numerous trials, and still cringes at the sight of a horde of swarmers.

Title: Infinity Blade III Review
Review: There's a fun fighting system in Infinity Blade III, but it isn't enough to carry this unnecessarily bloated adventure.
Author Information: Mark has been on the mobile games bandwagon since the launch of the App Store, and reviewed the excellent Infinity Blade II. He sunk around 10-hours of his commuting time into Infinity Blade III for this review.

Title: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures Review
Review: Pac-Man and the Ghostly Adventures is merely competent, but a surreal undercurrent does make you think differently about the pellet eater.
Author Information: Tom longs for the days when 3D platformers ruled the retail shelves. Pac-Man never appealed to him during his formative years, but he grew to love the yellow guy when Championship Edition and DX came out. It took roughly 10 hours to see all of Pacopolis, and he roped in three coworkers to play multiplayer during which fellow editor Chris Watters claimed a resounding victory.

Title: Lego Marvel Super Heroes Review
Review: Lego Marvel Super Heroes charms at every turn with its varied content and tongue-in-cheek attitude.
Author Information: Chris Barylick has every intention of unlocking 100% of this game's content, if only to fight the forces of evil with Aunt May and her umbrella.

Title: The Harvest Review
Review: The Harvest is short, forgettable, and tedious.
Author Information: Brett Todd has spent untold hours on his PC playing the roles he was destined to play, and was mighty glad The Harvest only added a few more hours to that total.

Title: The Guided Fate Paradox Review
Review: The Guided Fate Paradox provides a near limitless amount of content. The problem is that most of it isn't all that interesting.
Author Information: When it comes to strategy games, Maxwell prefers turn-based to real-time. Final Fantasy Tactics sits high atop that list, but he also enjoyed La Pucelle: Tactics and the early Disgaea games, dood! After pouring almost 50 hours in Paradox, he fears for his eternal soul.

Title: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow - Mirror of Fate HD Review
Review: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow - Mirror of Fate HD improves upon the original release by upgrading the visuals and stripping out unnecessary quick-time events.
Author Information: Peter's a glutton for Castlevania games and despiser of superfluous quick-time events. After completing the 3DS version, he played eight hours of Castlevania: Lords of Shadow - Mirror of Fate HD on the Xbox 360 for this review.

Title: How to Survive Review
Review: How to Survive doesn't push any boundaries, and it ends sooner than it should, but it does have a decent amount of solid play punctuated by bursts of excellence.
Author Information: An experienced killer of zombies, Daniel Starkey learned how to survive and tackled the undead hordes.

Title: WRC 4: FIA World Rally Championship Review
Review: WRC 4 continues this series' regular improvements with challenging and satisfying driving, but remains a largely unremarkable off-road racer.
Author Information: Joseph Barron is a master of speed...in his living room. He's the sort of guy who owns three sim-racing steering wheels, but doesn't have an actual car. He prefers his racing cars with big wings and open wheels, but he's pretty good at going sideways in virtual mud too.

Title: WWE 2K14 Review
Review: WWE 2K14 sports impressive presentation that faithfully recreates the best moment in WrestleMania history, but that doesn't make the act of wrestling any more exciting.
Author Information: After spending hours with the likes of WWF Royal Rumble and Wrestlefest growing up, Tom hasn't touched a wrestling game in years. Tom spent most of his time in WrestleMania mode, though he went online and tinkered with the creation elements as well.

Title: Football Manager 2014 Review
Review: Football Manager 2014 is the most exhaustive, most approachable entry in the series to date.
Author Information: John Robertson has lost far too many hours, over far too many years, playing Football Manager. With 50 hours of playing clocked up for this review, he has still failed to return Portsmouth to the Premier League.

Title: Mario & Sonic at the Sochi 2014 Olympic Winter Games Review
Review: Mario & Sonic's latest outing has the occasional fun moment, but fails to secure a podium finish.
Author Information: Martin Gaston has been known to enjoy a good collection of minigames late on a Friday night, and as a child loved Sonic the Hedgehog more than life itself. He played this latest collection of Olympic Winter games for 10 hours, forcing friends and coworkers to join in.

Title: Call of Duty: Ghosts Review
Review: With an outstanding new co-op mode and a campaign fueled by fierce combat, Call of Duty: Ghosts is another great addition to the blockbuster shooter franchise.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis has played every Call of Duty campaign to date, but his fondest memory of the series is the chaotic joy of 18-player Domination matches on Modern Warfare's tiny Shipment map. He played Ghosts at a review event in Southern California. Travel was paid for by Activision.

Title: Batman: Arkham Origins Review
Review: Batman: Arkham Origins relies much too heavily on familiar mechanics, making it a mechanically solid but uninspired adventure.
Author Information: Carolyn's favorite Batman book is Year One. Her favorite Batman actor is Michael Keaton. Her favorite Batman games are Batman: Arkham City and Batman for the NES.

Title: Angry Birds Star Wars Review
Review: The mobile classic comes to consoles, but at a much higher price.
Author Information: Chris Barylick has loved, lived and breathed Star Wars pretty much since he was a fetus. And he'll never get those weeks of his life he spent camping out for the prequels back. He played around 10 hours of Angry Birds Star Wars for the purposes of this review.

Title: Batman: Arkham Origins Blackgate Review
Review: Batman's latest portable adventure falls on its face due to a bevy of design issues that are too glaring to ignore.
Author Information: Peter has a soft spot in his heart for Super Metroid and Sunsoft's pair of Batman games on the NES, and he's fairly certain Michael Keaton is, in fact, Bruce Wayne.

Title: Eldritch Review
Review: Eldritch starts strong with tense gameplay and great exploration, but loses its way before the end.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent many years hiding in the shadows searching for keys and mystical artifacts, and believes that torches are for novices. For the purposes of this review, Cameron played each stage multiple times, though a few of those playthroughs happened because he forgot to watch his back.

Title: Battlefield 4 Review
Review: Battlefield 4's diverse and deadly multiplayer battles once again deliver exhilarating action, while the single-player campaign struggles to find its footing.
Author Information: Chris Watters has spent hundreds of hours in Battlefields past and still can't fly a jet very well. For this review, he played the PlayStation 4 and PC versions at a multi-day review event at EA, then went on to play PC, Xbox 360, and PlayStation 3 versions at home with copies provided by EA.

Title: Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag Review
Review: Easily the most ambitious Assassin's Creed game in years, Black Flag is an outstanding adventure by any standard.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis can spend hours explaining why Assassin's Creed II is his favorite game in the series, but Black Flag gives it a real run for its money. He played the PlayStation 4 version to completion over a period of several days at Ubisoft's San Francisco office. Current-gen versions were later played in GameSpot's office.

Title: Solstice Arena Review
Review: Solstice Arena is speedy, engaging, and terrifically fun.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks is preparing for the inevitable zom-MOBA apocalypse by hoarding all the free-to-play MOBA currencies he can find. He power-leveled to Solstice level 85 in a week.

Title: Professor Layton and the Azran Legacy Review
Review: Professor Layton and the Azran Legacy has some neat puzzles and some great new minigames, but fails to step outside its comfort zone.
Author Information: Lucy Ingram is an aficionado of puzzling adventure games and loves a bit of a challenge. She has followed the Professor Layton series from the onset of The Curious Village and is always eager for the next opportunity to stimulate her mind.

Title: Just Dance 2014 Review
Review: There's not much new to see in Just Dance 2014, but it remains one of the most accessible and stupidly fun party games around.
Author Information: Mark has reviewed nearly every dancing game that has been thrown GameSpot's way. Sadly, despite such experience, he remains absolutely terrible at dancing.

Title: Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney - Dual Destinies Review
Review: Dual Destinies rises above its expected trappings to offer a witty and insightful look at the nature of truth.
Author Information: Tom has been enamored with the legal system since Colonel Jessup argued that Lieutenant Kaffee couldn't handle the truth. A veteran of the Phoenix Wright franchise, Tom contends that the last case in Trials and Tribulations is the best writing ever seen in a video game.

Title: Wii Party U Review
Review: There's plenty in this package, but Wii Party U's bland presentation and inconsistent game quality can take the air out of a social gaming experience.
Author Information: Heidi is a firm believer that quality local multiplayer game design is an art form. She played through every single one of Wii Party U's minigames and recruited local friends to play through other modes with her. She also profusely apologizes to them for any long-term damage to their marriages as a result of said play.

Title: Dark Matter Review
Review: Style trumps substance in sci-fi survival horror side-scroller Dark Matter.
Author Information: Matt Cabral has never met a derelict spaceship he didn't want to explore

Title: Glare Review
Review: Glare needed more substance to truly shine.
Author Information: Jason Venter has enjoyed platformers ever since he took his first steps in the Mushroom Kingdom in 1988. He devoted several hours to Glare, time enough to finish the campaign and goof around in his favorite stages.

Title: Rocksmith 2014 Edition Review
Review: Rocksmith 2014 is a vast improvement on its predecessor, and a valuable learning tool for any aspiring guitar player.
Author Information: Mark has been playing guitar for the best part of 12 years, during which time he has spent an absurd amount of money collecting instruments, and drove every girlfriend he ever had to insanity with his endless practicing. He regrets nothing.

Title: Iesabel Review
Review: Iesabel gives you a cheap and quirky Diablo knockoff.
Author Information: Brett Todd is more of a hacker than a slasher, although he's willing to be talked into either for a good loot drop. Over 20 hours of all of the above went into this review.

Title: Bionic Dues Review
Review: Bionic Dues is a roguelike that looks like a rookie but plays like a pro.
Author Information: Leif Johnson has been playing roguelikes for quite some time

Title: The Stanley Parable Review
Review: The Stanley Parable is simultaneously a brilliant exploration of the nature of choice in games and a wonderfully entertaining game in its own right.
Author Information: Carolyn likes to venture off the beaten path in life as well as in games, but unfortunately, the narrator in her head isn't nearly as witty as the one in The Stanley Parable.

Title: Deus Ex: Human Revolution - Director's Cut Review
Review: An absorbing world and minor but meaningful improvements make Deus Ex: Human Revolution - The Director's Cut a winning revival.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd will never forget his first glimpse of the New York skyline in the original Deus Ex, and thinks Deus Ex: Invisible War gets a bad rap. He played the Director's Cut to completion, but not before hacking into every computer terminal he could find.

Title: Skylanders Swap Force Review
Review: Skylanders Swap Force is an expensive habit, but the game is so charming and fun that you'll be compelled to keep adding to your collection of cute figurines.
Author Information: Chris Barylick was born in the late '70s and spent way too much time playing platform and adventure games in the '80s and '90s. He continues to obsess over the Lego Star Wars games and will happily go back to collect more coins to unlock a cool new ship, if available.

Title: 140 Review
Review: 140 successfully blends crisp visuals with a rhythmic soundtrack in an engaging and challenging 2D platformer.
Author Information: Cameron Woolsey has spent the better part of his 20-year video game career hopping platforms and collecting keys. He still scours the Internet daily for his next retro purchase. For the purposes of this review, Cameron played through the game twice, though he is still unsure how he beat that third boss.

Title: Montague's Mount Review
Review: Montague's Mount takes a few respectable ideas and then wholly obscures them.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey is a fan of well-paced, slow-building psychological horror, but suffered through Montague's Mount so that he could see its conclusion.

Title: Full Bore: The First Dig Review
Review: Full Bore's open world of puzzles is fun to explore, though it doesn't always offer incentive to solve everything.
Author Information: Britton Peele has never been a boar, but he has always had a fondness for solving puzzles and for digging holes haphazardly. He uncovered roughly 65 percent of the secrets hidden underground and reached the end of the game before writing this review.

Title: Blue Estate Prologue Review
Review: Blue Estate Prologue's gross humor overshadows its few merits as a game.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd likes a good dirty joke and a titillating nip slip now and again. He completed Blue Estate Prologue twice on two difficulty settings. It wasn't any funnier the second time.

Title: Salvation Prophecy Review
Review: Salvation Prophecy is a charming space sim, but it lacks gravity.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks has taken over the helm of the Salvation, and brought peace to all factions to stifle the alien threat.

Title: Sonic Lost World Review
Review: Sonic Lost World is a confused and derivative platformer that struggles to make the most of its speedy blue star.
Author Information: Mark spent much of his youth chasing down Chaos Emeralds, just so he could turn a blue hedgehog yellow. He also considers Sonic & Knuckles' lock-on cartridge gaming's greatest technological achievement.

Title: Grand Theft Auto V Review - Southland Sprawl Review
Review: Grand Theft Auto V is a great game. But it too often erects roadblocks when you just want to be a catalyst for chaos.
Author Information: Brett Todd loves the GTA series, and untold hours of his life have gone into playing GTAs III through V.

Title: Knock-knock Review
Review: Knock-knock's unnerving atmosphere threatens to terrify, but there's nothing scary about its dull hide-and-seek gameplay.
Author Information: Carolyn's been scaring herself silly with video games since she first played Haunted House for the Atari 2600. She played Knock-knock alone in the dark, empty, creepy GameSpot offices late one night.

Title: Irritum Review
Review: Irritum blends puzzle platforming with philosophical musings, but neither element will keep you rooted in this barren world.
Author Information: Chris Watters relishes the precise hops and soaring leaps of a challenging platformer, though he usually doesn't seek to attain 100 percent completion. He completed 31 out of Irritum's 40 levels, collecting 47 out of 76 memories along the way.

Title: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 1 Review - Testing My Faith Review
Review: The characters and intrigue of Fables are well-represented, but something is amiss in The Wolf Among Us.
Author Information: From the tropical seas to the snarky suburbs to the zombie apocalypse, Chris Watters is the veteran of many Telltale Games adventures. He likes finding a way to fit in to new roles and new worlds, and generally plays nice with his new virtual friends.

Title: Rune Factory 4 Review
Review: Farming meets dungeon adventuring as this Harvest Moon spin-off makes good in its first foray onto the 3DS.
Author Information: As with many N64 owners in 1999, Miguel‰Ûªs Harvest Moon "gateway" installment was Harvest Moon 64. As much as he enjoys the franchise, Miguel would not have approved of Rune Factory had it been a mere Harvest Moon medieval reskin. The 55 hours he spent on Rune Factory 4 flew by unexpectedly.

Title: Rise of Venice Review
Review: Have a little patience with some of Rise of Venice‰Ûª's quirks, and you will soon enjoy forging a trading empire on the seas of the Renaissance-era Mediterranean.
Author Information: Brett Todd thinks only suckers pay retail, although he doesn‰Ûª't mind paying a few bucks for a good economic sim. He sailed the high seas buying low and selling high for about 25 hours for the purposes of this review.

Title: Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness Review
Review: Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness is one of the funniest and freshest role-playing games of the year.
Author Information: Heidi is a strategy RPG fanatic whose personal record for most time spent on a Disgaea title is 250-plus hours of Disgaea 2. For the purposes of this review, she put 45 hours into Disgaea D2, the majority of which was spent futzing with the Item World and finding ways to exploit the detailed gameplay mechanics.

Title: Prime World Review
Review: Prime World tries to innovate on the base MOBA gameplay, but lacks soul.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks likes to wave his cane at new MOBA games, recalling tales of "his day" when the StarCraft map Aeon of Strife and its spin-offs were the only creep-slaying game modes around. For this review, he reached Castle level 13 and played about 25 hours.

Title: A.R.E.S. Extinction Agenda EX Review
Review: A.R.E.S. Extinction Agenda EX is a generally satisfying homage to a beloved action franchise.
Author Information: Jason Venter has repeatedly cleared most Mega Man X games, and still loves a good platformer. He spent around 6 hours clearing both A.R.E.S. campaigns for the purposes of this review.

Title: League of Legends Review
Review: League of Legends is a free-to-play multiplayer phenomenon that has cemented itself as the cornerstone of its genre.
Author Information: Tyler Hicks likes to wave his cane at new-coming MOBA titles, recalling tales of "his day" when the StarCraft map Aeon of Strife and its spin-offs were the only creep-slaying game modes around. He's played several hundred hours of League of Legends, and has no plans to stop anytime soon.

Title: The Wolf Among Us: Episode 1 - Faith Review
Review: The heavyhearted first episode of The Wolf Among Us fully cloaks you in its bloody mystery.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd wasn't intimately familiar with the Fables universe until he started playing The Wolf Among Us, at which point he voraciously started consuming the comics. For this review, he played the episode three times, making different choices each time. However, he still has one playthrough he considers "his," and looks forward to seeing the tale through to its conclusion.

Title: Grand Theft Auto Online Review
Review: Grand Theft Auto Online often rises above its troubles to become a delightfully diverse open-world escapade.
Author Information: Carolyn has been a huge fan of the Grand Theft Auto games ever since she hit the streets of Liberty City in GTA III. She is definitely not currently wanted by police in 17 states.

Title: The Walking Dead: 400 Days - A Noble Experiment Review
Review: While inconsistent as a whole, The Walking Dead: 400 Days provides a few terrific snapshots into the experiences of those surviving the zombie apocalypse.
Author Information: Shaun McInnis is a veteran of the zombie apocalypse and Telltale's The Walking Dead ranks as one of his all-time favorites in the genre. He would prefer to pretend that The Walking Dead: Survival Instinct never existed.

Title: Beyond: Two Souls Review
Review: Beyond: Two Souls is a fascinating experience that expertly links story and mechanics to further your connection to the world.
Author Information: Tom vehemently defends David Cage's previous game Heavy Rain--plot holes and all--and wishes more developers would break free of industry conventions to create wholly unique experiences.

Title: BioShock Infinite - A Fan Scorned Review
Review: The beauty of BioShock Infinite is only skin deep as tedious combat and a tiresome story overshadow its artistic pleasures.
Author Information: The original BioShock is one of Tom's favorite games ever. He will most likely love any game that tells a fascinating story and uses the mechanics to build on those themes.

Title: Disney Infinity - A Parent's Take Review
Review: In our Other Take on Disney Infinity, we look at the game from a parent's point of view and see how suitable the game is for junior players.
Author Information: Randolph Ramsay played Disney Infinity with his four-year-old son, but also played quite a bit on his own (about 20 hours in total). He's had minimal exposure with other toy-based games, but did play Skylanders for about two hours once with an 11-year-old as a tutor.

Title: Card Hunter Review
Review: Card Hunter's fusion of tabletop role-playing games and trading cards is easy to get into and hard to pull away from.
Author Information: Daniel Starkey's first review for GameSpot was for Starseed Pilgrim, and he's been part of the freelancing team ever since!

Title: Shadow Warrior Review
Review: Shadow Warrior's fiery action reaches into the past, but its sense of progression is entirely modern.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd likes a good old-school shooter and a good dirty joke. After refreshing his memories with a bit of Wang-focused fun with the original Shadow Warrior, he was glad to see that the remake lived up to its legacy. If you consider genitalia humor to be a legacy, anyway.

Title: NBA 2K14 Review
Review: By offering further refinements to already impressive controls and animations, NBA 2K14 is one step closer to bringing the real sport to the digital world.
Author Information: Tom has been cheering on the Indiana Pacers for more than two decades, and has been playing basketball games for just as long. The days of Arch Rivals are thankfully long over.

Title: Alien Rage Review
Review: Alien Rage is a generic shooter notable only for its intense difficulty.
Author Information: Daniel Shannon still remembers the day when his family got a 486 with a CD-ROM drive. He used that PC to play an immense amount of Tie Fighter, Civilization 2, and Doom. For the purposes of this review, Daniel beat Alien Rage‰Ûªs campaign on Hard, a task that took him around 17 hours.

Title: Scribblenauts Unmasked Review
Review: An extensive cast of DC characters can't help Scribblenauts Unmasked overcome the dangers posed by its own flawed internal logic.
Author Information: Carolyn Petit had never played a Scribblenauts game before, but she has been saving universes with the power of her imagination ever since she saw The NeverEnding Story as a child.

Title: Rain Review
Review: Rain uses chilling atmosphere and a heartfelt story to draw you in to this endearing adventure.
Author Information: Nothing makes Tom feel like a brain champion quite like solving a tricky puzzle. And when such puzzles are complemented by a moving story and evocative aesthetics, that's even better.

Title: Pokemon X/Y Review
Review: Pokemon X and Y benefit greatly from their leap to a fully 3D world, and have plenty to offer both veterans and novices alike.
Author Information: Randolph Ramsay played Pokemon obsessively in his youth, and particularly loved the original 151 in Red/Blue. While he skipped the Black/White games, he still managed the watch the anime, so he‰Ûªs Team Snivy all the way. Randolph finished Pokemon Y in around 35 hours for the purposes of this review.

Title: Pokemon X/Y Review
Review: Pokemon X and Y benefit greatly from their leap to a fully 3D world, and have plenty to offer both veterans and novices alike.
Author Information: Randolph Ramsay played Pokemon obsessively in his youth, and particularly loved the original 151 in Red/Blue. While he skipped the Black/White games, he still managed the watch the anime, so he‰Ûªs Team Snivy all the way. Randolph finished Pokemon X/Y in around 35 hours for the purposes of this review.

Title: Armored Core: Verdict Day Review
Review: Brutal robot-destroying fun is buried deep, but this giant mech battling series could still use an oil change.
Author Information: Nathan Meunier's love affair with giant robot warfare dates all the way back to the original MechWarrior on MS-DOS. It's been a while since he last dug into the Armored Core series, but he's not one turn down any opportunity to hop into a mech cockpit. For this review, Nathan spent approximately 22 hours pummeling big metal things across the solo campaign and multiplayer war.

Title: MechWarrior Online Review
Review: MechWarrior Online gets the feel of mech combat right, but its lack of variety taints the experience.
Author Information: Leif Johnson likes big robots and massive online games.

Title: FIFA 14 Review
Review: FIFA 14 is an exercise in subtle refinements and clever tweaks that transforms the familiar into something that feels fresh, exciting, and always engaging.
Author Information: Mark is based in the UK, where soccer is known as "football", and from where he's been reviewing FIFA and PES for the last three years.

Title: Doorways Review
Review: Doorways shoots for scares, but elicits yawns.
Author Information: In the 90 minutes it took to complete the first two chapters of Doorways, Kevin VanOrd pined for all the great scary games that he could have been playing instead.

Title: Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death Review
Review: It may not be novel, but Marlow Briggs and the Mask of Death is still a boisterous and bombastic blast.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd likes big explosions and cheesy humor, which Marlow Briggs has an abundance of. He spent about four hours completing the game's campaign, and another hour fooling around on hard difficulty.

Title: Takedown: Red Sabre Review
Review: Takedown: Red Sabre is an unfinished, broken mess of a tactical shooter that offers not even one redemptive bright spot.
Author Information: Brett Todd has reviewed more bad games for GameSpot--and awesome ones too--than he cares to admit.

Title: Etrian Odyssey Untold: The Millenium Girl Review
Review: The original Etrian Odyssey is remade with refined customization, enchanting visuals, and an intriguing story.
Author Information: Having followed Etrian Odyssey since its inception, Miguel was curious how the series would come full circle with this remake. To play the story mode first and then to take that campaign's bonuses into a New Game+ playthrough of the classic mode resulted in 65 hours of play time. Miguel's been an amateur RPG cartographer ever since he used graph paper to map out his brother's exploits in the original Wizardry.

Title: Dragon Fantasy Book II Review
Review: Dragon Fantasy Book II is a pale shadow of the Super Nintendo role-playing games that it is inspired by.
Author Information: Brian Albert was a beloved freelancer at GameSpot until he joined the illustrious staff at IGN! We miss you, Brian.

Title: Final Fantasy XIV Online: A Realm Reborn Review
Review: It's no revolution, but Final Fantasy XIV: A Realm Reborn is a beautiful and charming online game with plenty to see and do.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is a lifelong RPG lover and violin player. When he isn't busy building PCs and composing symphonies, he watches American Dad reruns with his fat cat, Ollie.

Title: F1 2013 Review
Review: F1 2013 takes you on a nostalgia trip into the history of Formula One, while compelling new modes and subtle improvements layer atop a familiar, but winning formula.
Author Information: Danny has been a GameSpot community member since 2005. Since joining the staff as a video journalist in 2011 he has lost touch with most of his friends and family. He looks forward to the day achievement points become legal tender so he can return to Ireland and fix its broken economy.

Title: Steamworld Dig Review
Review: SteamWorld Dig is a charming, atmospheric exploration adventure, but it grinds to a halt just when it starts going full steam.
Author Information: Heidi Kemps likes long role-playing games, intricate fighting games, and all things Japanese.

Title: Foul Play Review
Review: It's hardly foul, but good ideas and charming animations aren't enough to save Foul Play from repetition.
Author Information: Britton Peele is a freelance writer for GameSpot and a Digital Entertainment Editor for The Dallas Morning News. Find him on Twitter @BrittonPeele.

Title: Killzone: Mercenary Review
Review: Killzone: Mercenary is a standard but enjoyable shooter and one of the best-looking games on the Vita.
Author Information: Before Killzone: Mercenary, the only Killzone game Carolyn had played was Killzone 2. Her writing services are not available to the highest bidder.

Title: Grand Theft Auto V Review
Review: Grand Theft Auto V is an outrageous, exhilarating, sometimes troubling crime epic that pushes open-world game design forward in amazing ways.
Author Information: Carolyn has been a huge fan of the Grand Theft Auto games ever since she hit the streets of Liberty City in GTA III. She is definitely not currently wanted by police in 17 states.

Title: PES 2014 Review
Review: PES 2014 moves ever closer towards simulation, and in doing so forgets exactly what makes the series so different and so much fun in the first place.
Author Information: Mark is based in the UK, where soccer is known as "football", and from where he's been reviewing FIFA and PES for the last three years.

Title: The Legend of Zelda: The Wind Waker HD Review
Review: The Legend of Zelda: Wind Waker HD is a lovingly updated version of a timeless, though flawed, adventure.
Author Information: Martin remembers the excitement of preordering the original GameCube version back in 2003. Art from the game has regularly featured up as his desktop wallpaper over the past decade.

Title: Arma III Review
Review: ARMA III delivers sprawling geography, intense online military engagement, and a dedicated community. Just be prepared to give as much as you take.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is a lifelong RPG lover and violin player. When he isn't busy building PCs and composing symphonies, he watches American Dad reruns with his fat cat, Ollie.

Title: Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 ReMIX Review
Review: The Kingdom Hearts HD 1.5 Remix compilation makes beautiful magic, but is still flawed in familiar places.
Author Information: Jason Venter has finished hundreds of video games since discovering the hobby in the late '80s, and he hopes to play and write about hundreds more before they bury him.

Title: NHL 14 Review
Review: NHL 14 adds little of note to NHL 13 aside from better hitting, more fighting, and a disappointing NHL 94 retro mode.
Author Information: Brett Todd has reviewed more bad games for GameSpot--and awesome ones too--than he cares to admit.

Title: NHL 14 Review
Review: NHL 14 adds little of note to NHL 13 aside from better hitting, more fighting, and a disappointing NHL 94 retro mode.
Author Information: Brett Todd has reviewed more bad games for GameSpot--and awesome ones too--than he cares to admit.

Title: Legend of Dungeon Review
Review: Combining beat-'em-up action with randomized levels and loot, Legend of Dungeon offers just enough variety to stem the tide of repetitive gameplay.
Author Information: Britton Peele is a freelance writer for GameSpot and a Digital Entertainment Editor for The Dallas Morning News. Find him on Twitter @BrittonPeele.

Title: Outlast Review
Review: Outlast is a weapons-free survival horror adventure that elicits frequent bouts of dread.
Author Information: Leif Johnson is a prolific freelancer from Chicago who confuses people by speaking with an East Texas accent. Somehow a childhood of herding cattle and raising emus prepared him for researching medieval texts for several years, but these days he fills his free time by smashing bad guys with big swords. In RPGs, of course.

Title: Diablo III Review
Review: Diablo III's captivating cooperative loot-driven gameplay makes the transition to console intact.
Author Information: Carolyn's been venturing into monster-infested dungeons in search of riches since the days of Gauntlet. She's always looking for gear that will let her spend less time sleeping and spend more time playing games.

Title: Total War: Rome II Review
Review: Total War: Rome II turns the battlefields of Ancient Europe into an engrossing strategic theater.
Author Information: Dan Starkey's first review for GameSpot was for Starseed Pilgrim, and he's been pleased to remain on hand ever since!

Title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows Review
Review: Game-breaking glitches and a poor camera make TMNT: Out of the Shadows a bruised and battered shell of what it could have been.
Author Information: Brian Albert was a beloved freelancer at GameSpot until he joined the illustrious staff at IGN! We miss you, Brian.

Title: Shelter Review
Review: Shelter doesn't reach the high level of profundity it aims for, but this journey through the wilds makes a few poignant points all the same.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has a cat named Ollie who refuses to play bass in Rock Band.

Title: Puppeteer Review
Review: Wildly imaginative and brimming with style, Puppeteer is a fantastic platformer that's heaps of fun for kids and adults alike.
Author Information: Mark managed to get all 121 stars in Mario Galaxy and all 242 in Mario Galaxy 2, which he commemorates with framed laminated screenshots on his desk. Suffice to say, he's quite the platformer fan.

Title: Hatsune Miku: Project Diva F Review
Review: Rhythm fans will find a lot of music, challenge, and customization to love as they get to know Hatsune Miku: Project Diva F.
Author Information: Jason Venter has finished hundreds of video games since discovering the hobby in the late '80s, and he hopes to play and write about hundreds more before they bury him.

Title: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow Ultimate Edition Review
Review: The Ultimate Edition of Castlevania: Lords of Shadow breathes new life into the three-year-old game through improved graphics and extra content.
Author Information: Castlevania's been a favorite series of Peter's since the Nintendo Entertainment System, starting with Castlevania III: Dracula's Curse.

Title: Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs Review
Review: Amnesia: A Machine for Pigs is extremely disturbing, more than a little disgusting, and impossible to stop playing.
Author Information: Brett Todd has reviewed more bad games for GameSpot--and awesome ones too--than he cares to admit.

Title: KickBeat Review
Review: KickBeat is a plucky new contender in the rhythm gaming arena, with punishing difficulty and pumping industrial beats.
Author Information: Brittany Vincent has been freelancing for GameSpot ever since her review for World of Warcraft: Mists of Pandaria.

Title: Tales of Xillia Review
Review: Tales of Xillia is a gorgeous and fast-paced Japanese role-playing game that suffers from a few questionable design choices.
Author Information: Heidi Kemps likes long role-playing games, intricate fighting games, and all things Japanese.

Title: Spelunky Review
Review: Major improvements to the cooperative mode coupled with the Vita's portability make this the best version of the already excellent Spelunky.
Author Information: Tom has a two-hour commute to work each day. Don't feel sorry for him, though, because he happily rides the rails while trying desperately to finally reach Hell.

Title: Diablo III Review
Review: Diablo III's captivating cooperative loot-driven gameplay makes the transition to console intact.
Author Information: Carolyn's been venturing into monster-infested dungeons in search of riches since the days of Gauntlet. She's always looking for gear that will let her spend less time sleeping and spend more time playing games.

Title: Space Hulk Review
Review: Its tense missions retain the spirit of the board game, but Space Hulk is ultimately a disappointing take on the Games Workshop classic.
Author Information: Brett Todd has reviewed more bad games for GameSpot--and awesome ones too--than he cares to admit.

Title: Lost Planet 3 Review
Review: Lost Planet 3 is both less exasperating and less diverse than its predecessors.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has a cat named Ollie who refuses to play bass in Rock Band.

Title: Lost Planet 3 Review
Review: Lost Planet 3 is both less exasperating and less diverse than its predecessors.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd has a cat named Ollie who refuses to play bass in Rock Band.

Title: Race the Sun Review
Review: Race the Sun is an elegant endeavor, pairing slick action and stiff challenge with systems that make you want to come back day after day.
Author Information: Even though he recognizes the term "endless runner" for the oxymoron it is, Chris Watters still enjoys trying to press onward and outdo his friends in petty leaderboard squabbles.

Title: Lost Planet 3 Review
Review: Lost Planet 3 is both less exasperating and less diverse than its predecessors.
Author Information: Kevin VanOrd is a lifelong RPG lover and violin player. When he isn't busy building PCs and composing symphonies, he watches American Dad reruns with his fat cat, Ollie.

Title: Rayman Legends Review
Review: The strange and delightful Rayman Legends offers a dizzying adventure whose only low point is in the few touch-screen stages.
Author Information: Tom is an unabashed lover of platforms. He has lost hours in everything from the Mushroom Kingdom to the warped world of Super Meat Boy, only shying away from those dreadful Sonic games.

Title: Disney Castle of Illusion HD Review
Review: Simple, satisfying gameplay and Disney-quality art make Castle of Illusion a remake worth exploring.
Author Information: Brian Albert was a beloved freelancer at GameSpot until he joined the illustrious staff at IGN! We miss you, Brian.

Title: Flashback Review
Review: Flashback is a great-looking remake of a classic game, but playing it is an exercise in confusion and frustration.

Title: Killer Is Dead Review
